top_10.name: The Coffee Berry SF
top_10.address: 1410 Lombard St, San Francisco, CA 94123, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: If you are in SF and looking for a great place for a cup of coffee and a baked treat (sweet or savory), make sure to try the Coffee Berry. The workers (owners?) will immediately make you feel welcome and valued. The drinks and food are delicious and dogs are welcome. You’ll find a lot of locals with their pups. It’s always a good sign when the locals are going! My daughter and I were staying at the hotel across the street and we found them on the first morning. On the second day when I visited without my daughter they asked if she was sleeping in, which she was. I was impressed they remembered and asked about her. Just a wonderful small business to check out if you are visiting or a local!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Worthy of all the 5 stars. It is a small coffee shop right at the bottom of Lombard street. We really enjoyed our Nutella latte and lavender latte. The ube croissant was our favorite. The savory pull apart was ok. They have indoor seating for like 8 and a couple small tables outside.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This is a small coffee shop with counter seating and a couple of tables inside and outside. It's a destination for the pastries, offering unique bakery items like ube croissants and ginger pull-apart bread alongside traditional morning fare. The coffee is also pretty good. Service is friendly and thoughtful. Oh, and they have free dog treats.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
We had the savoury pull-apart bread and the twice-baked ube croissant and both were incredible. The pull-apart bread was moist throughout and super flavourful. The ube croissant was crispy, with creamy filling, and an amazing sweet crust. Coffees are also great, but the pastries are the true reason for coming!
Also, they have a few nice tables outside, lovely for sunny days.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I love Coffee Berry as an addition to my neighborhood. I’m lucky enough to live right around the corner so it’s always there for a quick stop. The staff are always nice and greet you with a smile. They have a lot of pastry options and the espresso and coffee are always on point. My personal go to recently has been the Espresso Tonic but you can’t really go wrong. Also dog friendly!

top_10.name: Delah Coffee
top_10.address: 370 4th St, San Francisco, CA 94107, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: We are very lucky to have 2 count them 2 Yemeni coffee shops in this neighborhood. I refuse to pick favorites because they are both 5 star shops. Come to Delah for the amazing coffee, but stay for the pastries and attention to detail. Lots of seats and tables people working everywhere but also lively tables. If you have questions in the menu they are super helpful don't hesitate to ask.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This gem in the rough serves super tasty, Middle Eastern coffee, with or without an array of spices. A wide range of unique pastries tasted fresh and homemade. Service was super helpful and patient.The place was abuzz with positive energy from people of all walks of life. It's everything a cafe should be.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
It's always bustling with people and for good reason. This cozy, vibrant café has earned a loyal following thanks to its exceptional drinks and authentic Middle Eastern treats. It’s my go-to spot, especially for their 🌟pistachio latte ⭐️, which is rich, creamy and perfectly balanced with just the right amount of nutty flavor without being overly sweet . Trust me, one sip and you'll understand the hype.
They also have a variety of traditional Turkish desserts and savory pies that are delicious. And if you're a tea lover, don’t miss their Adeni chai - it's fragrant, spiced, and deeply satisfying. I recommend ordering it without sugar so you can sweeten it to your taste.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: A great place to work from, hang out with friends, or enjoy a coffee date. Has plenty of seats. Very efficient, fast and friendly staff. We ordered the adeni chai and the bee bite. Both were delicious! The chai was well flavored and very strong. We liked it with no sugar. However towards the end, we got some chunks of tea leaves so we had to waste the last few sips. We got the seeds and sesame bee bite served warm with the honey on the side. It had such a nice lightly crispy top with a soft bread pull between each hive bite.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
A really popular spot to study in so it can get crowded. It can get warm and a bit loud though I think well insulated from the mass of cars zooming by outside.

The box of treats are reeeeally sweet. Too sweet!! $16.45 ~25 pieces.

Recommended to take transit.

testimonials: We are very lucky to have 2 count them 2 Yemeni coffee shops in this neighborhood. I refuse to pick favorites because they are both 5 star shops. Come to Delah for the amazing coffee, but stay for the pastries and attention to detail. Lots of seats and tables people working everywhere but also lively tables. If you have questions in the menu they are super helpful don't hesitate to ask.

top_10.name: Scullery
top_10.address: 687 Geary St, San Francisco, CA 94102, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
The food and coffee was absolutely amazing! We had avocado toast and PB&J toast, they were both put together with precision with fresh ingredients and homemade bread. The latte and cappuccino were also just perfect.

The staff were super friendly, and having fun while serving up greatness. The venue is very small, so you might need to take it to go.

Enjoy!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I recently visited this small cafe and was genuinely impressed by the warm and cozy atmosphere it offers. Despite its size, the space has a great vibe that makes you want to stay a while, perfect for a quiet break or catching up with a friend.

The staff were super friendly and helpful, which added a welcoming touch to the whole experience. The coffee was beautifully presented, and you can tell they really care about the quality of what they serve.

Prices were very reasonable for the quality, and the pastries were a highlight. I especially recommend the almond croissant it was fresh, flaky, and full of flavor.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: If you don't want to pay for a big dining area but get some spot on breakfast this is your place. Some seats inside and chill music. Had the passion fruit and cream cheese Danish and Pesto and Egg. Was able to grab a Monster next door.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Their orange juice is really good and fresh!! We had smoked salmon mash and Pesto tomato mozzarella. It was good amount for two. Highly recommended. Would like to
come here again :):)

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
The food is ok. The service is bad. From the beginning, we asked how’s the new coffee taste and he was “oh it’s bad” and laughed at us. Just because we didn’t gave tip, they was really bad and humiliating us. After the order, the bartender yelled at the other one said “no tip no tip”. Then, after receiving the food, we wanted to eat in place, and received take away. We asked for plates and he started like “you need to tell us this before, why are you throwing away the paper bags?!” I mean, why didn’t you asked us? In every place we’ve been, we’ve always been asked for it’s to sit or take away, in addition, what do you want me to do with the paper bags since I’m not taking away?! Of course I will throw it.

After couple of minutes sitting in, a customer went in, asked how it’s going, how was the week, and the bartender said “it was hard, you know, people who don’t know how to order” clearly was talking about us while we sat there. Disgusting.

The staff were super friendly, and having fun while serving up greatness. The venue is very small, so you might need to take it to go.

Enjoy!

top_10.name: The Coffee Movement
top_10.address: 1030 Washington St, San Francisco, CA 94108, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I decided to try Coffee Movement after seeing so many amazing reviews — and it definitely lived up to the hype! I ordered the iced mocha and it was delicious, perfectly balanced and not overly sweet.

There was a long line when I arrived, but it moved quickly, which was a pleasant surprise. Just a heads-up: there’s no indoor seating, so be prepared to take your coffee to-go or enjoy it outside.

Overall, a great spot for quality coffee and worth the visit if you’re in the area.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Tucked in a small neighborhood, you’ll find this coffee shops that serves some amazing drinks.

I got a cafe latte, super rich, smooth, and the perfect balance of espresso and milk.

Their pastries do run out so if you get there later in the afternoon so better to go early if you’re looking to grab some. Seating is pretty limited as it’s a small space so it’s def more suited for takeout but will def come back soon!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Cute small cafe! Their pastry options didn’t look all that appealing yet you can tell they specialize in coffee. It was nice how there was no extra charge for oat milk in my latte. Both me and my husband ordered iced oat latte. We found both of our coffee to be too mild. We got extra shots. It seems like their oat milk is on the sweeter side with artificial sweetener. Didn’t appreciate it.

Espresso was not complex in terms of flavor. It was not the bold lattes we were hoping for. Espresso was too mild and uninteresting for us.

Nevertheless, liked the vibe, friendliness of the staff. We went 8:40am on Sunday and there was no line.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Came here from a recommendation from another barista as "probably the best in the city" and from my experience it definitely was. This was exactly what I was looking for, great coffee/espresso, service, and a focus on the craft. I tried to sample as much as the menu as possible. The cortado stood out as one of the best I've ever had and the coffee flight really allowed me to compare the differences between their selection of beans. It was a delight to pair the flight with my pastry. The lighter roast went well and the rounding it out after finishing with the more medium one.

This is definitely a spot I'll seek out every visit to SF.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Long overdue review, definitely one of my go to coffee spots in the city. Love their seasonal lattes especially the ginger spice latte.

The service here is always friendly and drinks are consistent.

There is no seating inside, but I usually like to pick up coffee here and walk down to washington square park or take a scenic walk to abacus row for some window shopping:)

top_10.name: Doppio Coffee & Brunch
top_10.address: 1551 Mission St, San Francisco, CA 94103, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Excellent service and food quality! I have enjoyed coming here quite a few times. The food is very fresh and delectable. The drinks are perfectly flavored. Not oversaturated with sugar unlike some coffee shops that over-rely on syrup flavorings. The flavor here is top notch.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This place is fantastic. Excellent coffee options and brunch as well. We loved the savory and sweet crepes and the gents working here today put their heart and soul into their work. Thanks for a great experience. Hope to come again.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Very nice place! Great atmosphere and friendly staff. The coffee was really good. We had the breakfast sandwich and it was delicious! Definitely recommend this place, good service

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Everything about this place is amazing. The food, the coffee, the music, the atmosphere. It's a must try! All the coffees are good, the crepes are delicious (the picture is the bariatas favorite), the breakfast sandwiches amazing! You won't be disappointed. My husband goes here practically every day now since we live so close.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Just had lunch here and I was genuinely surprised for how delicious their menu items were at great prices! We had the smoked salmon avocado toast and were recommended the tuna melt sandwich and both were amazing! I wanted to end my meal with a sweet treat so we got the berry lover crepe and it was a great finale for our lunch. Will definitely be back again!

testimonials: Excellent service and food quality! I have enjoyed coming here quite a few times. The food is very fresh and delectable. The drinks are perfectly flavored. Not oversaturated with sugar unlike some coffee shops that over-rely on syrup flavorings. The flavor here is top notch.

This place is fantastic. Excellent coffee options and brunch as well. We loved the savory and sweet crepes and the gents working here today put their heart and soul into their work. Thanks for a great experience. Hope to come again.
Very nice place! Great atmosphere and friendly staff. The coffee was really good. We had the breakfast sandwich and it was delicious! Definitely recommend this place, good service

top_10.name: Simple Pleasures Cafe
top_10.address: 3434 Balboa St, San Francisco, CA 94121, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Rating 5 stars mainly for ambiance and because I’d go back and try other things. Really charming, cozy place with all ages gathered- seems like an established community hub. There’s people working on laptops and just hanging out. Unfortunately the thing I ordered was not satisfying but I’ll try something else next time. I ordered a chai latte and it tasted nothing like any chai I’ve had. I had my two friends take sips of my drink too to verify and they said it tasted like ginger tea. I wonder if my drink got mixed up somehow or if they ran out of chai? If they ran out, I’d rather have been told so I could’ve gotten something else. My friends enjoyed their coffees and bagels. Friendly people and great atmosphere make it worth it for me to come back, try something new, and recommend to others.
Oh also! The writing on the cups was beautiful :)

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Impeccable vibes and great service - plus fabulous local beers on tap and apricot bars to die for. I'd post a picture of both, but they were gone too fast!!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
You can tell this is a community gathering place. Very laid back and people knew each other.

We were not content with our order. ,we wanted two single orders of espresso and getting one shot divided into two demitasses was not cool.
First cup had the froth and filled 3/4 th of the way. Second cup had no froth and filled 1/4 of the way. Plus it was cold.

Very disappointed.

If you are familiar with how espresso should be served and want a hot shot of it, this is not the place.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Simple Pleasures is a mainstay in the Outer Richmond. The roast their own coffee, their vanilla iced lattes are my personal favorite, baked goods are so good, the space is great so you can chill or work, they have an outdoor parklette, and they serve beer later in the day. I love this place.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Great coffee ☕️ and food is delicious. I was here every morning and afternoon during my stay in San Francisco and would recommend to anyone looking for great coffee, food and a really chill atmosphere to relax and or meet some really cool locals to learn some history about SF, Thanks Mike and Jon 😊

top_10.name: Haraz Coffee House
top_10.address: 1452 Franklin St, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Highlight, the workers behind the counter are patient and lovely 💞

I've tried most of the pastries/sweets. I wanted to love their take on the Dubai chocolate cake, but unfortunately since it sits in close proximity and in the same case as the items made with rose water, it's ruins the cake because it picks up the rose essence and you taste it 😔😫

The best item, im my opinion, is their baklava cheesecake. Its the star 😻 just get it, no doubt that you'll be happy you did.

Skip the beautiful pistachio croissant.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Staff are friendly.  Love the ambience. Perfect for socializing, relaxing, maybe working. We definitely enjoyed their Matcha Latte & Pistachio Latte. Their Mosaic Dubai was so delicious. Just the right amount of sweetness & very smooth.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: At first I just wanted to get my fave crispy sweets walking from brunch at @DACHA, but the cozy place and the Chai on the menu sound promising. I ended up getting rose milk cake too but that's a bit disappointing not so much rose taste. But the drinks and the ambience are just perfect!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Great place with good staff. Very cozy, atmospheric. I ordered Turkish coffee and sweets. Very tasty coffee for a low price. That day was my friend's birthday, they congratulated her with a cake and a candle. The employees of this cafe are just wonderful😍

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I visited Haraz Coffee two days ago and had a really pleasant experience. I ordered the Haraz Latte, which was smooth, aromatic, and had just the right balance of flavor. The café had a warm, welcoming atmosphere, perfect for relaxing or catching up with friends.

What stood out most was the service especially from Sarah. She was incredibly friendly, attentive, and made the visit even more enjoyable. Not to mention, she’s beautiful, which added a lovely charm to the experience.

Overall, I’d definitely recommend Haraz Coffee for both its drinks and its vibe. I’m already looking forward to my next visit.

top_10.name: The Coffee Movement
top_10.address: 1737 Balboa St, San Francisco, CA 94121, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: TCM did not disappoint. The almond croissant has just enough jam in it. The service was streamlined with 3 people all doing different task in making the coffee to make the line move quickly. The space was minimalistic and have seats outside as well. Coffee was point in. Will come back again.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I have mixed feelings about The Coffee Movement. The coffee wasn't bad, the ham and cheese croissant was VERY good, and the shop itself was pretty nice. The problem is mostly just around the value. The latte was quite tiny, and not at all cheap. I get that SF tends to be a bit more expensive in general, but I'm not sure I can justify returning for this price, outside of special occasions.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I’ve been there three times and gotten a different drink each time. The first two times I went, I thought the drinks were good but not amazing (lavender latte and cocoa cappuccino). The third time I got a latte, and it was probably the best cup of coffee I’ve ever had. It was smooth and flavorful and slightly sweet. This is also a great place to sit for an hour or two and get some work done. The staff members are really nice and ensure you have a great experience. The shop also has a bathroom, which surprisingly, a lot of coffee shops in SF do not. My only complaint is that I wish they had a bigger pastry selection.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
If the motto is “Good times, better coffee,” Coffee Movement Richmond is halfway there, and thankfully, it’s the half that matters most. The coffee is excellent. Seriously. Pour-overs that make you reconsider your life choices, most of the time. The fit-out is clean, modern, and quietly confident, just like the espresso. If you’re here for conversation or small-town hospitality, you might be disappointed. But if you’re here to caffeinate and get on with your day, you’ve found your place.

Price point is solid. I usually pop in for a split shot to share with my partner and finish with a pour over. I pay for the single estate coffee, because why would you not.

Let’s be real: the service doesn’t quite hit warm-and-fuzzy, but then again, you don’t go to a tattoo artist for a cuddle, and you don’t come here for chit-chat. You come for seriously well-made coffee, and in that department, they overdeliver. Whether you’re grabbing a quick takeaway or lingering to people-watch in the Richmond flow, Coffee Movement delivers on its promise, maybe not the “good times,” but definitely the “better coffee.”

Most chumps order milky coffees... perhaps the baristas want to serve people that love coffee. Open for opinion.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: If I could give it 10 stars, I would! The best matcha latte in the city — it just melts in your mouth. I only wish they had croissants =) but even without them, it’s a 10 out of 5!

testimonials: TCM did not disappoint. The almond croissant has just enough jam in it. Will come back again.

top_10.name: Ritual Coffee Roasters
top_10.address: 432b Octavia St, San Francisco, CA 94102, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: So I really like the vibe of ritual coffee on octavia street, it's very small and cute, but ritual coffee has many locations, but this one is my favorite out of all of them in the city.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Great location in Hayes, great vibe, you can get your coffee and walk around the neighborhood. But the coffee itself is nothing special for the hype. It was a bit overpriced. I got a Shakerato and it was just an iced latte with a marketing touch.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: So here is the thing, people who work here choose to work here. They aren’t forced or maybe they are because it’s the only reason I can fathom why I just experienced awful customer service. Be personable ladies, welcome your guest and don’t act as if they are a nuisance for expecting you to do your job. They were focus on the live band outside and talking amongst each other than giving good customer service. For almost $10 for a cup of coffee, you all need to refresh your training on customer service.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Great place for coffee in near city hall.  The staffs are very friendly and I enjoy the outdoor atmosphere.  It is kind of small though.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Try and avoid the weekends and have no wait time to enjoy a San Francisco classic. Great coffee in a great little spot. They truly know what is a long black which is a nice surprise. They normally have tasters of the chocolate which pretty much entices you to buy a bar. You can walk across the way and enjoy the coffee on a nice patch of grass.

top_10.name: Flywheel Coffee Roasters
top_10.address: 672 Stanyan St, San Francisco, CA 94117, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Flywheel Roasters on Stanyan is a true coffee paradise in SF. The moment you enter, an intriguing and distinct aroma of freshly roasted beans envelops you. Their commitment to same-day roasting is evident in every exceptional cup. The coffee is simply awesome – vibrant, nuanced, and bursting with flavor. You can taste the dedication in each sip. The passionate staff and welcoming atmosphere further enhance the experience. For any coffee lover, Flywheel on Stanyan is an absolute must-visit. Prepare to be enchanted by the quality and freshness!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Great work/study place IF YOU CAN GET A SEAT. Was pretty busy and crowded up until closing. Free wifi for 2 hours (I think you can extend this with an order). Outlets and good lighting. I ordered a chai latte with oatmilk and it was great. I’d definitely come back.

Allergen warning: all the pastries are handled with the same tongs and made in the same place as nuts/peanuts. I encourage avoiding the pastries if you have a peanut/tree nut allergy. They did look good though so if you don’t have an allergy go ham.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I really enjoy coming here. The coffee is amazing, the staff is friendly, and the pastries are fresh. You can work comfortably and there is a lot of space. There is also a nice outdoor space. The pastries can run out over the weekend so come early.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I'm not local - but it seems like everyone else in this coffeeshop was, and I mean that in the best way. Flywheel feels like a place where everybody knows everybody and the baristas know your dog.

Now, for the coffee. They had a nice selection of single source beans. We went for the siphon preparation. I know it's nothing special as far as actual infusion, but how often do you find a shop that can actually make a siphon brew?

We got the Ethiopian and Tanzanian beans which were both pleasant and distinct (the former being more earthy with subtle sweetness, the latter with more sour cherry notes). We watched the barista prepare our siphons, drank our coffees and enjoyed a crumb cake, watched the locals come and go, and just all and all had an extremely pleasant morning at Flywheel.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This is one of my fav and best coffee shops in the city. The interior? Spacious and warm. The outside? Scenic and beautiful. And the crew is outstanding. Had a paperweight light velvety steamer with honey and cinnamon, pure perfection. Art work was a bonus. Can’t wait to come back and spend entire days here. Keep up the great work y’all.

Prepare to be enchanted by the quality and freshness!

top_10.name: Pie Punks
top_10.address: 145 2nd St, San Francisco, CA 94105, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I was looking to try a new pizza spot in the city, and Pie Punks was close to my hotel—so we decided to give it a shot, and I’m glad we did. The atmosphere has a fun mix of pop culture and vintage vibes, which I really enjoyed. The energy inside the restaurant was great.

We sat at the bar top and were helped right away. To start, we ordered some cheese curds, and then shared two different slices of pizza to try a bit of everything. The cheese curds were amazing—honestly, they were my favorite part of the meal. The pizza was okay—not bad, but nothing too special.

I’d definitely come back, especially since it’s close to where I usually stay when I’m in the city. The vibes are on point, and it's a cool spot to hang out and grab a bite.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Stumbled upon this place when trying to find a place to eat somewhat near the Financial district.

We got half tomato and half garlic round pizza and both were delicious! Crust was perfect thickness and the two kinds of pizza that we ordered balanced each other really well. Really loved how the garlic pizza had actual pieces of garlic on top ;)

Vibes inside were great as well!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: OMG – this pizza spot is incredible! The vibe is on point, and the 90s hip hop soundtrack is everything. We tried the crispy broccolini, Detroit pepperoni, and thin crust pepperoni – all amazing. The Detroit-style pie had those crispy edges and was packed with flavor, and the broccolini made the perfect side. I’d order that Detroit again in a heartbeat! We’re in town for a conference and seriously wish we had found this place sooner—we would’ve come back for round two. Do yourself a favor and support this local gem. You won’t regret it! #supportlocal

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
We came here for dinner after a conference at the Moscone center. It’s less than a 10 min walk. The indoor seating was full so we ate outside.

I ordered the Detroit style chopped cheese pizza and my friend ordered the round pepperoni. The chopped cheese was delicious. It was melt cheese, ground beef, ketchup, lettuce, pickle and tomato and was so good. The crust was thick but light and fluffy. I really liked it.

I tried the pepperoni too and enjoyed it, but not as much as the Detroit style.

The service was friendly though they never refilled our waters.

I’d definitely come back. Very good pizza.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Came for dinner and ordered had the Grandma with a side cheese curds - very good.

They offer a deep dish, medium crust and a thin crust. Would have loved to try the thin crust pizza but the Grandma was more than enough for two.

I was also happy that they had a variety of beers and had Miller Lite available.

top_10.name: Golden Boy Pizza
top_10.address: 542 Green St, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: It’s a walk up storefront with window ordering. They offer a handful of specialties including whole pies or by the slice.  Always a line when I went by but moves pretty quickly. Ordered the pepperoni and combo slices. The zucchini on the combo pizza was different but good.  The pies are square!  The crust is solid and holds the ingredients without sagging.  A tasty and reasonably priced meal.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Famous pizza place in the heart of SF won’t disappoint! Get ready to stay in line for a bit but it moves fast and trust me, it’s worth the wait! $4 avg price for a slice of pizza? Unheard of these days!

The square was good size and delish.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I first saw this place on tiktok. Thought about it, but I never come to SF to even imagine trying it. Well, a fate brought me right around the corner and figured it was time. When we saw the long line, we knew it would be amazing. It did take a minute to get to order, but only because the folks in front were ordering pies (genius). When it was our turn, we ordered four slices, cheese, pepperoni, combo, and sausage.
The pepperoni has a hint of spicy that set it off completely. The cheese was cheesy and delicious. The sausage was tasty, but that COMBO ONE... by far the best one! It had a hint of sweet, spicy, and crunchy. Next time I am in SF, I will definitely be going back. It's worth the wait.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
One of the most memorable pizza spots in San Francisco.
Tried the pesto and the clam & garlic slices — both were packed with flavor and had that perfect focaccia-style crust. Quick service, great vibe, and unforgettable taste. I’ll definitely be back!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Golden Boy Pizza is a popular spot, so there is usually a bit of a wait, but for the price and taste it is absolutely worth it. The combo was my favorite this time, packed with flavor, though I’ve had the clam slice on a previous visit and can see why it’s such a local favorite. The cheese pull here is easily the biggest I’ve had on a slice, which makes it even more enjoyable to eat. Overall, it’s a tasty and satisfying snack that delivers exactly what you want from a pizza place.

top_10.name: Outta Sight Pizza
top_10.address: 422 Larkin St, San Francisco, CA 94102, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I recently visited Outta Sight Pizza in San Francisco, and it truly lives up to the hype. From the moment I walked in, I was greeted by the smell of fresh pizza and a visually striking interior. The experience was overwhelmingly positive, combining delicious food, quality ingredients, and a funky artistic decor that made the visit memorable. Yes, the price tag was a bit high (around $60 for our meal), but I left feeling it was absolutely worth it for the quality and overall experience. Here’s a breakdown of my visit:
- Pepperoni Pizza (Slice): Incredibly delicious, with a perfect thin crust that had a nice crunch on the outside and a chewy center. The pepperoni was savory and crispy around the edges, and you could taste the quality of the ingredients – from the tangy tomato sauce to the gooey, rich cheese. Each bite was bursting with flavor, and the slice was generous in size.
- Meatball Sub: A hearty sandwich overflowing with tender, flavorful meatballs and melted cheese. The bread was toasted just right – crunchy on the outside but soft inside, soaking up the savory marinara sauce. It’s the kind of comfort food that hits the spot; rich in flavor and clearly made with love and good ingredients.
Both items were freshly made to order and served hot. We could immediately tell the difference that quality ingredients make – nothing tasted processed or bland. For example, the tomato sauce on the pizza and sub had a homemade taste with herbs and natural sweetness, and the meats were lean and well-seasoned.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I was passing by this place and someone walking out had a pizza slice that caught my eye. Having just visited Chicago, I was craving for a thick slice like the Lunch Lady pizza brick. It’s not a triangle. It’s like a block so I don’t consider it a slice. At first sight, I thought maybe it’s going to be a little too doughy? After one bite, the flavors of the topping and the crunch of the crust were so satisfying. The shaved cheese gave it a nice finish. Will need to come back to try other pizzas next time.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Did someone say PECKING DUCK pizza!? No this is not a joke 🦆🍕

@thatsouttasight has brought this unique twist and it’s honestly so good! They also have other amazing combos and authentic New York style pizzas right here in San Francisco. Service was nice and it’s a small quick grab and go place. As most places in the city haha there’s a parking garage about 2 blocks down thankfully!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Pizza here is awesome! They have a variety to choose from with some very creative options. Their staff is great. There might be a little wait for your pizza but it is definitely worth it. Give them a try.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Solid NY style slice. Slices are on the small side but they’re thin, crispy, and have good structure. Zero flop, crust is chewy, sauce is good - not too sweet, perfectly tangy. Pepperoni is top notch. Jerk chicken is interesting - kinda sweet and spicy.

top_10.name: Piccolo Forno
top_10.address: 725 Columbus Ave, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: My husband and I ate here on a whim while visiting San Fran and we are so glad we did. The food, the service, and the atmosphere were all perfect. Our server was funny and charismatic and all the food we had was fresh and delicious. We truly enjoyed our experience here and have vowed to come back next time we are in town!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Underwhelming flavors, not a fan.

Service: 10/10 fast and super polite and friendly

Food: taste wasn’t it, entry bread w vinegar had no flavor. The pastas all lacked flavor except the gnocchi one. Tiramisu was nice and fresh we liked it a lot. Pizzas weren’t a favorite.

Overall: wouldn’t come here again, do to the food taste. Otherwise service is so nice.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Quaint Italian spot that we read had amazing pasta.  It didn't disappoint.  Probably less than 20 tables in the restaurant so there was a line on sidewalk when we arrived.  Always a good sign.  Bread served was fresh and so was the pasta.  Went with waiter recommended dishes.  Cannoli for dessert was perfect exclamation point on the meal.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Wow, wow, wow. This is some delicious, fresh Italian. I have had the opportunity to eat here on two different occasions while visiting San Francisco. The first time was with my family and the second with employees. The owner is incredibly friendly and accommodating and yes, he’s an authentic Italian. The lasagna will melt in your mouth and the desserts (especially the panna cotta) is to die for!!! I will be back on my next visit to the beautiful city.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Everything was perfect: good wine, good food and great service. We loved their linguine vongole with the pasta cooked to the right al dente texture and the clams were fresh. We also enjoyed amazing service by their passionate staff. Just be prepared for a queue even on a weekday night.

testimonials: My husband and I ate here on a whim while visiting San Fran and we are so glad we did. The food, the service, and the atmosphere were all perfect. Our server was funny and charismatic and all the food we had was fresh and delicious. We truly enjoyed our experience here and have vowed to come back next time we are in town!

top_10.name: Pizzetta 211
top_10.address: 211 23rd Ave, San Francisco, CA 94121, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
This place definitely moves at its own pace, for better or worse. When we arrived, the host spent a couple of minutes finishing a personal conversation before acknowledging us, which felt unprofessional and set the wrong tone from the start. Service throughout the meal was very slow. Our party of four waited a long time for food, and the pizzas didn’t come out together. By the time mine finally arrived, my friends had already finished eating, so I ended up taking most of it to go.

Our server did seem attentive, and the food itself was decent, good, but not great. My pizza had quite a bit of yellowing arugula (see pic) that I had to pick through. If I were to try this place again, it would be strictly for takeout. Also worth noting: there’s a 4.5% flat fee added for employee health.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I can't hate this place. This is where my girlfriend and I had our first date two years ago. The pizza hits the spot and the ambiance in the small restaurant is so cozy. With just 6 tables, this small joint has a rotating menu with unique pizzas that will surprise you and keep you wanting more. Pro Tip: bring loved ones 9/10

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Great place in the Bay Area and well worth a visit. Great patio for outdoor seating and a small but cosy indoor seating area.

The pizzas were so good. We got the braised artichoke, pesto, walnut and feta, and the lamb sausage with harissa and smoked mozzarella. Both 10/10.

Excellent food, service and atmosphere. Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Excellent experience at this pizza place! Their pizzas are made so delicately and you can tell they put a lot of effort into their food. The dough is super soft, thin and crunchy. Toppings are well balanced, each bite explodes with favour!

The cheese plate was a good starter, was quite filling! Would love to come back to try their other pizzas! Their menu changes weekly so there’s always something new to look forward to!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Awesome community spot with a beautiful patio and lovely but cozy interior seating area. Seasonal/periodically changing menu with thoughtful and unconventional options. Pizza/pizzettes were so good they caught me off guard- like damn great. Highly recommend!

top_10.name: Long Bridge Pizza Company
top_10.address: 2347 3rd St, San Francisco, CA 94107, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Really tasty sourdough style pizza but very expensive. We ordered a large pesto pizza, add jalapeños, and our total after tax and tip came out to $50. On top of that they charged $3 for a side of hot sauce. Prjce aside, it is very good pizza - blistered crackly crust and super tasty sauce.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Wow. I’ve only tried two pizza flavors here and just wow. Pesto is fresh with flavorful olive oil, and the hot honey is just sweet spicy complex tomato pepper goodness. I’m salivating writing about it.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: The price is reasonable and the taste is really nice! I would like to recommend to drop by this pizza restaurant! The Korean staff is kind, too!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I am Italian and I love the pizza at this place. The crust is a little ticker and crispier than traditional Italian pizza, but I like it that way. I usually go for sausage pizza. Draft beers also good! And I like the neighborhood, dog patch. Keep in mind the setting is very informal: you order your pizza and drink at the counter and then you sit yourself, but more glorified than a mere takeaway.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Pretty solid Margherita Pizza, the small comes out to $20

testimonials: Really tasty sourdough style pizza but very expensive. We ordered a large pesto pizza, add jalapeños, and our total after tax and tip came out to $50. On top of that they charged $3 for a side of hot sauce. Prjce aside, it is very good pizza - blistered crackly crust and super tasty sauce.

Wow. I’ve only tried two pizza flavors here and just wow. Pesto is fresh with flavorful olive oil, and the hot honey is just sweet spicy complex tomato pepper goodness. I’m salivating writing about it.
The price is reasonable and the taste is really nice! I would like to recommend to drop by this pizza restaurant! The Korean staff is kind, too!

top_10.name: Za Pizza
top_10.address: 1919 Hyde St, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Best pizza in San Fran. Hands down! Such a delight, it was perfectly executed, the flavors were on point, the service was fantastic! Good vibes all around, the people seemed happy to be there which matters! They were very accommodating our kids happily, noticing we were going to sit outside and brought chairs without us even asking. Very cool. We will be back as often as we can.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Excellent pizza in an a neighborhood setting. The staff was chill and very friendly. Loved the art on the walls! Would definitely recommend for anyone looking for a great slice or pie in the area.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Everything about this place just clicks and works perfectly. The music, the children’s art on the wall, the overall vibe is a true California pizza shop vibe.

They got a number of slice options, the Monday meat is very good. The sausage and the garlic go well together. The thing that really makes this spot is the dough.  It’s super light and crispy, not bready at all but it holds its texture perfectly. Also the pizza isn’t super salty or overwhelming. It’s literally all you could want in a perfect slice.

Also gotta point out that this place does what Tony’s fails to do and actually serves the slice HOT out of the oven. Really can’t say enough good things, huge hot slice of pizza, fair price, fun staff, in a chill unique environment. Definitely worth a stop if in the neighborhood.

They sell whole pies too that get made to order. Will be back.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
This is the pizza from your childhood. Amazing crisp crust. That perfect tomato sauce with a blend of seasonings that only enhance the crust and cheese.

The Cheese brings joy. It is not only flavorful but that has that really nice chewy texture.

The Pepperoni's are glorious. The right amount of salty and spicy.

3 tables and a counter. Staff is frankly, sweet and kind. It's quintessential San Francisco dining. It doesn't look like much, but it's amazing.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
One of the few casual lunch spots on Russian Hill you can find open mid-week. Unpretentious, small space, with limited choices displayed on a white board menu. I sat at the counter and  went with the Monday Meat "Special" - sweet sausage, tomato, garlic and basil. It was satisfying, delicious and inexpensive. A great slice with good beer on tap. What else could you want?

UPDATE: Back again for the Scaliano Friday special  slice and a  Kölsch beer. Even better than before.

top_10.name: Tony's Pizza Napoletana
top_10.address: 1570 Stockton St, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: We had reservations for lunch. Otherwise there’s a long wait time. But it’s worth the wait. Pizzas were very good! I have only tried vegetarian ones. I loved their zucchini flower fritters and other appetizers! The tomatoes in them are exceptionally tasty! Cheese is delicious. It’s a lot of good food that needs good workout later though.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
If you're looking for good pizza in CA this is the spot.

The wife and I ordered the Margarita pizza. Best I've had in CA. We also had the NY Cheese Pizza slice (next door, 2 doors down from Tony's). I've had NY Pizza in NY and this spot comes close to that.

Margarita pizza - 9.3/10 - The taste of the bread is an awesome wood fire taste.

NY Cheese Pizza - 8.8/10 - NY style pizza in NY is better, but for a place in CA this is great.

We arrived at 12:30 on a Tuesday (30min after opening) and we were seated right away. Noticed after 1pm it gets busy so get there early.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Well worth the wait and lived up to the hype. Everything we had was excellent, probably our best pizza ever (New Yorker), plan to go back every time we’re in SF. Add yourself to Yelp waitlist to make the wait easier, go there before your time is near though, worked well for us, we got a table inside as requested (waited longer for it but worth it to us). Service was great and just a fabulous experience overall.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
This is the quintessential Italian eatery with a lively atmosphere and great service.
The portions are big and the food is very delicious. We had the classic pepperoni and the classic cheese and bacon pizzas along with lasagna and carbonara. The pizzas were perfectly cooked with a nice crunchy crust. The pasta was cheesy and filling.
Well recommend.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Don't let my star's discourage you from eating here. The lack of service and sidewalk dining is worth the food.
I had the Detroit Style (Motohead) pizza, reg. Pepperoni, margarita pizza, and double baked cheese bread, and green bean appetizer. It cost us $155, which was worth the food. These were one of the best I have ever had. The issues I had was these; Extremely long wait times to be seated, for me it was 1.5 hrs so plan ahead.  Second the service was OK, but hard to get their attention and too many different people serving our table.  I ask three different people who came to my table for the check.  I had to find our waiter. Third,  the seating is outside on the curb. It can be nice but on a chilly SF evening it isn't.
Overall I really liked to food.

testimonials: We had reservations for lunch. Otherwise there’s a long wait time. But it’s worth the wait. Pizzas were very good! I have only tried vegetarian ones. I loved their zucchini flower fritters and other appetizers! The tomatoes in them are exceptionally tasty! Cheese is delicious. It’s a lot of good food that needs good workout later though.

If you're looking for good pizza in CA this is the spot.

The wife and I ordered the Margarita pizza. Best I've had in CA. We also had the NY Cheese Pizza slice (next door, 2 doors down from Tony's). I've had NY Pizza in NY and this spot comes close to that.

Margarita pizza - 9.3/10 - The taste of the bread is an awesome wood fire taste.

NY Cheese Pizza - 8.8/10 - NY style pizza in NY is better, but for a place in CA this is great.

We arrived at 12:30 on a Tuesday (30min after opening) and we were seated right away. Noticed after 1pm it gets busy so get there early.

Well worth the wait and lived up to the hype. Everything we had was excellent, probably our best pizza ever (New Yorker), plan to go back every time we’re in SF. Add yourself to Yelp waitlist to make the wait easier, go there before your time is near though, worked well for us, we got a table inside as requested (waited longer for it but worth it to us). Service was great and just a fabulous experience overall.

top_10.name: Montesacro Pinseria - SoMa
top_10.address: 510 Stevenson St, San Francisco, CA 94103, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Wow! I've often walked past this place and seen people eating at the sidewalk tables. A friend suggested we have lunch there today and what a surprise! The pizza special was delicious. It's a cool spot, almost feels like you're in Italy. And the service is exceptional -- as good as you'll get in any restaurant. I look forward to going back.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
After countless neighbors sang Montesacro’s praises, my partner and I arrived with sky‑high expectations. Sadly, the evening never climbed beyond middling, and a few missteps sent it tumbling well below average.

What we ordered

Porchetta 4 / 5	Nicely seasoned, juicy, good crackling—easily the best bite of the night.

Pinsa “Grottaferrata”	2 / 5	Arrived lukewarm and dripping oil; toppings felt flat.

Pinsa “Ponte Mammolo”	2 / 5	Same temperature and grease issues. Olive‑oil flavor absent, crust lacked the airy lightness pinsa is known for.

Strawberry Tiramisu (off‑menu “special”)	2 / 5	No espresso‑soaked ladyfingers, just strawberry cream with chocolate chips. Portion: one small square. Price: $20—hard to view as anything but a gouge.

(We both felt queasy after dinner.)

Service & Hygiene

Our server was friendly but repeatedly wiped tables with a bare hand, then handled plates and the POS screen without washing. That alone took the shine off the evening.

Most desserts fall between $6‑15, so the surprise $20 tiramisu stung. The pinsas, though generously sized, didn’t justify their mid‑$20s price tags given the execution.

Pro tip: Skip Stevenson Street between 5th & 6th on foot; the alley’s smell and hazards can sour an already mediocre evening.

Overall rating: ★★☆☆☆ (2 / 5)

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: What an absolute gem-in-the-wall. Located somewhat in an alleyway that is off the main street (which by the way, the main street did feel sketchy), and upon entering you feel immersed in a rustic restaurant that gives off huge authenticity vibes. We were served by someone who was so knowledgeable of the food, was able to articulate how they were special, and provided such enthusiasm, it was refreshing. We decided to get 2 pizzas for 2 people, and although it was said they are somewhat personal-sized, they were slightly larger (so expect extras!). We chose the white pizza MARANELLA and a red called TORMARANCIA and they were DELICIOUS! Absolutely some of the best pizzas I've ever had. The crust was light, crispy, and yet filling. We paired the pizza with some wine, and it hit the spot. HIGHLY, HIGHLY recommend all those visiting SF to try!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This used to be one of my favorite restaurants, now the quality is not the same, the bread basket got smaller and the service is fast and cleans the table immediately not giving you the opportunity to leisure. It used to be able to transport me back to Italy, now it just another US restaurant. Sadly the experience is no longer worth the cost

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Such a charming spot with Rustic Italian interiors if you can brave the neighbourhood. The ambience of this place takes you back to Rome. Coming to the pinza, the crust was just perfectly crunchy and soft. The pinza toppings were interesting but not my favourite!

testimonials: Wow! I've often walked past this place and seen people eating at the sidewalk tables. A friend suggested we have lunch there today and what a surprise! The pizza special was delicious. top_10.name: Piccolo Italia
top_10.address: 799 O'Farrell St, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: We really loved this pizza place because the pizza was delicious and so was the dough. It was hot and very fresh and you could tell that it was homemade. I highly recommend this amazing pizza.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Great late-night spot! I was really hungry, and the staff went out of their way to help — they started preparing my pizza while I was on the way, so it was ready when I arrived.

I requested less cheese, and they delivered exactly that. The pesto base was flavorful, and the pizza was loaded with veggie toppings. It seriously slapped.

If you’re looking for a solid late-night pizza place, this is it. Might be worth a visit during the day too!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Great pricing for slices of decent pizza. Open late, quick. good service. Has seating as well.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: $5 for cheese pizza slice. But other than that, this place is beyond authentic and I admire the different lifestyles who come in and drop by to try some of their pizza. The workers treat everyone with respect, and despite the small dinning area, everyone is able to gather around the enjoy their food. It’s amazing really!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Big slices, fresh and greasy in a good, late night cravings kind of way :) plenty of options - cheese, pepperoni, veggie, Hawaiian, etc. The chicken was a bit dry? Peperoni was solid. Hawaiian was also good, a little light on the pineapple - not tart enough... Big slices, so I feel like one is enough lol. limited seats inside. Cash preferred. Drinks in the fridge. Condiments on the table - self serve. Hard to park in this neighborhood.

top_10.name: Mo's Grill
top_10.address: 1322 Grant Ave, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Like they say, it tells a lot about a restaurant if they have an open kitchen. They do!! Not a very big place so you might have to wait. Loved the mushroom burger. The grilled chicken burger could be better as the grilled chicken patty felt dry. The French fries tasted extra crispy 👌🏼Would recommend giving a shot.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
We had a very delicious dinner at Mo‘s Grill. The Burger was on point - same for the sandwich! We can also recommend the garlic french fries! I am not a fan of fries, but these where out of this world!

See you again soon!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: boy oh boy did that burger restore something in me. fries yummy, crunchy, salty, and made my toes curl. i got the western burger and it was also good. would highly recommend u wont be disappointed #bbb #bestbayburger

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Very nice family owned restaurant had the blueberry pancakes with the fruit on top amazing. Just amazing. 🤩 Love it clean place water in glass 😉i was happy to see that it means something and it’s a  open kitchen .  mo’s it’s the place check it out 👍🏽👍🏽

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Delicious food! Very good quality! Terrific! I had a good time here, service is pretty fast, they do everything from scratch seems like, their meet is amazing!! Definitely a place to visit while you are in SF.

top_10.name: Pearl's Deluxe Burgers
top_10.address: 708 Post St, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Was very hungry after a +50k steps day around SF and craving for a proper large burger not too far from my hotel.
Lucky me, Pearl’s was just around the corner and following some online reviews I went for the Deluxe Bula Burger with extra mushroom and Kobe meat as replacement (buffalo not being available unfortunately) with a side of a mix French fries and onion rings.
Said sides were absolutely perfect, best French fries I had for quite a moment and onion rings crispy without being too dry.
Burger was massive and really comforting. Not the the absolute best I have ever had but very decent with a meat cooked to my desire (real “rare”).
Atmosphere was low key and very quiet, with fellow European travelers from Italy and France dining there too.
All in all a great no-frills comforting experience after a long and busy day with the best possible food to indulge in.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Went here for dinner while in town. I tried the mini burger and a mixed basket of sweet potato fries and onion rings. Overall I felt like the food was just ok. The burger seemed a bit undercooked and lacked flavor. The sweet potato fries were pretty good, probably the best part. The onion rings weren’t good. They lacked substance and flavor.

The restaurant is a small shop. Locally run. Overall it was clean but could use a refresh. Kinda had that old person house smell.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: My Prized Pearl burger was cooked to perfection but was disappointed with the lack of flavor of the burger. Not seasoned whatsoever which left me tasting the overbearing blue cheese. The garlic fries were good and my peanut butter milkshake was delicious. Presentation was good and the service was great but lacks the space for seating comfortably.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: One of my favorite burger spots in the area. Affordable and solid! Burgers are always fresh, my usual is a simple burger without cheese and I’ve never had a bad order. Love the fries. Everyone working there seems nice and very chill. Recommend 👍

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Fantastic burger spot!! Customer Service is five stars burgers are five stars value is 10 stars. You can get a mini burger for $10. Why are you not eating here?

top_10.name: Garaje
top_10.address: 475 3rd St, San Francisco, CA 94107, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
We usually get the burgers and do highly recommend them as they are delicious and very satisfying.
This time we each tried something different for takeout: my husband got the OG zapato and like that very much. I got the spicy fried chicken sandwich, which to me did not register as spicy enough.. plus the BBQ sauce with it was just too much sweetness which I would also not prefer for a "spicy fried chicken sandwich". Others may like this if they can only tolerate a little amount of heat, which is balanced by sweet- it's just not for me.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This place has been here forever and you can tell why. It's still super reasonably priced and the food is great. They always have tasty and unique stuff on tap too. My go-to is the Surfer Leo, but every burrito I've had has been good, as are the nachos.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Great vibes but pretty pricey food. Fish tacos were solid and yummy but expensive.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Excellent atmosphere. Great chips and tacos. Loved their involvement in PURSUIT.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Amazing food and fun atmosphere. Kitchen is delicious!
They were closing soon but even let us dine in.
Really excellent customer service!

Advice :
Try their burger! It's spectacular!

Also the zapato burritos are huge, best to split with someone!

top_10.name: The Melt
top_10.address: 455 Market St at First, Suite #140, San Francisco, CA 94105, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
**The Melt Experience**
I recently dined at a hamburger restaurant and decided to try their signature dish, the Double Melt Burger. Upon arrival, I was presented with the burger on a tray, accompanied by a refreshing cucumber on the side, which added a nice touch to the overall presentation.
As I took my first bite, I was immediately struck by the sheer heaviness of the burger. The generous layers of thick cheese melded with the juicy patties created a flavor profile that was both indulgent and satisfying. However, the richness of the cheese was quite intense, and I found myself feeling quite full after just a few bites. This may be a plus for some, especially if you're looking for a hearty meal, but it might be worth considering if you prefer lighter options.
In terms of pricing, I found it reasonable given the portion size and quality of the ingredients. Moreover, the restaurant boasts a great variety of food items on the menu, ensuring that there’s something for everyone, whether you’re in the mood for burgers, sides, or other entrees.
Overall, the Double Melt Burger delivers on flavor and is a solid choice for anyone who enjoys a decadent burger experience. Just be prepared for its size and richness! If you're looking for a filling meal in a casual setting, this restaurant is worth a visit.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I recently had the pleasure of dining at The Melt, and I must say, it was a fantastic experience! The service was impressively fast, making it easy to enjoy a quick meal without any hassle. Ordering was a breeze with the convenient iPad-style screens, allowing for a smooth and efficient process.

Now, let's talk about the food. The fries were absolutely exceptional—crispy and perfectly seasoned, they were a highlight of the meal! The burgers were equally tasty, bursting with flavor and cooked to perfection.

The atmosphere was enjoyable, with both indoor and outdoor seating options that cater to your preference. Overall, The Melt offers a great combination of delicious food and efficient service. I highly recommend it for anyone looking for a satisfying meal!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Honestly a really underrated spot in the city. Open super late, decent prices, and good quality. This is upscale fast food so don't expect mind blowing food, but for what it is, it's great. One of the best burgers in the city, and really great shakes and fries.

The actual mac and cheese is ok, but the burgers are S tier. Check them out if you have a late night craving.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This spot surprised me on how good the food actually was! Wow! Burger melted in my mouth, great pricing, no wait neither. If you in downtown SF, definitely have to try this spot out!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Two of us recently went here for a snack/dinner and we found the sandwiches (beef stake and beef patties inside spicy bread) are really tasty and satisfying. The garlic parmesan fries were soggy and not crispy, however tasty. Their portion sizes are quite decent for the price you pay. These sandwich concepts are quite cool and satisfying. Very well done guys!

top_10.name: Super Duper Burgers
top_10.address: 783 Mission St, San Francisco, CA 94103, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Super Duper Burgers was absolutely amazing! The meat was incredibly fresh — you can really taste the quality in every bite. The milkshakes were rich, creamy, and just the right amount of sweet. Prices were totally reasonable for the quality of food and service. Honestly, nothing but positive things to say. If you’re visiting San Francisco, this spot is a must-try! You won’t be disappointed. 🍔🥤

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: The burger was absolutely delicious! My first time in San Francisco and I heard that if you're craving a burger, This is the place to get something good. I was NOT disappointed. I only had a single burger with fries and a shake, but it was SO filling without feeling like an overwhelming amount of food. I used the kiosk at the front to order so I could take my time and see all my options. It was very easy to use. I liked the relaxed atmosphere and that there was a second floor where you can sit. I only gave the atmosphere 4 stars because there was a little bit of a funny smell when I went upstairs, but it was easy to ignore. Would definitely come here again for this awesome food!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Gluten free pasta straws?  What a great idea!  These are 100% better than paper straws especially for things like my strawberry shake. Got a shake, garlic fries, and a super duper cheese burger. All excellent. Thank you.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Chicken sandwich and Super Burger was delicious. Ciabatta roll nicely toasted just a little dark on the inside. Chicken and Beef was juicy. French Fries nice and crispy. Free pickles. Friendly and nice staff.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: It’s a must try burger place in downtown; very well priced and awesome burgers. You will not be disappointed; must try

top_10.name: Beep's Burgers
top_10.address: 1051 Ocean Ave, San Francisco, CA 94112, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Finally found my new go-to burger spot in SF! Went to Beep's last night around 11pm (love that they're open until 2am - perfect for late night cravings) and ordered their 1/2 pound burger well done with American cheese, avocado, and bacon plus fries. Holy cow, this might honestly be the best burger I've had in San Francisco. The patty was cooked perfectly - well done but still juicy somehow. The bacon was crispy, avocado was fresh, and everything just worked together so well. Even the fries were on point - crispy outside, fluffy inside. Yes, $25 for a burger and fries is pretty steep, but I'm not even mad about it because the quality was there. You can tell they use good ingredients and actually care about what they're putting out. The late hours are clutch too - there aren't many places doing quality food past midnight in the city. Staff was friendly even though it was late and they probably wanted to go home. If you're a burger lover, you need to check this place out. I'm already planning my next visit and trying to figure out what else on their menu is worth trying. Beep's just earned a loyal customer!​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Outstanding Smashburger with beautiful crusty American cheese. The bun is super fresh and the sauce is very complementary. The fries came out like lava, super hot and fresh. The nuggets are cooked to order and were steaming hot. I ordered a six piece and they gave me seven!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Just moved into town, definitely not coming back here when I become a local though, found hair in my garlic fries!!  However, there were so good so it’s a shame that this happened. I would say it would be a gamble to come here because the service was overall mediocre. But the food and history make up for it. Maybe next time they’ll be no hair, and same good fries? Who knows, but I sure won’t be finding out!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I really wanted to love this place because of the history behind it but unfortunately left feeling disgusted.

Parking is a nightmare. While I was lucky enough to get one of the 6 spots in the lot, that was only after I circled the block 3 times. Street parking was also not an option without an unreasonable amount of walking.

My one compliment about the burger is how well the done the milliard is. It is in the style of a lacy edge smash patty and imparts flaky bits of crispy beef to each bite. Other than that, it’s just an average hamburger.

The garlic fries were a major let down. They smelled phenomenal and were heavily seasoned  with garlic and green onion but ate like stale, greasy cardboard. They sat in my stomach and were miserable.

Maybe I just caught Beep’s Burgers on an off day but because of my experience, I will not be giving them a second chance.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Best burgers Ive had.Everything about it was special. Fresh ingredients cooked to perfection, bit pricey but definitely worth the stop. Top burger in Cali if not the US. Parking lot for parking. Outdoor seating.

testimonials: Finally found my new go-to burger spot in SF! Went to Beep's last night around 11pm (love that they're open until 2am - perfect for late night cravings) and ordered their 1/2 pound burger well done with American cheese, avocado, and bacon plus fries. Holy cow, this might honestly be the best burger I've had in San Francisco. The patty was cooked perfectly - well done but still juicy somehow. The bacon was crispy, avocado was fresh, and everything just worked together so well. Even the fries were on point - crispy outside, fluffy inside. Yes, $25 for a burger and fries is pretty steep, but I'm not even mad about it because the quality was there. You can tell they use good ingredients and actually care about what they're putting out. The late hours are clutch too - there aren't many places doing quality food past midnight in the city. Staff was friendly even though it was late and they probably wanted to go home. If you're a burger lover, you need to check this place out. I'm already planning my next visit and trying to figure out what else on their menu is worth trying. Beep's just earned a loyal customer!​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​

Outstanding Smashburger with beautiful crusty American cheese. The bun is super fresh and the sauce is very complementary. The fries came out like lava, super hot and fresh. The nuggets are cooked to order and were steaming hot. I ordered a six piece and they gave me seven!

Just moved into town, definitely not coming back here when I become a local though, found hair in my garlic fries!!  However, there were so good so it’s a shame that this happened. I would say it would be a gamble to come here because the service was overall mediocre. But the food and history make up for it. Maybe next time they’ll be no hair, and same good fries? Who knows, but I sure won’t be finding out!

top_10.name: Super Duper Burgers
top_10.address: 2304 Market St, San Francisco, CA 94114, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I been here during late night when I was craving for a burger while I was very hungry. Upon arrival, there was a bit of a line, but I did not mind it since I needed some time to decide what to get since it was my first time here in general. Finally it was my turn to order and I was met with one of their welcoming, well trained and understanding staffs that made the process a quick and easy one. I decided to order to go since my friend was waiting in the car where parking was not the best option in the area due to the overall safety. Everything was made to order which is the way I like it and I never mind the wait since I am a very patient person. Luckily I still captured a photo of my order even though I conquered my burger in a minute or two due to hunger. I highly recommend this place to all burger enthusiasts, if you are looking to try something new or in need of a quick bite just like me. I definitely will be back to tryout the other delicious options they have to offer.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
What's better than a bowl of piping hot ramen after a night of drinking? A good old greasy burger! Yeah!!!!

I was actually interested in locating a Habit Burger Grill, but they're not in the city. Thankfully our local friends knew of this SF startup.

ATMOSPHERE:
I walked by it numerous times but never noticed it due to its nostalgic look and signage. The inside has a few tables with more outside along the sidewalk. No drive thru.

MENU:
Burgers, milkshakes, soft serve, wine, beer.

FOOD:
Roasted Portobello Mushroom Cheeseburger
Like Five Guys, their stated "cheeseburgers" are double patties. Juicy, tender and full of flavor. Man, this was a damn good mushroom burger!

French Fries
No combos here, but these natural-cut shoestrings were affordable, crispy and tasty.

SERVICE:
It was Pride weekend so the place was pumping. Time from order to delivery was a quick 10 minutes or less.

OVERALL:
A little pricey but so worth it. This burger fan approves!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This was indeed one of the better burgers from a burger joint.  Juicy, flavorful and freshly made.   The dine in option is bare bones.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: The burgers were juicy and delicious with a natural beefy flavor. The fries were crispy and not overly salty. The milkshakes were also great. Service was quick and the staff friendly.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I've been to both this Castro super duper and the one on 98 mission each over a dozen times, and this Castro one just doesn't hit the same bar. This one in Castro don't properly mix the flavoring with the milk in the shake leaving a clump of flavoring (see pic), the burgers are ham-handed put together with the buns lacking the slight crisp in other modern burger stores. Just compare their items to the other locations side by side and it's obvious the other franchisees do a better job of doing the little things that make a good burger, fries or shake.

top_10.name: Super Duper Burgers
top_10.address: 2201 Chestnut St, San Francisco, CA 94123, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I’m a huge burger fan and in and out is by far my favorite for quality and being consistent with there meals. This is the first place I’d want more than in and out burger. The ingredients are fresh the meat was hot like burn your tastebuds kind of hot. It’s busy but able to keep up with demand. I’m glad I
Chose this new place over in and out burger.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: It's OK but I expected more based on the reviews. Burgers were dripping with fat and garlic fries had some rubbery cheese substitude one them. Ironically you have an option to leave out the parsley (which had no taste, it's just for looks) but not to leave out the cheese. Taste of the burgers was good though, that's what matters. Only one restroom in total makes for waits.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Do you like a good burger? Do you want to start questioning why you haven’t been covering your fries with garlic your whole life?

Well this is the place. The burgers are absolutely delicious, but the garlic fries are an absolute must! (pretty heavy but fantastic)

I would personally recommend to get double lettuce and double tomato!

Oh… and pickles are up for grabbing like if they were any common sauce!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Super Duper serves up delicious burgers. I opted for the mini burgers to try two different kinds and they weren’t all that mini; by European standards, they’re full-sized. I was especially surprised by how good the vegan option was.

The fries were just okay, but the service was fast and efficient.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
May 2025 US burger joint in trendy Chestnut St Marina area.  Good and sizeable portions of flavourful meats.  Think mini burger with a reg sized patty 😃

All meat patties are grilled to standards with good spicing.  Particularly like the free pickle station.

Modern stylized diner with toilets.

Very ideal for quick eats and small groups.

top_10.name: Roam Artisan Burgers
top_10.address: 1785 Union St, San Francisco, CA 94123, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Came here for lunch and left with mixed feelings. I had the seasonal mango chicken burger and a soup. the soup was the highlight: creamy, flavorful, and well seasoned.

The burger, on the other hand, was disappointing. Despite having plenty of ingredients, it lacked flavor and felt below average overall.

The place is spacious with lots of seating, so finding a table isn’t an issue. Just wish the food matched the potential of the space.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Normally I am not one to leave a review but since I am a tourist from Southern Cali, this is well deserve… two words , EAT HERE. The service is phenomenal, atmosphere was lovely, and the food is FRESH and HOT. Thank you to the wonderful lady who assisted us with our order as she helped a booming amount of customers and pushed out several to-go orders. She was smiling throughout and extremely courteous! The Springtime Burger is DELICIOUS. When I am back in SF, I will be sure to visit. I’m glad the reviews I read lived up to the hype. 10/10 and worth your money. Take a visit 💓

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Roam is a solid and consistent spot for burgers, has the mom and pop creativity with the corporate consistency. I will always praise their zucchini fries, as they are literally addictive. Always delicious and cleanly presented. I do enjoy that they have their seasonal menus come and go, as you don’t see that too often in burger joints. Counter service makes it nice and relaxed and for the whole family or a solo meal. As this is not a hidden gem, you know what youre gonna get here.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Absolutely amazing burgers! Easily one of the best I have ever had! I got the springtime burger and the chimichurri was perfectly balanced with the cheese, aioli, and spring greens. The burger had an excellent crunch, tons of delicious juices dripping out, and excellent beef. No notes 10/10

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This place has awesome burgers!  They don't skimp on the toppings or the patty size.  Plus, the prices are totally fair for what you get.  The staff were super nice and helpful too.  Our food came out crazy fast, which was a nice surprise.  Definitely recommend checking this place out if you're looking for a good burger.  I'll be back for sure!  So good!

top_10.address: 721 Market St, San Francisco, CA 94103, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: A borderline 5 star burger to me given the reasonable price. They don’t have even cheese included by default so I had to add both cheese and bacon to make the burger nice. They only had one cheese option available at the point I visited. The burger was juicy but on the flip side it was soaking with fat and my hands were all oily from the very first second I touched the burger. The chips were pretty oily and not as well made.  No interesting sauces either. Overall this place is reasonable for a quick bite. Don’t look for any good atmosphere there - the place is far from being sparkling clean

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Came here through a friend's recommendation and their burger didn't disappoint. I loved the beautifully chargrilled beef patty with some slightly crispy bits, yet they managed to keep the meat moist inside. We ordered the mini burger with fries to share which was perfect for a light lunch.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Loved it! The smash burger was delicious, the fries were super crispy, and the pickle side (all-you-can-eat!) was really good. I really liked the place. I just wouldn’t recommend using the bathroom, it smelled pretty bad, haha. But aside from that, when it comes to the food, it was excellent!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Hands down the BEST burger I’ve had in a while! The Super Burger was so juicy, it was hard to put down. It also has a good selection of add ons and substitutions. The Garlic Fries were crispy and I loved the touch of cheese on top. I’ve never had shake made how The Chocolate Shake w/ Fresh Strawberries is made , you get a really smooth and refreshing taste when both are sipped together.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Had to take my burger it was too red for me. I had to take it back to get it well done this time. It was season good. Blueberry shake is really good.
