top_10.name: Shizen
top_10.address: 370 14th St, San Francisco, CA 94103, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
We had a good experience at Shizen on a Sunday night. We managed to get a last-minute reservation and were impressed with the food and ambiance, though the service was just okay. We could not find street parking, so we opted for the paid parking lot next to the restaurant which was 20$. Coming to the dishes we tried:

Boddy and Soul: 5/5, this was best amongst the dishes we tried with great flavors.

Open invitation: 5/5, looks great and tastes equally good.

Sweet potato roll: 4/5, this classic roll was good but felt the specialty rolls were better.

Mushrooms and Gyoza: 3/5 both were underwhelming and a bit bland.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This is hands down the best vegan sushi I’ve ever had! I was lucky to snag a seat right away, with no wait. I tried the Boddy and Soul and Open Invitation from the Specialty rolls - both were outstanding. I was genuinely amazed by the incredible flavors in every bite. The sauces and ingredients were perfectly balanced and complemented each other beautifully. Since I don’t eat raw fish, finding this vegan sushi spot was a real treat. The hype is definitely justified! The service was fantastic, and my food arrived super quickly. I can’t wait to come back and sample more dishes from the menu.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Recommended by a family member and what an amazing spot!!! We got super lucky with being seated by walking in around 9pm on Saturday night.

The team was super helpful in accommodating us and requested we be ready to order as soon as we are seated. We ordered a bunch of different roles along with tempura and tofu appetizers.

The ambiance and comfort in this restaurant is very inviting which made the experience that much more fun. Ohhh and their hot sauce is AMAZING which is homemade!!!!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Amazing vegan sushi! We were lucky to get two  seats as walk-ins with only a 15-minute wait. Totally worth it—highly recommend!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This was a very great dining experience. Everything the staff, the food, the atmosphere. The food comes out as things are ready which gives the table an opportunity to sample things as they are fresh. The rolls were innovative and delicious. Every bite a flavor explosion. I had two none vegans at my table and they thoroughly enjoyed the meal and felt satisfied.

top_10.address: 395 Golden Gate Ave, San Francisco, CA 94102, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Edit: we went back and had crispy cauliflower, Indian fried rice and lemongrass deluxe (again) Everything was delicious!

Great vegan food! Went on a solo date and got the Lemongrass Deluxe. It was delicious! The right amount of spice as well. Definitely recommend and would visit again next time I'm in town!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: There's so many vegan options here and sooooo delicious. I wish I had this in Michigan as I love Vietnamese food but wish there were more places that used mock meats as a former meat eater for that nostalgic taste. I still love all the tofu options though and they have some cool snack options like canned vegetarian pate and even hot dogs.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Food is all vegan and very flavorful. Even though 2 dishes we ordered had the pepper sign next to them, they were not really spicy.

Very busy during the lunch hour. And because of the big hall with hard surface, it gets quite noisy.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I have visited this place multiple times, and it consistently offers some of the best food I’ve ever had. Their desserts are exceptional as well. I highly recommend it to anyone looking for a memorable dining experience and delicious food.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This is an absolute must try. I haven't been for over 15 years when they were in the old location. The new location is fantastic and the food is even better than before. Every option is on point with great flavors and freshness. The Queen was really good!

top_10.name: Wildseed
top_10.address: 2000 Union St, San Francisco, CA 94123, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Wildseed in San Francisco has quickly become a gem in the vegan dining scene, and for good reason! As vegans, finding great food can feel like an uphill battle, but Wildseed makes it effortless—and incredibly enjoyable.

The moment we walked in, we were warmly greeted by Jarod, I believe the manager, who immediately made us feel welcome and accommodated. His enthusiasm and attentiveness set the tone for an incredible experience.

Our server, Shadwa, was nothing short of amazing. From the start, she checked in on our preferences and any allergies we might have, ensuring every dish was tailored perfectly for us. Her friendliness and genuine care made our meal feel special—and her warm smile never left her face throughout the entire experience. What truly impressed us, though, was when Shadwa requested a slight modification to one of our dishes on our behalf. It’s clear that Wildseed’s team is all about going above and beyond to make sure their guests feel celebrated and cared for.

The food? Simply put: fresh, vibrant, and full of flavor. Every bite felt like a celebration of plant-based cuisine, with dishes that were as visually stunning as they were delicious. The ambiance was equally impressive—modern, clean, and inviting, with a lively energy that made us feel right at home.

From start to finish, Wildseed exceeded our expectations in every way. The combination of outstanding service, nutritious and flavorful food, and a warm, welcoming atmosphere makes this place a top contender for the best vegan restaurants in SF. If you’re in the area and (especially if you’re vegan), Wildseed is a must-visit.

Thank you to Jarod and Shadwa for making our experience so memorable—you truly shine, and we can’t wait to return!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: It's nice to have an upscale vegan restaurant in SF and I love that there's lots of options like non-alcoholic drinks  or gluten free menu options. Delicious juices and seasonal menu based on available product is a highlight for me. Expensive overall but worth the occasional indulgence, especially if it's for a special occasion. The service is always great and I recommend sitting at the bar if in a group of two.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Great vegan food and wine selection - a bit pricey for some dishes and a few odd tastes here and there like the sausage in the paella but overall 8/10 dinner experience and 9/10 brunch experience with great decor and ambiance + stellar service. Highly recommend the spicy curry, corn fritters, mezze and the breakfast sandwich

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This place wants to turn me into a vegan. The food is so good that I wish I could eat here everyday. My health would be better and my stomach would be happy. I love the green goddess pizza, meze plate and cucumber salad. Their custom cocktails and mocktails are superb too.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
May 2025 Original Wildseed branch offering trendy and farm based vegan cuisone and creative mixology.

We have loyally been going to the Palo Alto branch and this originating one was definitely a welcome find in SFO and the Pac Hts area.  If you arent sold to vegan cuisine this resto may change your mind and condition your taste buds.

Their seasonal section is always worth trying as well for the regulars.

The drinks are very diverse and offers unique themes and blends.

Staff have been consistently professional and accomodating.

The layout is spacious and can provide privacy with enough variety of indoor and outdoor choices.  From counters, cubicles and free standing tables.

Ideal for all types and sets of diners.

One of our more favorite causual dining restos in the Westcoast.

top_10.name: Firefly Restaurant
top_10.address: 4288 24th St, San Francisco, CA 94114, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Absolutely delicious. Mostly gluten free menu and very accommodating for dairy free needs as well. Our waitress was so wonderful, too. A little chilly in the parklet but they had blankets for us. 10/10.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This is a painful review to write because I wanted to love this place. The atmosphere is homey and welcoming, the staff was fantastic, and some of the food was delicious: every starter was amazing, and the sweet potatoes were a knockout. But then there were the misses. The fried chicken main arrived cold and greasy, and the brownie sundae was burnt to a crisp... Literally a crisp, as it was almost impossible to even cut it. The biscuits were also overbaked to the point of being painfully dry. And while the starters were good, it's mostly variations on carbs, with limited vegetable or other options. If the food was more evenly prepared and they added a little variety to the small plate options, this place would be amazing. Note their license is beer & wine only, no hard liquor.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
We really enjoy firefly. My wife is strict vegan, and they have many dishes which either are or can be made vegan. I am not vegan. We always get the seed loaf, really enjoy the rustic flavors. I enjoy the Pao de Queijo, and the onion jam that comes with it is my favorite. The Mexican street corn is mild and delightful.

My wife enjoys the daikon radish cakes and usually gets them as her main, supplemented with something else since they're a starter and a little small for a main. The choppy salad is excellent even in vegan form. The spring salad is also excellent as a vegan option. I've had both the fried chicken and the braised pork; both are excellent. The only quibble is that the "damn fine buttermilk biscuit" hasn't actually been that great on two occasions - it tends to be overcooked and not so tender. The cornbread is much better although it too tends to be overcooked. The Mac and cheese is fine but not spectacular.

For dessert, the chocolate peanut butter bar is excellent, but get the vanilla ice cream rather than the coffee cocoa nib vegan ice cream if you can. The dulce de leche pot de creme is excellent but very rich. And the key lime pie is also excellent, not too tart or too sweet - just right, but smaller than I would like.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Five star, creative DELICIOUS food. Easy Street parking. Friendly, professional, knowledgeable staff. Nice restroom. Casual yet festive ambience. Fun place for celebrations or dates.

They do NOT do take out. The focus is on the people who are present to them. And in turn, they are present to the people enjoying the warm, hospitable welcome.

Pricey but SO worth it.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This is my second time at this restaurant, and I'm so glad I came back to try some new dishes. The food was absolutely delicious!

testimonials: Absolutely delicious. Mostly gluten free menu and very accommodating for dairy free needs as well. Our waitress was so wonderful, too. A little chilly in the parklet but they had blankets for us. 10/10.

This is a painful review to write because I wanted to love this place. The atmosphere is homey and welcoming, the staff was fantastic, and some of the food was delicious: every starter was amazing, and the sweet potatoes were a knockout. But then there were the misses. The fried chicken main arrived cold and greasy, and the brownie sundae was burnt to a crisp... Literally a crisp, as it was almost impossible to even cut it. The biscuits were also overbaked to the point of being painfully dry. And while the starters were good, it's mostly variations on carbs, with limited vegetable or other options. If the food was more evenly prepared and they added a little variety to the small plate options, this place would be amazing. Note their license is beer & wine only, no hard liquor.

We really enjoy firefly. My wife is strict vegan, and they have many dishes which either are or can be made vegan. I am not vegan. We always get the seed loaf, really enjoy the rustic flavors. I enjoy the Pao de Queijo, and the onion jam that comes with it is my favorite. The Mexican street corn is mild and delightful.

My wife enjoys the daikon radish cakes and usually gets them as her main, supplemented with something else since they're a starter and a little small for a main. The choppy salad is excellent even in vegan form. The spring salad is also excellent as a vegan option. I've had both the fried chicken and the braised pork; both are excellent. The only quibble is that the "damn fine buttermilk biscuit" hasn't actually been that great on two occasions - it tends to be overcooked and not so tender. The cornbread is much better although it too tends to be overcooked. The Mac and cheese is fine but not spectacular.

For dessert, the chocolate peanut butter bar is excellent, but get the vanilla ice cream rather than the coffee cocoa nib vegan ice cream if you can. The dulce de leche pot de creme is excellent but very rich. And the key lime pie is also excellent, not too tart or too sweet - just right, but smaller than I would like.

top_10.name: Casa Borinqueña
top_10.address: Casa Borinqueña, 945 Market St, San Francisco, CA 94103, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Are you sure this is vegan? The chicken skewers were fantastic! The yucca fries with impossible beef was very flavorful.
And the cake was so moist and just the right amount of sweetness. The owner was was a doll and made us feel right at home.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Built up an appetite browsing through Ikea next door, then crossed into Saluhall, a hip eatery on mid-Market where Casa Borinqueña can be found. The Puerto Rican (PR) stand gave major island vibes and reminded me of the food I would find in Little Caribbean, NYC, but vegan.

The sample platter is the way to go with sweet BBQ skewers on a bed of rice and plantains. A PR meal wouldn’t be complete without tostones, topped with your choice of chik’n or beef. While you can get one of each, I have a slight preference for the chik’n. Wash it down with a Malta India, a popular carbonated malt drink from PR. Despite its name or bottle shape, it’s non-alcoholic. It was a nice touch that Casa Borinqueña carried this; it added to the meal.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: As soon as we spotted this vegan joint on Happy Cow, we knew we’d have to stop by! Everything we got was fantastic and if we had to do it all again, we wouldn’t change a thing! We love that you’re here!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: first time trying puerto rican food and it was amazing!!! ordered the sampler plate and everything was not only super worth it but incredibly tasty! it’s the type of food that makes you say “can’t believe it’s vegan” (but the best part is that it actually is). cashier was kind and service was quick. :]

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: The sample platter was incredible! We come down to the city to try new vegan spots and this did not disappoint we will definitely be back! There is a lot of love that goes into this food!

top_10.name: Rad Radish
top_10.address: 301 Hayes St, San Francisco, CA 94102, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Really loved this place! Delicious vegan food, everything came out super fast. Ordering is easy — either from your phone or using the self-service kiosk. The atmosphere is pleasant, clean, and stylish. I’ll definitely be back! 💚

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
OMG, Rad Radish in San Francisco is the ULTIMATE spot for plant-based food lovers! From the moment I walked in, I knew this place was going to be magic. The clean, inviting, and brightly colored environment instantly put me in a good mood, and the staff was so friendly and attentive—such a warm vibe!

Here's what I ordered:
Breakfast Sandwich: Flavor explosion, no, seriously, it was EVERYTHING.
Chilaquiles: Crispy, tangy, and perfectly spiced—such a great start to the day.
Spicy Marinated Cucumbers: Fresh, spicy, and totally addictive.
Vietnamese Iced Coffee with Lavender: Sweet, floral, and the perfect way to wash it all down.

What truly blew me away was how quickly everything was prepared—no waiting around, but you could tell the food was made with love and care. The prices were super reasonable, which only adds to the insanely good value here.

Bonus points for sharing ownership with WildSeed in the Marina, another amazing plant-based gem in the Marina Bay area! If you’re vegan (or just love good food), Rad Radish is a must-visit for a flavorful meal any time of day.

Thank you, Rad Radish, for making my plant-based adventure in SF absolutely radiant! 🌟🌱 I WILL BE BACK (SOON)!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I’m always grateful for vegan restaurants.  I thought my breakfast sandwich was tasty and  I enjoyed my salad, but I had to add on a lot to make it filling. My friend said food was boring and bland.  I wasn’t stoked that I went to pour some water and the pitcher had like some weird debris on the inside & the cups did not slightly look clean.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Delicious Vegan food in Hayes valley. Had the Breakfast sandwich with breakfast potatoes and salad . Evrything was delicious especially the potatoes! Food came quickly and ordering was easy . I will come back and try other stuff on the menu . This is  conveniently located plant based eatery

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: My wife is pescatarian and loved the options, I had the caprese burger and thought it was very enjoyable. Cozy decor and very kind staff. Was a short drive from our hotel in Union Square. We will absolutely be back the next time we visit SF.

top_10.name: Cha-Ya
top_10.address: 762 Valencia St, San Francisco, CA 94110, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Pros: Menu is all vegetarian. Atmosphere is cozy. Service is super fast. Ordered arrived within minutes of placing the order. Run by old Japanese folks. Servers are super sweet old Japanese ladies. Loved the service. Food is delicious too with so much variety and flavor.
Cons : It’s just a little on the pricy side.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Very good for vegan fare. The udon was tasty, and the rolls were inventive. I could do with less of the seaweed salad inside the bigger roll though it was hard to eat. Otherwise great spot and will be back!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
In the bustling heart of San Francisco’s Mission District, where the clamor of modernity often drowns the whispers of tradition, I chanced upon a sanctuary of serenity and sustenance: Cha-Ya, a vegan Japanese eatery that beckons the weary traveler with promises of wholesome fare and tranquil ambiance.

Upon entering this modest establishment, one is greeted not by the ostentation of opulence, but by the humble elegance reminiscent of a Zen monk’s abode. The air is imbued with the subtle aromas of miso and sesame, evoking memories of distant Kyoto temples and the disciplined artistry of shōjin ryōri.

On my recent visit, I partook in a repast that commenced with a sushi ensemble, where golden daikon and an array of verdant vegetables were ensconced within delicate rice and nori. Each morsel was a testament to the chef’s devotion to purity and balance. Accompanying this was a sunomono salad—crisp cucumber slices mingled with a hint of cinnamon, presenting a dance of flavors both refreshing and unexpected. A bowl of miso soup, rich yet unassuming, provided warmth to the soul, while a chilled Sapporo lent a crisp counterpoint to the meal’s gentle nuances.

Though my appetite was sated, the menu’s offerings whispered temptations yet unexplored. The Cha-Ya Roll, a signature creation, boasts tempura-fried vegetables enveloped in sushi rice, drizzled with a soy-ginger glaze—a harmonious blend of texture and taste. The Kinoko Udon, with its medley of mushrooms in a savory broth, promises comfort on fog-laden evenings. For those seeking variety, the Cha-Ya Nabe presents a hearty hot pot brimming with tofu, vegetables, and delicate noodles, inviting communal indulgence.

In an age where the essence of Japanese cuisine is often overshadowed by the ubiquity of meat and fish, Cha-Ya stands as a beacon for those yearning for authenticity without compromise. It is a place where the principles of compassion and culinary excellence converge, offering nourishment that transcends the mere physical.

As I departed, the lingering flavors and the establishment’s quiet dignity left an indelible impression. Cha-Ya is not merely a restaurant; it is a haven—a reminder that amidst the cacophony of city life, one can still find pockets of peace and purity.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This cozy, family-run restaurant is an absolute gem! The food is incredible—seriously, you have to try it.  Their Gyoza, Inari Sushi, and Sansai Noodles are my personal favorites.  Plus, they have amazing Happy Hour deals on Saturdays and Sundays!  The staff is also the sweetest and makes the whole experience even better.  Highly recommend checking this place out!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Family seating, amazing food that warms the heart and body. Easy to find fully vegan with the menu. Staff is more than happy to answer questions, even when trying to figure out which direction a cab might pick up from

testimonials:

top_10.name: Casita Vegana SF
top_10.address: Pier 27, The Embarcadero, San Francisco, CA 94111, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: If you are looking for homemade, tasty and affordable vegan food around the wharf area, I do recommend this place! We took the two different plates options and we loved it! So happy to support small independent vegan businesses when travelling. Worth it!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
The food was so good I even forgot to take a picture before eat lol
We order hotdogs (really good), sandwich (absolutely perfect) and a iced matcha. The owner is super nice and the view (La Casita is parking in Pier 7 water front) is stunning. I definitely recommend to all vegans and vegetarians in Bay Area or tourists.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Visited 11/06/2023

Delicious vegan food from this food truck. It was nearby the Exploratorium and we fancied something quick and delicious and this place delivered amazing food.
We had the tacos and a hot dog with a view out into the water. The lady serving was really friendly and they took card which was a bonus for us as well.

Would recommend this place, it's delicious.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I got the taco plate and the food was so flavorful and delicious.  Highly recommend.  I did have a lil trouble finding it, if you use google maps, it shows it is in the middle of pier 7 when in fact it is on the street by Pier 7.  Will definitely be back, whenever I'm in San Fran.  Thanks so much!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Absolutely delicious food. Had 2 sandwiches. Fresh flavours and ingredients prepared super fast. Can't recommend highly enough.

testimonials: If you are looking for homemade, tasty and affordable vegan food around the wharf area, I do recommend this place! We took the two different plates options and we loved it! So happy to support small independent vegan businesses when travelling. Worth it!

Would recommend this place, it's delicious.

top_10.name: Savor Cafe
top_10.address: 401 Irving St, San Francisco, CA 94122, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Savor Cafe might just be my favorite restaurant in the city. The food feels home made - you can feel the effort put in to each dish. I’m vegan and appreciate how nearly every dish is already vegan and those that aren’t mostly all can be adjusted.

I’ve been numerous times now and have never been disappointed. The menu switches up fairly often using seasonal vegetables which makes it always a new experience. Each dish is unique and has helped me find new flavors I enjoy and overcome previous biases I held for others. Really recommend the spanish melt sandwich!

The owner is incredibly kind and knowledgeable - he’s usually always telling jokes and has been very generous to me after he’s recognized me coming in regularly.

Check it out, you won’t regret it!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I really enjoyed the well-prepared and innovative cuisine!  Fresh ingredients of the season, skillful preparation, and gentle but rich flavors make every dish a delight.  The welcoming owner/chef is quiet, kind and inviting. The fresh baked almond croissants were excellent. The mujumara, lentil soup and fattoush salad were all Arabic comfort foods, accessible to any palate. Most if not all of the food was vegan (not sure about the feta on the fattoush), though I’m not sure I would have guessed that from the dishes. I could eat here every day and will certainly make the trip across town again.  The restaurant can be busy so maybe make a reservation if you can. Wonderful!!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I came here with my partner and we were genuinely impressed by the food, service and the atmosphere. The space is clean, cozy, and welcoming, with a cultured home kitchen feel rather than the usual sf café style.

Our waiter (who I suspect might be the owner) was very personable and even memorized our order. He recommended the Hodo Tofu Sougar, which was excellent! It was flavorful, hearty, and filling. We also got the café mocha and jackfruit sandwich, both of which were very tasty as well.

It is rare for me to give a full 5/5 in this city, especially for a vegetarian/vegan restaurant, but this place truly deserves it. I really enjoyed the “mom and pop” feel to it and the food tasted like an excellent home cooked meal made with a lot of care and intention.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
We visited the Bay Area for four days and were just looking for a vegan lunch spot. Instead, we found this gem and ended up eating there twice in those four days—plus ordering more to take back to LA!

Everything we tried was full of flavor and texture, and you can truly feel that it’s cooked with love. The owner is always present, interacting with customers, which adds even more charm to the place.

My absolute favorite was the knaffe—I had always wanted to try it but had never seen a vegan version before! The mushroom shawarma was also incredible.

I would definitely recommend this place to all my friends and will be coming back next time I’m in the Bay Area.

Thank you, Mohamed!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I can’t believe we just discovered Savor Cafe SF—it’s absolutely fantastic! As someone who grew up in a Middle Eastern household, I often miss the flavors I loved as a child since my partner is vegan and I’m vegetarian. But Chef Mohamed has masterfully reimagined traditional dishes into plant-based delights without compromising on authenticity. Every bite is packed with rich, familiar flavors. I can’t wait to bring family and friends to experience this gem. Run, don’t walk!

top_10.name: Greens
top_10.address: Building A, 2 Marina Blvd, San Francisco, CA 94123, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: There is a reason this restaurant has been around so long. They have always done an excellent job of creating fun vegetarian or vegan dishes. Nice cocktail menu although I must have got one of the only drinks that seemed child sized. It was good though. I forget the name (sorry). Go and have a great night out. Beautiful view over the bay and bridge if you go at sunset. Don’t skip desert!!! Reservations recommended.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
A new found favorite.
There is a reason this place has been around since 1979. It deserves to be.
Was it an accident we ended up here for my birthday dinner when it was thought we were going somewhere else?
Serendipitous fate is how I see it in every aspect.
We got a window table with a spectacular sunset view, service was extremely attentive (swapping our plates perhaps more than necessary, but I appreciate the intention), and the food...
How can I possibly describe it?
Well...I bought the cookbook and complimented chef Katie personally if that says anything.
It was like food art in presentation and taste experience.
One appetizer was so good we immediately ordered a second one. You should go and figure out which one it was before it's not on the menu anymore.
Because it is seasonal food selections, we indulged as much as physically possible. We filled our bellies to the top.
I look forward to returning as soon as possible. I wish there could be more than one location, but understand having just one allows total focus on delivering only the best of everything they can.
Hats off to everyone working there. You are spectacular!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I recently dined at this vegetarian restaurant and thoroughly enjoyed the experience. The food was truly delicious overall, with the main dishes standing out as highlights. However, we were a bit surprised by the appetizer, which was just a tiny piece for two people. While the tomato soup was decent, it didn’t quite appeal to my taste, and I couldn’t finish it. On a positive note, the main courses were quite good, and the restaurant boasted an incredible view that added to the ambiance. The atmosphere was wonderfully relaxing, and our waiter was both attentive and polite. I would definitely recommend this place for a pleasant dining experience!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: 5 star food and service.  Happy we were able to get seating without reservations on mother’s day (I know we got lucky).  You can taste the freshness in the dishes.  I could eat the cheddar biscuits all day.  The house made jelly that came with the scones could be served with just a spoon.  The entrees showcased the flavors of the ingredients very well.  And the views from the restaurant are wonderful.  Last time at this restaurant was in the early 2000’s.  Great to see this restaurant has been in operations as long as it has.  I know that speaks to a great team pushing out consistently amazing food and service.  No hesitation recommend!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Father’s Day Celebration brunch w family! Food was delicious: loved the blueberry scones but they were Tiny!

Black Bean soup was dreamy good. Our scramble eggs and squash pupusas were equally good! Ordered the granola & fresh fruit but sadly measly serving of granola. Though the yogurt was delightful.
Ordered a fresh squeezed OJ -so fresh!

Lovely view of the Marina & Golden Gate Bridge -perfect atmosphere. Beautiful dining room!

Service was ok - on top at the beginning of service but a bit distracted at near end of meal. Lacks a little be more warmth but I’ll attribute that to the fact they were buzzzy!
Hostess was efficient but needs more welcoming vibe!
Overall a good meal but not stellar service

top_10.name: Neighbor Bakehouse
top_10.address: 2343 3rd St UNIT 100, San Francisco, CA 94107, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: We came here on a weekend afternoon. There was still plenty of bread inside! The server is friendly! Once you walk in, you will smell the sweetness of the bread and it is amazing. I got the ginger pull apart, the raspberry pistachios croissant, mushroom tart and the cream. They are all unique and good! Recommended!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: We stopped by Neighbor Bakehouse on a Sunday at 8 am. There was plenty of street parking available. As we were walking to get in line (3 parties in front of us), 2 employees rudely pushed past us on the sidewalk. It was clear they were late as the bakery was supposed to open at 8 am but did not open until 8:15 am. We got the char siu croissant, ube croissant, pistachio blackberry croissant, and ginger pull apart. The char sui croissant is more like a Danish but a good alternative for people who like savory pastries. The ube croissant was ok - although the interior was pretty, I thought the ube flavor was lacking. The pistachio blackberry croissant has a nice tartness from the blackberry filling. The ginger pull apart was very unique and delicious - I really like ginger flavored things so I enjoyed it (this is more like real ginger flavor and not gingerbread). I would get all the pastries again except the ube croissant. Overall, I enjoyed the pastries but I think B Patisserie and Arsicault are still my favorite bakeries.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I love the food, no argument there. The only complaint is the service. Some of the cashiers are friendlier than the others. Also, there is no one fulfilling the orders, at least on the weekends. So, the cashier has to give you your order before getting to other people which makes a long wait. I would go back for the food, but not the vibe, unfortunately…

Update in July 2025:
Unfortunately, the unfriendliness issue still persists. Quite frankly, I walked out of there today pretty bummed. I talk very highly of this place and the quality of their pastries. I second guessed myself today. I suggested to one of the cashiers to post a picture of their pasty options online, and they said “you can just take a picture”. I just politely suggested it because as I told them, too, I didn’t want to hold the line while deciding what to get. It was very rude of them to not take it and maybe just pretend they were open to feedback. So this is the only place for me to write a feedback on their customer service. I don’t find myself as interested in their business as I used to be anymore and that’s a shame. Fortunately, there are plenty of bakeries around here with new ones opening all the time.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I did hear about the bakery from people and decided to go. And indeed it was worth it. I went at 11:30. There was a small queue.
I ordered strawberry matcha croissant and ginger pull apart (veg). Both of them were good. It was crispy and flavourful. They have various bread options.
Must try

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I always make sure to stop by this place when I'm in SF! Their collection is fantastic, especially the chocolate hazelnut, pistachio blackberry, sausage, and charsiu

top_10.name: Arsicault Bakery
top_10.address: 397 Arguello Blvd, San Francisco, CA 94118, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Their croissants and other pastries are exceptionally well-made. We waited 20-30 minutes on a Friday morning and they were well worth! They were so soft, flakey, crispy, buttery.

We got the plain croissant, kouign amann, chocolate croissant, and ham & cheese croissant.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Arsicault is a popular croissant stop in the bay for a reason. Their chocolate almond croissant is perfect, I wish I bought more to bring home. We went around noon mid week and there was no wait! I’d recommend this place to anyone wanting a good croissant in the city.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
This is a capital B bakery, no frills, not a cafe, specializing in high quality French pastry. The line down the block does not lie.

They have a system, it moves fast. Once you're inside, you have your order in what feels like seconds.

The croissant base is the star of the show. You can have it plain, with chocolate, almond, sugar, cinnamon, or some combination thereof, whatever you choose. But you don't really need it. The pure buttery, flaky crust is perfection by itself.

Between the four of us we tried about half the menu, and there wasn't a bad bite to be had. Get whatever you fancy, and enjoy a pastry made with the care and technique it demands.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: There’s always a line here so make sure to get there early! They’re known for the almond croissant and I definitely understand why: crispy outside and soft on the inside rich with almond paste that tastes natural and not artificial. I think it is a bit on the sweeter side though. The ham and cheese croissant was my favorite because we got it warm and the cheese pull was crazy. The ham in the croissant was also super meaty and didn’t taste like soft thin deli meat. Also tried the kouignn amann which wasn’t as remarkable as the other two. It was like a rolled up less crunchy version of a croissant with sugar glaze.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Absolutely loved Arsicault!!
Tried the almond croissant, kouign amann, morning bun, and the cranberry coconut scone (not pictured).
Everything was so delicious, definitely recommend trying a few different things!
There can be a wait to order, but it's all worth it!
If you are from out of town or new, definitely add it to your list of bakeries to visit!

top_10.name: Cinderella Bakery & Cafe
top_10.address: 436 Balboa St, San Francisco, CA 94118, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
My husband and I came to San Francisco today from Sacramento and chose Cinderella Bakery & Café for lunch. We ordered borscht and fried dumplings — everything was delicious and very home-style! Authentic Ukrainian food that brought back warm memories. We especially loved that there’s a wide variety of baked goods, pastries, and Ukrainian dishes and drinks.

The staff was friendly and attentive. We enjoyed the outdoor seating area with covered benches — cozy and surprisingly dust-free even though it’s near the road. Portions are generous — you’ll definitely leave full.

The only downside was that the tables were a bit sticky and the interior felt a bit dated — though that kind of added to the nostalgic charm. If you’re craving real Ukrainian food, I definitely recommend stopping by.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I've been wanting to visit this place for a long time, and finally, last Saturday, I had the chance to have lunch there. I will return every time I get the opportunity. It has a reputation for a reason: delicious, simple food, a wide selection, reasonable prices, fast service, and the food tastes simply amazing. Everything I tried was fantastic!

The only thing I wish for is a bigger place, but I suppose that's something we all want to. I just want more stomach and time to try every dish on their menu! If you haven't visited this place yet, don't hesitate. I do not doubt that every item on their menu is worth trying and tastes delicious.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Café Cinderella is a great spot on San Francisco’s culinary map. They serve delicious Russian and Eastern European food and desserts. The Polish pierogi stuffed with cheese are truly authentic, and the Russian soups, like solyanka, are outstanding. Portions are generous and very filling, and the prices are quite reasonable. What I also really appreciated is that, despite the low prices and casual, bar-like atmosphere, they still serve everything on ceramic plates with real metal cutlery. Overall, I can highly recommend this place.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Authentic, affordable, tasty Russian cuisine paired with big-portioned and wide variety of sweets and pastries. What’s not to like? I’ve been here a few times and have never been disappointed. I highly recommend the Borscht soup.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This place is definitely popular for a reason. They have extensive menus with Russian dishes. Non-Russian items look fabulous as well. My friend recommended Fried Perosky (a kind of bread with stuffing). It tastes great when it's warm. When I bring it back home and toast until it is slightly crispy, it is even better! I am looking forward to trying many more things there.

top_10.name: b. patisserie
top_10.address: 2821 California St, San Francisco, CA 94115, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ Highly recommended (1=Avoid, 3=Standard, 5=Can't Miss). San Francisco is home to many great bakeries, but B. Patisserie is a local and international staple. Peak hours should be avoided and parking can be a little bit of pain since you'll have to find street parking somewhere nearby. There is a good amount of seating, but can be challenging on a weekend. Their menu is vast, but I would stick with the laminated pastries and skip the tartines and desserts. The banana chocolate almond croissant is something I've only been able to find here and is one of their signature offerings.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: We got the chocolate chip cookie, a banana almond croissant, chocolate kouign-amann, and a peach scone. The kouign-amann was like a mini croissant with a melted chocolate topping. The banana almond was like crossing banana bread and a croissant, the best part was the crispy edges, they were like crispy chocolate chip cookie pieces. The chocolate chip cookie was like a Panera cookie. The scone was ok but plain and had very little peach flavor.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Food was good, but customer service was rude.

We were in the area on Saturday around 4:30 PM and wanted to try their popular kouign-amann, but they were sold out. We decided to get the banana chocolate almond croissant which was surprisingly great. We also tried the yuzu cheesecake, which was fine. When we asked one of the people at the counter a question about the ingredients in the cake, she was quite rude. The person at the billing counter was nice and helpful.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Spectacular! The cookie is one of the best I’ve had in my life. The raspberry almond croissant was perfectly balanced both in taste and texture. Everything was absolutely delicious.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Really good baked items! We ordered a croissant, chocolate and seasonal (passion fruit) kouign amann, and a pain suisse. All the items were fresh and good, but we especially liked the chocolate kouign amann and the pain suisse (which was a little on the sweeter side but went very well with the coffee). There was a bit of a line, but it moved quickly, and there was good enough seating. Their coffee was good too.

top_10.name: Jane The Bakery
top_10.address: 1881 Geary Blvd, San Francisco, CA 94115, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Walked to this cute bakery from Japan town. There are so many pastries and they are all amazing. I had the pistachio olive twist and latte which was not too sweet. The matcha and banana bread were also amazing. We got there at 10 right before the line got crazy but it would be worth the wait. The service is fast and there is seating outside as well as a cute park across the street.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Loved the vegan banana bread which was also gluten-free. In my opinion it could’ve had some chocolate chip or walnuts in it as well to add a bit more variety but it was delicious nonetheless! They also had a chocolate chip cookie, a snickerdoodle and a muffin which were vegan and
gluten-free. I’ll be back to try the other options for sure

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Great coffee and tasty pastries — what more can you ask for? I dropped by Jane for a quick bite before work, and I was super impressed by the wide spread of pastries, ranging from the classics to creative and unique confections. I decided to get my go-to baseline — a chocolate croissant and cappuccino — and I was quite impressed overall! The croissant was buttery and flakey, and it had plenty of chocolate. If anything, it might have had slightly too much chocolate for my taste, since it was quite a bit sweeter than I’m used to, but that might be a controversial take. The coffee was also nice and nutty.

The staff was super friendly and efficient — I was in and out within five minutes, which included my indecision at the counter — so it’s a great spot if you’re in a rush. There isn’t any indoor space to sit down, but there’s a standing counter along the window or a few communal booths outside that you can hang out at.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: We were four people sharing different kinds of croissants — plain, chocolate, pain au raisin, and almond. My personal favorite was definitely the pain au raisin. We also had the prosciutto & burrata sandwich, which was amazing. The salad sandwich was packed with fresh ingredients, but the bread was a bit soggy and too soft, which took away from the overall experience. There was a long line and unfortunately no seating available, so we ended up eating in the park across the street. It would have been lovely to enjoy our coffee in ceramic cups instead of paper, if only there had been a place to sit. Still, everything tasted great and the quality was high.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
The best coffee I’ve had in San Francisco all month – hands down. Made on a La Marzocco machine, it’s smooth, rich, and absolutely worth stopping for. The oat cookie we tried? Unreal. Perfectly balanced, not too sweet, and just the right amount of chewy.

The service was just as good as the coffee, with a super friendly and welcoming staff who made the experience even better. If you’re a coffee lover or just craving something delicious, this place is a must-visit.

gluten-free. I’ll be back to try the other options for sure

top_10.name: ONE65 Patisserie & Boutique
top_10.address: 165 O'Farrell St 1st Floor, San Francisco, CA 94102, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I ate the best pistachio and chocolate croissant, it was amazing. Ham and cheese also very good.
Macaroon just ok.
The entremets were good. Mango, passion fruit and coconut was better than the chocolate one.
Service was good.
Nice environment.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Exquisite! Perfect texture and buttery flavor. A confluence of eye-candy and deliciousness. The small narrow space for seating fills up at busy times.
The brioche à la crême was perfectly spongy, light, and just barely sweet. The pain au raisin was crispy and fluffy and oh so buttery. Incredible.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Services are great. Cakes and desserts are nicely presented. We have flan and moose tart. Both are delicious. Paper cup holders are easily torn apart, though I think it is the compostable material they use.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This bakery is world-class and is well worth making a detour from whatever else you have going on to stop by for while in San Francisco. The Pastries, Deserts, Chocolates, & Lattes are all of the highest quality.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Service from folks at the counter was great.  The cakes were beautifully presented.  Taste was just a bit off.  There wasn't one that I was blown away by what the cake tasted like.  Matcha, lemon, chocolate, na none of them.   Looks better than they taste unfortunately.

testimonials:
I ate the best pistachio and chocolate croissant, it was amazing. Ham and cheese also very good.
Macaroon just ok.
The entremets were good. Mango, passion fruit and coconut was better than the chocolate one.
Service was good.
Nice environment.

top_10.name: Noe Valley Bakery
top_10.address: 4073 24th St, San Francisco, CA 94114, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Desserts: 5/5
Service: 3.5/5
Ambiance: 4/5
Overall: I have to say that there are some definite hits from this place.

The extended review...

Desserts:

Milky Way Bombe - 5/5 - This is a nice combination of textures and flavors.  For the most part it's all chocolate but again a nice assortment of textures.  You get a crispy shell, creamy mousse, and fluffy cake on the inside.

Red Velvet Cake - 5/5 - A very moist cake base and fluffy and tasty cream cheese frosting.  I have to say this is one the best ones I've had.

Oreo Cake - 5/5 - Just like the Red Velvet Cake, the cake is very moist and tasty.  It also has a similar cream cheese frosting with some oreos in it.  SO YUM!!!!

Raspberry St German Eclair - 3.5/5 - the texture was consistent with standard eclairs and the filling was quite nice.  What I loved was the different flavor of the traditional eclair.

Service: 3.5/5 - Friendly service.

Ambiance: 4/5 - It has a good space for taking a seat to enjoy yourself once this pandemic is over.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I absolutely love their Financier Tartlets! The cardamom knot is also great and their brownies are yummy too! I come here for decadent treats to keep me strong throughout the tough  work day!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Great cakes! Frosting is rich and the cake itself is light. The chocolate birthday cake is especially good but I also loved the passion fruit lemon.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: The cake was fresh and tasty, but the decoration and writing were poor. I wouldn’t order for an event again. Had to wait over 20mins just to pick up.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This place is dynamite. I have been coming here for years, but haven’t been able to try anything else other than the cupcakes, the chocolate bomb select breads and frozen cookies. It’s just so over the top good. One of my favorite places in Noe Valley. Keep it up guys! Thank you so much!

top_10.name: Bob's Donut & Pastry Shop
top_10.address: 1621 Polk St, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Bob’s is a neighborhood 24-hour gem that just can’t be beat. They have all the best types - glazed, chocolate, maple, old fashioned, filled, donut holes, you name it. They’re fast, and you can watch them regularly put in fresh batches of donuts. Highly recommend for breakfast or that mid-afternoon sweet snack craving. Easy for grab and go or they have a few tables and chairs to sit at.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: The new 24 hours Bob's Donuts location on Polk in the city! Was looking for dessert and everyone knows about this place. Their original location is 2 min walk away but I believe they will close that soon. This is their new location and much bigger with tables to sit at. Lots of donut varieties made fresh. I like the s'mores, malasadas with cream and creme brûlée donuts but better to get them early morning but gets dense after awhile. Prices are decent. Street parking is difficult in the day but at midnight, lots of parking available. Friendly service but they are busy. I would recommend for a late night snack. ;)

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Bob’s Donuts & Pastry Shop outwardly doesn’t look like much, but the display case of delicious-looking donuts doesn’t lie. I got an Apple fritter, both a maple and a chocolate cruller, and a crumb donut. All of them were fabulous. I don’t love overly sweet donuts, so the crumb was my favorite. That’s not to say the other ones were overly sweet though; each donut’s flavor was exceptionally balanced. The texture of the crullers were light, fluffy, and went perfectly with the creamy and sweet icing. Bob’s Donuts & Pastry shop is a great spot for classic donuts.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
When you think of Nob Hill businesses, Bob’s Donuts immediately comes to mind. Freshly made in their original store one block over since the 1970s!
Now there’s an additional new Bob’s Donuts location at 1720 Polk (the next block North)!
The Grand Opening was SO Fun!
People lined up before the doors opened at 10 am on 2/21/25. As we patrons got to the doorway, we were treated to a Freshly fried Glazed Donut.
The inside was completely new.
The counter had the variety of donuts all laid out. It was a rainbow of colored frosting. Donuts of all sizes.
I bought a strawberry malasada, which was like a strawberry compote sugar donut. Delicious! So light & airy inside!
Past the cashier, Bob’s Donuts family members handed out complimentary tote bags and a long-stem rose! 🌹
There’s nothing better than nostalgia, neighborhood bakeries, supporting a local Nob Hill family business & fresh donuts!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Visited Bob's Donuts expecting something special given its reputation as a San Francisco landmark. Bought half a dozen donuts to try different varieties.
Asked staff for their recommendation and got a small crumb-topped donut with maple glaze. This was actually the most disappointing - too sweet and crumbly texture. The other donuts were average quality, nothing better than what you'd find at other local shops.
Hard to understand why this place has such long lines and recognition. There are better donut options in the city without the wait and hype.
I do think Bob's Donut doesn't live up to the legend.

testimonials: Bob’s is a neighborhood 24-hour gem that just can’t be beat. They have all the best types - glazed, chocolate, maple, old fashioned, filled, donut holes, you name it. They’re fast, and you can watch them regularly put in fresh batches of donuts. Highly recommend for breakfast or that mid-afternoon sweet snack craving. Easy for grab and go or they have a few tables and chairs to sit at.

The new 24 hours Bob's Donuts location on Polk in the city! Was looking for dessert and everyone knows about this place. Their original location is 2 min walk away but I believe they will close that soon. This is their new location and much bigger with tables to sit at. Lots of donut varieties made fresh. I like the s'mores, malasadas with cream and creme brûlée donuts but better to get them early morning but gets dense after awhile. Prices are decent. Street parking is difficult in the day but at midnight, lots of parking available. Friendly service but they are busy. I would recommend for a late night snack. ;)

Bob’s Donuts & Pastry Shop outwardly doesn’t look like much, but the display case of delicious-looking donuts doesn’t lie. I got an Apple fritter, both a maple and a chocolate cruller, and a crumb donut. All of them were fabulous. I don’t love overly sweet donuts, so the crumb was my favorite. That’s not to say the other ones were overly sweet though; each donut’s flavor was exceptionally balanced. The texture of the crullers were light, fluffy, and went perfectly with the creamy and sweet icing. Bob’s Donuts & Pastry shop is a great spot for classic donuts.

top_10.name: Thorough Bread & Pastry
top_10.address: 248 Church St, San Francisco, CA 94114, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Just FYI – this location does not serve iced coffee

Although their selection of pastries is quite delightful! I would definitely suggest this as a substitute for your usual donut. There are many sweet, jellied, breads, and chocolate desserts.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
We ordered almond and original croissants
There are not very heavy but I can’t taste the  buttery smell of it 🥐
The coffee shop has a nice patio for customers to seat at the back of the store
☕️

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Highly recommend the ham and cheese croissant and heading out into the back garden, a lush leafy oasis with a dozen tables for quiet conversations fed by wind chimes and good company.
Return visit: I wanted the peach galette but was given the pineapple one. Didn't notice until I opened my to go bag. In addition to it just not being what I wanted, I didn't think the pastry was as tasty as the croissant. It's more dry than I hoped. So I can't say that I enjoy the pastries equally.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: 10/10 outdoor seating, especially if it’s sunny outside. the sandwich i got was pretty solid, sourdough fluffy and light though not sour at all. the croissant tasted a bit old, on the doughy and crispy side compared to the more oily versions at other bakeries i feel.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
a hidden gem of a bakery in a city known for their pastries. although the pastries here aren’t the best i’ve had, you can’t beat the price and cozy atmosphere. skip the coffee. overall, would definitely come back to try the other pastries and bread.

flat white: it was a latte, and a poorly constructed one.

plain croissant: perfectly buttery and crispy. hit the spot!

raspberry almond croissant: not too sweet, solid almond frangipane

custard morning bun: the pastry was solid but the custard was above average. really enjoyed this one.

top_10.name: Tartine Bakery
top_10.address: 600 Guerrero St, San Francisco, CA 94110, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Anything that we got was great. All the sandwiches have house made breads; highly recommended. Also they have great pastry and deserts and also coffee. All good. There is long waiting time and not enough seat. But you can take away and enjoy the food at Dolores park.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
amazing cakes and other desert here- we tried almost everything and they all soooo good.
The almond tart was incredible - lots of flavors that work together but not too sweet.
Sourdough is also amazing here - got a couple of options but the buttermilk is supposed to be best and quickest sell so you have to be here early to get it
Chocolate cake is all right, a bit too sweet and heavy for our liking.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Fantastic pastries and great location. The almond croissant was perfect and unlike any I have had before. Not too sweet and didn’t taste of artificial almond, which is extremely rare to find. The plain croissant was luxurious and everything you want a croissant to be. The morning bun was soft and had a hint of orange, which was a nice surprise. We came in on a Thursday morning around 10:30am and seating was pretty tight, but eventually a spot opened up. Will definitely be back.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Overall my experience was good, a borderline 5 star. There are a lot of dessert options like cakes and some pastries (mostly sweet too). The onion and cheese pastry tasted well. Maybe I would prefer a bit more filling and slightly crunchier pastry but it was still good. Note that the prices are fairly high

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: We live in central Florida and were in SF on business. I’ve been baking Chad Robertson Tartine Country loaf for a couple months, so super excited to try the “real deal “. It did not disappoint. Easy to locate, as the wait line was out the door. Worth the wait, I had avocado toast, enjoyed in the outside seating area. Lovely taste, great crunch from the crust, fresh seasonings. I don’t know when we’ll be in SF again, so glad we were able to enjoy!

testimonials: Anything that we got was great. All the sandwiches have house made breads; highly recommended. Also they have great pastry and deserts and also coffee. All good. There is long waiting time and not enough seat. But you can take away and enjoy the food at Dolores park.

We came in on a Thursday morning around 10:30am and seating was pretty tight, but eventually a spot opened up. Will definitely be back.

top_10.name: Lapisara Eatery
top_10.address: 698 Post St, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Visited Lapisara on Saturday for brunch. Despite the line outside, we were seated quickly.
Tried the Crab Omelette and Chili Bomb Basil Omelette - both excellent! Really interesting take on breakfast with authentic Thai flavors. Much more exciting than typical American brunch options.
The Ube Latte was beautifully presented in a very cute cup, but unfortunately too sweet for our liking.
Service was attentive and professional throughout our meal.
Recommended for anyone looking to try something different for brunch. The Thai-style omelettes are definitely worth the visit.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: While we were in the city, we decided to stop by Lapisara Eatery for a nice brunch and it ended up being one of the highlights of our trip. This cozy little corner spot has a chill vibe, street views, and a solid brunch menu. The food came out quick, looked amazing, and tasted just as good. I had the best Belgian waffles I’ve ever had crispy on the outside, soft and fluffy inside. They also had a great selection of lattes and a decent drink menu, which made the whole experience even better. Everything tasted fresh, the service was smooth, and the atmosphere was calm and relaxing. If you're visiting San Francisco and want a brunch spot that really hits the mark, this is one you definitely need to check out.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Ooh la la! Great discovery! It wasn't too busy, which makes me wonder if people are just missing out. It wasn't the weekend but with it being summer I would think there would be a lot of tourists here. The food was delish and the service was very pleasant! The drinks were very interesting, and the taste was impressive. The chicken and waffles, while not spicy or over seasoned were very good. And crispy outside and juicy inside. It wasn't on the bone but had plenty of flavor. Chicken eggs Benedict, awesome! While a bit on the higher end, worth the splurge for one day for breakfast. The pictures do this place justice!!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Pleasant restaurant with their fried chicken being my favorite. The waffles were soft for my liking. I prefer crisp to my waffle. The dunginess crab benedict plate was solid. The potato combination and salad were great compliments to the benedict. The benedict itself was better with the potatoes too add savoriness to the meal. The matcha latte topped with whipped cream and an matcha ice formed bear, salted caramel Irish cream, and espresso macchiato were all recommendable. The service is okay. If I were to recommend a must try, it would be a plate to your liking with fried chicken. The selling point is the amazing fried chicken.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Please excuse the photo of partially eaten food. I almost forgot to take a pic 😁. Food amazing! I had french toast and ”Queen B” bacon which is thick cut bacon with a sweet and slightly spicy glaze on it. Highly recommend and well worth the upcharge! Will return when visiting SF again.

top_10.name: Heist Restaurant
top_10.address: 678 Post St, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: The breakfast at Heist’s is absolutely incredible!! The food here is high quality, fresh, and packed with flavour. Furthermore, the staff who work at this place are very attentive and friendly, they truly care about their customers here 😃🙌  This little restaurant/cafe is very minimalistic, sleek, and has a very cozy, “down-to-earth” vibe. If you are looking for a restaurant in the theatre district that is in a safe area, that is clean with not a lot of homelessness, you will absolutely love this place!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Wonderful breakfast spot - the server treated us very well, and the food was fantastic (I got like this veggie burrito). Honestly would return - it’s pricey but absolutely worth it. Great way to have a “late breakfast” packed with flavor, not oily and not too salty (which happens a lot with these breakfast places). Plus there is quite a bit of seating inside and a few chairs outside. Also exceptionally clean bathroom, which is always a plus

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: We visited here on our trip to San Fran. My gf ordered the heist & I ordered the gluten free pancakes. Great gf pancakes. The berry topping was a nice complement. Lattes were yummy & aesthetically pleasing - we had the nutella latte & the ube latte. I’m not sure how they make the eggs but they were seasoned so well & were beyond your usual scrambled eggs. The restaurant itself is okay, a little bland. Servers were attentive. Great for solo dining or 2 people- wouldn’t recommend a large party because the space is quite small. I would eat here again.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Great breakfast find!
Delicious food in a modern, clean setting. The Captain Crunch Burrito was spicy and amazing, the Chicken Caesar Wrap hit the spot, and the Avocado Toast with egg was a favorite. Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I had a delightful breakfast experience. The scrambled eggs were perfectly fluffy and seasoned, while the granola bowl offered a satisfying crunch with fresh fruits and creamy yogurt. The restaurant’s cozy atmosphere and friendly staff made for an inviting dining experience. Heist is known for its breakfast and brunch offerings, including popular items like breakfast burritos, French toast, and pancakes.  They also cater to various dietary preferences, offering vegan and gluten-free options.  I highly recommend Heist Restaurant for a delicious and enjoyable meal in San Francisco.

top_10.name: Doppio Coffee & Brunch
top_10.address: 1551 Mission St, San Francisco, CA 94103, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Excellent service and food quality! I have enjoyed coming here quite a few times. The food is very fresh and delectable. The drinks are perfectly flavored. Not oversaturated with sugar unlike some coffee shops that over-rely on syrup flavorings. The flavor here is top notch.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This place is fantastic. Excellent coffee options and brunch as well. We loved the savory and sweet crepes and the gents working here today put their heart and soul into their work. Thanks for a great experience. Hope to come again.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Very nice place! Great atmosphere and friendly staff. The coffee was really good. We had the breakfast sandwich and it was delicious! Definitely recommend this place, good service

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Everything about this place is amazing. The food, the coffee, the music, the atmosphere. It's a must try! All the coffees are good, the crepes are delicious (the picture is the bariatas favorite), the breakfast sandwiches amazing! You won't be disappointed. My husband goes here practically every day now since we live so close.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Just had lunch here and I was genuinely surprised for how delicious their menu items were at great prices! We had the smoked salmon avocado toast and were recommended the tuna melt sandwich and both were amazing! I wanted to end my meal with a sweet treat so we got the berry lover crepe and it was a great finale for our lunch. Will definitely be back again!

testimonials: Excellent service and food quality! I have enjoyed coming here quite a few times. The food is very fresh and delectable. The drinks are perfectly flavored. Not oversaturated with sugar unlike some coffee shops that over-rely on syrup flavorings. The flavor here is top notch.

Very nice place! Great atmosphere and friendly staff. The coffee was really good. We had the breakfast sandwich and it was delicious! Definitely recommend this place, good service

top_10.name: Sweet Maple
top_10.address: 2101 Sutter St, San Francisco, CA 94115, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
The food and atmosphere was amazing here! Try their SMSF pancakes,which are thin and soft with maple syrup, we added the berries topping with extra 5 dollars, it was worth it!!
Well roasted coffee with sweet pancakes were perfect match!
It’s my second time visiting SF, can’t believe I found such a cute brunch cafe.
I kept asking for my coffee to be refilled, and we’ve waited for the server to ask for the check,however I understood it was a busy restaurant
The only thing surprised and confused, they take 6%of your purchase for employees benefits fee 🙏

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Incredible. What an awesome breakfast place! Ordered, pancake, French toast, eggs, potatoes and the famous bacon. Everything was good, nothing was disappointing. You have to try the bacon at the very least because, wow, that taste! We came around 9:30 on a Sunday, huge line but the wait isn’t long. For some reason they weren’t checking if people wanted to eat outside? We would have opted for it and I even let the front host know and he never sat us, the whole time there were open seats! Even though that was annoying we still ate.

Worth a visit.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: A friend and I walked to Sweet Maple as the sun broke through the summer fog this morning. I can imagine that on a weekend morning, Sweet Maple has a long queue of people waiting, but on this Thursday morning around 9:00am we were seated immediately.  We shared a Millionaire Bacon platter (pictured) and all I can say is, if you love bacon, you will be completely delighted as you eat this bacon like a millionaire. My Marnier French Toast was delicious and flavorful. My friend had eggs prepared to perfection. The wait staff was responsive, plentiful and excellent. The environment was clean, modern and well lit.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This was such a fun and unique brunch experience I had in SF! I went here after my brother's graduation ceremony and my family had the best time. The staff were very welcoming here and also note that the entire group needs to be present to be seated. This place seemed like a local favorite and the millionaire's bacon sounded interesting to me so I got to try it and it was SO good! The millionaire's bacon is what really stood out to me from this restaurant. I love how they consider the aesthetic of the food plating but the flavors of each dish is all amazing too. The staff constantly tended to our tables to refill our water & even though it was on the pricier end, I am so grateful that we celebrated my brother at Sweet Maple!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Absolutely everything was perfect! Starting off with the Millionaire Bacon Sampler Platter, this was amazing. Four different seasonings for the bacon I was beyond words. I got the French toast with mixed berries, berries being blueberries, strawberries and blackberries. It reminded no, no joke, of my aunt’s French toast. The iced mocha is in my top 3 of iced mochas I’ve ever had ❤️

top_10.name: Wooden Spoon
top_10.address: 2172 Market St, San Francisco, CA 94114, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Good varieties for breakfast and brunch. The egg stuff is delicious; very uniquely cooked. Fresh juice options and coffee too. Also recommending the salads.

Long waiting times :(

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I have to give this place its roses. If you time it right (outside of the rush), you can come in without waiting, but people DEFINITELY know about this iconic brunch spot.

Key features:
-Fresh squeezed orange juice
-Big Breakfast platters (Loved the Big Spoon at $25)
-Crispy, tasty bacon
-Cocktails & Coffee (Espresso Martini slaps)

I also enjoyed the Original Pattern Hazy IPA on tap! Fresh ingredients and customizable breakfast plates for picky eaters and/or dining restrictions. 100% recommend!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Nestled on the edge of the Castro and Mission, Wooden Spoon is a charming brunch spot perfect for catching up with a friend—no reservations, just walk in!

I ordered The Spoon Cobb, a light, healthy salad that doesn’t skimp on flavor—fresh greens, generous bacon bites, chicken, creamy avocado, and just enough cheese to keep things interesting. But the real conversation starter? Three egg halves. That’s 1.5 eggs. Not sure if it’s supposed to be one or two, but honestly, I kind of loved the ambiguity. It adds a little intrigue and I appreciate the extra protein.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: The food was great. The fried chicken is so yummy. The smoked salmon soft scramble egg is nicely cooked. We were lucky that we got seated at the bar right away. There usually is a wait. Will definitely come back again!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Split the hang fry and french toast with a friend. The portions are great! Service was amazing.

Came in at 11am on Sunday and waited just a little bit before we sat down.

top_10.name: Zazie
top_10.address: 941 Cole St, San Francisco, CA 94117, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
American cafe with good variety of brunch options.
Good fresh delicious food with veggie options. Not typical American portion.
Service is a bit slow but responsive. It's quiet but vibrant atmosphere. Good for couple, meetup and small gathering.
Hard to find parking but possible in around streets.
Indoor setting, limited outdoor setting but nice cozy patio in the end of cafe.
Not accessible for tight inside and steps to patio.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Loved this place, feels like I'm in France every time. We enjoyed the special pancakes. Today's special pancakes where called the Miracle Pancakes (made with sour cream and poppy seeds). So good! The Crab Eggs Benedict had a good portion of fresh crab. Cannes scrambled eggs were flavorful. The Chicken apple sausage are delicious.

Seating in the back patio. They have overhead heaters to keep you warm on a chilly day.

Service was outstanding!!!

I would recommend a reservation  on the weekend.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Zazie is hands down one of our Top 5 favorite restaurants in the San Francisco Bay Area, and every visit reminds me exactly why.

As someone who’s a big, big meat eater, I rarely go for a meatless option—but the lemon ricotta ravioli here is in a league of its own. Bright, creamy, and melt-in-your-mouth delicious, it’s one of the very few vegetarian dishes that leaves me totally satisfied without even thinking about meat. That says a lot.

Of course, when I do indulge my carnivorous side, the pork chop is absolutely divine—so tender it practically falls apart, and paired with buttery potatoes and the dreamiest mac and cheese. Rich, hearty, comforting. It’s the kind of dish you crave long after the meal is over.

The escargot deserves a special shoutout—it instantly transports me back to Paris. Delicately prepared, garlicky, and served with that unmistakable French flair. It’s the real deal.

And please, whatever you do, don’t skip dessert. The Chaud is an experience. Warm, gooey chocolate topped with toasted marshmallows—it’s like being wrapped in a hug that somehow takes you straight to Brussels. Yum, yum, YUM!

Zazie isn’t just a meal—it’s a mood, a memory, and a masterpiece every time. Whether you’re a die-hard meat lover or looking for something refined and soulful, this place delivers.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Great Brunch and lovely atmosphere. You will need to wait for half an hour depending on what time of the day you go. The Portion is quite generous. I ordered only one pancake, but it was good for two to share as it is quite thick. There is no tip, but the price is slightly on a higher side. Good quality brunch. I really liked the salsa in the egg Benedict and the home fry was very good with well roasted sweet garlics.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I love the atmosphere here, especially the enclosed patio. It is surrounded entirely by wood slats and a full ceiling with powerful heaters. They have dog night on the patio every Monday evening. The food is outstanding and with tips included in the pricing it makes the bill very simple. The Salmon Risotto, Burger and Pork Chop were all extremely well executed. Rich sauces, simply dressed salads and a freshly baked warm roll add the French flare to what otherwise would just be yummy food.

Service was outstanding!!!

Zazie is hands down one of our Top 5 favorite restaurants in the San Francisco Bay Area, and every visit reminds me exactly why.

As someone who’s a big, big meat eater, I rarely go for a meatless option—but the lemon ricotta ravioli here is in a league of its own. Bright, creamy, and melt-in-your-mouth delicious, it’s one of the very few vegetarian dishes that leaves me totally satisfied without even thinking about meat. That says a lot.

Of course, when I do indulge my carnivorous side, the pork chop is absolutely divine—so tender it practically falls apart, and paired with buttery potatoes and the dreamiest mac and cheese. Rich, hearty, comforting. It’s the kind of dish you crave long after the meal is over.

The escargot deserves a special shoutout—it instantly transports me back to Paris. Delicately prepared, garlicky, and served with that unmistakable French flair. It’s the real deal.

And please, whatever you do, don’t skip dessert. The Chaud is an experience. Warm, gooey chocolate topped with toasted marshmallows—it’s like being wrapped in a hug that somehow takes you straight to Brussels. Yum, yum, YUM!

Zazie isn’t just a meal—it’s a mood, a memory, and a masterpiece every time. Whether you’re a die-hard meat lover or looking for something refined and soulful, this place delivers.

top_10.name: Spruce
top_10.address: 3640 Sacramento St, San Francisco, CA 94118, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: The service was phenomenal, but our entrees were quite frankly inedible. I really wish I had said something, but we were celebrating a birthday, so I didn’t want to tarnish the evening. The attached photo was of my entree, it’s poached salmon. There was absolutely no seasoning, my friends and I were fighting over the salt that came with the table butter. Our bill was over $900 for four people. I really wish we had a better experience considering how much we were looking forward to this meal and how much we had spent.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
The staff are always the cornerstone of any notable restaurant experience, and Spruce’s team genuinely delivered. Our server, Michael, was so kind, and his attentiveness really made our night.

Every dish was beautifully and creatively presented, but our favorites were the Yukon potatoes and the Wagyu New York Strip.

As someone with celiac disease, I felt incredibly well cared for. The staff was knowledgeable, which helped with restaurant anxiety regarding gluten. Really thoughtful modifications were made to ensure our meals were both entirely gluten-free, which did not compromise the flavor! That especially can be hard to find in a restaurant. :)

Really really enjoyed once again, could not recommend more.

Concerning the first picture, I did dim the light a bit! It’s not that dark in person, but it is a dimmer & more intimate setting.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Very nice restaurant with top class service and elegant atmosphere. The food was the best part: everything was perfectly cooked and presented . Would love to come back and have the black truffle pasta again! The giant cookie was also delicious 🤤

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Be aware of the kind of reservation you’re making. We had no idea that the dining room is prix fixe only. Luckily they were able to move us into the lounge which was great! We were able to try several dishes and cocktails and the staff was great. This place is pricey but good for a date.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I had such a great solo weekend brunch at Spruce in San Francisco. From the moment I walked in, everything felt easy and welcoming. I was seated right away, and my server was super friendly and attentive without being over the top.

They started me off with a warm slice of coffee cake and some really creamy butter. Simple but so good. I went with a seafood-focused brunch and kicked things off with the dry aged amberjack melon crudo. It was incredibly refreshing, with the perfect mix of sweet melon, citrus, and delicate fish.

The highlight was the butter poached lobster eggs Benedict. The lobster was tender and full of flavor, and the eggs and hollandaise were cooked perfectly. Even the greens on the side were fresh and bright.

To finish, I had the beignets. They were warm, light, and fluffy, served with a rich chocolate sauce and smooth crème anglaise. The chocolate sauce was especially good.

Overall, Spruce absolutely delivered. The food, service, and vibe all came together for a really memorable brunch. If you are looking for a refined but relaxed spot in San Francisco, I definitely recommend it. I will be back.
