top_10.name: Sisterita
top_10.address: 669 Commercial St, San Francisco, CA 94111, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
5 Stars – Sisterita is a Hidden Gem!

We wish we had discovered Sisterita earlier on in our San Francisco stay — it ended up being one of the best breakfasts of our trip!

The Escape from Alcatraz (their take on scrambled eggs, omelette-style) was hands down the best I’ve ever had. Perfect texture, bold flavor, and thoughtfully prepared.

We also ordered the Voila French Toast Brioche, and it was beyond amazing — airy, flavorful, and visually stunning. Every bite felt like a treat.

Service was kind, the atmosphere was charming, and the food, unforgettable. We’ll absolutely return. Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Wow! This restaurant is a true gem of the Bay area. One of my favorite foods is chicken & waffles. Whenever I travel I am on the hunt for the best chicken & waffles. I've been to many large cities in America & so far, this is the very best chicken & waffles I've ever had! Chicken was perfect; tender & juicy on the inside & crunchy on the outside. The waffle was soft & lightly sweet with a crispy exterior. The maple syrup & spicy mayo sauce were exceptional pairings. I also highly recommend getting the spicy bacon. It's not a crunchy bacon, but a sweet & spicy bacon that was tender & sticky with the sweet spicy sauce. Overall, every element of the dish was packed with flavor, without being too salty, & the texture of the food was flawless! My son got the same order & raved about it as well. He said it was his favorite breakfast. If you love chicken & waffles, you need to order it here.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Sisterita is flat out my top favorite restaurant in the Bay area. Outstanding flavors, gorgeous space, delicious menu, sweetest staff. We are foodies and our bar is set very high. Sisterita was so outstanding and flavorful, we raved about it all weekend. Whatever you are doing over there, continue forever please. You hold a special place in my heart!!

Grilled Prawn Tacos - bursting with flavor!!!
Crispy Chicken Fried Rice - outstanding
French Onion Soup - packed with depth & flavor
French Fries

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
A Little Slice of French Brunch Heaven – Sisterita

If you’re on the hunt for the perfect brunch spot, look no further than Sisterita. This charming gem blends French vibes with warm hospitality, making it the kind of place you’ll want to keep coming back to.

The decor is thoughtfully done—stylish, cozy, and full of lovely little details that make the whole experience feel special from the moment you walk in. April, the owner, is an absolute delight, and you can really feel her passion in every corner of the place. The staff is friendly and welcoming, which just adds to the feel-good vibe.

Now, let’s talk about the food—absolutely delicious! Do yourself a favor and order the Florentine Benny. The eggs are perfectly poached, the hollandaise is rich and flavorful, and the homemade potatoes on the side? Out of this world. Everything on the plate was bursting with flavor.

And don’t skip the drinks—the mango mimosa is refreshing, perfectly balanced, and totally hits the spot.

Whether you're catching up with friends or just treating yourself to a delightful brunch, Sisterita is a must-visit in San Francisco. Great food, great atmosphere, and great people.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Great food, great service. We were there for fourth of July and they added fun decor to the plates. Ambiance was on point. Food was stellar. Something to mention is the tables are really close to one another. We got in without waiting or a reservation. Short walk from The top of Nob hill.

top_10.name: Mymy
top_10.address: 1500 California St, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Cute place with great breakfast! Had the regular eggs Benedict with a side of bacon (dying for crispy bacon) attentive staff, constantly refilling my coffee and food came very quickly even tho the place was packed. Absolutely satisfied my craving for brunch meal!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
During a recent trip to San Francisco, I was tipped off about a breakfast spot in Nob Hill, which is a local favorite. We arrived mid-morning, and while the indoor space was a little bit snug, the quality of the food was AMAZING and easily stole the spotlight.

We were seated within just a few minutes, and the staff was very welcoming and attentive with their service.

To start things off, we ordered the French Toast topped with seasonal fruit, which included blackberries, blueberries, strawberries, and orange slices. This came with a side of eggs and bacon. Our second entrée was a plate of scrambled eggs, sausage, toast, and fresh fruit, which included bananas.

We just had an intense workout, so our  appetite was in full gear, and this place definitely hit the spot. Mymy’s ended up being our favorite breakfast spot in San Francisco.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: What a cute little hole in the wall this place is! It sort of gives diner vibes… but better. Their Benedict is amazing but if you’re a fan of Hollandaise sauce I would definitely ask for an extra side of it. The service was great and the staff was kind. Very clean  interior. It looked family owned and they were busy when I walked in at about 11pm on a weekday! But I was seated and served in a timely manner.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Was looking for a great breakfast spot and this was the one! Sat outside to enjoy the weather and the service was great. I asked for a recommendation because I was stuck between a few options, and while the rec was exactly what I realllyyyyy wanted, I opted for the breakfast plate (we love a good breakfast salad). My meal was fabulous and I will definitely have to come back to try the other menu items.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Saturday can get pretty busy, as we arrived around 10:30am it was about 15 minutes wait and the line continued to get longer. Bottomless coffee and watermelon mimosa were good compliments to the Baja Benedict and Miss Mymy. Potatoes were very crispy. Salad was fresh. Zucchini pancakes had a hint of sweetness with bacon flavor. Nice neighborhood restaurant with a very San Franciscan vibe.

top_10.name: Brenda's French Soul Food
top_10.address: 652 Polk St, San Francisco, CA 94102, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: We had the catfish and fried chicken Benedict, grillades and grits and the bananas fosters french toast. The portions are all shareable, and that we did! Perfect texture and flavors from all menu items. Tomorrow we will be trying all of their famous beignets.My favorite was the beignets. They were so soft and crunchy and the seasoning was amazing.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Wow, our server was so helpful and kind. The food spoke for itself. Absolutely delicious. We went on a Sunday morning in June. The vibe was chill lots of small groups and couples coming in and out. We tried several things on the menu. Great flavors in everything. 💯 Recommend.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Reservation recommend. The food is delicious and the portions are large. I hope I can try more dishes. Servers are nice and willing to introduce dishes. Just tables are so close.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: The food was excellent. We’re not big eaters, so we usually split one order, but we got the Crawfish Beignets and the Spicy Chicken Sandwich, both to split between the two of us. It was plenty of food with room to spare. My favorite was the beignets. They were so soft and crunchy and the seasoning was amazing.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
This was the best brunch spot in SF according to Google Gemini.  And boy, did it deliver. Make sure you reserve your table via the website before showing up, to ensure you don't wait very long.

This was among the best meals I have ever had. My meal was the Shrimp Pot Pie, which was a daily special. (Not on the menu. Just on the chalk board.) Amazing!

My friend got the Hangtown fry with cheese grits and a biscuit with homemade strawberry preserves.  She said the biscuit was the best she'd ever had, and she's from Florida! I had never seen bacon and oyster cooked together with eggs. My friend sang it's praises.

Oh, and we started with the beignets! They were enormous.  They come in an order of 3 which is too much for 2 people about to eat a huge meal. I'd recommend asking for 2 instead of you are only 2 people. These were excellent beignets.

Our waitsraff were "Johnny-on-the-spot" with the water refills. So kind and helpful too.

We will be back.

Word of advice- get there betweem 8am and 10am or definitely you'll want a reservation. Leave time for parking too, btw.

top_10.name: KUSAKABE
top_10.address: 584 Washington St, San Francisco, CA 94111, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: My favorite Japanese restaurant in SF. Every dish is made thoughtfully and is delicious. The tastes are subtle but delicious, delicate and authentic. The Nigata sake was a perfect complement, clean and dry. Really amazing place.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Incredible experience! My fiancé took me here for my birthday dinner. Mika was so sweet and accommodating, making sure every course and piece was executed perfectly. High quality fish and ingredients! Everything was delicious and they made my birthday super special!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This was our first experience at an omakase restaurant, and the bar has been set exceedingly high. We sat at the counter, directly across from Patrick--who is the sweetest, most approachable, and knowledgeable craftsman one could score to lead our experience. The food was meticulously assembled, and we loved the textures and flavors. Nothing but praise for the kitchen to the servers to every detail put into the experience. Check out the Transamerica Pyramid Redwood Park on your way!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I simply can not rave about this restaurant enough. It was my first time here and it defintetly not be my last!

From the moment you walk in and get greeted by the staff and sushi chefs, to the servers meticuosly clearing dishes and plates, you feel very welcomed.

The food was so well prepared, fresh, and simply delicious. It was definelty one of the best sushi i've eaten in San Francisco and the Bay Area!  18 dishes came out and i was very full. About 200 dollars for the omakaze but well worth every dollar!  I can't wait to return!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
We celebrated a close friend’s bachelor party at Kusakabe with a dinner for nine. While the evening offered some incredible highlights, there were also a few unfortunate aspects that left us with mixed feelings about the experience.

The food was truly exceptional. Every dish was carefully crafted and elegantly presented, offering a range of delicate flavors and textures that impressed everyone in our group. The omakase journey was memorable, with standout courses like the uni that melted in the mouth and sparked admiration even from those in our party who are typically hesitant about raw seafood. The attention to detail in the preparation was evident, and the kitchen’s talent shined through in every bite.

We also want to acknowledge the excellent service. Our group was significantly delayed due to travel complications, but the staff welcomed us with grace and understanding. They held our reservation without issue, served us with warmth and professionalism, and allowed us to enjoy the meal at our own pace. Their hospitality made us feel genuinely cared for.

However, there were two major issues that deeply affected our overall impression. First, one of the sushi pieces contained a bone. This was both surprising and disappointing, particularly in a restaurant where precision is expected and the cost per person exceeds $200 before tax and gratuity. It disrupted the experience in a way that was hard to ignore.

The second and more disturbing issue was the presence of a cockroach on the wall behind our table. In any dining environment, this would be unacceptable. In a fine dining setting that charges premium prices and prides itself on offering a refined atmosphere, it was shocking. The sight of a cockroach near our table dampened what was otherwise a thoughtfully curated and beautifully served meal. We chose not to make a scene, but the image stayed with us for the rest of the night.

Despite these setbacks, we had a wonderful evening in terms of the company, conversation, and culinary adventure. It was a joyful gathering that brought us closer together, and there were moments that we will fondly remember for years to come.

Kusakabe has remarkable food and a kind, accommodating staff. But fine dining is about more than what is served on the plate. We hope the restaurant takes this feedback seriously, because the potential for a flawless experience is certainly there, and it would be a shame for preventable issues to overshadow such culinary excellence.

The pictures of the bones and the cockroach is attached.

top_10.name: Saru Sushi Bar
top_10.address: 3856 24th St, San Francisco, CA 94114, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Never disappoints and always consistent - definitely the best and most recommended place for anyone visiting San Francisco craving for nigiri, sushi and sashimi. Their 5 pieces of Salmon Omakase is absolutely heaven on earth!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Absolutely love Saru - the fish is very fresh and every piece of sushi is delicately trimmed and prepared. I am also a particular fan of the Hamachi Truffle appetizer, highly recommend. The "Watermelon Roll" is also delicious - it is wrapped in a cucumber sheet rather than in rice; very refreshing and a great addition to a meal if you want to cut back on some rice.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This place is so good! Tasty food, cosy atmosphere, friendly staff. Highlights are the appetizer spoons (in the photo) and the seaweed is possibly the best I’ve tasted.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Saru hits the mark for what you would expect SF sushi to be like - excellent. The fish is FRESH, rich in flavor, and soft as butter. The tiny space is clean, well decorated with authentic beautiful Japanese plates and serving pieces. And the staff is working hard as a team to take great care of everyone.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Saru is among the best sushi restaurants in Northern California and beyond. I have eaten at some of the finest sushi restaurants in California and Saru is at the top. They have an excellent selection of fish and their presentation is simple and authentic. The service is excellent. I have never had an experience that was below expectation.

The "Watermelon Roll" is also delicious - it is wrapped in a cucumber sheet rather than in rice; very refreshing and a great addition to a meal if you want to cut back on some rice.

top_10.name: Kuma Sushi + Sake
top_10.address: 1040 Polk St, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I would give this spot 10 stars if I could. My boyfriend and I usually come here once a week! Kay and Henry are incredible. Food, service, and vibes are great. My favorite sushi spot in the Bay Area!!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I’m a Japanese who started eating raw fish at the age of 7. I can proudly say that Kuma Sushi + Sake is an amazing sushi restaurant in every way!

It’s a popular sushi place so their fish is always fresh. Here, I had the freshest Santa Barbara uni that I have ever had in my life.

The flavors are innovative & creative.  I had an appetizer of “Katsuo Tataki”and the combination of the flavors was incredible.

Their rolls are fun to try and I love “Hey Girl” and “Jackalope.” I can eat them every day!

I love how they put the origins of each fish on the menu so we know where our fish came from.

Anyways, eating is believing. Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I was looking for a local sushi spot while in town that was also affordable, and found that at Kuma. The food was fresh, they had unique takes on “classic” dishes (from the salad to the sushi rolls), and the servers were attentive. I’ll definitely go back the next time I’m in San Francisco.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
First time at Kuma Sushi and what an amazing experience! The sushi was absolutely top-notch — fresh, beautifully prepared, and full of flavor.

The atmosphere had a welcoming and local vibe, which made us feel right at home. While EDM music isn’t really my thing during dinner, it didn’t take away from the great experience.

We will definitely be back 100%! Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Delicious, quality fish and reasonably priced. I'd eat that California roll every day if I lived nearby. I don't know if there's a better $11 dish in the city.

We ate a bunch of fish and had a few sides. Service was great. I would definitely come back.

top_10.name: Hakashi Japanese Sushi Bar & Grill
top_10.address: 474 3rd St, San Francisco, CA 94107, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Came here on a Friday night and was pleasantly surprised by our overall experience. We had reservations and got seated quickly with drink orders in. We had a bunch of Nigiri, our favorite being chu toro, hamachi, and mackerel. But everything we had was high quality cuts. The rice was perfectly done as well, which I feel like that ingredient gets overlooked often. The wakame salad salad was fresh and absolutely delicious. We sat at the sushi bars and the chefs were so fun to watch and nice to chat with. The price is very fair for the quality you get here. We will absolutely be making this our new go to local sushi spot. Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: We sincerely appreciate your warm hospitality in hosting our boss and our team. The endless flow of drinks and the abundance of delicious food filled our stomachs beyond capacity, leaving us truly grateful for your generosity. Your kindness and effort in making us feel welcome did not go unnoticed, and we deeply appreciate the time and care you put into ensuring everyone had a wonderful time. Thank you once again for your exceptional hospitality. We truly enjoyed every moment.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Fantastic staff! Great to chat with the chef as he portioned out a fresh tuna cut. He offered me a piece and shared great detail on buying and serving    tuna.

Enjoying 9 pieces of very tasty and well presented nigiri. Fun and tasty experience 100% worth a stop 🍣!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Master Julio gave us a great omakase experience! The sushi items were marvelous and we enjoyed his energy and enthusiasm.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Chef Julio and his staff gave us one of the most amazing dining experiences that my wife and I have experienced. We've been to hole in the walls to Michelin starred restaurants, and this place has topped all of those experiences. You can see how much Chef Julio loves/enjoys his craft. He took his time to explain each dish in detail. Obviously, I was drunk with endorphins with each bite that I don't remember the names of all the pieces that we were pampered with. I did remember that each piece had different layers of flavors that never overpowered each other. They perfectly fused together in harmony. I overheard another patron say he just returned from Japan, and this place beats the quality there. I personally can't confirm that, but I can seriously say my wife enjoyed it so much. She told me we're ONLY coming back here for Omakase and nowhere else. Thank you, Chef, and see you again soon.

testimonials: Came here on a Friday night and was pleasantly surprised by our overall experience. We had reservations and got seated quickly with drink orders in. We had a bunch of Nigiri, our favorite being chu toro, hamachi, and mackerel. But everything we had was high quality cuts. The rice was perfectly done as well, which I feel like that ingredient gets overlooked often. The wakame salad salad was fresh and absolutely delicious. We sat at the sushi bars and the chefs were so fun to watch and nice to chat with. The price is very fair for the quality you get here. We will absolutely be making this our new go to local sushi spot. Highly recommend!

We sincerely appreciate your warm hospitality in hosting our boss and our team. The endless flow of drinks and the abundance of delicious food filled our stomachs beyond capacity, leaving us truly grateful for your generosity. Your kindness and effort in making us feel welcome did not go unnoticed, and we deeply appreciate the time and care you put into ensuring everyone had a wonderful time. Thank you once again for your exceptional hospitality. We truly enjoyed every moment.

Fantastic staff! Great to chat with the chef as he portioned out a fresh tuna cut. He offered me a piece and shared great detail on buying and serving    tuna.

Enjoying 9 pieces of very tasty and well presented nigiri. Fun and tasty experience 100% worth a stop 🍣!

top_10.name: Ebisu Restaurant
top_10.address: 1283 9th Ave, San Francisco, CA 94122, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
This is by far my favourite restaurant in SF! The quality of the fish, the service, the flavour! Everything was top notch. If you can, try to be seated at the bar so you can talk directly to the chef… it adds to the experience!

Expect to wait 30min before getting seated. The restaurant is packed on Friday or Saturday nights!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
First when I come in they put me at the darkest corner in the restaurant and I asked to move to another table.

Second, no one ask for what I want to drink after 5 minutes I sat down. (For some reason all the staff including the chef were focusing on one specific table may be VIP I guess)

Should have more options on Omakase, I don't mind to pay more.
But if I ordered Omakase with only regular Salmon, Tuna, Albacore, Ikura and MASAGO without even 1 piece of UNI or Scallop why would I order deluxe sushi or Omakase.

Ankimo, first time ever with no sauce and I had to ask for ponzu sauce on the side .

Conclusion, way overrated for their stars.

去之前期望太高👀
食完之後食物和服務水準比預期差太遠！😔😔😔

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Sorry for not visiting sooner. Top sushi nigiri with such delicious soft sushi rice. No wonder there was a line for a seat. I will definitely be hitting this place up more often. No joke.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: The restaurant's service & food were top notch!! Delicious, quick served, good quality.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Coming from Vancouver I’ve always found the average sushi restaurant lacking for a variety of reasons, but randomly ending up at Ebisu has turned around my entire opinion.

This is exactly what you want out of a casual sushi restaurant, solid food, friendly staff, and awesome atmosphere that isn’t set to over the top SF prices.

This place is great.

top_10.name: Roka Akor - San Francisco
top_10.address: 801 Montgomery St, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: The food was very good and well prepared. We like the different small bites to share. Scallops were nicely roasted. Some dishes had a bit of spice to them. The desserts were delicious. A little on the pricey side but good service and presentation.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
The food is amazing!
We dropped by without an appointment on a Friday night and they were able to get us 4 seated in the bar & lounge area downstairs. They do have a main floor as soon as you enter which is large and roomy, but I’m really glad we got seated in the bar area. Totally different vibe - cool, dark interiors, with a very intimate feel. Love the decor.
Service was on point.

Cocktails were okay, but the sake was incredible!
For appetisers we tried the beef kimchi dumplings (so good!), beet and burrata salad (delicious) and eggplant tempura (must try!).

All the three rolls were fantastic but my favorite was the dragon roll. I’d highly recommend.

We tried the cod which was good, but not something I’d get against. The presentation of the dish was beautiful.

One dish I would definitely recommend is the mushroom and rice hot pot - we all loved it! Simple and delicious.
Overall just an awesome experience

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I went here Saturday for a birthday dinner. The staff all around was EXCEPTIONAL. The host was super pleasant and made sure we had a cute table at a booth. She also took pictures of me and my date. The server recommended the most incredible dishes and was really pleasant. The food was tasty and fresh. The ambience was really nice also. The staff really went above and beyond to make the birthday special. I can’t wait to return for the yummy cuisine!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Roka Akor absolutely delivers when it comes to food and atmosphere. The sushi was fresh, creative, and beautifully presented—easily some of the best I’ve had. The entire menu felt thoughtfully crafted, and the flavors were spot on. You can tell the chefs here really know what they’re doing. We ordered multiple appetizers and entrees to share as well as all the desserts.  I wouldn't choose any dessert again as they were pretty mediocre

The ambiance is also top-tier. Sleek, modern, and upscale, but still warm and comfortable. It's the kind of place that feels special without being stuffy. Add to that an excellent spirits list with rare whiskies, great sake options, and inventive cocktails—it’s a dream for anyone who appreciates a good drink with their meal.

Only downside? The timing between courses was off. The brought our food to soon, making our business party of 6 feel overly rushed which  threw off the rhythm of the evening. And unfortunately, the restroom was in poor shape—not what you'd expect from a restaurant of this caliber.

All in all, Roku Akor is still 100% worth a visit for the food and vibe alone. Just hoping they tighten up service timing and take better care of the facilities next time. If they do, it’s easily a 5-star spot!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: this place is fun! i came for a birthday dinner and got the omakase menu. the dishes are good, but the fish is not excellent. the best dish (which was exceptional!!) was the black cod. the staff was wonderful and extremely accommodating of dietary restrictions. the presentations were also stunning!

testimonials: The food was very good and well prepared. We like the different small bites to share. Scallops were nicely roasted. Some dishes had a bit of spice to them. The desserts were delicious. A little on the pricey side but good service and presentation.

top_10.name: The Shota
top_10.address: 115 Sansome St, San Francisco, CA 94104, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This is probably the best and most impressive omakase I’ve had in San Francisco so far. I highly recommend it, especially for special occasions like birthdays or celebrations. The service, the food, everything was absolutely perfect. The freshness of the fish was outstanding. I really loved it and I’ll definitely be back again.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
We came here to celebrate a birthday and did not leave disappointed. The food was really good and had some fun spins on Japanese ingredients that were creative compared to other omakase spots in the city.

The whole vibe of the place is modern and polished, yet warm. Before the courses begin they show you the fish that will be used and the supplements you can get, we got the uni supplement which came in a little box for us to enjoy through out the meal. It was of really high quality, sweet and light with no after taste. There were two types of in house made ginger with different textures that pair well with different courses and they brought outa bluefin tuna head to tell us more about the fish and how it’s used in sushi which was fun.

Would highly recommend for an occasion!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
One of the best meals/experiences I've had. From the moment we walked in to when we left,  everyone was super attentive and constantly checking in on us.  We did the drink pairing and they were very generous in keeping each glass topped off for each course.  The sake selection was truly fragrant and tasty!

Now the food was just superb.  Amazing Japanese flavors and the presentation was sublime.  There wasn't a single bite that I could criticize at all. It was enjoyed thoroughly by everyone in our dinner party!  Hands down I would come again.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
What an incredible, unforgettable experience. The food is exquisite: the ingredients are of the highest quality, the preparation is top-notch, and the flavour combinations are stunning. It’s a wonderful combination of dishes, including sushi, though that’s not the star of the show. Instead, the other dishes are the highlight of the evening: from the slow-cooked octopus to the sashimi and, most of all, the gyuoku banana cake. Incredible. The wagyu sushi, an addendum, is also marvellous, perfectly executed.

The service is also lovely. Everyone is incredibly friendly and attentive. A very minor comment is that all explanations about the courses were very standardised, including the speed of delivery (sometimes hard to follow), making it feel a tad less personal. But that’s only for the explanations of the dishes—other than that, it was really personal and intimate.

The ambience is also excellent. I will absolutely come here again.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: One of my favorite omakase experiences I have had was at The Shota. Jason was our chef and we talked with him about his experience training in Japan and how he was a San Francisco native. Every course was amazing but I really enjoyed the sashimi course! Aside from the food the place is beautiful and the plating is so well thought out.

testimonials: This is probably the best and most impressive omakase I’ve had in San Francisco so far. I highly recommend it, especially for special occasions like birthdays or celebrations. The service, the food, everything was absolutely perfect. The freshness of the fish was outstanding. I really loved it and I’ll definitely be back again.

top_10.name: Zentarou Sushi and Sake Bar
top_10.address: 1380 9th Ave, San Francisco, CA 94122, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
10/10 recommend.

Don’t come if you’re in a rush. Relax, sit at the bar, and enjoy the best fish outside of Japan. I question if you say you’ve gotten food poisoning here. The freshest best quality in the city. Also, don’t sleep on the sake. Best selection on the west coast. Ask Bee for recommendations you won’t be disappointed!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I’ve gotta say WOW for this spot! My husband and I felt welcomed at the first step from the door of Zentarou. All staffs are energetically attentive and greeting us like one of their family. We were seated at the bar which is one of the best spot to see what chef preparing our dishes. We ordered several dishes. Zero disappointment!! We gotta say that the special kinmedai yuzu dish was totally spot on of tonight. Beef Oroshi was amazing , we ordered a few nigiris. Kyoto style nigiris provided on our plates , no extra soy sauce or wasabi needed, because they are all seasoned !! rare seasonal items are the secret (ask chef) One of the secrets is asking the server for Sake pairing!! They will provide you best sakes to pair with your dishes. (Beachy was one of the best Sake sommelier) ask him to set your Sake pairing with your food!   Not just delicious food, but We got the best experience for the whole night! We will definitely come back and shout out!!. Honestly This restaurant should certainly be one of the Michelin stars

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
If you’re on the hunt for premium sushi that will blow your mind, look no further than Zentarou Sushi & Sake Bar this hidden gem in San Francisco is next-level and truly one of the city’s best-kept secrets. From the moment you step in, the vibe is elevated yet welcoming, and every dish is a masterpiece. I seriously cannot recommend this spot enough if you’re a sushi lover (or even if you’re just sushi-curious), because the quality here is unmatched, the flavors are rich, and the freshness? Insane.

Now let’s talk about the showstopper: the KIN DON. This signature bowl is an absolute luxury dream stacked with buttery Hokkaido Uni, rich caviar, briny Ikura, melt-in-your-mouth toro tartare, delicate hotate, flavorful salmon tartare, and perfectly grilled unagi. Every bite is like a flavor explosion that just melts in your mouth and makes you wonder where this has been all your life. 😍🔥

Pair it with their incredible selection of authentic Japanese sake, and you’ve got yourself a whole vibe this isn’t just dinner, it’s an experience. Whether you’re out on a foodie adventure or just looking for your new go-to spot for quality Japanese cuisine, Zentarou is where it’s at. Trust me, you’ll fall in love, become a regular, and probably tell all your friends about this spot that feels like a secret but deserves to be known.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Best bang for your buck for an omakase in SF. $92 for a 6-course meal that was absolutely delicious. We looked around town and other omakases were $250+ per seat, and while I’m sure those places are delicious, I was so excited to find this place. We were “wow-ing” with every bite! Came here 2x during my 5-day stay in SF. For my gluten free and food allergy people, they were super accommodating and made the omakase to my needs without questioning it. 10/10 would go back a 3rd time next time in town.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I had the supreme omakase, oysters, tempura, salmon collar and the lychee sherbet.
The sushi was decent, it was good but nothing special. The wasabi was a bit too much on the nigiri.

For the most part everything was not bad, but the toro and truffle nigiri was way too chewy and I couldn’t eat it.

The salmon collar was a little bland, but the desserts were delicious!!

top_10.name: Chīsai Sushi Club
top_10.address: 3369 Mission St, San Francisco, CA 94110, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
We decided to celebrate our 3rd anniversary here.

We found parking around the corner on a side street and arrived at the restaurant on time. The staff greeted us warmly and led us to our seats at the counter.

We both ordered the Oki plus a couple more supplements. I got the premium sake flight, while my boyfriend got their ginger beer.

We savored and enjoyed every single bite. The highlights of the meal were the nori butter on salmon nigiri, the foie gras on scallop, and the uni carbonara. Every piece of fish was fresh and tasty. We appreciate that they were sourced from different countries/areas.

They gave us Barley ice cream with a little taiyaki to end the meal. Absolutely worth it.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I came here by myself after reading great things about the vegan Omakase online and was thoroughly impressed.

I chose The Yasai and supplemented it with the Morel Temaki (mushroom & vegan caviar hand roll). This was easily in my top 5 meals of the year.

The service was warm and informative, with the Chef describing in detail the process for each dish and answering every question I had.

The menu is brilliantly creative, using ingredients that one would never expect in an Omakase such as tomatoes, leek, and asparagus shine like they never have before.

The highlight of my meal was a roasted tomato nigiri topped with a fermented peppercorn. I may have forgotten to take a picture of it, but I don’t think I’ll forget the taste for a long time. I can also recommend the Morel Temaki.

The drink menu has several options including a sake float but I went with two Japanese craft beers: a Yuzu Ale and a Witbier with ginger. I enjoyed both but the Yuzu Ale wins between the two.

The meal closed with two scoops of cardamom ice cream which was as delightful as the rest of my meal.

No notes. This was an excellent experience.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Really great experience! Fish quality was really incredible and the flavors were interesting. The uni toro hand roll was so fresh and delicious, almost ordered 2 but got too full. Only thing that wasn't outstanding was the dessert. Ice cream was a little too sweet and the malted cream flavor was a little meh.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Excellent omakase experience, especially for the price point! Favorites of the night: scallop with foie gras, seared salmon nigiri, salmon ceviche temaki, and the A5 wagyu uni blue cheese nigiri. Loved our experience!!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
This sushi restaurant opened in 2021, founded by a non-Japanese chef who trained at multiple sushi spots, including a Japanese-owned one. We tried an omakase course called "The Oki."

Unlike other high-end, Japanese-owned sushi restaurants in SF that import most of their fish from Tsukiji—resulting in higher prices—this place sources from various regions, like tuna from Mexico, allowing for more affordable pricing.

I quickly noticed that their challenge lies in the fish and condiment pairings. At first glance, it looks like a traditional omakase, but I could sense some imbalance in flavors with certain nigiri. Of course, taste is subjective—but personally, I still prefer the fish quality from Japan. Some bites had great harmony, while others felt a bit off.

They have a solid sake and beer selection, and the service is friendly and attentive.

top_10.name: AKIKOS
top_10.address: 430 Folsom St, San Francisco, CA 94108, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: One of the most delicious meals I’ve had in a very long time. We had the Omakase and each course was unique and tasty. Service was impeccable and the ambience was perfect. Overall a great dining experience. Thank you!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Came here recently to celebrate with work colleagues. Food and service were excellent as usual. Atmosphere is probably still my favorite part about Akikos. It’s modern and open versus a more traditional counter experience. Highly recommended for groups. A la carte menu ensures everyone is satisfied including providing an opportunity to order another bite of something particularly enjoyable on the menu.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Absolute delight and the best omakase and nigiri I have ever had. We sat at the bar. Each dish in the otsumami was incredible. I think my favorites were the Fuji Salmon, Sashimi, Robusuta, and Chawanmushi. I thought they had set the bar quite high with the otsumami but the nigiri did not disappoint at all. The rice is steamed very fresh and each piece was made in front of us. The fish intentionally at room temperature with the warm rice really made the flavors pop in a way I had never experienced before with nigiri. Just fantastic. Our chef was lovely to watch and everything she made was perfection. I think my favorites were Karei, Kanpachi, tokishirazu, and botan ebi. We liked all the items so much when they gave us the additional menu we ordered a few more pieces. Can’t wait to come back!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Delicious lunch Omakase, with sake pairing. Excellent service. Really fun vibe. Hot tip - lunch starts with standard Omakase (no "a la carte" menu") but after Omakase service is complete, they offer you a menu to add on. We added the snapper, uni and wagyu and it was great! Lunchtime sake pairing was 4 generous, full glasses of sake and they were all delicious. Fun modern vibe, with sunlight but not "too bright". I liked that it didn't feel like we were sitting in a cave, which was nice for a lunchtime treat.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Impeccable lunch omakase experience. Meticulous attention paid to the individual elements of every dish, making each sing. Hospitality unmatched- for example- immediate coat and luggage check for travelers. Chefs are present and enthusiastic about the food. Notice the details when you go- unique and purposeful flatware, ceramics, lighting, etc. Will be back.

testimonials: One of the most delicious meals I’ve had in a very long time. We had the Omakase and each course was unique and tasty. Service was impeccable and the ambience was perfect. Overall a great dining experience. Thank you!

top_10.name: Sriracha Thai Cuisine
top_10.address: 1319 9th Ave, San Francisco, CA 94122, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Came here for lunch to try out this spot because we were craving Thai food.

Order calamari, spicy wings, fried rice with fried chicken, pad Thai, chef special pork belly dish, and eggplant with salmon, along with a side of white rice

Everything was pretty flavorful. Calamari was surprisingly fried very well. The wings were a bit tiny for my liking and seemed like it had the taste where wings were in the freezer if you know what I mean.

For the main dishes, the pad Thai didn’t have the orange color I was use to but it had the flavor you would expect from pad Thai. Generous portions of meat as well.

The pork belly dish was decent - vegetables were pretty spicy so be careful. The pork belly had a slight crispy skin but don’t expect a crunch.

Would come again if we were in the area. Bill came out to about $140?after tip for the 6 items for a party of 4

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Came on a weekday for dinner, no wait
Friendly and quick service

We ordered
1. Yellow curry with beef: very flavorful, tender beef, slightly spicy but very good 9/10
2. Fried rice with duck: great flavors, generous portions 10/10

Would come back again!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I visited this place for the first time — and it definitely won’t be the last! The atmosphere is cozy, the staff is attentive, and the food is truly delicious. Everything was top-notch: from the presentation to the flavor. I especially appreciated the attention to detail — cleanliness, music, and the speed of service all made for a really pleasant experience. Highly recommend to anyone who values quality and a warm, thoughtful approach!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Sriracha Thai Cuisine offers a well-rounded menu of Thai classics, from pad thai and green curry to tom yum soup and mango sticky rice. The flavors are bold and balanced, with just the right amount of heat and sweetness. The restaurant is clean and inviting, with a modern yet cozy interior.

Staff are friendly and happy to adjust spice levels or accommodate dietary needs. The lunch specials are a great value, and the dinner portions are generous. It’s a dependable go-to for Thai food that’s flavorful without being overly Americanized.

The restaurant’s attention to detail and commitment to quality make it a standout choice for Thai cuisine in the area. Whether you’re dining in or ordering takeout, Sriracha Thai Cuisine consistently delivers a satisfying and enjoyable experience.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Cute and cozy Thai place!

The food came out super fast, great flavours, good level of spiciness.

Also most of the restaurants around close in the afternoon so it is a good spot to grab a late lunch.

Oh they also have lunch offers between 11-3PM.

testimonials:
Came here for lunch to try out this spot because we were craving Thai food.

Order calamari, spicy wings, fried rice with fried chicken, pad Thai, chef special pork belly dish, and eggplant with salmon, along with a side of white rice

Everything was pretty flavorful. Calamari was surprisingly fried very well. The wings were a bit tiny for my liking and seemed like it had the taste where wings were in the freezer if you know what I mean.

For the main dishes, the pad Thai didn’t have the orange color I was use to but it had the flavor you would expect from pad Thai. Generous portions of meat as well.

The pork belly dish was decent - vegetables were pretty spicy so be careful. The pork belly had a slight crispy skin but don’t expect a crunch.

Would come again if we were in the area. Bill came out to about $140?after tip for the 6 items for a party of 4

Came on a weekday for dinner, no wait
Friendly and quick service

We ordered
1. Yellow curry with beef: very flavorful, tender beef, slightly spicy but very good 9/10
2. Fried rice with duck: great flavors, generous portions 10/10

Would come back again!

I visited this place for the first time — and it definitely won’t be the last! The atmosphere is cozy, the staff is attentive, and the food is truly delicious. Everything was top-notch: from the presentation to the flavor. I especially appreciated the attention to detail — cleanliness, music, and the speed of service all made for a really pleasant experience. Highly recommend to anyone who values quality and a warm, thoughtful approach!

top_10.name: New Thai Elephant
top_10.address: 393 Bay St, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Perfect for the keto traveller. Tried the F04, their spicy version of the crispy pork belly. It was wonderful. The pork belly was not overcooked and really tasty as it was sauted with bell peppers, Thai basil and chilly peppers, not too spicy.

The ambience is cozy with large painted Thai murals on the wall.

The service was friendly and attentive, beyond what is typically expected, was helped by May.

Their check in and Queuing system is simple albeit manual, just write your name and number of folks in your party. Came on a wed night and had to wait a very reasonable 20 mins to be seated.

A curious observation was parties all stayed for at least 1 hour and the restaurant did not pressure anyone to leave.

The place was spotless and clean.

If are in San Francisco and looking for a wonderful keto friendly restaurant, do stop by.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Very friendly staff. Quick service. Fresh, hot food. We arrived when they opened at 4:30. On a previous visit we had the pad kae mao noodles, a classic. We ordered the green curry and pineapple fried rice with soft tofu and no mushrooms. The pineapple fried rice tasted good. If you are sensitive to the smell of eggs, we suggest you ask for no eggs. The pineapple trunks were a little too large for our preference and they forgot the remove the mushrooms. By the time our food arrived, the restaurant was packed. They get really busy! The green curry was good, we took leftovers home and it tasted too sweet.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Friendly price and respectful customer service.  Food is excellent.
I love the fact that this Thai restaurant has Thai people that actually speak Thai language work here.

I am 100% recommend this to all.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Excellent Thai food in an unassuming restaurant. They have elephant icons such as Dumbo and African elephants. The Thai iced teas was the best with a teddy bear ice mold making it very cute. Satay was good as was the Papaya salad (warning it is not very spicy on medium). Spring rolls had tofu inside and had a minty taste. The Red curry with chicken was nicely spiced and was very good with the rice. Pad See Eu noodle also was well liked with plenty of chicken. The BBQ pork fried rice was good but did not have much pork in it. Nothing was left after we finished. Service was fast. Bathrooms were clean

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Went her for dinner, didn’t have resos but was able to quickly get a table for 2.  Pad Kee Mao and Cashew Nut Chicken.   Quick service and large portions.   Lively environment

top_10.name: Zen Yai
top_10.address: 771 Ellis St, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
They serve authentic thai food! I ordered boat noodles and it came just as what i had in Thailand! My friend also ordered Pad Kapao crispy pork and it tasted great (even though i prefer not to have the green beans in pad kapao). Price is great.

The servers seemed kind. My phone was running out of battery in their restaurant and the server lady charged it for me using their outlet!

The only con would be the location because this restaurant sits on where there are many homeless people. We were walking there and it was our first time walking in San Francisco so it was a little scary.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Amazing Thai food. Very reasonable price for this area. We visited this restaurant 3 times in one week. The best part is they have small bowl so I can try several things. My favorite is ต้มยำหมูสับ tom yum and pad see ew. Service is always excellent and attentive. However, the surrounding area is not the best, full of homeless. Hard to find parking spot

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This was my first time here and the food was very very good! It's definitely in a sketchy area, but worth it! Go with a big group so you can try many different dishes. I wanted to try more. It's recommended and I would return!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Very authentic thai restaurant in the heart of SFO! We ended up here as suggested by a thai lady we met in a café. She suggesed Zen Yai as a genuine thai restaurant. Totally true! We ordered the sausage, papaya salad, cashew nut, pad thai and pad krapao ( last two not shown in the pictures). Everything was delicious. The waiters were very friendly. Regarding the price/quality, very reasonable. The only negative thing to mention, which is not related to the restaurant, is the fact that the neighborhood is full of people struggling with drug adiction in the streets. It is a bit shocking to see and if you come from abroad like us that we come from Europe, it was sad and confronting to see.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I just had food delivered to me from a different platform from this restaurant. The boneless duck 🦆 was perfectly cooked and somewhat spicy 🌶️. The ambience of the place looks really good from the pictures I have seen. I give this place  a five star ⭐️. I highly recommend this restaurant. I may order from them again sometime again.

top_10.name: Kothai Republic
top_10.address: 1398 9th Ave, San Francisco, CA 94122, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Excellent food , service and ambiance! Went with two little kids and the kids devoured the pork jowl dish. Server made great recommendations and went out of his way to make sure we had a great dining experience. Would definitely come back! Drooling thinking about their seasonal tomato burrata toast(?) appetizer.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I’ve eaten at Kothai four times now and it is consistently outstanding. The food is creative, using top quality super fresh ingredients that the team here has lovingly put together into dishes that delight the eye and please the palate. I also really like the soju cocktails, which are spirit forward and perfectly balanced, never too sweet, never too sour. The service is professional but warm, and they remember you if you come back. The staff are knowledgeable and excited about the food. I only wish I lived closer so I could come more often.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I’ve passed by this restaurant many times and finally got to try it. Surprisingly, everything was delicious — the flavors were great, and the textures were spot on. The service was excellent too. The chicken was juicy and tender, and the red curry was a perfect complement. They mentioned that the menu changes quite often, so I’ll definitely be back to try more next time!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I reserved a table for 8 at kothai to host my birthday dinner. I was pleased overall with my dining experience, and would return again for a nice occasion like dinner with parents or a celebration. The restaurant has limited capacity, but I found making a reservation online to book a large table quite simple. Moderate noise, but we were able to hear everyone at our table. Nothing too noteworthy about the service, even though I had reserved for a special occasion.

For our party of 8, we ordered 6 small plates and 3 large plates, and shared amongst each other. Great blend of flavors and textures. We really enjoyed a lot of the food. Favorites of the table were the crudo, the mussels, and the king salmon thai curry. Personally, I really enjoyed the pork jowl and the bronzino. It is quite impressive they were able to fillet the bronzino and maintain its shape for presentation.

The mio sparking sake and the sequoia nigori were our picks to pair with our food selection. Both were excellent with the meal, but the mio sparkling sake was definitely the favorite.

As for service, they seemed a little short staffed as there were only one waiter and another employee serving the drinks. I had to flag them a few times to refill our waters. And, it was tough getting their attention at times. However, the waiter was accommodating to the dietary needs at the table.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: The food was delicious! Generous portions and everything tasted so fresh. It is a bit pricey but worth it. The only thing we were not crazy about was the apple cheesecake for dessert. It wasn't bad but it wasn't great either. Chocolate mousse was amazing! Drinks were light and refreshing.

testimonials: Excellent food , service and ambiance! Went with two little kids and the kids devoured the pork jowl dish. Server made great recommendations and went out of his way to make sure we had a great dining experience. Would definitely come back! The staff are knowledgeable and excited about the food. I only wish I lived closer so I could come more often.

The chicken was juicy and tender, and the red curry was a perfect complement. They mentioned that the menu changes quite often, so I’ll definitely be back to try more next time!

top_10.name: Khao Tiew
top_10.address: 272 Claremont Blvd, San Francisco, CA 94127, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
The price is fair and the environment is charming! I loved the decor—so many old Thai commercial posters from 20–30 years ago that give off a nostalgic 70s–80s vibe 🌟

The waitress was super attentive. Be warned though: if you come during peak dinner hours, there’s usually a long wait, but you can easily join the waitlist on Yelp!

Despite the crowd, food came out really fast. Everything we ordered had such a great balance of flavors.

💯 My top recommendations:
•	Duck breast curry – rich, flavorful, and so satisfying.
•	Kaya toast – perfectly crispy and sweet.

They also have a good drink selection, and we saw a lot of people ordering the crispy papaya salad—huge portion and definitely unique!

If you’re craving Thai food, I highly recommend this place!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Came here with a group about an hour after opening and placed our names on the Yelp waitlist. We did not have to wait too long which was great but the place was packed. I thought the food was okay. We only had one dish I did not like because it tasted burnt. It was the steamed egg with large pieces of shrimp but the inside was burned and seeped throughout the dish. I would also pass on the mango sticky rice given presentation, size, and lack of complexity.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Absolutely delicious! We went earlier to avoid the long line and were seated immediately. Lots of vegetarian options, all were really well made and full of authentic flavor. The spice was actually spicy, thankfully. Would highly recommend!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: The wait time is always crazy, so we did takeout. The food smells really good, and the prices are reasonable. But I don’t think waiting an hour is worth it. We didn’t order anything too special—it was just standard Thai food to us. I recommend trying takeout before waiting in line for an hour.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Easily one of the best restaurants in SF, top 5 for me. Some of the best Thai food I've ever had. Beef fried rice and duck breast curry had me licking my spoon. MUST get if you go. The crab and shrimp glass noodle dish was good too, but a bit underwhelming compared to the others, and the most expensive. Wouldn't get it again.

I will return here and try more of their menu. This place is definitely pricey, but worth the money. A MUST visit in SF.

Absolutely delicious! We went earlier to avoid the long line and were seated immediately. Lots of vegetarian options, all were really well made and full of authentic flavor. The spice was actually spicy, thankfully. Would highly recommend!

top_10.name: Oraan Thai Eatery
top_10.address: 3750 Geary Blvd, San Francisco, CA 94118, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: At lunch time the place was near empty. The place is super cute and the service was good. Had the Choo Chee Salmon, it was amazing! Truly, fantastic! Indulged into a Thai Pumpkin Custard, which was cute, very nicely presented, and not very sweet. Definitely want to come back here. Great spot for a romantic dinner as well.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
tasty thai restaurant in inner richmond. dishes were well executed and left happy overall, but don’t expect to be mind blown. service was also above average and appreciated the friendly servers!

crispy eggplant: appetizer was OK. safe and decent choice but didn’t stand out

yellow curry: would recommend! good flavor and filled with toppings

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
We ordered Som Tum ( papaya salad), Thai fried rice &  Kang Dang.
Since we are vegetarian and wants to customize she was so nice and customized the Kang Dang with Yellow curry instead of Red curry ( Red curry had fish sauce).
The taste was so good and we pretty much emptied the whole plate without a drop.
Nice Quantity except the fried rice could be little more quantity.

The service was soo good and very peaceful place and nice atmosphere.

I would recommend if you haven’t been there to give a try.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Gai Himmaparn: 10/10 so flavor; the chicken was so crispy and the sauce was sweet and tangy and pairs well with the jasmine rice
Nuer Marakot: 10/10 the steak was so juicy and marinated to perfection; a must try!!
Pad Seew: 7/10 definitely had better; was a little cold; beef thin so it was a little dry
Mango sticky rice: 10/10 best I’ve had in SF
Thai Iced Tea: 10/10 very solid; good flavor and not overly sweet
The staff was AMAZING and the place  is so beautiful  and lighting makes the place feel cozy

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: One of the best Thai food meals I’ve had in years! Every plate was delicious and they had plenty of vegan options or dishes they could make vegan. The fried eggplant, pad see ewe, and yellow curry were amazing 😍

testimonials: At lunch time the place was near empty. The place is super cute and the service was good. Had the Choo Chee Salmon, it was amazing! Truly, fantastic! top_10.name: Phat Thai
top_10.address: 2380 Lombard St, San Francisco, CA 94123, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Great service and portion sizes. Solid food overall, just a bit surprised that our Pad Kee Mao came in thin noodles vs wide noodles. The pineapple fried rice was also good, just a bit too strong on the yellow curry powder for our liking. We also ordered the phat wings which were solid and tasted fresh. Overall, a solid spot if you are around the area for Thai food.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I LOVE Phat Thai! Bobby and crew are always so accommodating and friendly. Indicative of Thai culture, their hospitality is always on point. The food is authentic and always delicious. I love the fried rolls, the spicy papaya salad, and the mango sticky rice. And don't get me started on the amazing nitro Thai iced tea...a MUST have! Highly recommended and I will forever be a loyal customer!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Finally, a good Thai restaurant in SF! The mild sweet tinge in their Pad Kee Mao sealed the deal for me. The noodles were cooked well in sauce and tofu was properly fried. Basil leaves added a great touch. Don’t forget to get their fried tofu - that peanut sauce was amazing!
Would definitely come back.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I was staying at the Infinity Hotel and returning a little late when I noticed that Phat Thai was still open. Since I wanted to have dinner in my room, I decided to get takeout. I ordered the fried pork with fried rice, and the food was absolutely great! The sauce that came with it was amazing and really brought the dish together. 🍚

Unfortunately, I didn’t get a chance to experience the dine-in ambiance this time, but I’d definitely love to try it next time I’m in the area. The only downside for me was the pricing. I ordered two of the same dish and ended up paying around $50, which felt a bit on the higher side💲. That said, the taste definitely compensated for it. Overall, a great spot for tasty Thai food! 🥘

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
This is a fun, casual spot for some great Thai food.  The space is cozy and some of the tables are high-tops, so don't expect white table cloths.

We had the green curry and pad Thai  Both were excellent.  The green curry was a bit spicy, so if you don't like it spicy then let them know beforehand.  We also had the chicken wings and they were incredible!

If you're looking for some mid-week Thai food, Phat Thai is 100% your spot.  They do a good takeout business too.

top_10.name: Farmhouse Kitchen Thai Cuisine
top_10.address: 710 Florida St, San Francisco, CA 94110, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: A wonderful place with amazing food! A bit pricey for Thai but you get more than your money's worth. We started with the coconut flavored soup added chicken - honestly that fish alone can feed two hungry people! The beef was absolutely tender fall off the bone. The egg rolls had such a unique flavor. And all the currys were great and generous proportions.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I love this place. I used to work across the street 8 years ago when I started coming here for lunch. I used to order the fried chicken or the beef noodle soup. I don’t quite remember the names but I do remember enjoying every meal I had here.

I don’t think the quality has diminished one bit. I still come by here occasionally but more often than not, I order for delivery just to get a hit of that curry dip for the fried chicken at the comfort of my home.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Solid Thai restaurant but a victim of its own success. Made a reservation for 4 and based on the call, was not a problem, but still had to wait for a table. Service is solid but you aren't going to get too much attention-understandable given the volume of patrons and orders they have to deal with. Menu is extensive and priced as you might expect from the neighborhood and clientele. The food was good but came out not quite as hot (temperature) as you'd like. Interior is attractive, as are the dishes and cocktails. No freebies for birthdays, haha.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Visited with friends from work. Very busy, but delicious food and unique drinks.  I had the Tom Yum soup with prawns and it was just spicy enough. Full of flavor and plenty of well cooked prawns. We also shared a few apps including calamari and samosas.  It was all very authentic to what we had in Thailand.  I had a drink with elderberry liquor,  I forget the name, but really loved it. Someone ordered the blue rice which was different to look at, but it's just rice. The staff was attentive and food was delivered quickly.  A very enjoyable experience.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
We came here for Saturday lunch (later in the lunch time). The place was lively but not crowded. We didn't have a reservation but got the table right away.
Some of the staff members were nice and friendly while some were indifferent which felt borderline rude at times.
We ordered non-alcoholic Martini which I wasn't a fan of. For starters we had Crispy egg rolls and Roti Mataba, both the dishes were really tasty with good quantities. For mains we shared Pad Kee Mow which was just a perfect amount of spicy (for our South Asian taste buds)
Very mixed bag but pretty Instagrammish decor.

top_10.name: House of Thai
top_10.address: 901 Larkin St, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: A very cute and family oriented Thai spot in Sanfrans. Service is quick and very friendly. The food is exceptionally seasoned.Every dish was balanced and flavorful.  The food is well portioned with reasonable prices. Some of the best Thai food I have ever had. Well worth stopping a visit.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I stopped by for Dinner, I started with basil beauty drink it’s good it’s just a little too sweet, papaya salad is good. Fresh roll is good too it could be better with less mixed greens which over power the rest of the ingredients, for the red curry is good could be better with a little bit more portion. Service was great, restaurant had good ambiance it’s clean as well. Overall I recommend this place for Thai restaurants among the Thai restaurants if you’re visiting SF.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Really legit Thai food. Among the best!! Also a lot of great variety. Old standbys like Pad Kee Mao and Papaya Salad are amazing plus BBQ pork like nothing I ever had is super tasty. Love the condiments in case you want to dial up the heat even more.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Ordered the pork Pad Thai and it's the best compare to ALL the Thai restaurants around here. Perfect amount of sauce (not dry unlike most), generous amount of pork and they gave us big serving for our order. This is now my new go to Thai restaurant.
_________________

10/21/2024
My grandson and I went to dine-in for brunch and they did not disappoint! We love everything that we ordered: fried egg rolls; green curry with tofu; crunchy pork belly with green beans and red bell peppers; sticky rice with coconut milk and fresh mango. The service was always with a smile! We enjoyed it.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: The atmosphere and waiter is fantastic. Always serving with a smile. The food Pad Thai and cashew nut were very tasty. Definitely need to try if you like Thai food.

testimonials: A very cute and family oriented Thai spot in Sanfrans. Service is quick and very friendly. The food is exceptionally seasoned.Every dish was balanced and flavorful.  The food is well portioned with reasonable prices. Some of the best Thai food I have ever had. Well worth stopping a visit.

I stopped by for Dinner, I started with basil beauty drink it’s good it’s just a little too sweet, papaya salad is good. Fresh roll is good too it could be better with less mixed greens which over power the rest of the ingredients, for the red curry is good could be better with a little bit more portion. Service was great, restaurant had good ambiance it’s clean as well. Overall I recommend this place for Thai restaurants among the Thai restaurants if you’re visiting SF.

Really legit Thai food. Among the best!! Also a lot of great variety. Old standbys like Pad Kee Mao and Papaya Salad are amazing plus BBQ pork like nothing I ever had is super tasty. Love the condiments in case you want to dial up the heat even more.

top_10.name: The ThongLor SF - Thai Restaurant
top_10.address: 420 Geary St, San Francisco, CA 94102, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
This is one of those little neighborhood spots that's small, and cozy with friendly service that makes you feel welcome as soon as you step inside.
The food was good, and they give you generous portions, making it a really satisfying and well-priced meal. For a simple, tasty, and pleasant dining experience, this place is a definite win.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Absolutely yummy. Great Thai food in quite large portions. My Pad Thai was just perfect.
The restaurant is fairly small but we (party of 5) were seated quite quickly (20 minutes).
The service is fast and correct.
Pricing is fair considering the location.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
the food was good. we ordered the pad see ew, the roasted duck rice plate, and mango sticky rice for dessert. my friend and i enjoyed ourselves and the staff were pleasant.
regarding the restaurant itself: this is a true ‘hole in the wall’ spot. it’s really small and crowded, and it didn’t seem very wheelchair accessible to me. prepare to wait in line to get a seat! i thought it was worth the wait though.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
If you think paradise is just a beach with a cocktail, wait until your taste buds crash-land at The ThongLor SF — the tiny Thai treasure that’s making big waves in San Francisco’s foodie scene!

I stumbled in solo on a business trip, but honestly, this cozy hole-in-the-wall with about 8 tables felt like a bustling family reunion (only with way better food and zero awkward small talk). The kitchen is right up front, so you get a front-row seat to the culinary magic — watching your meal get crafted is like a live cooking show, but better because you get to eat the finale.

Now, let’s talk food: Tom Yum Soup that’s so perfectly balanced it practically sings “Sawasdee ka!” to your soul. The pineapple fried rice? A symphony of veggies, cashews, and tofu that had me wondering if I’d accidentally landed in Bangkok. And vegetarians, rejoice! With two whole pages of vegetarian and vegan options, this place is basically your new spiritual home.

The staff? Superstars. Friendly, attentive, and clearly running the show like a well-oiled family machine. They got me seated, sorted, and served faster than you can say “Pad Thai, please!”

Fancy? Nope. Worth it? Absolutely. If you’re in SF and craving Thai that hits all the right notes without breaking the bank, The ThongLor SF is your go-to. I’m already plotting my next visit — and you should be too!

**Pro tip:** Come hungry, bring friends, and prepare to fall in love with Thai food all over again. 🌶️🍍🥢

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Great little restaurant 1.5 blocks west of Union Square. Service was fast, food was delicious. I had Pra Ram with chicken. My partner had Basil Fried Rice with chicken. We split an appetizer of vegetarian rolls.

testimonials:
This is one of those little neighborhood spots that's small, and cozy with friendly service that makes you feel welcome as soon as you step inside.
The food was good, and they give you generous portions, making it a really satisfying and well-priced meal. For a simple, tasty, and pleasant dining experience, this place is a definite win.

The service is fast and correct.
Pricing is fair considering the location.

top_10.name: 御食园 Z & Y Peking Duck
top_10.address: 606 Jackson St, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
We arrived at Z&Y Peking Duck in San Francisco and were fortunate to get a table as walk ins, as the restaurant was busy. Once seated, our server welcomed us warmly and took our drinks order before returning shortly after to take our food order. We decided to go for the half portion of Peking duck with pancakes, which arrived beautifully prepared and tasted really good. From our table we were able to watch the chef prepare the duck, which added to the overall experience. One of the servers, Jenny, kindly guided us on the different ways to enjoy the duck and her advice made it even more enjoyable.

After finishing our appetiser, our main dishes arrived which included Mongolian beef and chicken fried rice. Both dishes were served fresh, full of flavour and very satisfying. The combination of the food quality and the attentive service made the evening a memorable one.

Overall, our experience at Z&Y Peking Duck was excellent and we would highly recommend a visit for great food and warm service from the team.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Had a fantastic meal at Z&Y Peking Duck!! Ordered the whole duck in advance when we made the reservation. Ling was a really great server and attentive! Also got the pork belly with preserved greens, spicy duck blood, and green beans - all delicious! Finished with the almond curd which was adorable and tasty, but not too sweet. Would definitely come back!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Z&Y Restaurant is hands down one of the best spots in San Francisco for Peking duck but make sure you call ahead and reserve your duck because they do run out, and it’s their star dish for a reason. The duck is top-notch: beautifully roasted, shiny and crispy skin, and not overly fatty, which makes it even better. It’s served with soft pancakes, green onions, cucumber, and even a small dish of sugar. I was curious about the sugar until I overheard the table next to me dipping the duck skin in it is game changer!

The quality is excellent, and while you might find cheaper Peking duck elsewhere, the flavor and texture here make it well worth the price. We also ordered the Chicken with Explosive Chili Pepper, which featured a generous amount of Szechuan chili peppers. It delivered that classic mouth-numbing sensation, but in a perfectly balanced way not overwhelming at all. The fried chicken pieces were seasoned perfectly and packed with flavor.

On top of the amazing food, the service stood out. Even though the place was busy, one of the servers took the time to explain the dish’s origin and the best way to enjoy it, which made the whole experience even more special.

Highly recommend for anyone craving authentic Chinese flavors especially the duck. A must-visit when in SF!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Absolutely delicious Beijing roast duck and spicy dry pot bullfrog! The flavors were authentic and unforgettable. Our server Stanley was incredibly attentive and friendly — excellent service! Highly recommend this place to anyone looking for great Chinese food.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: So glad my parents and I found this place on a whim! We ordered the Peking duck, fried rice, chow mein, and pea sprouts - everything tasted amazing and incredibly fresh. The chef was kind enough to explain to us how they traditionally eat the duck with the wrap. The restaurant itself has a chill ambience. Highly recommend and looking forward to my next trip back :)

top_10.name: Dumpling Home
top_10.address: 298 Gough St, San Francisco, CA 94102, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I’ve been to almost every dumpling spot in SF (my wife’s a big fan 😂), so I’d say I’ve got a decent benchmark. This place is solid, definitely good, but not the best in the city.

The standout for me was the spicy pork soup dumpling, full of flavor and perfectly done. The sesame boiled dumpling was also above average. But the spicy beef boiled dumpling didn’t quite hit the mark, bland and forgettable.

Be ready for a wait, there’s usually a line and it can take 20–30 minutes to get seated. Overall, worth trying, but I wouldn’t call it a top dumpling destination.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Went on a thursday night. Expect a wait if you come after 6:30 pm, they don't seat you until you have the full party.

That said, service was really quick once we sat down. We ordered the pork and beef pan-fried dumplings, pork xiao long bao, sauteed grean beans, cucumber, and the Zha Jiang noodles. Everything was really good.

My favorite was the pan-fried dumplings, as I've never had that before. Just be careful as it does squirt everywhere if you bite into it. I liked the pork better than the beef dumpling. The cucumber was fresh, although I didn't really taste the garlic sauce. The xiao long bao was great, and the meat and sauce were very flavorful. Although personally, I thought they were on the bigger side. I prefer XLB that has an equal meat to pastry ratio. The green beans were perfectly crunchy.

For 6 dishes, tea and 1 beer, we paid ~$120 including tips. This is a good portion for 3 people.

Would definitely come back again.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Dumpling Home offers authentic and delicious Chinese food that truly impressed me. The soup dumplings were outstanding — they held all the flavorful broth without breaking, which is a challenge even for restaurants in China. The small bites were refreshing, tasty, and full of variety. Despite the lunch rush, the business ran smoothly with efficient service. Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I'm glad I didn't listen to the negative opinions; my wife and I had such a great time and meal here. We've tried a lot of dumpling restuarants around the country and several in SF, and this is by far our favorite.

Regarding the long waits, it's worth noting that for parties of 2 the waits may be way shorter than for larger parties. On a bustling Friday night at 6:30pm our wait was under 5 minutes as a party of 2 despite there being a line outside the door.

The dumplings were delicious: more flavorful, better ratio of filling/soup, and so many options to choose from.

We also appreciated the ambiance much more than other dumpling restaurants. Having a corner buildijg location allows for windows on both sides (better natural light and views), the acoustics were better than other spots (so you can actually hear the person next to you), and being in a great area allows for walking/hanging out or grabbing a dessert or tea afterward.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
If I could give more than five stars, I would. Dumpling Home is hands-down one of the most exceptional dining experiences we’ve had in San Francisco.

We ordered a feast:
- Numb & Spicy Xiao Long Bao, a total flavor bomb (tip: don’t bite into it; rather, have it whole)
- Fried Pork Wontons
- Pan Seared Pork Dumplings
- Curry Lamb Dumplings, which was totally unexpected delight.

Honestly, we couldn’t even pick a favorite—they were all outrageously good. This place deserves every bit of its Michelin Bib Gourmand recognition—and then some.
