top_10.name: Dragon Beaux
top_10.address: 5700 Geary Blvd, San Francisco, CA 94121, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
From out of town and tried a wide assortment of things! Not pictured, roasted squab, so delicious! Everything was delicious and if you want to experience sf in one sitting, Dragon Beaux is the place to go!
I recommend making a reservation since this is a popular spot to eat, once seated the service is very attentive! Great atmosphere for a celebration or even a casual meal!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
A wonderful place for top notch dim sum!

Arrived 15 minutes before opening and there was a queue already waiting on. Saturday morning.  Every party in line was seated when the doors opened.

Nice, elegant ambiance.  We were lucky to get the booth seating with nice padded benches and carved stone accents.  I'm guessing it's because we made reservations in advance.

Great selection of teas to order.

No rolling carts, items are ordered from the menu and brought to your table.  Great selection of items, from the typical traditional items to some more unique items.  All were delicious, served hot fresh from the kitchen.
Our favorites include the fried sea bass cubes, spinach sesame flatbread, crispy roast pork, and beef brisket stew on rice rolls.

Service was excellent and attentive. The staff were fluent in both English and Chinese.

We ordered a lot to sample the dishes but took the remainder home.  Staff expertly packed up the food for us at the table.

Well worth the trip and treat for a great meal.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I am a particularly big fan of Chinese food and my family decided to eat here for my sister’s birthday and I love the food here so much. The service was very nice and the overall ambiance of the place was excellent for a Chinese restaurant. I give them five stars ⭐️. I highly recommend them for dinner.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I made a reservation for lunch on a weekday. It's really not necessary if you get there at opening time. There were several already waiting and standing in a distributed queue but once the doors were unlocked everyone seemed to know who got there first. There appear to be some dim sum favorites that are ready at 11am. One of them is the har gow which was promptly placed at our table right after we submitted our order sheet. The 5 star dishes were the shrimp dumpling (har gow), char siu crepe and the stir-fried green beans. The taro puff, tofu roulette, beef bao and 5-guys xiaolongbao were 4-stars. The condiments like Zhenjiang vinegar for xiaolongbao and red rice vinegar came served in shallow dishes upon request. There's nothing placed on the table to start. The service was quick with many people attending to food delivery, dish removal, hot water addition to our tea pot. The vibe of the place is lively and energetic because of the clientele that are meeting up with friends and family and work colleagues.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: We came to Dragon Beaux after seeing fellow Vinkin's beautiful food photos. That guy is pretty awesome. The main attraction was the sand storm crab $49. At my age, it is hard to find something new. I've never heard of sand storm crab before. It was a deep fried crab with cilantro, minced garlic, scallions, peppers and fermented black beans. Fermented black beans is typically used in dishes like stir-fried clams. The sand storm crab was not bad. It was really oily. Still, tasty nevertheless. The other two dishes we had were the seafood crispy noodles $24 and honey pepper wings $13. Both were OK. The bonus was the free unexpected ice cream at the end of the meal. The restaurant is clean, no wait on a Tuesday night with excellent service and a speedy kitchen. Great meal.

top_10.name: Hong Kong Clay Pot Restaurant
top_10.address: 960 Grant Ave, San Francisco, CA 94108, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I was so happy to go to San Francisco for my birthday. My husband treated me to dinner in Chinatown at Hong Kong Clay Pot. Everything we ate was thoroughly enjoyed. From the salt and pepper chicken wings to the Chicken Clay Pot with chicken, sausage, mushrooms and onions.This is a no-frills restaurant, but all the food is bursting with flavor.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
This is a neat little walk up restaurant in Chinatown. It’s easy to miss the entrance because it’s only a door that leads up stairs, but it’s worth the search.

Service is friendly and the food is very good and reasonably priced.

I enjoyed the kung pao prawns. The dish was just spicy enough but not overdone.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: the interior is of course outdated, everything is old and not very clean. but this is almost in all establishments, so I will evaluate the quality of the food. the order was brought quickly. the eggplants, pork were cooked well. the shrimp tempura was excellent.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Wow!  I eat a lot of Chinese food, and this place has raised the bar for what excellent Chinese food tastes like.  Rarely on my travels, do I find a restaurant I want to go back to because I have limited time and I want to try as much of the food as I can wherever I am. But this place is one of those rare places that I would eat a second time (I didn't because I got invited out for my other meals).

I got the Seafood Clay Pot, and my friend got the Frog Clay Pot. We shared them and the egg drop soup (which was served family style) and pot stickers.  They were amazing.

The service was fast, courteous, and welcoming.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Taste of Hong Kong!!

Only a short stay in SF after travelled from East coast. Dad and I have been craving for a good and authentic Chinese Canton meal. After looked at all the Google reviews of the whole Chinatown. We decided to go for this place and we made the right choice. The sizzling claypot dishes were hearty and delicious just what we needed for a cold day and the veggie stir-fry was so fresh and well cooked. Beef Chow Fun (rice noodle) was great with wok hey 鑊氣 My dad called it the best meal since we have been away from home for 2 weeks. And the price is very reasonable too. Most importantly we made friend with the lady boss, she is so welcoming and looked after us well. She chatted with us the whole time talk about everything just like an old friend. We felt like home eating at her place so we went back again second night. Highly recommended for people if you look for an authentic Cantonese place and don’t know where to go. This place has something other place may not have - 人情味 👍🏼👍🏼 多謝老闆娘🙏🏼

top_10.name: LetsSweet Kitchen
top_10.address: 1010 Bryant St, San Francisco, CA 94103, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Food so yummy. Won ton noodle soup was the bomb. Also got today’s special which was fried pork chop with Chinese spicy curry and salad ❤️

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: The food was amazing! I ordered the signature dou meat rice. The meat was tender and juicy, and the rice was generous. I also ordered a stuffed youtiao that comes with shrimps inside, which were also quite delicious. Services are very friendly. I highly recommend it and will definitely be back.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Absolutely fantastic food! I had the curry beef with rice, along with a hong Kong milk tea. Both just knocked it out of the park. Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: One of the best wonton noodle soup around the area. Excited for the new menu with more hk style food and snack. Service is excellent and warm welcome.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I am happy that there's a new Hong Kong Style Cafe (Cha Chan Tang) in the city. The food taste like authentic HK style food. The fish siumai is something hard to get in the US. I appreciate they have that available on the menu. Milk tea is good, just need to make the tea taste stronger to make it perfect. Hope they keep up the good work.

Absolutely fantastic food! I had the curry beef with rice, along with a hong Kong milk tea. Both just knocked it out of the park. Highly recommend!

top_10.name: Sohunan of Henry's Hunan
top_10.address: 674 Sacramento St, San Francisco, CA 94111, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Food was excellent! We had the Hunan shrimp, Hunan dumplings, and hot and sour soup, the food came out hot with the freshest ingredients. Venue was very clean, service was good, nice and quiet.

Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: A cozy hole-in-the-wall eatery featuring an open kitchen with a flame wok. Enjoy great food and a bit of entertainment from the kitchen that brings the comfort of home cooking during a bustling day in San Francisco.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Nice restaurant with authentic Hunan dishes. The smoked pork belly tastes really good 💯😊 Good luck with the fortune cat too! 😺

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: The dishes were too salty for me. The portion sizes are smaller than expected.  Also 3 dollars/person for rice.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
What’s going on with positive reviews ? This is not hunan food ! This is expensive Panda Express.
No majao pepper in any dish, smoked pork belly was not fresh at all.
What you see on the photo was $74

testimonials:
Food was excellent! We had the Hunan shrimp, Hunan dumplings, and hot and sour soup, the food came out hot with the freshest ingredients. Venue was very clean, service was good, nice and quiet.

Highly recommend!

A cozy hole-in-the-wall eatery featuring an open kitchen with a flame wok. Enjoy great food and a bit of entertainment from the kitchen that brings the comfort of home cooking during a bustling day in San Francisco.
Nice restaurant with authentic Hunan dishes. The smoked pork belly tastes really good 💯😊 Good luck with the fortune cat too! 😺

top_10.name: R & G Lounge
top_10.address: 631 Kearny St, San Francisco, CA 94108, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I recommend coming here if you are in a large group like 10-11 people. But I would also not recommend the banquet menu. You get 9 items plus dessert for $708 under menu B. However our group of 11 ordered 13 dishes plus dessert plus alcohol and our sub total was only $583 and that included not just 1 but 2 crabs and a whole Peking duck. This ended up being a better deal doing a la cart and we had just enough food for everyone to share family style.

We ordered:

2 x salted egg yolk crab
Whole Peking duck
2 x Steamed clam and egg
1 yang chow fried rice
1 special fried rice
Combination seafood garlic noodle
Honey spare ribs
Salted egg yolk pumpkin
Garlic stir fry pea shoots
Scallops w/beef steak
Prawn with honey walnuts

Service was good despite they were very busy. It took 30 minutes for the first dish to come out. While we waited we asked for peanuts. I saw on the menu they charge $5, but didn’t see it on the bill. Other restaurants give peanuts without having to ask. The peanuts were plain, unroasted and unsalted. Most of the dishes were great. However, the special fried rice fell short. There was nothing special about it. It tasted like plain egg fried rice. Some of the clams were chewy while others were tender. Prawn with honey walnuts needed a touch of acidity in the coating.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
A magnificent meal at the R&G Lounge. This is one of Chinatowns best restaurants. Everything was was terrific so I’m not going to waste any time. The sea bass and the chicken surprisingly stood out the most. This restaurant is a good spot for special occasions and is perfect for bigger groups. The staff is attentive and quick. Overall a great dining experience I would recommend.
Dos thumbs up 👍👍

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: We had a 9-hour layover and decided to explore San Francisco with my family. What a great decision! We found this amazing restaurant, and everything we tried was delicious. The duck and bao buns were a true delight: flavorful and cooked to perfection. It was the perfect way to pass the time and turn a long wait into an unforgettable memory. I highly recommend this place for a fantastic family meal!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: R&G Lounge serves delicious dishes—everything we ordered was full of flavor and perfectly cooked. The restaurant has a comfortable atmosphere and great service. It gets quite busy during peak hours, so going a bit earlier is a good idea to avoid waiting. Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I found this place through Google Maps recommendations and I want to tell you that it was a unique experience since we arrived. It is the best Cantonese restaurant in  San
Francisco. We arrived around 8 pm and we didn't have to wait. They took us to the underground part, which is an experience since it seems like you are entering another city. The service was excellent because the waiter was very patient since my English is not the best and he helped me choose the dishes. They welcomed us with tea, which they were very careful to serve. Afterwards, we ordered the duck, which was delicious, and the prawns with honey walnuts, which I also highly recommend because the combination of flavors is wonderful. The dessert was also delicious. Overall, I highly recommend the restaurant because you will eat very well and in a unique way.

testimonials:
I recommend coming here if you are in a large group like 10-11 people. But I would also not recommend the banquet menu. You get 9 items plus dessert for $708 under menu B. However our group of 11 ordered 13 dishes plus dessert plus alcohol and our sub total was only $583 and that included not just 1 but 2 crabs and a whole Peking duck. This ended up being a better deal doing a la cart and we had just enough food for everyone to share family style.

We ordered:

2 x salted egg yolk crab
Whole Peking duck
2 x Steamed clam and egg
1 yang chow fried rice
1 special fried rice
Combination seafood garlic noodle
Honey spare ribs
Salted egg yolk pumpkin
Garlic stir fry pea shoots
Scallops w/beef steak
Prawn with honey walnuts

Service was good despite they were very busy. It took 30 minutes for the first dish to come out. While we waited we asked for peanuts. I saw on the menu they charge $5, but didn’t see it on the bill. Other restaurants give peanuts without having to ask. The peanuts were plain, unroasted and unsalted. Most of the dishes were great. However, the special fried rice fell short. There was nothing special about it. It tasted like plain egg fried rice. Some of the clams were chewy while others were tender. Prawn with honey walnuts needed a touch of acidity in the coating.

A magnificent meal at the R&G Lounge. This is one of Chinatowns best restaurants. Everything was was terrific so I’m not going to waste any time. The sea bass and the chicken surprisingly stood out the most. This restaurant is a good spot for special occasions and is perfect for bigger groups. The staff is attentive and quick. Overall a great dining experience I would recommend.
Dos thumbs up 👍👍

We had a 9-hour layover and decided to explore San Francisco with my family. What a great decision! We found this amazing restaurant, and everything we tried was delicious. The duck and bao buns were a true delight: flavorful and cooked to perfection. It was the perfect way to pass the time and turn a long wait into an unforgettable memory. I highly recommend this place for a fantastic family meal!

top_10.name: Mister Jiu's
top_10.address: 28 Waverly Pl, San Francisco, CA 94108, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Last minute splurge, we booked the only appt, last one of the night. But luckily they notified us that an earlier spot opened up. The food took on an interesting take on Hong Kong cuisine. Our favorites were the choeng fun (with clam!), silken tofu (lots of tofu and made in-house tofu), and the chrysanthemum milk tea (lactose intolerant friendly).

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: No exaggeration… best Peking Duck I’ve had in my life. We had the 6 course dinner  that was a surprise with every dish. Innovative, complex and a delight to the senses. Not a mystery why they have earned a Michelin star. Service was impeccable and served with passion for the food. ALDA was incredible ! She was knowledgeable, worldly and her love for this establishment and its products showed through. We had to ask Ethan to come to the table so we could express our gratitude. Fantastic food, hospitality and artistry.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Great place, great atmosphere, service, drinks, expansive and expensive wine list. Essentially a price fix menu, choice of two 1st courses, then a well prepared Peking duck. Went with one other couple. One drink each. A bottle of wine, $140, about mid price on the list. An order of fried rice with the dinner. Ended up, at almost $500 per couple.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: A hybrid of fine dining and casual restaurant in SF China town with a Michelin star. Lovely tasting menu with 6 dishes plus more.  Particularly delightful in the Ham sui gwok (鹹水角) unlike any in dim sum restaurant, the different ways of cooking the squab, and the lamb meat.  The servers are attentive and hospitable.  We recommend reservations but if you want to try your luck, visit early, between 5pm and 5:30pm, you may get a bar table without a reservation.  It is way more pricey compared to other Chinese dinners nearby. It makes a special dinner for special occasions. We plan to come back to try out its Peking duck.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: The tea smoked duck is a stand out. Once you order, it takes an hour.  They use Liberty Duck. Mister Jius perfected the method by making the exterior crispy and the inside still medium rare and moist. We ordered the daikon cake with olive tapenade which was so unique. I don't usually like olive but the olives on top of the daikon cake elevated the taste. Their chow fun with charsiu came out piping hot, the way it should be. I feel like they made the noodle from scratch too. Good amount of soy sauce and flavor. Can never go wrong with milk bread and homemade soft honey butter. Prices are a little higher than other Chinese restaurants but this is quality. Must try

top_10.name: Harborview Restaurant & Bar
top_10.address: Street Level Drumm &, Four Embarcadero Center, Sacramento St, San Francisco, CA 94111, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: The restaurant is nestled at the bay with a good view if you sit outside at the terrace. The decor inside is exceptional along with pretty clean fish tanks. They offer a wide variety of dim sum and dishes and are pretty good. Our favorite is the roast pork belly (crispy skin and moist meat).

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Lovely day to sit outside on the balcony for a really nice meal. Food came quickly and was really good quality. No MSG in the food that we could detect which is a bonus. Great job girls and guys!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: The best crispy pork and baked buns EVER. Worth a visit just for those two items but the dim sum is great as well. Spacious enough to accommodate large weekend crowds and super efficient service without making you feel rushed.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: It might be a dish I do not know about but please don't freak out by the dead fish and suspicious ecosystem growing in the water tank in the corridor to access the restaurant because the worst is yet to come. Firstly, the costumer service is below decent standards given that the waiters didn't understand the concept of being friendly or polite, there was also a waiter that seemed to have a cold and wanted to demosntrate it to all of us. The atmosphere was chaotic and loud. Lastly, the food was what we call "decent" some sauces are surpises because you can't really descifer what they contain and the fried food is near to tasteless.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
In one word, Awesome.
superb restaurant, great and authentic service, extremely tasty food, resemble to the food I ate in China. will clearly come back. We were party of four and tasted from large variety. ended up with $110 per couple including tax and tip.
Be aware that the restau is crowded in the evenings

top_10.name: Yank Sing (Spear St.)
top_10.address: 101 Spear St, San Francisco, CA 94105, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Slow service and overpriced dim sum. Had better dim sum experience at Harborview.  They have the push carts here but they skipped some tables. Asked for utensils and the waiter forgot so we had to ask another waiter so then proceeded to do other tasks with the utensils in his hand instead of just dropping them off at our table first.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: It is rare to find cart service dimsum these days.  Yank Sing met our expectations and more.  The selections are typical but with a twist.  We had one of everything.  A variety of dumplings, one better than the next Soup dumpling, curry dumpling, mushroom and chicken dumpling.  High quality food.  However, prices are much higher than normal and servings are less.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Great Dim Sum but I did feel like servers pushed food on us. The custard dessert was warm and delicious.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Two of us ordered 9 dishes as we were a little excited. A little too much than our stomach can take. All dishes are great and better than most dim sum places in the south bay. Among the 9 dishes, we like dumplings, sesame balls, and bean curd roll a lot. Sesame balls are a little expensive at $15, but they are the best I have had so far (I like dessert a lot). The place is comfy, the dim sum carts are all around you. The jasmine tea uses true high quality tea leaves that is one of the best in Chinese restaurants I have been to. This place has been on the Michelin list twice (2016 and 2021). They deserve it.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Solid dim sum offering near the waterfront. I went on Sunday at 11. Dining for one. They were delightful, and the dim sum favourites were top notch. Serving sizes for one are never the strong suit of dim sum, it favours a crowd, but a delightful meal nonetheless.

A variety of dumplings, one better than the next Soup dumpling, curry dumpling, mushroom and chicken dumpling.  High quality food.  However, prices are much higher than normal and servings are less.
Great Dim Sum but I did feel like servers pushed food on us. The custard dessert was warm and delicious.

top_10.name: Himalayan Cuisine SF
top_10.address: 1412 Polk St, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I recently had my first dining experience at Himalayan Cuisine SF, and I’m already planning my next visit. From the moment I walked in, the warm and friendly atmosphere made me feel welcome, setting the tone for a truly memorable meal.

The food was absolutely flavorful — each and every bite bursting with authentic spices and rich, comforting taste. There’s a wide variety of dishes to choose from, making it easy for anyone to find something they’ll love, whether you're a meat lover or prefer vegetarian options. I especially appreciated how affordable everything was, considering the generous portions and high quality of ingredients.

What really stood out was how deeply the experience immersed me in Nepali culture — from the traditional decor to the thoughtfully crafted menu. This is more than just a meal; it’s a cultural experience that transports you straight to the Himalayas.

The service was excellent, too. The staff was kind, attentive, and eager to explain dishes to a first-timer like me.

If you’re in San Francisco and want a delicious, authentic, and affordable culinary adventure, Himalayan Cuisine SF is a must-do.

Thanks to Bishow for taking us to the Himalayan Cuisine.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: First of all, service was excellent- welcoming, friendly, and attentive at all times. Our water glasses were always being topped off even if they weren’t empty. Only not rating 5 stars because our dishes were too spicy for us and I didn’t get to try the dishes at a level of spice where I could really appreciate the meal. Now we know that if we come back, we’ll get “mild” instead of “medium” spice here. We can handle a fair bit of spice and thought we could do “medium” and we did but our noses were running a bit and my friend didn’t eat as much as she normally would for dinner. My veggie paneer dish was actually fine at medium spice but I think if I chose mild, I could’ve tasted more flavor vs spice and that would’ve been more enjoyable for me.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Amazing food! The flavors were fantastic. I had the Vegetable Korma and Coconut shrimp curry, and the shrimp curry was my favorite. But both were amazing! Great service, good atmosphere.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
The food was excellent and authentic. The tastes and decoration really reminded us of our visit to Nepal.
Highly recommend this place!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

An absolute gem! Himalayan Cuisine in San Francisco delivers a warm, inviting atmosphere paired with bold, authentic flavors. Every dish we tried—from the samosas to the chicken karhai —was perfectly seasoned and bursting with flavor. The naan was fresh and pillowy, and the service was incredibly friendly and attentive. This place is a must-visit if you love Nepali, Tibetan, or Indian-inspired dishes. We left full, happy, and already planning our return. Highly recommend!

top_10.name: Nepa Indian Cuisine
top_10.address: 507 Divisadero St, San Francisco, CA 94117, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Oh boy, I don’t even know where to start. This restaurant is by far the best Indian & Nepalese restaurant that I have ever been to anywhere. This restaurant beats any Indian restaurant in SF by any measure. The food is so tasty, so flavorful. The service is out of this world. The atmosphere is superb. The prices are extremely fair. As soon as we sat, they were bringing complimentary appetizers with some complimentary house sauces. Every food we had was 10/10. This is definitely paradise for food lovers. I have been to almost every Indian restaurant in the city, no restaurant comes even close to this one. I think Nepa restaurant is even better than some of the best Michellin Star Restaurants. I feel like royalty there. All staff members are absolutely friendly, smiling, very helpful. They are amazing people, both employees and even the owner. I have not enjoyed going to restaurant as much as I did going to Nepa. I am now 💯 loyal customer. Forget about any other restaurant l, come down here, you won’t be disappointed ever. This is heaven for foodies. Restaurants, please take a note about how to run a restaurant from Nepa. Learn from them. Cuz this is how you do it. Thank you Nepa Team for taking absolutely amazing care of your customers. We see you Nepa Team

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I had a great lunch at Nepa! Lots of vegetarian options and I was happily surprised by the flavor of the Jeera Aloo. Very yummy! Excited to come back again and try more.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Nice casual environment. Food was incredible, over ordered to the point of scared. The Hot is perfectly spiced, I debated going higher but what am I trying to prove?
- lamb biryani
- chicken Tikka masala
- garlic naan
- Momo's

Momo's we're incredible, a surprise highlight on top of a delicious meal.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: The best food we have had in SF. Stumbled upon this restaurant on our visit to the Alamo square. It was a foggy evening and we ordered Momos, Chowmein. Everything we ordered was Amazing. The Gulab jamun was lip smacking. Ended the meal with masala chai. Not jut the food but the service was exceptional . Do give this place a try and you won’t regret it.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: We went for lunch today. We felt very much welcome and felt at home in this place because of Janarthan who was very polite and friendly who speaks English as well as Hindi and Nepali . This was the best Indian restaurant serving the most authentic Indian food I ever had at n this part of USA. I loved the lamb curry suggested by the friendly Janarthan who took our orders. The fried momos were beyond words as I always have steamed momos. The tandoori platter, garlic naan all other items were perfect in taste catering to our Indian buds. Spice was adjusted to our needs. The complimentary masala tea Janarthan offered me as I spoke a bit of Nepali was out of the world. Ambience was great with Bollywood songs playing on the TV in the background to take the experience to another level. Would be my place to go whenever I think of Indian food . The gulab Jamuns to wind up the dinner were perfect.

top_10.name: Diwali Indian Cuisine
top_10.address: 1499 Valencia St, San Francisco, CA 94110, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Diwali Indian Cuisine is a gem! The food is flavorful, fresh, and absolutely delicious—every bite is a treat. The manager is the highlight of the experience: super friendly, welcoming, and genuinely funny. He had us laughing the whole time—honestly, he could do stand-up comedy on the side! Great food, great vibes, and great people. Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Amal went above and beyond — incredibly friendly, knowledgeable, and eager to help. If you're unsure what to order, definitely ask for Amal. He’ll guide you based on your preferences and give you thoughtful recommendations.

I recently discovered this new restaurant, and it instantly became a favorite — especially for one standout dish: Chicken 65.

Chicken 65 at this place is the best of all restaurants that I’ve tried in all of San Francisco and San Jose. Tastes exactly like the original version from Chennai, South India. Bravo to the Chef for bringing back the true authentic taste. Chicken 65 is not spicy, it’s mild and can taste the Flavors better. Masala Dosa is a 10/10.

The restaurant itself is clean and welcoming — a perfect place for both quick bites and relaxed meals.

If you're on the hunt for authentic South Indian flavors in the Bay Area, look no further.

Here’s what I Ordered:
Chicken 65 (vibrant red, mild spicy)
Masala Dosa (has stuffed potatoes)
Mango Lassi Drink (cool, refreshing, and not overly sweet)

Restroom ✨💖
Never seen such a clean Restroom, that speaks high attention to detail. Extremely clean, super impressed how spotless they've cared for this place.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Best Indian food I’ve had in SF in a while. Delicious food with amazing service. Highly recommend supporting this family run business!

This is the same spot as Dosa Corner, just under new ownership. The service was amazing and the interior was cozy. The owners were so sweet and attentive, both helped us out with choosing what to order. They recently opened this restaurant and were open to hear any feedback from us on how they can improve their service. They even offered us dessert (halwa) on the house!

We ordered a masala dosa and chicken biryani for two. The portion sizing was so big that we had enough leftovers for lunch the next day! The masala dosa was very good and tasted quite authentic. The biryani and raita was another highlight.

This is definitely going to be one of my regular spots!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: We love Indian food, this restaurant with new owner have some of the best home made genuine fresh flavors I have ever tasted. We truly hit gem here. Every dish is prepared with so much care and the flavors are amazing. Unique, fresh and authentic. Probably the very best Indian restaurant in the mission district so far. Our pictures don't give justice also because we took them after we ate some of the  food already... One of the best chicken biryani, tasty paneer appetizer, amazing chai, fish curry.... Veggie curry was amazing too. Different from any curry I tasted

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
You know those dining experiences that stick with you, not just satisfying hunger, but also sparking inspiration? This was one of them.

We had the pepper chicken fry dosa and king fish curry with idiyappam, a pairing my wife recommended over my usual naan. Firstly, the combination of dosa with a flavorful chicken curry is underrated, instantly bringing back comforting memories of home. The king fish curry was also beautifully balanced, hitting that perfect spot between tangy and spicy. The fish itself was perhaps a touch chewy, and nailing the temperature could elevate this dish even further. What impressed me most was that nothing felt overpowering or heavy, leaving you feeling satisfied rather than needing to wash it all down.

Beyond the delicious food, the owners, Kamala and Durgaprasad, were incredibly gracious and warm, and their story was inspiring. I sincerely hope their passion and tireless dedication reach many more people.

top_10.name: Trisara
top_10.address: 211 Kearny St, San Francisco, CA 94108, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Absolutely delicious. Visited here on an early Saturday evening. Ordered 4 dishes with Chicken Tikka Masala being the best. All the dishes had excellent flavor and were superb. Portions are medium-small sized.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Will not recommend this place if you’re looking for authentic Nepalese/Indian food. We ordered chow mein and chicken 65, both dishes completely lacked flavor. The chicken momos were okay, but the veg momos tasted stale. Overall, disappointing.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This place was crowded at 350 PM, which is a good sign! the food is outstanding, so some of the best Chicken Tikka Masala and samosa that I have had before. The garlic naan was good too. Gave it a 5 for food. Service was good too. Small place, so atmosphere not great. Overall, very good!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Came here for lunch with coworkers. We got chicken momo, goat curry and okra. The servings looked small when it first got to our table but turns out it was just enough for our table of three. None of the spices were overpowering. Service was fantastic. Just keep in mind it takes some time to cook the dishes so probably can't come here if you're on a strict lunch break. Make sure you have ample time to wait.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: One the best indo Nepali restaurant in sf . Had chicken curry salmon curry ,garlic naan and chicken momo . All food was delicious and momo is the best ever I had 😘. Owner is  friendly and quick service. All over 5 star .

top_10.name: Marina Indian Cuisine
top_10.address: 1968 Lombard St, San Francisco, CA 94123, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Marina Indian Cuisine was such a great find! We ordered the gobi manchurian, butter chicken, and paneer tikka masala—and everything hit the spot. The gobi manchurian had the perfect crisp and flavor, while the butter chicken was super creamy and rich. The paneer tikka masala was also packed with flavor and had just the right amount of spice. What really stood out, though, was the service—genuinely kind and attentive the whole way through. To top it all off, they surprised us with rice pudding at the end, which was a really sweet touch (literally). Definitely recommend stopping by if you’re craving some solid Indian food!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Very mediocre food with mediocre service. My food was mostly plain. The waitress was talking very quietly, I could barely hear her even though it was completely silent in the restaurant. I don’t recommend this place but maybe your food choice will be better than mine. Their menu is huge and I’m sure people can find something they like. I was probably not lucky that time

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Really enjoyed the chicken palak and aloo paratha we had here. Chicken was in large pieces and tasted stewed—very comforting. Loved the spiced potato in the paratha. Bhengan barta was also nice and butter naan ties it all together.

Getting a mild curry is indeed very mild. Would recommend getting medium if you want a little heat, though it was delicious even without.

Really friendly service and large portions. Looking forward to coming back.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Food was AMAZING. Especially the shahi paneer. The atmosphere was so cute and nice inside, with nice greenery on the wall. And very considerate, attentive, and sweet staff!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I loved it. Can’t explain it any better. Food was incredible, service was perfect. Roshan was so fun, giving us everything we asked for and more. Recommendations were incredible and we even got to see the kitchens. Flavor of everything was the stuff dreams are made of. Atmosphere was so comfortable and beautiful. 10/10.

top_10.name: Taj Indian Cuisine
top_10.address: 5701 Geary Blvd, San Francisco, CA 94121, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Finally giving this new(ish) spot in the neighborhood now that they have some time to settle in.  Went with a Chicken Tikka Masala, Rice and some Garlic Naan. Instead of my usual go to Mango Lassi I went with a Salted Lassi. The Salted Lassi was nice and a good balance to the Masala (just know it’s a salted plain yogurt drink and not sweet like a Mango Lassi is).  Overall impressions of the food and experience is decent. Great Masala Sauce, but unfortunately the chicken was a bit dry and chewy on the day I had it. The Garlic Naan was great and very tasty with the sauce.  Value was ok, but note you have to pay $4 for rice to go with a $16 entree as rice is not included with the entree.. All in all it was a bit of a pricy lunch for one at $32 before tip. My suggestion is to go with a group to share different dishes family style. Decor is pretty basic, but very clean and nice service by staff.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Today we wanted to eat out, but we wanted comfort food after a long day in the city and this restaurant hit the spot! The ambiance and food is amazing, we were so impressed by the amount of love you could taste in every bite, reminded our family of eating back home (punjab)! We thanked the chef for his service and will definitely be going back!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
8/20/2025- update:
Still as good as the first time!  The  chick pea veggie fritters were amazing!   So is the curry!  Super yummy!

First time here and I was pleasantly surprised!  Food is very good!   I was wondering why my tea took a bit to get, they brew it and it’s milk chai.  We had the tandoori salmon and the veggie basmati rice and it was amazing!  Service is good, they are  very nice and the prices are good!  Will definitely be coming back!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I just got back from an excellent meal from this restaurant and the food here was really good. The rice 🍚 dish was very well prepared and the service was very nice and the overall ambiance was very nice for an Indian restaurant. I highly recommend people try this place out. I give them 5 stars all around.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Great spot for affordable, flavorful Indian food! We ordered the Baingan bartha, saag paneer, malai kofta, chicken curry, and tandoori chicken - all were delicious! will definitely be coming back here

top_10.name: Sunset Indian Cuisine
top_10.address: 642 Irving St, San Francisco, CA 94122, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: the food was amazing here! we got the chicken chilli and the salmon curry and both were well cooked and flavorful. service was really good! this might just be my new spot for indian

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Went to Sunset Indian Cuisine today for lunch and wow I’m still full. Like, might-skip- dinner tonight full. First of all, the place is super clean like “your mom would approve” clean. They kick things off with a complimentary papadum and some punchy house-made pickle. Free crunchy snacks? Yes, I will be coming back.

We ordered the chowmein, hurricane momos, and kebabs, and every single dish hit the spot. The chowmein was flavorful and perfectly cooked, the momos were juicy and satisfying, and the kebabs had that smoky, grilled goodness. You can really taste the authentic Nepalese and Indian flavors.

Heads-up: this is traditional Nepalese and Indian cooking, which means everything is made fresh from scratch so no shortcuts here. So yes, your food might take a while depending on what you are craving and how busy it is but trust me, it’s worth the wait. And hey, you get a free appetizer while you chill, so no biggie.

Bonus points: whether you’re a meat lover, vegetarian, or vegan, they’ve got something for everyone. They also offer nut-free and gluten-free options, just ask they’re super accommodating.

Overall, the food’s amazing, the vibe is welcoming, and the service is spot-on. Come hungry, leave happy, and maybe bring stretchy pants just in case.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: We had a fantastic experience at this Indian restaurant! The food was absolutely delicious — we ordered the Hurricane Veg Momo, Garlic Naan, and Shahi Paneer, and everything was bursting with flavour. My favourite is hurricane momo. The portions were generous, making it great value for the price. Service was impressively fast, and the prices were very reasonable. Totally worth the visit — highly recommend for anyone craving authentic and satisfying Indian food!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I ordered from this restaurant after being disappointed with another restaurant nearby this one. I have to say that the food was a big difference than what I got from the other place last night. Both the chicken vindaloo and the jeera aloo were very good. For dessert I ordered the Kheer Rice Pudding and Gulab Jamun. The Gulab Jamun was very soft and okay but definitely could be way better. It was edible but I wouldn't jump up to order it again. The Kheer Rice Pudding was okay as well but I would only order again if nothing else is opened.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Sunset Indian Cuisine - A True Gem for Indian Food in San Francisco

If you’re craving authentic Indian flavors, look no further than Sunset Indian Cuisine in San Francisco. This place delivers an incredible dining experience, combining fresh ingredients, bold spices, and a welcoming ambiance.

Food Highlights:
•	The naan here is exceptional – freshly baked, soft, and perfect for scooping up their rich curries.
•	The samosas are crispy on the outside, with a perfectly spiced and flavorful filling.
•	Their lamb biryani is an absolute must-try. It’s fragrant, tender, and generously portioned – a delight for any biryani lover.

In all honesty, everything on the menu is outstanding. The dishes are prepared with care, balancing authentic Indian spices and flavors to perfection. Whether you’re a fan of vegetarian options or prefer hearty meat dishes, you’ll find something to love here.

Service and Ambiance:
The staff is friendly and attentive, ensuring you feel at home while enjoying your meal. The cozy ambiance makes it an excellent spot for family dinners, date nights, or casual outings with friends.

Overall:
Sunset Indian Cuisine is a standout among Indian restaurants in San Francisco. With its fresh, flavorful food and impeccable service, it’s a place you’ll want to return to again and again. Highly recommended!

top_10.name: Noe Indian Cuisine
top_10.address: 4166 24th St, San Francisco, CA 94114, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Came here without a reservation on a weekend for lunch. We were seated quickly. The samosas were really good. The breads were huge. The curries definitely packed heat. The ice cream cubes to top off the meal were cute, milky, and sweet.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Visited on a weekday night with a friend. We had the chicken tikka masala, garlic naan, papadum and the wings. I also got the mango lassi which was so so good. Everything was so delicious and we've tried a couple of Indian restaurants in SF already -- this was truly outstanding! It was pretty affordable, service was quick and friendly. We will definitely be back.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Came here to dine on a Friday evening with some friends. The food tasted very good, especially the garlic naan bread which we thoroughly enjoyed. The starters and the choices of curries was also plentiful.

The only downside was an unpleasant smell originating from the bathroom and the pretty long wait for the food to arrive.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Very nice Indian food served reasonably well in a not great environment.

Really, the menu and food quality are a cut above the typical Indian restaurant in this price range. My only minor complaint is how loud and annoying the radio is (and it does appear to actually be a radio, complete with ads between the songs).

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Food was really good and staff were so kind. I will visit again soon!

top_10.name: CURRY & KABAB INDIAN RESTAURNT
top_10.address: 489 3rd St, San Francisco, CA 94107, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: As a Brit… Okay so my review will be a little skewed as I’ll be comparing this to some seriously excellent Indian food.. After a chat with the server who was polite and helpful I went for the Chicken tikka masala (CTM) and a garlic naan. I swerved the free poppadom as it was a little/ way too soft for my liking.. The CTM actually tasted pretty good albeit very different to the UK original, the meat was a little unimpressive and lacked the freshness I was hoping for. The naan, if slightly thin and crispy in places, tasted pretty good and the whole affair was washed down with a bottle of Taj Magal - Decent! Really I’d give this a 3.5 if a could, but that would be a solid 3.5 and up against some polished competition so by no means a poor score: if you’re in the area and have an Indian flavoured itch to scratch, you good do a lot worse..

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Great Indian food here in San Francisco. We order this as take out often. Every dish is delicious. The flavors really pop. The meat and rice are good quality. Nice vegetarian options as well. The atmosphere and service for dine-in is a nice experience.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This is the best restaurant we have ever had the pleasure of dining. The food and environment are immaculate. You can tell from the moment you walk in the door that they take immense pride in their facility and their guest’s experience.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This was the best Indian I've found in the United States. We arrived a little after 7pm on a Monday and there was no wait to be seated. We got samosas, butter chicken, veggie Tikka masala, and garlic naan. All were very delicious and I would order them all again. The food came quickly and the server was very helpful answering questions. I will definitely be back here and try more of the menu. Eat here before they become famous!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: First time here and already planing to come back next week! The rich aromas are so intoxicating! This place is a hidden gem that deserves to thrive. Definitely take your family here for a wonderful meal and pay patronage to keep this place open for the community!

top_10.name: Ocean Indian Cuisine
top_10.address: 6127 Geary Blvd, San Francisco, CA 94121, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This is one incredible Indian restaurant. The seafood biryani I had was so good. I ate every bite. I didn’t go away hungry. I highly recommend people try this place out at least once if you are in San Francisco. The ambiance of the place is very fancy and the service was very friendly. I would like to give them 5 stars all around.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Very friendly staff, I have been coming here for a few years already. Food is consistently good, they have the best Butter Chicken Masala and Garlic Naan of every Indian restaurant I have tried! To the point that's now, how I measure if the food is as good at other places. Hands down, best Indian food! The location is not too busy and they stay open later than most restaurants, always a good bite, especially for dinner, when parking is easy around Geary.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
i feel that service and food quality is truly amazing. but i’m removing points because the wait time is just far too long. i think the shortest i’ve waited was 20 min and the longest was 30+.

i appreciate them giving us a small dish because the wait time is long but that’s my only qualm with this place with it also not having a heater when it’s cold as there is the sf wind draft always coming through.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: WOW! What an amazing culinary delight! We were visiting from Miami, originally from West London so know a good curry when we taste one. Ocean Indian offers exceptional North Indian/Nepalese, dishes at prices that are ridiculously low for the quality you are getting! I'd like to say thanks to Tara and our young waiter, both were just so hospitable and welcoming - Indian hospitality at its very best.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Really sad. I have been ordering not ones and dine in in this place. Always was good experience. Until today. When I order for delivery by Dordash. My favorite Tika masala, nan , and rice. Tikaasala wasn't good at all. Or maybe they put me Butter masala, since I noticed they have it in menu and saw on rewies. It was not seasoned enough not runny not the right texture and the chicken extremely overcooked. I just tasted a bit and put aside all good. Maybe I will give it to some homeless person or toss it away. It was very disappointing when the restaurant that I always enjoy makes such mistakes. If you see your food not the same or taste wrong I understand you guys don't want to lose money and try to sell it but always remember you will lose clients. I am not sure I will order more here. Thank you

top_10.name: El Buen Comer
top_10.address: 3435 Mission St, San Francisco, CA 94110, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Decided to give this corner eatery a try for a quick lunch pit stop. Lunch in my book is quick sit, refuel and go concept unless I'm on vacation.
I like the interior of the place. Very charming and inviting. I grabbed a table and ordered two tacos.  One fish and one shrimp, some chips and salsa and that was it.  I can really comment on the chips, you can equal or better in any taqueria, the salsa was alright but certainly not a home made version.  The tacos, mmmm for my taste the fish was over fried and so was the shrimp.  Nice presentation but average in taste and flavor.  Oh well maybe I have to see if dinner fare pans out better.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
The green mole with pork was absolutely stunning. I love moles and Mexican food in general and this was one of the best.  The handmade corn tortillas are excellent.
Wait staff was very helpful and accommodating, and it did not take long to get the food once our large party had ordered.  They also have very high quality tequilas, and use G4 tequila for their margaritas, which is impressive.
Definitely going there again.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I was walking to this place and wanted to eat there but it was near closing time. I was reading some reviews while walking for tips. Some people say they make great mole, so I walked faster because I love mole. I have been constantly disappointed with some mole experiences around here, so I was keen on trying this one.

I got the chicken with red mole to go. I used their restroom and when I finished, my order was just ready. As expected from an efficient, no-frill Mexican kitchen. That was a positive sign.

Got home after about 3 hours. Took a bite from the now-cold mole and, wow, this is exactly what I was looking for. A complex, well-balanced mole (not that easy to find). It was kinda addictive and I finished half of my dish cold. The chicken was fine and not very tender and the tortilla was ok, but as a whole, it was a very satisfying dish, especially when you mix a little bit of black beans with the mole and chicken and eat it with the tortilla. Buen comer, indeed.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Excellent food and the best mole I’ve had in SF. Loved the sweetness of the mole rojo and the chicken was perfectly cooked. Started with an absolutely delicious carnitas taco.

Definitely stop here for an incredible meal with an extremely friendly and helpful team.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: One of the green best moles I’ve ever had, so complex in flavors, cant wait to try the other moles. Also loved their hot sauce and tortillas.

top_10.name: Taqueria Los Mayas
top_10.address: 331 Clement St, San Francisco, CA 94118, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Fabulous fresh dishes, reasonably priced and served with a smile. We got the Wednesday special (two panuchos for $10) and the Ensalada yucateca with pollo verdi. They were both large and delicious, and I  especially enjoyed the fresh corn and mandarins in the salad. After we finished, I asked about one of the dishes I hadn't tried (pollo motuleno), and the lovely Lupita gave me a small complimentary taste and told me all about how it is made from achiote. I'll be returning again soon!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: It was so salty it was almost painful but I still finished most of it. I was gonna give it 4 stars but then I remebered how salty it was. I'm not familiar with the different styles of Mexican foods but I really liked how many different toppings were on the nachos. I never had nachos with carrots in them. If they used like 3 times less of the salt then I would give them 5 stars. The chochinitas was kinda dry but not the worst.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Decent carne asada super burrito for $16.50. the meat could be higher quality/more season. Overall a decent spot, not super impressive but solid. Good salsas, very nice interior with a bar and TV's

reviews.text: This has been a great experience. I brought my Mexican parents here and they loved it which is saying a lot. The workers were super nice and they even let my dad go wash his hands in the sink behind the counter when the bathroom was taken. A lot of seating space and the music was perfect volume not overwhelming!!

top_10.address: 2128 Mission St, San Francisco, CA 94110, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I have been enjoy food from here for years. I highly recommend the Al pastor in a super burrito and ask for extra cheese. In general good food on the menu and a red salsa that has a spice level that provides the kick to my food that is missing from some other restaurants in the area. Serving food until about 2AM is a huge plus for the late night scene. If you haven’t been here yet it’s worth checking out and visiting regardless of the time of day. And the staff is great as well. A well rounded experience in general that I think more people should know about!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Excellent Jamaican Jerk Chicken Burrito with pineapple, salsa, plantains, rice, and beans for $14! Also enjoyed the steak quesadillas for $12.50 but not as great value wise as they are small. Would definitely go here again as they provide unique and delicious takes on Mexican food!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Amazing salsa, mole sauce, soyrizo (vegetarian friendly)! Lip smacking delicious. I've been looking for a good mole sauce since the time I came back from Mexico City and I got closure after having the mole sauce here 🥹 delicious food! Portion size for enchiladas is huge and can be shared by two!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: We had the super burrito and the quesadillas, both of which tasted mediocre. The flavor was bland, so I wasn't sure if they were going for a healthy style or what, basically flavorless. And it took a while to get our food, even though we were dining in.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I read the reviews and all were glowing. I was only in town for 1 day and was craving proper tacos. This place exceeded expectations. Clearly pride was taken in the restaurant. Bright, colourful and exceptionally clean. Service was friendly and helpful and the food… OMG the chicken taco was the best I have ever had EVER. I got the deluxe one and it was so well balanced. I’ll be dreaming of these tacos until I return to SFO again

top_10.name: Tacos El Patron
top_10.address: 1500 S Van Ness Ave #100, San Francisco, CA 94110, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Excellent birria and tacos. Come with good sides nopales, refried beans, onions and radish and 4 different sauces. A generous serving of chip and salsa. Birria taco is good and consome not too oily. The Al Pastor Tace very tasty, can't wait to try to other meats. I see they have shrimp and fish tacos - which I can't wait to try soon.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: One of the best tacos in San Francisco. Neighborhood is a little packed with cars along the streets and can be a bit hard to parking. Tacos are really good and they can fry the items a little longer and they come out really nice and crispy. The drinks are also really good. Worth a visit.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Absolutely fantastic tacos. I think possibly the best I have found in the bay area. We were specifically looking for a place with good birria tacos for my teen to try, and they did not disappoint. On top of that, the pollo, asada, carnitas, and pescado tacos were all fabulous. The aqua fresca was also amazing. Can't wait to come back!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Birria tacos were amazing, highly rated for a reason! Every order of 2+ tacos comes with free sides, and chips were also complimentary. Unfortunately, tables were very sticky

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: mm mm MM! Absolutely delicious birria tacos, and the tomato salsa and chips that came with it were excellent as well! Of the 4 bottled sauces/salsa they bring over, the salsa Verde was the best by far. So so glad we found this spot!

top_10.name: Papito
top_10.address: 1457 18th St, San Francisco, CA 94107, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Great place to bring friends, family or even a date.  Most of the food and drinks my friends and I ordered were delicious. The only entree that I didn't enjoy was their fajitas, they were under seasoned and lacked flavor. Definitely have to order the calamari, that red sauce is soo good 😁. The Al Pastor torta was packed with flavor and the fried chicken nachos were different in a good and delicious way. Service was good, but keep in mind that the restaurant is on the small side so there may be a bit of a wait for larger parties. Definitely coming back again!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Chicken Fajitas (white meat) are outstanding!! And trust me on this one , I’ve been too hundreds of placing in search for good fajitas , and this one is definitely in my top 2 , try it try it. You will love it. Restaurant is located in a little funky neighbourhood, go and explore it.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Super delicious. The food tasted amazing and the place had a great vibe. Usually I want to add more hot sauce or salsa to taco salads,  but this was perfect as is. Super affordable for a sit-down place. 10/10

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Came in for a quick snack, and ordered some guac. Some of the worse guacamole I've had, IDK how you mess it up so bad. No salt, seasoning or flavor, just mush 🤢 Tastes just like store bought stuff that's been sitting around for weeks

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I cannot recommend this place enough! I live for Mexican food so I've tried many Mexican restaurants and this one takes the cake. The food was delicious, it was so rich in flavor. Everything we tried was really good, we were all impressed. We ate here twice during our 3-day stay in San Francisco. The staff was also very kind! We will be returning!

Service was good, but keep in mind that the restaurant is on the small side so there may be a bit of a wait for larger parties. Definitely coming back again!

Super delicious. The food tasted amazing and the place had a great vibe. Usually I want to add more hot sauce or salsa to taco salads,  but this was perfect as is. Super affordable for a sit-down place. 10/10

top_10.name: Loló
top_10.address: 974 Valencia St, San Francisco, CA 94110, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: A fun Mexican restaurant with unique combinations. We enjoyed the guacamole, empanadas, fried avocado tacos, cauliflower tacos, and grilled broccolini and roasted beet tostadas. Lively atmosphere and interesting décor.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Absolutely amazing experience. The staff were so warm and friendly, and the food was incredibly fresh and delicious. I highly recommend it! The ceviche was super fresh and tasty, and the churros were unbelievably good!!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: One of the best meals I’ve had in a long time. The service was prompt and attentive, the server provided detailed guidance on options we were curious about. We had a mix of starters and main dishes, the birrera tacos and empanadas were stand outs. Would definitely come back again.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
The staff is on top of everything, they were super kind and welcoming.
The food was really enjoyable, would recommend the flautas particularly. Also, the starters can be taken as main dishes.
It was pretty packed so I'd recommend you to plan ahead & make a reservation!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I love the decor, the bartender's, waiter's, and host's attentiveness. The tacos were incredible.  We ordered the fish tacos, cauliflower tacos and the avocado 🥑 tacos. We paired it with a few drinks and they didn't disappoint either. The salsa was appropriately spicy enough for a Latina, and with a lot of flavor.

testimonials: A fun Mexican restaurant with unique combinations. We enjoyed the guacamole, empanadas, fried avocado tacos, cauliflower tacos, and grilled broccolini and roasted beet tostadas. Lively atmosphere and interesting décor.

Absolutely amazing experience. The staff were so warm and friendly, and the food was incredibly fresh and delicious. I highly recommend it! The ceviche was super fresh and tasty, and the churros were unbelievably good!!

One of the best meals I’ve had in a long time. The service was prompt and attentive, the server provided detailed guidance on options we were curious about. We had a mix of starters and main dishes, the birrera tacos and empanadas were stand outs. Would definitely come back again.

top_10.name: Cantina Los Mayas
top_10.address: 431 Balboa St, San Francisco, CA 94118, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
The Mexican Coffee is unbelievable. We had a side of plantains that were perfectly served!!!

This is a destination place for brunch on Sunday. You cannot go wrong if you love Mexican food.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Visiting San Francisco all the way from Texas and we 100% recommend this family friendly restaurant. The food was authentic and delicious. We left no crumbs. The customer service was also amazing. Muchas gracias por todo! Volveremos muy pronto!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Had a delicious bday dinner here. The food and drinks were delicious. Enjoyed all of our dishes and would have loved to order more from their menu. Drink options were ample and they had an extensive wine list as well.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Food here is delicious, fresh and unique to the Yucatán area.  Favorite dish was the mixed dessert platter and pumpkin seed dip.  Service was on the slow side, took us an hour to get our appetizer, but they comped us with a free dip.  Service then picked up.   Ambience is nice and ideal for a nice sit down dinner.  Would come again.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Accessible, friendly warm vibes. Excellent food, fantastic craft cocktails, depth of choices, tequila, and Mezcal.

testimonials:
The Mexican Coffee is unbelievable. We had a side of plantains that were perfectly served!!!

This is a destination place for brunch on Sunday. You cannot go wrong if you love Mexican food.

Had a delicious bday dinner here. The food and drinks were delicious. Enjoyed all of our dishes and would have loved to order more from their menu. Drink options were ample and they had an extensive wine list as well.

top_10.name: Taquería El Farolito
top_10.address: 2779 Mission St, San Francisco, CA 94110, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: One of the famous California-style burrito places in the Mission. Often a line, but worth it! Very cheap & great deal by Bay Area standards - you can get a large, tasty deluxe burrito for ~$12. Order at the counter, wait for your number to be called. Indoor and outdoor seating. CASH ONLY.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Really fantastic burrito. My first mission burrito and it was a great experience. Well-stuffed, well-wrapped for eating on the go, and all the fillings were flavorful on their own. The salsas were fresh and delicious and both on the mild side, but the red has a bit more heat. Enough for 1.5-2 meals unless you are super hungry. Service was fast and friendly. Would definitely get another!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This place is so unassuming and the food absolutely delivers beyond expectation. The carne asada supreme burrito was fantastic and by far the best burrito I have ever had. The green avocado salsa is top tier.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Came here and the line was out the door and still got my order in around 10 minutes. It’s a cash only establishment and they have an ATM inside, indoor dining is small but they have a small patio in the back where I was able to sit. My friend got the torta and said it hit home; the bread was crispy and the cheese was delicious. I got the super burrito w carnitas which was HUGE and so good! All that plus chips was $21 with tax.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: A classic for a reason. The super burrito with your meat of choice for $9.99 has to be one of the best meal deals in the entire state. It’s a hit with locals, tourists, and everyone in between. This place has to be making money hand over fist and it’s still a total dive. I just know the owners are loaded and still operating a cash only business. This is becoming a mandatory visit whenever I’m in San Francisco. Also, having sesos on the menu is a power move. Enormous authenticity points.

testimonials: One of the famous California-style burrito places in the Mission. Often a line, but worth it! Very cheap & great deal by Bay Area standards - you can get a large, tasty deluxe burrito for ~$12. Order at the counter, wait for your number to be called. Indoor and outdoor seating. CASH ONLY.

Really fantastic burrito. My first mission burrito and it was a great experience. Well-stuffed, well-wrapped for eating on the go, and all the fillings were flavorful on their own. The salsas were fresh and delicious and both on the mild side, but the red has a bit more heat. Enough for 1.5-2 meals unless you are super hungry. Service was fast and friendly. Would definitely get another!

This place is so unassuming and the food absolutely delivers beyond expectation. The carne asada supreme burrito was fantastic and by far the best burrito I have ever had. The green avocado salsa is top tier.

top_10.name: La Taqueria
top_10.address: 2889 Mission St, San Francisco, CA 94110, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This place was great. This was the first time me and my wife has been here and we got to tell you this is going to be our new favorite spot when we visit San Francisco. We had the super burrito fried the proportion sizes is not that large but it is worth every bit of the money. There was a pretty big line but trust me don't let that scare you away it goes really fast. The inside is pretty small so it's hard to get a table so we just got to go and ate it at our car.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
The chicken tacos were ordinary.
The meat did not have any flavors. It was just boiled chicken and beans.
The tacos being boiled chicken with the sauce were extremely soggy.

Same was the case with the burrito. No flavor and extremely soggy. Making it difficult to eat.

For 5.2$, I would definitely not visit this place again. Definitely overpriced.
The salsa did not have any flavors either.
This is just an overrated busy place.
Definitely not worth the hype and popularity.
Would definitely not visit again

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: My husband and I have been there several times already. It's the best taqueria in SF, in our opinion. Taste is always on point, and you can get authentic tacos for a fair price. We always take one taco each and nachos with guacamole to share. Although the restaurant seems to be full all day long, you don't have to wait for a table. I can really recommend you to come here if you are looking for an authentic Mexican food experience. 🌮

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
My friends and I have been here a couple of times after seeing a lot of hype about it.

I always get the carne asada burrito (make sure to ask for the mission style so u get the tortillas to be crispy) and let me tell you it’s so worth the hype. You don’t get any rice in the burritos, and instead, you get the juiciest pieces of meat and a good portion of it too!

From time to time we get the quesadilla and those are super good too. It’s a little more oilier than the burritos since they make the tortillas super crispy but hits the spot. There’s usually a long line but it usually moves quickly.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: We ordered a Carne asada burrito and a Carnitas burrito El Dorado style. Both were good burritos. It was a trip to San Francisco for us. We stayed down by the bay and was it worth the ride to the mission District just for the burrito probably not. Yes it’s an experience. You have to try. The burrito is good but it’s not great.

top_10.name: Puerto Alegre
top_10.address: 546 Valencia St, San Francisco, CA 94110, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Puerto Alegre has been around a long time and with good reason. The food is solid, service is excellent. Had the Chile Verde Pork House Special. Comes with 3 warm tortillas, beans, rice, salad and stewed pork. Everything was delicious, good portion of the pork meat. Service was really spot on, didn't have to ask for anything. The atmosphere is definitely old school Mission District. First time I ate here was in 1995, other than the prices it hasn't changed at all. Did I mention they serve big pitchers of margaritas! People go bananas here with the margaritas. When it's really busy it can be difficult getting a table. You might have to wait 30-60 minutes to be seated. Overall great experience at Puerto Alegre, I highly recommend this business

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: My FIL was in town and Tex Mex with a good margarita is always on his list. Turns out we’d taken him a few years ago and he still loved it. The service is great and the food is plentiful. The chips are super crispy and my burrito was awesome. Loaded with flavor, a delicious sauce, you can’t go wrong. We just had a pitcher of regular Margaritas but you could tell it wasn’t just a mix. It was cold, refreshing and bursting with Lime. All in all I highly recommend you stop by here if you have the chance!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Chips and salsa here were fantastic! The fajita plate was also delicious and flavorful. Absolutely loved the charred onions they added an extra pop to the meat.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: One of my favorite places in the Mission. After the art gallery 5 of us wandered in and was welcomed with warm arms. The staff is so nice and accommodating.  It took moments to seat us and then the margaritas started flowing,  chips, guacamole and salsa arrived and minutes later the food. Highly recommend the chicharrones in red sauce, but you can't go wrong with any choice. Note they now close at 9pm on a Friday, but make sure you stop in alone or with a group as a good time will be had. There is a bar and TVs playing for your entertainment.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Food is so mediocre. The service is terrible. There’s no communication between the staff. Why ask me if I want another pitcher of margaritas if the other staff person already ordered it for us, BUT took 15 mins for it to come out? It wasn’t even busy for it to take that long. Even the person that brought the pitcher out apologized. The pozole was so watered down that not even the green salsa could save it. There’s better places for Mexican food. Unfortunately, my friend likes this place that I will go because of him, but I would never take out of towners.

top_10.name: Cocobang
top_10.address: 550 Taylor St, San Francisco, CA 94102, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Super tasty late night dinner place! No reservation so we waited around 30 minutes to get a table. Service and atmosphere was okay, very busy vibes around the time we ate (8PM).

Food was so delicious and filling for the price! The corn cheese was so good and cheesy, it went well with everything. The kimchi fried rice was also delicious and all the ingredients came together perfectly. The BBQ combo is the best deal for the price and the meat was flavorful and tender, with an extra bowl of white rice to go with it. I would recommend ordering any of these items because they were all so tasty! We still had leftovers too.

Overall, I would definitely recommend coming here for a cheap, tasty, late night dinner. I do wish there was some dessert on the menu though!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Coco Bang might not look super fancy from the outside, but don’t let that fool you. This place is awesome! As soon as we walked in, the staff was super friendly and made us feel welcome. The vibe inside is really cool and relaxed. It’s a great place to hang out and enjoy a meal with friends or family.

We ordered six different dishes and shared them family-style. Every single one was delicious! The flavors were amazing, and you can tell the food is made with care. It’s hard to find a place where everything you try tastes this good.

If you’re looking for great Korean food and a fun atmosphere, Coco Bang is the place to go. We had a great time and can’t wait to come back!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This spot has quietly become a bit of a San Francisco favourite. The service is brisk but polite, and the food is great value—solid, well-made Asian dishes served late into the night. Perfect if you’ve had a few drinks and need something spicy and satisfying (and yes, some of it is very spicy, so proceed with caution). The lighting is a bit harsh for my taste, but the lively, eclectic crowd more than makes up for it. Expect a mix of locals, late-night wanderers, and beer-fuelled diners. A fun, dependable option when most other kitchens are closed.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: We were hungry after a day of baseball and sight seeing ans I was craving hotpot. So we found this cute little place. The wait was about a 20 minute wait. The wait staff was super friendly. We had the army soup and the kimchi fried rice. It was so delicious. Would def. War here again.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Probably the best fried chicken entry I’ve ever had in my life. Without a doubt top 3. Me and my friend visited and wanted to come back for lunch and dinner the next day too.

Cozy, small and fast
