top_10.name: Daeho Kalbijim & Beef Soup
top_10.address: 1620 Post St, San Francisco, CA 94115, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Hands down best kalbijjim from a restaurant and I crave it from time to time. This second time we got the premium kalbijjim (large, mild, cheese) and it was intense, flavorful, unbelievably good. The short rib meat was so tender. Each bite was bursting with flavor. Whenever we come back to SF, we will come once again!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Came with a group of friends for dinner. Make sure to check the wait time ahead, it can get really busy! Servers come quickly to take your orders and the food comes just as fast. Had the Kalbitang which was fantastic, hot and full of flavour. The sides are very tasty as well, you'll be full from everything there. Definitely recommend giving it a try if you like Korean food!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
A couple friends recommended this place and decided to visit with my family. It was their first time trying kalbijjim. We got the large one with extra cheese as well as some mandu and it was enough for the four of us.

It was very tasty and well served and reminded me of the one I had when I was living in Korea.

We ended up paying around 130 bucks for the four of us.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Tried to go with a couple of friends last Friday. We arrived by 7:15 and they told us the waiting time was 45 minutes. As the 45 minutes passed we got a text message saying that table was ready; then the waitress said she wanted to know if we were still around… another 50 minutes passed and they didn’t even tell us what was going on, after multiple times asking they gave us a menu and told us “you have to order now, and you may be seated in 30 more minutes”

I don’t know why they play like that, I’d rather if they tell me: “waiting list is 2 hours” then I could decide, but playing with customers time is the worst. Definitely not coming back ever, and not recommend to any people I know, sad because the food is good.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I have been here for a couple of times in the last few years and this place is legit for kalbijjim. I came here on a Friday around 545PM for two people. As I arrived, the small tables for two people were filling up very quickly. Luckily I got seated right away. After 6PM, you need to wait in line, so I highly suggest to come here 5 to 6 PM. Yes it is early for dinner unless you don't mind to wait. To me, I hate waiting. Lol. I ordered B2 which was Premium Kalbijjim with regular size. This portion definitely can fill up more than 2 people. I also added extra rice cake and cheese. Both add-ons were 11 bucks. The cheese itself seemed  to be worth it, but not for the extra rice cake. I counted the total and it was like 10 pcs, so basically a handful.  The short rib was well tender and cooked. The services were on point and efficient. As soon as we were done, we paid and left because I didn't want others to wait too long. I suggest you do the same and don't sit and chat after you finished eating. It's a common courtesy. I also recommend to park at the Jtown plaza because street parking spaces are limited due to high volume of cars. I definitely come back to try other food on the menu like Seolleong Tang and Mandu Guk. Big fan. Keep up the good work!

testimonials: Hands down best kalbijjim from a restaurant and I crave it from time to time. This second time we got the premium kalbijjim (large, mild, cheese) and it was intense, flavorful, unbelievably good. The short rib meat was so tender. Each bite was bursting with flavor. Whenever we come back to SF, we will come once again!

Came with a group of friends for dinner. Make sure to check the wait time ahead, it can get really busy! Servers come quickly to take your orders and the food comes just as fast. Had the Kalbitang which was fantastic, hot and full of flavour. The sides are very tasty as well, you'll be full from everything there. Definitely recommend giving it a try if you like Korean food!

A couple friends recommended this place and decided to visit with my family. It was their first time trying kalbijjim. We got the large one with extra cheese as well as some mandu and it was enough for the four of us.

It was very tasty and well served and reminded me of the one I had when I was living in Korea.

We ended up paying around 130 bucks for the four of us.

top_10.name: SAN HO WON
top_10.address: 2170 Bryant St, San Francisco, CA 94110, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: We came in without a reservation on a Thursday night and had to wait 2 hours for a table for 2. My favorites were the steamed egg, green onion pancake, and beef neck. We tried the pork jowl and it was good but a bit fattier. I loved the mixture of veggies that came with the lettuce wraps too. The kimchi jjigae was really good too along with the scorched rice. Service was great and I liked the pace of each item coming out.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: one of my favourite meals in sf so far — we had the set menu for dinner and it was A LOt of food. every dish was incredibly well seasoned and fresh, favourites were definitely the jebi churi (beef neck fillet) and gamasot fried rice with naengi & clam  doenjjang jigae. the banana soft serve with hazelnuts and nutella was a banger. service was great too! came out to be $350 or so after tax and tip, including a bottle of makgeolli.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Absolutely amazing! The meat is fresh and flavorful, the sides are delicious, and the service is fast and extremely friendly. The restaurant is spotless with a clean, modern design, and you can tell they’re very detail-oriented in everything they do. They even surprised us with complimentary Polaroid photos! Easily one of the best spots I’ve ever been to.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
The food was pretty good, but I wish the bibimbap had more rice. The meats were cooked beautifully and super tender but tasted a bit bland and flavorless.
The dalgona cheesecake and lobster claw were super good! The presentation for the bingsu was honestly a bit off-putting, and needed more nurungji.
All in all decent experience, definitely make a reservation, and good luck trying to find parking LOL

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: My review is based on my visit about one year ago. I visited here with my parents visiting from Korea and we had course menu. Overall, the foods were good but it was a bit mixed. Grilled meats were exceptionally good although we were already quite full by then. But soups (both Kimchi soup and rice soup) felt quite off to us. They tasted like they were based off of a very different ingredient from how we typically cook, which was a big disappointment for us. But the staffs were really nice and their drinks were unique in a good way. Overall we enjoyed our meal.

Easily one of the best spots I’ve ever been to.

top_10.name: Surisan
top_10.address: 505 Beach St, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I love this place. Keeping quality high at every aspect. Drinks: we had Matcha Mojito and Korean76 both lovely cocktails. Above many other SF bars. Food: loved Korean bbq and a new appetizer (seafood pancake, or something like that). The chocolate caramel cake was great as well.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
🍳 Brunch at Surisan – Worth a Stop in SF! 🥓

Dropped into Surisan for brunch and overall had a solid experience with a few highs and lows.

✅ The MBLT wrap (miso bacon, lettuce & tomato) was fantastic—savory, satisfying, and wrapped up just right.
💙 The blueberry-stuffed French toast? Next-level. Perfect texture, not overly sweet, and packed with flavor. I’d go back just for that.
😕 The popover, though, was a miss—overcooked and dry. Definitely didn’t live up to the hype.
☕️ Service was friendly, but I had to ask for water and coffee refills (minor detail, but worth noting).

📝 Overall: Good vibes, great menu, and some standout dishes. Just a couple small things from being a 5-star brunch spot.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: We stumbled upon Surisan and had a wonderful Saturday morning brunch! Plenty of seating on the patio, not much street noise, and the service was quick. We enjoyed the Blackstone Benedict and Belly Bap. The bacon lived up to the hype! We would gladly return to try the rest of the menu.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Very nice restaurant with lots of tables inside and out. Everything we had to eat was amazingly delicious. The millionaire bacon was spot on. Wings are juicy and come in great flavors. Bbq for 2 was beautifully prepared and flavorful. Best Korean food ever!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: What a nice surprise to find this place. Korean American fusion food. Bulgigi fried rice was delicious as was was the Surisan scramble with millionaires bacon, so yummy. Delicious fresh OJ and cappuccino too. Service was fast nice ambiance.

testimonials: I love this place. Keeping quality high at every aspect. Drinks: we had Matcha Mojito and Korean76 both lovely cocktails. Above many other SF bars. Food: loved Korean bbq and a new appetizer (seafood pancake, or something like that). The chocolate caramel cake was great as well.

top_10.name: POGU
top_10.address: 63 Serramonte Center, Daly City, CA 94015, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I came to try this popular restaurant inside the Korean supermarket. There was no wait — we were seated right away. Although it’s located in a supermarket, the atmosphere was decent and actually felt quite formal.

The service was excellent — the staff were very friendly and welcoming, always smiling. I forgot the server’s name, but I think it might have been Yao or something similar, a three-letter name starting with “Y.”

As for the food, everything looked great, but the taste was just okay. Not bad, but not particularly impressive either — slightly below what I was expecting.

The sauce on the sashimi salad was decent, and the chicken soup was a bit salty without much of that rich chicken flavor. The beef short ribs were fine, though they weren’t served hot — more lukewarm — but tasted good with the spicy mayo and soybean paste.

Overall, it was a decent experience. The service definitely added a positive touch.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Unexpected gem in Serramonte!

We walked in with zero expectations and left planning our next visit. The food was excellent across the board and the service was truly above and beyond — friendly, attentive, and on-point with suggestions.

Special shout-out to the beef barbecue: tender, deeply flavorful, and perfectly cooked — outstanding. The fresh bread was a fun, unexpected win (warm and dangerously good). I also tried abalone for the first time — clean, buttery, and beautifully prepared.

Great timing, dishes arrived unexpectedly fast. Highly recommend Pogu if you’re anywhere near Serramonte.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: My family and I came in for a celebration and chose to get the Chef's Choice menu. Overall, the menu was well balanced, tasty and excellent quality. All the ingredients were fresh and seasoned well. Service was great, very attentive and accommodating. I'd recommend this place for a low-key date night if you're looking for a great Korean menu.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: The food was delicious, and the service was super friendly and fast. I had the menu blue sunset mocktail which is not for the weak, as it tasted like blue raspberry without the raspberry. Some people’s taste, probably not mine though. For my dinner I had the beef bulgogi bowl which was delicious. The flavors were simple but rich, and the beef was very well cooked. The interior is clean and nicely designed, but it’s pretty open, so from my seat I had a clear view of the Old Navy across the way, which took away a little from the vibe. This restaurant was definitely a little expensive, but still a great experience!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: POGU has been nothing but fantastic. They keep the menu small and simple but each dish coming out looks very creative with beautiful plating. The taste also matches a the food will come back! Also really appreciate all the vegetarian options. Go for the Makgeoli cocktails!

top_10.name: Manna
top_10.address: 845 Irving St, San Francisco, CA 94122, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Manna was outstanding. We came for dinner on a Wednesday night around 7 and the place was packed. We only had to wait about 5 minutes. Everything we ordered was delicious. I highly recommend Manna.

I would rate everything 5/5 but the Seafood dol-sot bibimbap was probably my favorite.

Haven’t been to a restaurant that I have enjoyed this much in a long time.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Affordable and delicious Korean food with fast service, great taste, and good portions. Their Korean seafood pancake was really tasty, and their dolsot bibimbap had fresh ingredients.

They provide fresh kimchi as part of their banchan and offer free refills.

The dining space inside is rather tight with ~10 tables, but they also have a few 2-person outdoor dining tables. There is a paper waitlist on the back of the door.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: We tried the bibimbap and kimchi pancake! Both were fine. Loved the atmosphere of this place and the staff were friendly. We had to wait about 15 minutes to be seated indoors on a Sunday for lunch and by the time we left there was a long line!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Stopped by for some lunch while walking though the area and was positively surprised. The atmosphere inside is very inviting, definitely on the livelier side, but you can comfortably talk across a table. Food was excellent, and the banchan were equally very good. Service is a little bit scattered, but food came out quick!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
The food was excellent good and I love it!

We received very poor service from a woman with short hair and a hat. Despite leaving an 18% tips, she sighed at us in a disrespectful manner. It made us feel discriminated against, which was extremely disappointing.

top_10.name: Muguboka Restaurant
top_10.address: 401 Balboa St, San Francisco, CA 94118, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
This place is it. If you’re looking for cozy Korean food with a solid array of soup options, look no further, this place is it.

I’ve been here once to try various soups (unpictured), and they were great. This time, I tried their bibimbap and tofu soup. Also fantastic. The bibimbap comes sizzling in its stone pot and gets crispy if you let it sit. Complementary banchan and fried mandoo.

Service is also very responsive and attentive. Clean tables.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Best casual Korean food in Sf. They gave us two extra dishes on the house which I was debating ordering earlier but didn’t. It’s like they knew!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Everything was great! The food, staff, ambience. Its a cute little restaurant, perfect for families and friends. The staff was super accommodating and they altered the dishes for us since most of us don’t eat red meat. We tried the Soft Tofu, Duk Boki, Korean Kimchi Pancakes and Bibimbap. Each dish was great, the bibimbap was a little bland but the sides made up for that.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: A homey neighborhood place. The BEST Korean food my husband and I have had for awhile. Very friendly service. It took no time for all the hot dishes to arrive. Will definitely come back.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This place has a lot of nice options of Korean food. The staff is friendly and they usually give you free small appetizers and even a soup! The gyoza 🥟 and beef ribs are my favorites! 👌🏼 it is a small family restaurant, so sometimes the service is slow

top_10.name: Kingbob
top_10.address: 645 Clay St, San Francisco, CA 94111, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This place brought me back to Korea. Good food and true flavors. It’s the real KFC (Korean fried chicken). I ordered bulgogi rice bowl, kimchi fried rice, and soy chicken and spicy chicken. All of it was good. Food was made to order, so it was a bit of a wait but so worth it. Whenever I stop in San Fran, this will be my go to place to eat.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: The food danced delightfully on my taste buds — a flavorful performance, though the spice level barely whispered instead of roared. A curious twist in the tale: even water and other humble basics come with a price tag (a bit like being charged to breathe, if you ask me). Still, the feast was tasty, the service swift and cheerful, and overall, a pleasant little culinary adventure!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
First time reviewing it was so good!!!! Ive never cared enough but this place is SOOOO good.. and its affordable!!
It’s so hard to find a place that does good tteokbeokki but the red sauce thing here was exactly how it tasted in korea - and the perfect amount of spicy where its felt but not hard to eat!!! The tteok was well cooked and squishy.
The kimbap is wonderful and looks soooo pretty. There are many choices including a vegetarian amount, and the amount for the price is probably the best in san francisco!!
The guy who runs the place seems rly nice (i think he makes it to order). Theres a clean and big restroom.
We went as four people and each of us only paid $10~$13 but we split 3 kimbap plates, one ramen, and one tteokbeokki

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Just had Kingbob for the first time and wow I’m impressed. I’m not Korean and I’m not a picky eater but this hit every craving I had for Korean food. The tuna gimbap was super flavorful and the spicy pork gimbap had the perfect kick. The tteokbokki was chewy and rich just the way I like it. Everything tasted fresh and satisfying. Definitely coming back.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Great casual korean food restaurant. I had a classic combo of ramen and kimbab. Tofu ramen was really delicious with a perfect spicy kick (not too spicy). I’d come again!

top_10.name: Han Il Kwan
top_10.address: 1802 Balboa St, San Francisco, CA 94121, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I have visited here many times, usually when I am in the area where I am craving for some good Korean food. Most of the times when I arrive there is a wait with multiple parties ahead of me, but I do not mind since I am a very patient person. The food and service is good here, so I understand why it is always busy and packed here. You can choose to have either their Korean barbecue dishes or their traditional authentic Korean items. Their menu consists of shareable items, soups, stir fry dishes, and much more delicious items. The staffs here are welcoming, well trained and understanding where I never encountered any issues during any of my visits. If you are not in the mood in waiting then I recommend you making a reservation if available. I highly recommend this place to all Korean food enthusiasts, to all Korean barbecue lovers, or if you just want to try something new. I definitely will be back to tryout the other delicious options they have to offer.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
We were in the mood for Korean BBQ so we stopped by here. We caught them in the busiest time and had to wait a bit.
The meat for the grill is definitely overpriced considering the few options you get and the portion size they give you. All the kimchis are really good and I can say we had a good time.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Overall pretty good. Appreciated the plentiful and diverse bonchan. Kalbi was better than brisket, but what killed me was my special request in a birthday dinner for 6 where the tteokbokki was overcooked and mushy rather than chewy and al dente 😭

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: So far, this place is the best Korean restaurant I have tried. The food was tasty and big amounts. They give complementary sweet rice drinks at the end. I forgot to take pictures of the kimchi soup and the bibimbap.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: When the small 8 complimentary dishes came, they won my heart already. The food is above average compared to the places I’ve visited so far.

top_10.name: um.ma
top_10.address: 1220 9th Ave, San Francisco, CA 94122, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Best Korean food in town! And at a decent price! Highly recommend their bibimbap, corn cheese, dak galbi and kimchee prawns. Most of the seating is at the back of the restaurant, each table sits 4 comfortably. Consider a reservation, especially during weekends. This place gets packed. They also have the BEST side dishes.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: So glad to finally try Um.mas and definitely worth it! The sundubu-jjigae was everything you could want out of a soup on a cold day. It was incredibly fresh and well seasoned, like everything else we had. They had great portion sizes as well for the price. Staff were incredibly polite and the overall vibes of the restaurant were chill and such a relaxing, fun place to be.  I'd definitely go back.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Having been here dozens of times over the years, Um Ma is an acceptable spot for patio Korean food with good vibes, especially on a warm day.

Whether you are in Golden Gate Park or strolling through the sunset, it's conveniently located. Again, the vibes are good and the patio is a plus as it makes it dog friendly. Doesn't really feel like an authentic Korean place and it's a bit like they are trying too hard to be hip but maybe that's what sells. I recommend making reservations as it can get busy during prime time.

The service is ... usually sub par. Even on our best visit, it was still lacking. I want to be charitable and assume they are just severely understaffed. You'll often have a hard time getting a hold of them and even if you do, expect to remind them multiple times for requests. They've made it so you can now order on your phone but for any special requests, it's the same issue.

The food is pricey but a few of the dishes are actually worth it. Haven't visited in a while but apparently now they charge for extra banchan (side dishes)... what? I know times are tough but damn.

While the patio atmosphere is nice and the location is convenient for many, there are better Korean spots even in SF (and much, much better in the Bay in general).

Overall, the place is good but not great and while the atmosphere is lovely, things like the insufficient level of service and the inconsistent quality of the dishes makes it hard to make this a must visit for anyone.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Good service, nice outdoor patio with heaters and delicious food. We got two soups, tteobokki, pork belly and fried chicken wings and it came out to $100 exactly (plus gave tip). We recommend and will be back.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Came here on a weeknight, never had trouble getting a table. The food is good but not great, partially due to the prices to portion ratio.

We ordered teokkboki, LA galbi, beef bulgogi, pork belly, kimchi fried rice, bibimbap. Everything was well cooked. Galbi wasn’t too fatty and was delish, bulgogi was slightly too sweet but still tasty, kimchi fried rice lacked seasoning or taste, bibimbap had a unique western take on it, pork belly was mid.

One disappointing thing - banchan (small side dish) isn’t free flow - it’s just season quails eggs, spiced broccoli, yellow pickled radish and kimchi. It’s disappointing considering these are inexpensive sides even from a restaurant owner perspective.

I’ve dined here on multiple occasions, I’d personally recommend: LA galbi, scallion pancake, soonduboo jjigae, rock n roe rice and charred gai lon.

Service staff were good! We enjoyed our food and service, just oddly underwhelmed by needing to pay for side dishes which are free flow in majority of the Korean joints I’ve been to. It’s not a big deal, just in principle?

Would come again if I’m in the area. Total came to about $50+ per person with tips.

testimonials: Best Korean food in town! And at a decent price! Highly recommend their bibimbap, corn cheese, dak galbi and kimchee prawns. Most of the seating is at the back of the restaurant, each table sits 4 comfortably. Consider a reservation, especially during weekends. This place gets packed. They also have the BEST side dishes.

So glad to finally try Um.mas and definitely worth it! The sundubu-jjigae was everything you could want out of a soup on a cold day. It was incredibly fresh and well seasoned, like everything else we had. They had great portion sizes as well for the price. Staff were incredibly polite and the overall vibes of the restaurant were chill and such a relaxing, fun place to be.  I'd definitely go back.

Having been here dozens of times over the years, Um Ma is an acceptable spot for patio Korean food with good vibes, especially on a warm day.

Whether you are in Golden Gate Park or strolling through the sunset, it's conveniently located. Again, the vibes are good and the patio is a plus as it makes it dog friendly. Doesn't really feel like an authentic Korean place and it's a bit like they are trying too hard to be hip but maybe that's what sells. I recommend making reservations as it can get busy during prime time.

The service is ... usually sub par. Even on our best visit, it was still lacking. I want to be charitable and assume they are just severely understaffed. You'll often have a hard time getting a hold of them and even if you do, expect to remind them multiple times for requests. They've made it so you can now order on your phone but for any special requests, it's the same issue.

The food is pricey but a few of the dishes are actually worth it. Haven't visited in a while but apparently now they charge for extra banchan (side dishes)... what? I know times are tough but damn.

While the patio atmosphere is nice and the location is convenient for many, there are better Korean spots even in SF (and much, much better in the Bay in general).

Overall, the place is good but not great and while the atmosphere is lovely, things like the insufficient level of service and the inconsistent quality of the dishes makes it hard to make this a must visit for anyone.

top_10.name: Seven Hills
top_10.address: 1896 Hyde St, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Had an amazing dinner at this Italian restaurant! Everything tasted incredibly fresh — you can really tell they use high-quality ingredients. We especially loved the prosciutto with melon and the duck liver pâté — both were absolutely perfect. The atmosphere was cozy yet elegant, and our server Derek was great — super friendly and attentive. A truly memorable dining experience. Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I thought everything was perfect. Our waiter was EXCELLENT. We got a bottle of red from Campagna which was reasonably priced and delectable. Our two salads were delicate and refined, and the pasta was firm but tender (how is that possible by the way?) filled with delightful morsels. Nice mixed fruit pie with ice cream to complete. Recommended.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This chef is really imaginative with flavors and textures. A plateful of summer was found in the mozzarella with flamed peaches, cherries, pecans and arugula. The fresh focaccia had great herb flavor. The gem salad with clementines, avocado, and radishes and topped with hazelnut was a really lovely combination. The special was truffle tortellini with the Croatian truffle shaved right at the table and had incredible buttery richness. The budino chocolate dessert was immensely rich and smooth. What a great evening out and such lovely efficient service and beautiful ambience.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This place did not disappoint. I travel to Italy a lot and always come back going ugh why is the food so bad in the US—this was the first prosciutto and melon plate I’ve had that actually reminded me of Florence. The Maccheroncelli was also a stand out  with the house-made ricotta being my favorite part of the dish. Definitely spendy, but I think worth it for the very authentic Italian dishes served. Service was honestly great too which is not something I usually find myself writing. Derek (hope I got that right) is awesome!!! Will definitely be back!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Impressed, simply impressed. My fiance and I were astonished at the experience we had last night. I don't think I've ever left a review for a restaurant before, but I felt compelled after the incredibly attentive and respectful staff served us what is arguably the most deliciously balanced and  well portioned Italian meal we've ever had, at a compelling price point. The focaccia was beautifully baked, with interesting and delicate flavors that gave us an idea of what we had gotten ourselves into. Followed shortly thereafter by absolutely delectable duck liver pate and apricot crostinis. But the stars of the show were definitely the squid ink pasta and the raviolini. They were both superb: light but complex, savory but not too rich, and just enough on the plate to sate your hunger. Bravo!
If you're reading this review and you're debating dinner spots, your choice has been made for you -- choose Seven Hills.

The atmosphere was cozy yet elegant, and our server Derek was great — super friendly and attentive. A truly memorable dining experience. Highly recommend!

top_10.name: Piccolo Forno
top_10.address: 725 Columbus Ave, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: My husband and I ate here on a whim while visiting San Fran and we are so glad we did. The food, the service, and the atmosphere were all perfect. Our server was funny and charismatic and all the food we had was fresh and delicious. We truly enjoyed our experience here and have vowed to come back next time we are in town!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Underwhelming flavors, not a fan.

Service: 10/10 fast and super polite and friendly

Food: taste wasn’t it, entry bread w vinegar had no flavor. The pastas all lacked flavor except the gnocchi one. Tiramisu was nice and fresh we liked it a lot. Pizzas weren’t a favorite.

Overall: wouldn’t come here again, do to the food taste. Otherwise service is so nice.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Quaint Italian spot that we read had amazing pasta.  It didn't disappoint.  Probably less than 20 tables in the restaurant so there was a line on sidewalk when we arrived.  Always a good sign.  Bread served was fresh and so was the pasta.  Went with waiter recommended dishes.  Cannoli for dessert was perfect exclamation point on the meal.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Wow, wow, wow. This is some delicious, fresh Italian. I have had the opportunity to eat here on two different occasions while visiting San Francisco. The first time was with my family and the second with employees. The owner is incredibly friendly and accommodating and yes, he’s an authentic Italian. The lasagna will melt in your mouth and the desserts (especially the panna cotta) is to die for!!! I will be back on my next visit to the beautiful city.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Everything was perfect: good wine, good food and great service. We loved their linguine vongole with the pasta cooked to the right al dente texture and the clams were fresh. We also enjoyed amazing service by their passionate staff. Just be prepared for a queue even on a weekday night.

testimonials: My husband and I ate here on a whim while visiting San Fran and we are so glad we did. The food, the service, and the atmosphere were all perfect. Our server was funny and charismatic and all the food we had was fresh and delicious. We truly enjoyed our experience here and have vowed to come back next time we are in town!

Service: 10/10 fast and super polite and friendly

Food: taste wasn’t it, entry bread w vinegar had no flavor. The pastas all lacked flavor except the gnocchi one. Tiramisu was nice and fresh we liked it a lot. Pizzas weren’t a favorite.

Overall: wouldn’t come here again, do to the food taste. Otherwise service is so nice.

top_10.name: The Italian Homemade Company
top_10.address: 716 Columbus Ave, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I had the best time here with my family & friends. They do use one time use plates but I think it's because they must be extremely busy with serving & cooking. The pasta was so good but my favorite was the lasagna. Do NOT skip out on the lasagna!!! I would definitely go back to eat here again. I loved how welcoming the staff was and the pasta tasted super fresh. Although there were so many branches of this restaurant, I recommend coming here to try it in this area because this place is the place to be! I love walking around this area but make sure to stay vigilant.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Tried the pasta and it was great. We shared and sampled and all agreed this is excellent pasta. Sat outdoors on a un level table but it was still nice. It definitely was crowded.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
This place is amazing, the pasta is phenomenal! Freshly made. You can pick whatever style pasta you want with whatever type of sauce you want. Small menu one sided so you know it’s fresh. Long line but comes out pretty fast and well worth the wait. Seating inside and outside because it is smaller. They even sell their pasta noodles on the shelf and fresh in a fridge. Yummy desserts too.
I wasn’t able to finish all my pasta so I took it home. I don’t know how it could have gotten any better but it did. Thank you to all the gentlemen cooking and running around (you can watch them making your food) and the lady working the register.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: The food at The Italian Homemade Company was tasty and fresh – the pasta had good texture and flavor. However, it didn’t quite live up to the hype. Everything was served on disposable plates, which took away from the overall dining experience. Great for a quick, casual bite, but not ideal if you’re looking for something more memorable or atmospheric.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Daughter took me here for lunch. I got the spinach cheese filled raviolis with browned butter sage sauce. She got tagliatelle with bolognese sauce. Mine was delicious! Hers tasted like a can of chef boyardee ravioli with meat sauce. There aren’t typical refillable drinks to order so you have to buy a single can of soda. Not much seating available.

top_10.name: Bella Trattoria
top_10.address: 3854 Geary Blvd, San Francisco, CA 94118, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Had dinner here with a group of friends on a Friday night and had a great experience. The food and ambiance were both solid, but what really made the evening stand out was our server, Kitty. She was incredibly sweet and attentive, and also gave great recommendations throughout the night. We made a reservation through OpenTable, which made everything easy and seamless. Would definitely come back!

Thank you again Kitty!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: We just had one of the best dining experiences ever at this Italian restaurant! The food was so amazing that we even forgot to take photos. But what truly stood out was the exceptional service. Our server, Kitty, was incredibly warm and friendly. She noticed we weren’t enjoying one of our dishes and promptly replaced it, then surprised us with a delightful panna cotta dessert. It’s rare to find such attentive and thoughtful customer service these days. Thanks to Kitty, our night was truly unforgettable. We’ll definitely be back and highly recommend this place to everyone.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Relaxed feel with an upscale ambiance. The food is delicious!! Highly recommended for a chill night out. They were very accommodating to our last-minute party of 9 celebrating a 21st birthday.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Delicious Italian spot with exceptional staff and a cozy, welcoming ambiance. I loved the pesto pasta—it was fresh, flavorful, and not overly greasy. The bread served with sun-dried tomatoes was absolutely incredible; I’d honestly come back just for that! One star off because my partner didn’t enjoy the burrata pizza—it was more like bread topped with burrata, arugula, and ham, and lacked warmth and sauce. That said, we’re excited to come back and try other pizzas. Overall, great food and outstanding service. Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Great spot for some Italian comfort food.
I got the mushroom gnocchi, and the mushroom polenta (those are not the correct names of the dishes, just my descriptions 😂)
The gluten free gnocchi was delicious and soft, and the sauce was quite rich and flavorful. The polenta was soft and tasty, and the mushrooms and cheese on top were great. I enjoyed the wine sauce on it as well. Overall a bit rich, so I probably should have ordered some salad, but the flavors were fantastic and nothing was lacking. Cute atmosphere, very friendly staff, prompt service, and I just felt right at home there. If you're gluten free and vegetarian or pescetarian, they have some great options! I also love that they are open pretty late, until 11, so I was able to drop by pretty late after my tourist activities.
Highly recommend!

top_10.name: The Italian Homemade Company
top_10.address: 1919 Union St, San Francisco, CA 94123, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: The pasta is very fresh- you can see them making it in the front window! Indoor and outdoor seating options. If you’re a vegetarian, there’s a couple options but very limited… I saw so many good reviews about the gnocchi, I tried that and had it with the marinara sauce - good and my only complaint is it went super quickly and didn’t feel very filling to me.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Delicious food for a reasonable price. Pasta dishes run you just shy of $20 which is definitely well below the San Francisco average. The atmosphere inside is very casual, and has a combination of table and bar seating. The menu allows a choice of pasta with any of their 6-7 sauce options, so lots of customization available. Definitely very good and recommended!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: It was quite, not a lot of people, nice atmosphere, nice customer service. Sandwiches were a little dry, some provided sauces would have been really nice, but we paid 4$ for a small amount of sauce. Tiramisu was so good, the cream was really fluffy and it was really moist. Overall pretty good

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: The food was delicious, as a chef of almost 15 years.  I appreciate a homemade meal. As soon as you walk in, the staff was speaking Italian, a gentleman was working ravioli sheets and you just knew from that point this place was going to be legit and it did not disappoint at all. Found another reason worth coming back to SF and this place is it. Going to try their other locations during my next visit!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
The BLONDE  woman at the register completely ruined our experience. From the very beginning, she was noticeably unfriendly — she interrupted me while I was placing my order and kept rushing me, even though there was only one couple behind us who were still deciding what to get. It felt like she was deliberately speaking fast and harshly just to make it clear we weren’t welcome. It was unpleasant and unnecessary.
Later, she was the one who brought our food. She acted like she didn’t see us and just slammed the plates down on the table. That kind of attitude is unacceptable. I also noticed in the comments that many other people have complained about this same blonde woman — so it’s clearly not a one-time issue. It’s a shame, because the food was genuinely delicious, and the dark-haired guy and girl were really friendly and kind. They created a nice atmosphere, and if it weren’t for the rude behavior of the cashier, our overall impression would have been completely different.

top_10.name: Trattoria Contadina
top_10.address: 1800 Mason St, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: The first time I came here I had an amazing pasta and great service. Came back with a friend for a second time and had a lack-luster experience. The pastas were fine, but nothing close to what it was before. My mom does a better pasta. Their tiramisu was good and the bartender was extremely nice and accommodating to our drink requests. Big props to him! I wish the waiter could learn a thing or two from him.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
My family was visiting from Japan and requested Italian.  We reserved for a party for 7. They were able to accommodate my allergy son and they are also kid friendly.  They gave our girls crayons and menus to color. We shared 2 appetizers and 4 dishes.

Definitely enjoyed our meal and time spent there.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Quality was disappointing. The Caesar salad was drenched in cheap dressing and pre-shredded cheese. The Italian soda was just sparkling water with cheap syrup dumped into it. The pork was overcooked, the pasta was very salty. On top of that the servers were in a rush to turn over our table. I came back from the bathroom with my leftover food in a box already. Bad experience.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Lovely staff and even better pasta. I will absolutely be coming back here - we got the il davioli (8.1/10 and risotto verde(8.7/10). The perfect place for solo date night, couple date night, celebration or honestly anything. Very cozy and friendly atmosphere and genuinely the fastest food service ever. The glass of Chardonnay wasn’t the best I’ve had but it wasn’t the star of the show so that’s ok

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: We both lived in SF 30 years ago and came SF to celebrate our 30th Wedding Anniversary.  We use to go 3 to 4 times a month and the food and service was always outstanding, and I always ordered Pavarotti or #7 as it use to be referred as!  However, this time was very disappointed and I am sure Pablo didn’t make it and one of the sous chefs cooked it for me.   Unlike 30 years ago, the prosciutto and sun-dried tomatoes were barely visible this time, and there was very little flavor.  Such a disappointment with such high expectations! 🙁 Then they brought us an order of tiramisu as a gift to celebrate our 30 anniversary, very nice gesture, however, when I received the bill they charged me for the dessert! Are you kidding me!  Well, no need to come back again!  I have great memories of great food, with great friends, unfortunately not this time! Thanks for the memories!

top_10.name: La Ciccia
top_10.address: 291 30th St, San Francisco, CA 94131, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: For the appetizer, we ordered Inzalaredda de Acciugasa e Arangiu, which paired perfectly with the bread. We also ordered Prupisceddu in Umidu cun Tomatiga, which was incredibly tender. Pasta Cruzza cun Arrizonis for the main course was very authentic, and eating it warm was a delightful experience. Pezza de Angioni a sa Saba was also very tender. The restaurant had a great ambiance, and the service was excellent!!!! ❤️

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
La Ciccia is one of our favorite restaurants in SF. We’ve been coming here a bunch over the past year and took our parents here whenever they are in town

It's a small family style restaurant with a cozy vibe, and the service is always friendly

We've tried pretty much everything on the menu at this point, and our favorite dishes are the roasted calamari, baby octopus stew, and oven roasted prawns. Everything is packed with flavor. This place is perfect if you like a little bit of spice in your dishes

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Quaint bistro in San Francisco Mission area with southern Italian cuisine focus. Food is fresh and there are daily specials to choose from. Reservations are highly recommended as the venue is small and often full and thus you run risk of not finding table if you they are full.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Absolutely delicious from start to finish.
Calamari and sea urchin pasta were amazing as well as the flat bread and the Parma ham.
Amazing gnocchis as well.
Service +++ attentive and really welcoming in a family style restaurant.
We drove 1h30 do eat at la Ciccia and it was worth it!
A gem.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Had the best evening at La Ciccia, and every dish and the wine were all delicious.  Cheryl and team are lovely, very warm and welcoming. Here’s what we ordered:

Starters: calamari, the oven roasted prawns
Mains: pasta special of the day, and the spaghetti spicy olive oil with bottariga

All were so flavorful and complex, will order everything again. Forgot what wine we had but it was recommended by our server.

testimonials: For the appetizer, we ordered Inzalaredda de Acciugasa e Arangiu, which paired perfectly with the bread. We also ordered Prupisceddu in Umidu cun Tomatiga, which was incredibly tender. Pasta Cruzza cun Arrizonis for the main course was very authentic, and eating it warm was a delightful experience. Pezza de Angioni a sa Saba was also very tender. The restaurant had a great ambiance, and the service was excellent!!!! ❤️

top_10.name: Acquerello
top_10.address: NEAR VAN NESS &, 1722 Sacramento St, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I did the 4 course and here are my takeaways:

1. I was worried it wouldn’t be enough food and I would need to get In N Out after.  It was.  The portions are bigger and they add extras.

2. Great way to experience Michelin without doing the full thing.  Experience was 3 hours.

3. Service was 10/10, wine pairing was 9/10, presentation was 10/10, food was 7/10

Overall great experience and worth the steep price. If you are just looking for great food, however, there are much better options in the neighborhood that are half the price.  You are paying for the full experience (atmosphere, service, presentation, etc).

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This was a great location for us to celebrate my wife’s birthday. The service was absolutely unbelievable. Honestly it was so good it almost got annoying. My water glass never was less than 3/4 full and any time you left the table you napkin was refreshed. The food was beautiful and totally different than I had ever experienced. It was good but not like any food I had had before. My only issue was my tuna that I got for my main course was a little over cooked. Definitely a great experience. Also definitely as expensive as I thought it would be. It was easy to walk to from our hotel on union square.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: The Michelin experience for a late night champagne tasting was excellent in terms of service and ambiance. However some of the small appetizers felt as though they’ve been sitting there for quite a while and were very obviously end of the night leftovers as there was a slight fishy and or slight staleness in them. Notably, the caviar and champagne tasted exquisite and the service was impeccable. The personalized touches such that of the letter and birthday dessert certainly added to the experience.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Acquerello was the perfect choice for a birthday celebration! The atmosphere is so elegant, yet still felt welcoming. And oh my goodness, the pasta! It's incredible that they've been serving some of these dishes for 35 years – you can taste the history and perfection in every bite. It was definitely a standout. Combine that with impeccable service and a fantastic wine list, and you've got a truly memorable dining experience. Highly recommend for any special occasion!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I have been to multiple 1, 2, and 3 Michelin star restaurants and I can’t believe this place only has 2 stars. It is a must go for any food lover.
The food was exceptional! The vegetarian substitutions were made with the same, if not more, thoughtfulness. While some aspects were experimental, it was never at the expense of flavor. The pictures do not do the place justice (experience from Oct 2024).
The staff were very friendly and made solo dining a comfortable experience. The pace of dinner was spot on so I didn’t feel rushed nor was I waiting for courses. They explained the complex techniques used to make each dish which was appreciated.

top_10.name: Sotto Mare
top_10.address: 552 Green St, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Second time coming here and the food is still as incredible as the first time trying it!

The cioppino is so flavorful. The seafood tastes very fresh. I love dipping the (complimentary) bread in the sauces/broths as well.

If you love to watch some (cooking) action and are a party of 1 or 2, I highly recommend sitting at the bar. I thoroughly enjoyed eating while watching the chefs do their magic in the open kitchen. They are super efficient, clean, organized, and great at multi-tasking. Super impressive to watch them cook the very food I'm eating!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Great seafood and pasta restaurant! We called 1 day ahead to reserve a spot; it'll be hard to get in without a reservation. The place was very cramped and busy, but from the quality of the food I can see why! Service was okay.

Complimentary bread was tough on its own, but you can dip it in your pasta sauces/soups after you finish and it tastes so good! Oysters and clam chowder was okay. Lobster ravioli wasn't my favorite, but the sauce was great. I would definitely recommend getting the smoked salmon fettuccine because the salty salmon contrasted great with the creamy sauce and pasta! Portion sizes were also surprisingly great and my group of 3 were full from sharing these dishes.

Overall, if you're in the area and craving seafood or pasta, I would definitely recommend checking it out!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Sotto Mare was a recommendation that turned out to be spot on. It was our first time, and definitely not the last.
The place is small, cozy, and full of charm, and the service makes it even better: the entire staff is incredibly kind and welcoming, making you feel right at home.
We ordered the famous “Best Damn Crab Cioppino”, the menu says it’s for two, but honestly, it could feed three easily. The flavor was amazing, the seafood super fresh, and that sauce… perfect for dipping bread until the last drop.
No doubt about it, next time I’m in San Francisco, Sotto Mare will be one of my must-stop spots. Highly recommended!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
The restaurant is quite small and it was busy. At least last night, the best option was to eat at the bar.  From start to finish, everyone there were super friendly and efficient.

We started with a cup of clam chowder and 2 oyster shooters. The oysters were delicious and the chowder was full of clams. Yummy!

After that, we ordered the sand dabs with spinach and steamed mussels. Wow!  Huge portions of delicious food. The sand dabs were sweet and flavored with lemon.  And the mussels while small were excellent too. We went through 2 bread servings to sop up the delicious broth.

We went early and there was a waiting line when we left.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
While in San Francisco, we tried the local specialty, Cioppino, along with a side of risotto. The risotto was truly amazing — I definitely recommend it. However, I didn’t quite understand the Cioppino. It was very mild, and the spices and sauce didn’t fully complement the seafood. I ate it, but honestly, I couldn’t really taste much.
We also had a glass of house white wine, which was good.

For me, I’d rate the meal 4 stars. I’ve had better seafood elsewhere, but it was still a decent experience.

top_10.name: Pazzia Ristorante Italiano
top_10.address: 337 3rd St, San Francisco, CA 94107, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
My boyfriend and I didn’t have a reservation but decided to try our luck walking in on a busy Saturday night. The place was packed and buzzing with energy, but the staff couldn’t have been nicer or more accommodating — they made us feel welcome right away.

The food was incredible. I had the wild king salmon spinach paccheri pasta, which was rich, flavorful, and perfectly cooked. My boyfriend got the sausage pizza — crispy, savory, and loaded with flavor. We also shared the calamari, which was light, crispy, and not at all greasy.

This has quickly become one of my favorite Italian spots in the city. Great vibes, excellent service, and unforgettable food. Can’t wait to come back!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I began with the fritto misto, there’s better in the city at a cheaper price. The margarita pizza was just a glorified cheese pizza with one leaf of basil in the center. I had to ask for more basil. I also had to ask for parm. My next curiosity is the pasta. People I dined with liked the parpadelli and the rigatoni, I don’t eat pork so that’s me passing their experience to you guys in my review. Julia and Carlos were professional and welcoming. 2nd try: the Caesar salad was over dressed and came with 4 croutons and the dressing was underwhelming with no anchovy taste, the worst Caesar salad I’ve ever had. The chicken was overcooked the broccoli was good but everything was oily. The bread was underwhelming too. I got a tiramisu on the house because of the chicken and it was good. Overpriced for what I got though.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Fantastic and cozy atmosphere with quick service and delicious food. The tiramisu was fantastic and I devoured the lasagna! We will be back.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
How can I describe the place with the best gnocchi (after my grandma’s gnocchi) I have ever eaten?
Giulia and her brother are so kind and accommodating!! If I could give you more stars, I would!!
And don’t forget: visit Nannai in Recife ♥️😊

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Was very impressed. Got 2 pizzas and 2 pastas. 1 special and 1 on the list. Also got a bottle wine and a couple spritzes. Overall,  enjoyed the food and the ambiance. Pretty loud in there but it was packed. Had an outdoor area as well. I would go back.

top_10.name: North Beach Gyros
top_10.address: 561 Columbus Ave, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Fantastic warm welcome from stepping in the door. My family were seated immediately and service was so friendly throughout our visit to a lovely Mediterranean jewel in North Beach. Excellent food, very authentic cuisine, just what we wanted as a family on holiday travelling California. So good to dine in a locally owned restaurant and not have processed burgers/American food available. As tourists visiting from the UK would highly recommended. Thanks for the great experience on our last night.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Food was amazing and portions were huge!!! I had chicken wrap and it came with a yogurt sauce which was delicious. Absolutely loved it and will come back if my family is gonna be in San Francisco again. Our waiter, Oscar is incredible, he gave off a great energy and he is extra nice!!!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Dear local people if you live around this gem i recommend you come here. The fresh ingredients you can taste with every BITE. This was delicious and full of flavors. I drove here all the way from mill valley and it was worth the drive. I can’t wait to come back.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Such good experience. Really great food and really great atmosphere. The meat was tender and delicious. Serving sizes were amazing as well and customer service was some of the best I’ve ever seen. Be sure to come here it was a great experience.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I couldn't describe a better Greek place, a staff that is more than happy to make sure their customers are satisfied and happy. Very quality Greek food, personally had the Chicken Gyros, Greek Fries, and the Baklava. It's a top choice for Greek, and it was a great option for dinner.

I was very pleased with the management and ambience, handled with a high level of expertise and professionalism that I find unmatched from other restaurants. I highly recommend this place, and enjoy your time when you visit!

Attached are a few beautiful images of the food I tried.

top_10.name: The Bite
top_10.address: 996 Mission St, San Francisco, CA 94103, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Delicious vegan options (clearly indicated) and friendly service. I ate this gyro so quickly bc of how good it was (see second pic)I’m definitely returning for more😌

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I was invited to lunch at The Bite. I chose the Lamb & Beef wrap and I absolutely enjoyed my meal. The wrap was huge but most importantly fresh tasting. The wrap is served with 3 different sauces and all 3 are delicious. The Bite is in a shady neighborhood but the restaurant is clean and safe. I will be returning.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Some of the best late night food in all of SF! Very tasty and high quality ingredients. Love this place!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Delicious, healthy, and full of flavor! The falafel bowl is my favorite, nutritious with beautiful presentation! Staff is super sweet. One of my top favorite restaurants in San Francisco. Also the limeade is the best. You have to visit The Bite when in SF!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Exceptional lentil soup. Never had a recipe so light and tasty with such an interesting depth of flavor. The Soma salad was also very good.
The area it is in is a little seedy but worth the trip. The restaurant itself is tidy and clean, the wait staff friendly and helpful. I will be back again for more soup and sample more food.

Some of the best late night food in all of SF! Very tasty and high quality ingredients. Love this place!

top_10.name: Kokkari Estiatorio
top_10.address: 200 Jackson St, San Francisco, CA 94111, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This place is elevated, I feel like I wasn’t dressed appropriately. But even so the staff was great, very professional and friendly. Exceptional wine menu. We got a mix appetizer and moussaka. I liked the app, the moussaka was pretty heavy and a bit one note for me. I generally enjoy a more casual place.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
We went with a group of friends and tried several dishes from the menu. First of all, we were served a huge basket of freshly baked sourdough bread with amazing olive oil, such a great start!

We ordered a variety of plates to share, and everything was delicious and generous in portion. Highlights for us were the octopus and the massive branzino, both outstanding.

The service was excellent from beginning to end. A solid 10/10. We’ll definitely be coming back! :)

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Definitely one of the best Greek restaurant in the city of San Francisco! The experience starts with the extraordinary interior design of the rustic vintage farmhouse, vibe filled with energy. There is a giant skewer of kebab oven in the center of the restaurant as well. Service is great, busy lively., the food is absolutely delicious. We got lamb and various veggies. The feta and watermelon salad is surprisingly good. highly recommend.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Most dishes are very good, we had very traditional Greek items such as saganaki, dolmades, octopus (excellent), gigantes, kolokothokeftedes (zucchini cakes). The taramosalata, typical of the Greek mezedes, was disappointing, very flavorless. The kokkinisto with lamb shank excellent. The loukoumades (doughnut balls) were disappointing, not crispy on the outside.
I have cut marks on atmosphere because of two things. Greek hospitality, filoxenia, is famous; it was completely missing. The service was what you would expect at a good restaurant, no more. Simple Greek greetings such as "kalosorizete" (welcome) and "styn iyeia sas" (to your health) after pouring the drinks would have made it more authentic. And the "kerasma" (typically a simple dessert) on the house, so inherent to the Greek culture was completely missing.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
This was the best Greek food I’ve ever had! The food was delicious, and the temperature and atmosphere of the restaurant were perfect.

Our server, Ben, was incredibly kind and professional. His recommendations did not disappoint. The highlights of the meal were the lamb and sea bass—both made with fresh ingredients and had an amazingly tender texture.

Everything came together perfectly. This is definitely a place I’d love to return to when I’m back in San Francisco! 👏🍽️🥂

top_10.name: Presidio Kebab Mediterranean Restaurant
top_10.address: 3277 Sacramento St, San Francisco, CA 94115, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Amazing food and service. We had chicken kebab plate, Turkish breakfast with sausage, lentil soup, chicken wrap, a special appetizer with three different hors d’oeuvres. We also had regular coffee and Turkish coffee which came with a Turkish delight.

It also came with freshly baked pita bread and a hot sauce, best pita bread ever.

The owner and staff are super friendly, warm and welcoming. The seats and tables are very comfortable It has say quiet atmosphere with really beautiful decoration, the restroom is extremely clean too. We have been there many times and is our favorite Turkish/Middle Eastern restaurant!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Excellent food and very friendly service. Big portions, reasonable pricing. Nice atmosphere, background music, low noise if at all. Dinner with family. We'll be back. Highly recommended!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
The food was so delicious and the staff were really friendly.
I made a reservation, but they even gave me a separate welcome drink to keep me waiting a bit.
I will definitely go again.   I like service❤️❤️❤️❤️

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: A charming spot with coastal-inspired decor, delicious Mediterranean food, and incredibly friendly service. We went with the Baba Ghanoush and the Yaprak Doner Kebab - both beautifully plated and packed with stunning flavors. The lamb in the kebab in particular had a rich taste that really stood out. Wish we had room to try more dishes - definitely a gem worth returning to!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: The food was delicious, portions were generous, and everything was cooked to perfection. The atmosphere was cozy and the service was warm and friendly. Definitely a place I’ll return to!

top_10.name: Milos Meze
top_10.address: 3348 Steiner St, San Francisco, CA 94123, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: We just popped in here without a reservation and seated  immediately. Service is top notch even asking if we had any food allergies.  Food is exceptional. Great flavors present with the beef and lamb dish. Octopus 🐙 very tasty and not over grilled. Red hummus a bit spicy but delicious. Give this place a try. I don’t feel you’ll be disappointed.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Had an amazing evening yesterday at Milos Meze with my brothers and a friend! 🥂✨
The appetizers and food were absolutely delicious, and we wrapped it up perfectly with their homemade baklava and other mouthwatering desserts. 🍽️🍯
The cozy tavern vibe and Mediterranean-inspired ambiance made everything even more special.

Big thanks to Chef Ali and his wonderful team for the warm hospitality — you truly deserve every award you’ve earned! 👏👏
Can’t wait to come back! 💙

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: We tried this restaurant on Sunday for dinner and we loved it! The Greek food and wine were delicious! The restaurant is beautiful and the music great! The waiters seemed to be in a hurry because they kept taking our plates, even when we hadn’t finished eating! 🤣 oh and it’s pricy but the dishes are large… will definitely come back again!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Took a friend here for a celebratory dinner. We got the octopus, moussaka, and the lamb souvlaki. Also had a nice bottle of crisp dry Greek white wine. The food was super fresh and bursting with flavor. Will def be back. I live and work in this area and I think this is a great addition to the neighborhood.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
The food was excellent, every dish was full of flavor and the lamb chops were top notch. It is far too loud for me though, that alone is enough to make me cross it off my list. I had to lean in to listen to my husband on the other side of the table...I mean LOUD. So for that alone it's not my bag. The grilled Spanish octopus dish was a bit disappointing as well, size-wise. One small tentacle for the price.

Other than that, great service, delicious food and beautiful interior.

top_10.name: Lokma
top_10.address: 1801 Clement St, San Francisco, CA 94121, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I went here yesterday for an anniversary dinner with my partner and we really liked it overall :)) Our waitress was extremely kind and helpful. The sevice was excellent across the board. The food was also excellent. The chicken was extremely tender and well prepared and the freshness of the ingredients really shines through. I do wish I was able to see/understand Turkish influences a bit more clearly but we really liked this place and will be coming back again.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Reasonable portion sizes — not too much! Grilled chicken was very tender and flavorful but the halibut dish was even better. I would recommend the dips & pita as well; baba ganoush spread was my favorite.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Came in with a party of two for dinner around 6pm on a Monday. We did not make a reservation and were given high top seats by the window. It’s a cozy spot, and I was surprised they were able to seat that many people in that space. Dinner food was okay, all in all more like a 3.5/5 rating, but I was not wowed.

You should double check with the waiter and clarify a few times if you have food allergies. My friend has a dairy allergy and we clarified a few times that meant no butter as well. We shared the calamari which was tasty. The texture of the couscous pearls, nuts, and the calamari was  chewy and fun to eat each bite. My friend ordered the burger and really enjoyed that. As for my braised short rib, it was prepared nicely as I barely had to use my knife. I wish there was a flavorful sauce that it came with to dip the meat and potatoes. It was a solid meal overall but I probably won’t come again for dinner. Perhaps I will check out the brunch as they are known for brunch more.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
f you're looking for an authentic and absolutely delicious Turkish breakfast experience in San Francisco, Lokma is a must-visit!

We ordered their Turkish breakfast spread and everything was fresh, flavorful, and beautifully presented. Each small dish felt thoughtfully prepared from the creamy cheeses and honey to the vibrant olives and fresh fruits. The scrambled eggs with sausage (sucuk) were fluffy and perfectly seasoned, and the warm, fluffy pita slices were the perfect match. Their spinach and cheese börek was a real highlight too flaky, savory, and topped with a light sprinkle of sesame seeds.

The presentation alone is worth mentioning everything came out so colorful and inviting. (See the photos!)

The staff were friendly, attentive, and made the experience even better. The cozy atmosphere and beautiful wooden tables made it feel like a true Turkish home.

Highly recommend Lokma for anyone craving a vibrant and hearty breakfast it's truly one of the best breakfast experiences I've had in the Bay Area!

Favorite bites:

Sucuklu Yumurta (Turkish sausage with scrambled eggs)

Spinach Börek

Homemade jams and olives

Thank you, Lokma team -- can't wait to come back!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
The halibut was DIVINE. Start your course with the hummus and pita. Get the chicken or halibut and end your meal with the baklava with ice cream. You will not be disappointed.

One of my favorite San Francisco spots to eat at, brunch or dinner, especially as the sun sets.

top_10.name: Zitouna
top_10.address: 2435 Clement St, San Francisco, CA 94121, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Cute, vibrant atmosphere with deliciously authentic food! Everything was fresh and well made, just as pictured! The lamb was well spiced and the rice was perfectly cooked. Hummus was exactly like we had in the Middle East, creamy and delightful, served with warm pita. The owners were also super friendly and generous; customer service was on another level. (Pictured are their falafel, lamb kabobs, and combination dip platter.)

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Very good food!  This was a great find for us. We are visiting from out of town and just googled healthy food and found this place. We had 6 of us eat here, all different orders and all of us were extremely pleased with our meal. And the owners are amazingly kind and friendly.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: The food is absolutely amazing! Super fresh, flavorful, and healthy. The staff is very warm and attentive. We ordered family styled and EVERYTHING was excellent! Generous portions, this is my new favorite Mediterranean restaurant!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Beautifully located on a lively street in a great neighborhood, this Mediterranean restaurant stands out with its stylish interior and impressive high ceilings. The decor is tasteful and creates an open, airy atmosphere.

The food is of high quality, fresh, well-prepared, and flavorful. Portions are very generous, which is great value, but can be a bit much if you’re not a big eater or short on time.

Staff were friendly and welcoming, though service could have been a bit quicker. One small drawback: the acoustics. The high ceiling makes it a little tricky to have a soft-spoken conversation.

Still, a solid experience overall, especially if you’re looking to enjoy a slow, relaxed meal.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: St glad I found this place! It just opened in May. Nice, bright, cute vibe. Food is delicious. Excellent service. Will be back again to try out some more items!

testimonials: Cute, vibrant atmosphere with deliciously authentic food! Everything was fresh and well made, just as pictured! The lamb was well spiced and the rice was perfectly cooked. Hummus was exactly like we had in the Middle East, creamy and delightful, served with warm pita. The owners were also super friendly and generous; customer service was on another level. (Pictured are their falafel, lamb kabobs, and combination dip platter.)

Very good food!  This was a great find for us. We are visiting from out of town and just googled healthy food and found this place. We had 6 of us eat here, all different orders and all of us were extremely pleased with our meal. And the owners are amazingly kind and friendly.

The food is absolutely amazing! Super fresh, flavorful, and healthy. The staff is very warm and attentive. We ordered family styled and EVERYTHING was excellent! Generous portions, this is my new favorite Mediterranean restaurant!

top_10.name: Ricco Mediterranean
top_10.address: 3145 Fillmore St, San Francisco, CA 94123, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Fantastic halal Mediterranean restaurant! The lamb shank was amazing! Everything else we tried was delicious as well. Fast, friendly service. Seated immediately for lunch on a Sunday. Accommodating to young children. Highly recommended!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
With my wife being Lebanese we have tried Mediterranean and the like types of food all across the world and I'd have to say that this experience as we were traveling to the Bay Area certainly was disappointing.
The grape leaves AKA dolmas had lemon and honey drizzled over them - that was a first. The falafel wrap seemed kind of spicy, but not a flavor spice more of an ingredient spice, couldn't make out what that was. The hummus came with a giant tortilla instead of actual pita. The salad didn't have any dressing, and the kibbe seem more like a kabob that actual baked kibbe itself. The tzatziki as a side cost $8 which for just wanting a little bit of a side sauce seem like a little excessive. We didn't get any utensils with our order and it was stapled together by the restaurant before our driver delivered it to us.
For a restaurant with such a high rating and the high prices  I don't know if they were having an off day or if they cater to dine-in customers more so than delivery but I certainly would not go back again.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Exceptionally nice food, high quality service. The marinated chicken kebab was one of the nicest I’ve tasted, succulent and moist and the basmati rice was cooked to perfect, very many thanks for making my dining experience so nice.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Had the Caesar salad with lamb. Also had Salmon dish with whipped potatoes and vegetables. Good portion sizes. Very tasty and flavorful. Nice location. Highly recommend.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: In such a lively neighborhood with so many flashy places around, Ricco feels like treasure hidden in plain sight. I must have walked by a dozen times and I feel like a complete fool for not giving them a shot sooner. The food is phenomenal. First off, the dolma was the best I’ve ever had in my life. Seems simple, rice wrapped in grape leaves, right? But it was exceptional. The lamb kebab was delicious, the veggies were buttery and garlicky and perfectly cooked, the rice was flavorful, and that whole roasted tomato was like a nostalgia bomb that brought me back to my childhood. The restaurant itself is really nice too (they don’t always have little skeleton farmers atop the bar but hey it’s Halloween), and the staff is attentive and friendly. Stop scrolling around trying to figure out what you want to eat tonight. You found it, this is it.

top_10.name: Bistro Mediterraneo
top_10.address: 2955 Clement St, San Francisco, CA 94121, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

Absolutely delicious food and a truly special spot! Everything is freshly made by the owner, who prepares each dish with care and attention - it really shows in the flavor. We eat here regularly because the quality is consistently outstanding.

The Mediterranean plate, loaded with fresh vegetables, creamy yogurt, and perfectly cooked rice, is a standout. Also, the falafel and rice pudding for dessert is amazing.

If you’re looking for a healthy, flavorful, and homemade meal, this place is a must-try. 10/10—highly recommend! 🙌

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: The food was absolutely amazing, I really enjoyed it! You don’t often come across Mediterranean cuisine this delicious. I especially recommend trying the desserts — they’re full of nuts and have such a perfectly balanced flavor. For anyone with a sweet tooth, this will be a 100% hit.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Unbelievable food with such low prices. The zaatar bread was freshly made, the lentil soup was incredible, the dolma were so flavorful, and the mutabbal was my favorite. This is such a humble restaurant with incredible fresh food. I’d go out of my way to go back.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I was totally mistaken by the name and all the positive reviews.  Once I got there, I was disappointed at the atmosphere but wanted to give it a try.  That was a mistake.  We ordered lentil soup and a plate of gyros.  As we were waiting for food, I noticed that the kitchen was almost missing.  I am not even sure if there is any burner or any proper cooking equipment. That is not a good sign!  The food came out quickly, probably because there is no cooking done in the back.  The lentil soup was very sour (too much lemon?) and lacked flavor.    I feel like nothing is fresh there.
They should change the name to something that represents "Turkish shop selling food/snacks." There is nothing close to a bistro.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Great food and service. I recommend the desserts, especially the ones with the ice cream (out of this world). The place is small, but very clean and cozy.

testimonials:
⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

top_10.name: Ararat Kebab & Gyros
top_10.address: 612 O'Farrell St, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
First time here today and it was pretty good. Got a kofte kebab wrap which was $15. Pretty tender and seasoned well. Nice hummus and garlic sauce. Service was good too, chill waiter/owner.

Want to give it 5 stars but felt like the size was kind of small for $15. And it was good but not mind blowing. I’ll come back to try more of the menu though.

Also this place is in a pretty rough part of town so be a bit careful if you come here in person.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This food was so good! 🤤 great portions good quality and very home like feeling place , the desserts are to die for! I definitely recommend this place and is added to my favorite places to eat in SF.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I moved to the Bay Area from Armenia in 2023, and this is the closest to Armenian food I've found so far.

Delicious food, and the Kurdish people running the place were quite nice to me.

I don't speak their language, but I still felt welcome and will be returning for the great food + similar music and atmosphere.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Very delicious meal at this restaurant I highly recommend

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Mashallah amazing food friendly workers and complementary çay just like in turkey. I ordered the Iskender which is difficult to find here in the bay area. The Doner is amazing since it is sliced beef from the spit not just minced meat like many places do. Price is reasonable for portions and for quality. Its the tenderloin so the outdoor seating is the only thing I would avoid.
