top_10.name: Scoma's Restaurant
top_10.address: 1965 Al Scoma Way, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Tried Scomas’s when I was in San Francisco. Restaurant is near the waterfront and is busy most of the time. Reservation is recommended. Food taste and quality is good. Staffs are courteous and service was quick. Ordered the fish and chips, crab cake, and salmon. Taste is good and quantity is good. Price is on the higher side since the food is fresh and  restaurant is located in a busy area.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: The service was excellent. The server was personable and knowledgeable about the menu, including the wine. The three of us really enjoyed our meals. There was nothing that I didn’t enjoy. I had the pacific snapper. It was “omg” delicious. This is definitely a place that I would frequent if I lived in the area.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Amazing food here!
Cioppino was great as expected, but the shrimp & scallop was unexpectedly so delightful to eat! It had very nice taste of lemon and butter, and cooked very well so the texture of each ingredients were nice.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This historic waterfront restaurant provided a  seafood extravaganza with fish so fresh it tasted like it just jumped out the water and onto our plates! Loved the chowder, oysters (Scoma style), anchovies, lazy man's ciopinno and fish and chips.  Eat here for lunch and then go visit the sea lions for a perfect day!  🎣🐟😋🍻👍🏼🙏🏼

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
A blast from the past! Scoma’s started in 1965 and has remained the same since then. From the decor to the waiters in white uniforms. A precious time capsule in the modern world.

The waiter was oozing old world charm, smooth and professional. Drinks before ordering food. Sourdough bread basket only comes out after the menu has been taken away…. He’s been working there for a long time!

Bloody Mary was delicious. Well blended with the house mix. Old school style with the celery stick in a tall glass. Very drinkable.

Sourdough bread was soft with a crust. Perfect for a clam chowder and to scoop up the chunks of clams. Once again, delicious. There’s no outstanding taste, no jarring texture. Not too salty, no overpowering clam taste nor anything outstanding.

Caesar salad was good. The romaine was fresh and crispy, tossed in classic dressing with just enough cheese. A no frills salad that lets the ingredients shine. Good!

Crab cakes were also good. They were juicy, tasty and didn’t taste of breadcrumbs or any other ingredients used. Cakes were very fresh and were not overcooked. There’s over powering crab taste which is nice.

Crab Louie Salad had a mountain of crab on it. It was as fresh as it can get. Once again, there’s no overwhelming “seafood “ smell which is good.

Go for the old world charm. The fresh seafood. The waterfront and surroundings. Leave the modern world behind for an hour or two. Nice experience.

testimonials: Tried Scomas’s when I was in San Francisco. Restaurant is near the waterfront and is busy most of the time. Reservation is recommended. Food taste and quality is good. Staffs are courteous and service was quick. Ordered the fish and chips, crab cake, and salmon. Taste is good and quantity is good. Price is on the higher side since the food is fresh and  restaurant is located in a busy area.

top_10.name: Sotto Mare
top_10.address: 552 Green St, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Second time coming here and the food is still as incredible as the first time trying it!

The cioppino is so flavorful. The seafood tastes very fresh. I love dipping the (complimentary) bread in the sauces/broths as well.

If you love to watch some (cooking) action and are a party of 1 or 2, I highly recommend sitting at the bar. I thoroughly enjoyed eating while watching the chefs do their magic in the open kitchen. They are super efficient, clean, organized, and great at multi-tasking. Super impressive to watch them cook the very food I'm eating!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Great seafood and pasta restaurant! We called 1 day ahead to reserve a spot; it'll be hard to get in without a reservation. The place was very cramped and busy, but from the quality of the food I can see why! Service was okay.

Complimentary bread was tough on its own, but you can dip it in your pasta sauces/soups after you finish and it tastes so good! Oysters and clam chowder was okay. Lobster ravioli wasn't my favorite, but the sauce was great. I would definitely recommend getting the smoked salmon fettuccine because the salty salmon contrasted great with the creamy sauce and pasta! Portion sizes were also surprisingly great and my group of 3 were full from sharing these dishes.

Overall, if you're in the area and craving seafood or pasta, I would definitely recommend checking it out!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Sotto Mare was a recommendation that turned out to be spot on. It was our first time, and definitely not the last.
The place is small, cozy, and full of charm, and the service makes it even better: the entire staff is incredibly kind and welcoming, making you feel right at home.
We ordered the famous “Best Damn Crab Cioppino”, the menu says it’s for two, but honestly, it could feed three easily. The flavor was amazing, the seafood super fresh, and that sauce… perfect for dipping bread until the last drop.
No doubt about it, next time I’m in San Francisco, Sotto Mare will be one of my must-stop spots. Highly recommended!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
The restaurant is quite small and it was busy. At least last night, the best option was to eat at the bar.  From start to finish, everyone there were super friendly and efficient.

We started with a cup of clam chowder and 2 oyster shooters. The oysters were delicious and the chowder was full of clams. Yummy!

After that, we ordered the sand dabs with spinach and steamed mussels. Wow!  Huge portions of delicious food. The sand dabs were sweet and flavored with lemon.  And the mussels while small were excellent too. We went through 2 bread servings to sop up the delicious broth.

We went early and there was a waiting line when we left.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
While in San Francisco, we tried the local specialty, Cioppino, along with a side of risotto. The risotto was truly amazing — I definitely recommend it. However, I didn’t quite understand the Cioppino. It was very mild, and the spices and sauce didn’t fully complement the seafood. I ate it, but honestly, I couldn’t really taste much.
We also had a glass of house white wine, which was good.

For me, I’d rate the meal 4 stars. I’ve had better seafood elsewhere, but it was still a decent experience.

top_10.name: Hog Island Oyster Co.
top_10.address: Ferry Building, #11, San Francisco, CA 94111, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Had a fabulous light dinner after arriving from the UK. Sat at the counter as a lone businessman but, the staff were chatty, friendly  and polite. All the fish was very fresh, presented well and cooked just right. The green leaves salad was large for one but fresh and well dressed. All washed down with a couple of glasses of Riesling which complemented everything. It appeared hugely popular which is always a good sign but as you can't reserve a table allow plenty of time as there is only a queue system. I only had to wait about 10 minutes on a Saturday at 19:30. Well worth a visit.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: We got there at 11 and by 12 it was packed – definitely a popular spot! Great place to enjoy fresh oysters. We ordered a variety and could really taste the difference. Also had some clams, which were delicious. Staff was super friendly and service was fast. We were two people and paid around $50 each for 12 oysters, 4 grilled oysters, 4 clams, and beers. I’ll definitely be back! We sat in the bar part and loved to see how they opened the oysters.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Hog Island Oyster Co is a must-visit in San Francisco! We started with the sweetwater oysters, and they were some of the freshest, cleanest, and most flavorful I’ve ever had, absolutely perfect. The fish and chips were golden, crispy, and not greasy at all, with tender fish that melted in your mouth. And the clam chowder? Honestly, it might be the best I’ve ever had. Rich, creamy, loaded with clams, and perfectly balanced.

Service was friendly and efficient, the atmosphere was lively without being overwhelming, and the views of the Bay make it even better. This place nails it on every level. Can’t wait to come back!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Right near the ferry landing on the water side of San Francisco’s Ferry Building, Hog Oyster Island Co. offers an easygoing spot to enjoy fresh seafood.

The rustic seafood stew was warm and flavorful, packed with a mix of seafood in a rich tomato broth, plus some good bread to soak it up. The shrimp po’ boy came on a soft brioche bun—crispy shrimp, tangy sauce, and a nice balance of textures. The grilled oysters with garlic butter and Cajun spice were smoky and rich, with just the right kick.

Our server—whose name we didn’t catch—was friendly, quick, and clearly knew the place well. He mentioned he’s been with the restaurant for over 10 years, and it showed in how smoothly everything ran.

Simple menu, great views, and a comfortable setting make it a solid stop if you’re in the area.

Pro tip: parking near the Ferry Building can be tricky. Try downloading the SpotHero app to snag inexpensive parking nearby—it saved us a lot of time and hassle. I paid $10.75 ! Yes, $10.75 for garage parking for 12 hrs but no in and out privileges.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This spot is such a treat with great food and fantastic service. I always try to do at least one meal here with friends from out of town because it's such a great view, great local cuisine (even the Atlantic oysters are harvested as babies from Massachusetts and then grown here in California and great staff. Couple small things to know - your whole party need to be there to be seated and like all Ferry Building restaurants bathrooms are inside the building not the restaurant.

top_10.name: Betty Lou's Seafood & Grill
top_10.address: 318 Columbus Ave, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: On a seafood recommendation by a resident my wife and I had a wonderful experience here. We were visiting The City for her birthday, having lived here many years ago. So many choices for good seafood, but we will surely go here again when we return.  My wife had the seafood linguine in tomato cream and I the cioppino. Mine had 1/2 a crab and was so large I thought it was for two. I ate it all! Thankfully, they had bibs. This cioppino is finger food and will decorate the tablecloth, napkins and you! So good! We both finished our plates, which is rare these days. The staff were attentive, suggestions spot on and the owner was very nice, sharing stories of his life and career. Thank you Hector and all the staff. Looking forward to our next meal!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I like the eclectic decor. Sometimes breezy if someone leaves one of the doors open. Cioppino is definitely the way to go. I liked the large shrimp and scallops especially. Risotto was okay but a little under for the rice. Seafood was fresh. Bread was good. I could see why they charge for additional

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
**A Solid Seafood Experience at Betty Lou’s Seafood Grill**

Betty Lou’s Seafood Grill offers a **pleasant dining experience in the heart of San Francisco**, delivering fresh seafood with thoughtful preparation. While the **clam chowder was thinner** than expected, it still carried a decent flavor that complemented the meal.

The highlight of the evening was the **large prawns in butter sauce**, an entrée that truly stood out. The prawns were **perfectly cooked** and paired beautifully with the accompanying potatoes, creating a rich and satisfying dish.

Service was **decent** throughout our visit—not extraordinary, but efficient enough to ensure a smooth meal.

Overall, Betty Lou’s is a **good seafood restaurant**, providing enjoyable flavors without going over the top. If you’re looking for a casual spot with well-prepared seafood, it’s certainly worth considering.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Wonderful clam chowder with plenty ingredients. Flavors is well seasoned. Oyster is ok and fresh. Creamy pasta is in good quality.
Service is nice. I arrived early lunch time. Plenty of seats available

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Who’s the best? Betty Lou’s Seafood & Grill is the best. Exquisite in all respects, a deliciously tasteful  menu and wonderful staff who are very kind and attentive to the details. Thank you for always being consistently above and beyond excellent.

top_10.name: Hook Fish Co
top_10.address: 4542 Irving St, San Francisco, CA 94122, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Hook Fish was at the top of my San Francisco food list, and it absolutely lived up to the hype—we ended up going twice in 48 hours! The fish and chips were perfect, the fish sandwich was next-level, and the fish tacos? Unreal. We also grabbed the chips and guac, which were simple but insanely fresh, and I’m still thinking about their French fries!

The staff was super friendly, and the whole vibe just feels like pure coastal California with a little San Francisco twist. You might have to wait for a table or eat along the perimeter outside, but trust me—it’s worth it. When I say fresh, I mean fresh… we literally walked up as someone was unloading fish straight out of a pickup. Couldn’t recommend this place more! If you miss this place, you’ll regret it.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Came on a Sunday around 5 pm for a snack. Ordered the 3 piece fish and chips $22. Fish was rockfish. Medium sized pieces. Batter was light and crispy, not excessively oily, very good overall. Fries were decent, maybe half were soggy, generous portion. They also sell sandwiches, oysters, fresh seafood to take home, wine and beer on tap, etc. Self serve water is provided. It's an order at the counter and seat yourself type of place. Outdoor seating only. It may be hard to find a table since they are usually quite busy. Only 1 restroom so plan ahead

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Hook Fish is an absolute gem. I’m not sure what drove some of these reviewers to be so critical of delicious seafood but maybe they’ll work that out in therapy at some point. Will there be a line? Yes, probably, but it moves pretty fast, and they’re going to give you a little fob that will vibrate when your order is ready, so all you’ll have to do is hang out , have a drink maybe, and enjoy some conversation with friends, or perhaps strangers that are also fresh fish enthusiasts. The poke burrito is as outstanding as it is gigantic. Make sure you try some of that tasty carrot hot sauce they’ve got hanging around too (pro-tip: shake the bottle up first).

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I stumbled upon Hook Fish while perusing social media. A few IG reels with some Hook Fish eats showed up on my feed. I thought lets give it a shot, since we're headed to the city anyways, more specifically to the Dutch Windmill area of Golden Gate Park.

We placed our order at Hook Fish around 1:15 PM on a Sunday afternoon. Nothing elaborate or excessive. We were told to expect a 40 minute wait! Well...it was a bit arduous to back out now, considering we parked three blocks away and walked about 10 minutes, then waited another 10 minutes in line to order. Speaking off...Hook Fish is basically in the middle of the neighborhood, so parking it very challenging. The venue is tiny, no room inside to sit down, it does have an open kitchen where you can see your feed being made. There is a small restroom inside and there is some compact outdoor seating right outside the venue.

#HookFish:
~ Fish and Chips - 4/5
Your standard Fish and Chips with seasoned fries. Beer battered with housemade tartar sauce. Good, but not amazing or to die for...

~ Tacos - 4/5
Good Fish Tacos with plenty of things going on... -`Avocado, pico de gallo, pickled slaw, spicy aioli in housemade corn tortillas (order of 2)

~ HABAÑERO CARROT - 5/5
It's all about the Sauce!! This stuff is brilliant! Not too Spicy with a very unique flavor profile. DELISH!!

Hook Fish is good, just not not worth a 40 minute to hour plus wait...
There are plenty of similar options available.

I'd stop by again if the wait wasn't terrible, but I don't fell like missed out on anything if I didn't make it out to Hook Fish...

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Held out on trying this place for too long. The poke burrito is the best I’ve ever had, and it’s HUGE! Worth every penny. The chips and guacamole were also very good.

Have yet to try the fish and chips or the fish tacos, which I hear are excellent. Excited to come back. FYI there’s only outdoor seating, and not too much of it so be prepared and dress appropriately.

testimonials:
Hook Fish was at the top of my San Francisco food list, and it absolutely lived up to the hype—we ended up going twice in 48 hours! The fish and chips were perfect, the fish sandwich was next-level, and the fish tacos? Unreal. We also grabbed the chips and guac, which were simple but insanely fresh, and I’m still thinking about their French fries!

The staff was super friendly, and the whole vibe just feels like pure coastal California with a little San Francisco twist. You might have to wait for a table or eat along the perimeter outside, but trust me—it’s worth it. When I say fresh, I mean fresh… we literally walked up as someone was unloading fish straight out of a pickup. Couldn’t recommend this place more! If you miss this place, you’ll regret it.

Came on a Sunday around 5 pm for a snack. Ordered the 3 piece fish and chips $22. Fish was rockfish. Medium sized pieces. Batter was light and crispy, not excessively oily, very good overall. Fries were decent, maybe half were soggy, generous portion. They also sell sandwiches, oysters, fresh seafood to take home, wine and beer on tap, etc. Self serve water is provided. It's an order at the counter and seat yourself type of place. Outdoor seating only. It may be hard to find a table since they are usually quite busy. Only 1 restroom so plan ahead

Hook Fish is an absolute gem. I’m not sure what drove some of these reviewers to be so critical of delicious seafood but maybe they’ll work that out in therapy at some point. Will there be a line? Yes, probably, but it moves pretty fast, and they’re going to give you a little fob that will vibrate when your order is ready, so all you’ll have to do is hang out , have a drink maybe, and enjoy some conversation with friends, or perhaps strangers that are also fresh fish enthusiasts. The poke burrito is as outstanding as it is gigantic. Make sure you try some of that tasty carrot hot sauce they’ve got hanging around too (pro-tip: shake the bottle up first).

top_10.name: Swan Oyster Depot
top_10.address: 1517 Polk St, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
This is one of those places you must try when you’re in the Bay Area. The food is amazing, and yes, the line is usually at least 30 minutes to an hour, but it’s worth it.

We’ve been here many times, but yesterday we had a disappointing experience. We arrived at around 1:30 PM, and the restaurant closes at 2:30 PM. After waiting in line for almost an hour, right before it was our turn, they told everyone still in line that anyone not seated by 2:30 could only order takeout.

The problem is that they don’t have a website, and this rule isn’t posted anywhere. It would be helpful if they could either stop the line at a certain point or let people know earlier that dine-in may no longer be available. It was frustrating to wait that long and not be able to sit down and eat, especially since many people don’t live nearby and can’t easily come back.

Maybe they could hand out numbered tickets once they know how many guests they can still seat. That way, people at the end of the line won’t waste time standing there for nothing. Just a simple system like that would really help manage expectations.

That said, the food is still excellent. The crab back is one of my absolute favorites, and the sashimi is super fresh.

Overall, still a five-star meal, but I hope they can improve the way they handle the end-of-day rush.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Cash-only spot that is generous with high quality seafood at actually very good prices. Counter seating with all the fixings ready for you. Oysters are a must, and I’d add the combination cocktail to the list as well. Everything else can be to your preference but I fancied the smoked salmon. Was easy to get seated as a solo diner.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This place is it. I waited for little bit in line and chatted with my new friend Donn about vintage cinema and seafood. What a cool guy. We sat together and enjoyed the best seafood I’ve ever had. That’s not an exaggeration, it was an incredible experience and fresh as can be. We had a couple Crab Louie salads and oysters. Highly recommend this place and the staff were the absolute best! Great energy and so knowledgeable paired with a love for what they do. You’ll love it and make sure to bring cash!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
The clam chowder here is absolutely the very best there is in SF! Perfect with bread. The Dungeness crab is wonderfully sweet. Try the octopus salad too, it’s lovely.
Be prepared to wait. We waited for slightly over an hour to get seats for 5 pax. But it’s well worth the wait. Come early to avoid disappointment.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Nice atmosphere and good food. But when I wait one hour + and spend 100$ I expect something more elevated in quality and service. All together a nice experience but I would say its not worth the hype.

top_10.name: Fog Harbor Fish House
top_10.address: 39 Pier, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
We were in town for business and decided to give Fog Harbor a try… we were not disappointed!  To start off, our servers Alex and Dom were amazing.  Friendly, knowledgeable, and efficient.

Because I had to, I tried their clam chowder. It was good, one of the better chowders I have had.

We had the red chili garlic shrimp as an appetizer, and it was fantastic… I’ll warn you, ask for more bread because you don’t want t to waste that amazing sauce!

For our mains, I had the cioppino. It was good, though after the garlic shrimp I found myself wishing it had more spice.

My honey had the crab ravioli, it was great, with a wonderful sauce. Be ready, there is a mound of crab on top, so go hungry.

Overall, a great experience, you definitely need to give this place a try.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
What an incredible dining experience! We were seated by a window with a breathtaking view of the ocean, made even more special by the sight of sea lions playing in the water.

The service was top-notch from start to finish. A special thank you to our server, David Q, who made our meal truly memorable. He patiently answered our questions about the menu, timed each course perfectly so we could savor our food without feeling rushed or crowded, and even validated our parking.

Everything we ordered was delicious, from the clam chowder and mussel fries to the main courses. The calamari was perfectly soft, and both the swordfish and salmon were cooked to absolute perfection. Don't miss out on their Golden Sunset and Strawberry Lemonade, either. A fantastic meal in an unbeatable location!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
It’s not often you experience 5 🌟 service, 5 🌟 food, and 5 🌟 ambiance! This is it!

We came here for our last meal in town, solely based on the sheer volume of amazing reviews! Glad we did.

The wait was only a few minutes and they sat us with a window view. Our server (Luis) was amazing the entire time. Friendly, helpful, funny and personable. You can’t ask for anymore.

The food came out in a very timely manner and the presentation on every dish was impeccable! The taste matched how good they looked. The scallops were perfectly cooked as was the seafood in both of our risottos. Even the bread is fresh and so tasty!

Loved this place and the reviews accurately reflect a fine dining experience but casual at the same time.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Unreal! The food was delicious, the service phenomenal.
David took wonderful care of us! We were simply amazed how he pulled us into such a magical experience. He really brings it all together here.

Photos:
First the crab cakes for an appetizer- crispy and moist
The clam chowder bowl, tasty and creamy.
David took a fantastic photo of us
And lastly our view as he had lunch (you can see Alcatraz from your table)

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
It’s a very nice place. Our Server is a very kind gentleman.  We ordered swordfish and mixed grill and crab cakes.

The price looks decent. It might be my taste is a bit heavy so I felt both main entries may need to put more salt.

top_10.name: La Mar Cocina Peruana San Francisco
top_10.address: 1 1/2 Ferry Plaza, San Francisco, CA 94111, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
The views and vibes are spectacular! Located really close to the Giants stadium and it’s right by the bay so it’s a gorgeous view. Make sure to bring a jacket or layer. They have heating lamps but it still gets a little chilly. The atmosphere is stunning, especially if you go on a clear day and can see the bay or the sunset. The interior is beautiful as well!

The hostess provided friendly and accommodating service. It is a fine dining restaurant and therefore perhaps not the most authentic or traditional, but the chefs here do an amazing job. We loved the vibe, the view and the food!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I cannot say enough amazing things about La Mar. Everything about the setting, service and food is perfect. We were lucky enough to have our small wedding ceremony and reception lunch in the City Room. Velvet, our events manager, was so kind and communicative throughout the entire process, and helped us build out the intimate event of our dreams! We've also had the pleasure of dining at La Mar on our own and have had wonderful experiences. The restaurant has several unique sections to meet the vibe you're looking for, and my favorite is the patio overlooking the water. It's so special to enjoy great food with a beautiful view of the bay. The cocktails, appetizers, entrees, and desserts are all incredible - whether you are looking for a nice meal out, cool bar, or even a special event...La Mar is the best!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
This spot had been on my list for a while — and overall, it didn’t disappoint. The decor is stunning, and while you don’t get direct water views, it’s right by the bay so you can enjoy a nice post-meal walk.

Drinks were just okay taste-wise, but beautifully presented. The food was solid, and the service was warm and friendly throughout.

Only downside? The parking. It’s a headache and definitely made the experience a bit less smooth. I’d come back, but probably not during peak hours.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: We chose this restaurant to celebrate my anniversary, and it did not disappoint. The place is beautiful, with the option to dine inside or out on the patio. The staff was wonderful..and I really liked their uniforms. The food was both delicious and beautifully presented, and the service was excellent with everything arriving right on time. The bartender crafted some fantastic cocktails, and the complimentary dessert was a thoughtful touch that I truly appreciated.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Food was amazing however the service has room to improve:

1. We were one of the few who arrived at restaurant open and we made reservation ahead of time, we would want patio outdoor seating. The waitress led us to a table as far as possible from water front, and told us that that was our table. Meanwhile at least ten group of other guests got seated as close as they could get to water front. Waitress didn’t ask us about preference or anything, I feel we got  judged based on our appearance.

2. Through out the two hour dinning, our waiter never ever spared us a smile, even under the circumstances that our baby tried very hard to stare and smile at him multiple times. He got this attitude like it was our honor to be served by him. In the end we leave him 18% tip (because we were not so happy), he even greeted us goodbye with a strict face.
We were happy with all other people in the restaurant, especially one lady who helped clean our table, she smiled a lot.

Of course service doesn’t have a perfect measurement, but as customers, we did feel we deserved to be treated better.

top_10.name: Waterbar Restaurant
top_10.address: 399 The Embarcadero, San Francisco, CA 94105, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: We went to their happy hour for the $1.55 oyster. We ordered a dozen first to try if the oysters are fresh. YES. They are so fresh and tasty, so we ordered another dozen. The location is very good, you can see the bay bridge from the window. The aquarium in the restaurant is a plus. We also had reservation for dinner, they transferred us to dining tables with breathtaking views. We tried their   Seared tuna, beef and lamb. The food was very tasty, but personally I like lamb chops better. The service was excellent. We will definitely come back.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Some of the best food in SF. The best oysters were amazing and branzino soft and buttery. First time having squab. Amazing first experience. It was tender and flavorful. The star of the show was the pork chop. I immediately asked our waiter how it was made - it was that good. Tender, nice crust, perfectly seasoned. Just yum! Also, can end this review without shouting out our waiter. Her was so knowledgeable about every dish, gave us great recommendations and just had great conversation overall.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
We had dinner here on a special occasion and were delighted with the entire experience.
We had drinks and oyster starters and trout and lamb dishes as entrees. All items were well prepared and tasteful!
The service was very courteous, friendly and efficient. In fact I had a query about the origin of the Trout Fish and it was explained very informatively by our steward.
All in all we had a delightful dining experience!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Really enjoyed a happy hour snack here on the way from the airport. Highlight and what I’d go back for was the drinks and the oysters. The seafood bisque was rich and tasted of the sea but the crab cakes were pretty standard fried bar fare. The oysters and in particular the price on the oysters made this a bargain in what is otherwise a very posh space with great service. We were looking for seafood with a great view of the water and this delivered.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I just love this place. It’s super special. The staff is knowledgeable and helpful— especially if anyone in your party doesn’t know oysters well, they’re trained in knowing the differences and making oyster recommendations. Anytime someone comes to visit me in San Francisco, I take them here. It’s such a special experience… The patio is my favorite during the day. The bar is nice for happy hour and the dining room is lovely for a more upscale intimate dinner. Highly recommend!

top_10.name: Tadich Grill
top_10.address: 240 California St, San Francisco, CA 94111, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
We had an amazing dinner at Tadich Grill, our server James made sure we had everything we needed and gave us good recommendations, the Tadich platter is a must try.

Something we really appreciate is we never felt rushed as you are in other restaurants in the city, so we could really take our time and enjoy our dinner. We’ll be back soon.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Tadich grill found it on Google. Wanted to check out the oldest restaurant in California able to walk in on a Saturday night about six got a table in 10 minutes. The atmosphere and ambience is unique and a great experience. Service is very good. We ordered a fire grilled halibut steak and prime rib. The food unfortunately was just OK. I will give props to the cheesecake. Excellent slice.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Tadich Grill, located in the heart of San Francisco, is a legendary dining destination renowned for its rich history and exceptional seafood offerings. Since opening in 1849, this historic establishment has maintained its reputation as a premier spot for classic fish dishes, combining tradition with quality.

One of the standout features of Tadich Grill is its commitment to fresh, locally sourced ingredients. Their signature dishes, such as the grilled salmon and blackened swordfish, are expertly prepared, showcasing the natural flavors of the ocean. The fish is always perfectly cooked—flaky, tender, and seasoned just right—highlighting the chef’s mastery and attention to detail. The citrus-marinated halibut and the New England-style clam chowder are also must-tries that exemplify the restaurant’s dedication to authentic, hearty flavors.

The ambiance at Tadich Grill adds to the overall experience. Its vintage decor and bustling, yet cozy, atmosphere evoke a sense of timelessness, making every visit feel special. The attentive service further enhances the dining experience, ensuring guests feel valued and well cared for.

Whether you’re a seafood aficionado or simply seeking a memorable meal, Tadich Grill’s fish dishes do not disappoint. They blend freshness, skill, and tradition in every bite, making it a top choice for anyone craving high-quality, flavorful seafood in a historic setting. Overall, Tadich Grill is a culinary gem that consistently delivers unforgettable fish dishes worth savoring.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Had a great meal at Tadish Grill! The oysters were fresh, the cocktails were top-notch, and both the grilled dishes and pasta were really tasty. Everything was well-seasoned and cooked just right. The service was also excellent! super friendly and attentive staff. Definitely a place I’d come back to!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Great experience! From the friendly greeting upon entry to being seated quickly. A great place to people watch and indulge. Strong cocktails and flavorful food! An old school vibe when it comes to service, something that is greatly appreciated!  Have the bread ! Try thr wine and ask for a taste! Fresh scallops dish was outstanding and not overly salty( had it twice ). Steak potatoes entree was flavorful and delicious.  Will be back for a third time !  They can accommodate walk-in’s which is fun at the bar!

Something we really appreciate is we never felt rushed as you are in other restaurants in the city, so we could really take our time and enjoy our dinner. We’ll be back soon.

top_10.name: Molinari Delicatessen
top_10.address: 373 Columbus Ave, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Came here because of the great reviews and it did not disappoint. Sandwiches were great with tons of flavor and huge! I had lunch one day and breakfast the next :) the shop inside is also a great spot to buy different products. We came here on a Friday at 10:30 am so line was non existence although pictures suggest this become a hot spot at times. There are no seating area so one has to seat outside and can be chilling at times. Plus there is no bathroom. Overall a great spot and will highly recommend to visit and try their nice sandwiches

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
They ran out of focaccia at 3pm

Take a number and wait to be called. When they call your number, order, then pay when you pick up

Was still good with soft bread, but not worth the 30min wait. Cheese was still cold after the sandwich was toasted

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
It was crazy busy at 2pm yesterday. We waited 30 minutes to place our order. Was it worth it?  Not really. We ordered the Italian combo on Italian bread. That was a mistake. We like crusty bread but this was tough. Taking a bite required moving the bread back and forth to tear it off.

The flavor was great but it should be for $18. People behind the counter were friendly and there are a few tables outside.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Famous Italian deli spot in the North Beach neighborhood. Popular with both tourists and local residents. We ordered the 4 different subs, and they were all delicious - my favorite was the Molinari special. Prices were around $16 per sub, which is definitely big enough for one person. They cut it in half so you can exchange with your friend/family if you wanna try multiple subs.

As you walk in, you’ll feel as if you were transported to Italy. The whole store is filled with imported food goods from Italy and it’s a great vibe that gets your appetite going. They also slice the deli meat in front of you for some cool showmanship.

Make sure to grab a ticket as soon as you walk in, as they’ll call your number to take orders at the counter. The wait might be 20-30 mins depending on the day and time. If you are low on time, I don’t think it’s an essential spot to visit as I’m sure there are other lesser known spots with just as good subs.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: After waiting 50-minutes, there were still 9 tickets in front of us so we gave up. Was cool to experience the buzz and see all the different ingredients and local characters coming in/out. Wouldn’t recommend unless you’re willing to wait a long time for an $18 sandwich - or you go at a time when there’s no queue.

testimonials: Came here because of the great reviews and it did not disappoint. Sandwiches were great with tons of flavor and huge! I had lunch one day and breakfast the next :) the shop inside is also a great spot to buy different products. We came here on a Friday at 10:30 am so line was non existence although pictures suggest this become a hot spot at times. There are no seating area so one has to seat outside and can be chilling at times. Plus there is no bathroom. Overall a great spot and will highly recommend to visit and try their nice sandwiches

They ran out of focaccia at 3pm

Take a number and wait to be called. When they call your number, order, then pay when you pick up

Was still good with soft bread, but not worth the 30min wait. Cheese was still cold after the sandwich was toasted

It was crazy busy at 2pm yesterday. We waited 30 minutes to place our order. Was it worth it?  Not really. We ordered the Italian combo on Italian bread. That was a mistake. We like crusty bread but this was tough. Taking a bite required moving the bread back and forth to tear it off.

The flavor was great but it should be for $18. People behind the counter were friendly and there are a few tables outside.

top_10.name: Roxie Food Center
top_10.address: 1901 San Jose Avenue, San Francisco, CA 94112, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I haven't been here in such a long time.   I'm happy to see that this place is still around and nothing has changed.   The place is small but packed with so many goodies.  They have a wide assortment of chips,  candies, and so much more.
I had ordered my husband and I a sandwich.  The sandwiches were a little pricy but they were huge.   Delicious and satisfying.

1.  Turkey and cheese on dutch crunch:  Bread was nice and fresh.

2.  Tony special (tri-tip w/ bbq sauce plain):  Crunchy and flavorful.

3.  Beef and cheese piroshki:  A classic must have for me.  It brings back so many nostalgic memories.   It definitely hit the spot.

I bought a variety of goodies like classic Cabdury chocolates from Europe and an assortment of chips.  I definitely plan to be back sooner than later.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I ordered the Tony's Tri Tip sandwich it was great. I would highly recommend it I will be making another trip next time to try the Avocado BLT sandwich.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Roxie Food Center is a fantastic spot for anyone looking for a quick and delicious sandwich. The quality of the food is exceptional, with an impressive selection of fresh ingredients that cater to a variety of tastes. Whether you're in the mood for something sweet or savory, you're sure to find something that satisfies your cravings.

The service at Roxie Food Center is top-notch. The staff is friendly, welcoming, and always willing to help you with any questions you may have about the choices. They are quick to make recommendations based on your preferences and are attentive to your needs throughout your visit.

Prices at Roxie Food Center are reasonable for the quality and quantity of food provided, making it an excellent value for anyone looking for a satisfying sandwich without breaking the bank. Additionally, the food center is always clean and well-maintained, and in good condition.

Located in a convenient location with reasonable parking, Roxie Food Center is a great place to stop for a quick bite If you're in the area, I highly recommend checking it out.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Have been coming to Roxie’s since I was in 6th grade. Favorite sandwich has always been the crab sandwich with everything on it.
In my opinion every sandwich here is good, they make it how you want it and they always give you a hefty sandwich. You can never go wrong pulling up to Roxie’s!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Hands down, the best sandwiches in the entire City, and they're some of the friendliest owners, too. They are San Francisco legends, and I'm proud to patronize them because their food is very good and delicious. Highly recommended and I try to frequent them regularly...

top_10.name: Submarine Center
top_10.address: 820 Ulloa St, San Francisco, CA 94127, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I was craving a pastrami and found this place was within biking distance so I went out and ordered ahead on doordash for pick up. It was ready by the time I got there.

The pastrami sandwich was good and juicy though it's not a traditional pastrami I had in mind, I'd still come back for this. But is a sandwich really $17 these days?

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
My boyfriend was craving a sandwich, so I looked up a few spots and decided to give this place a try — and I’m so glad we did! It’s a small space but super efficient and well-run.

We ordered two subs, and they were absolutely amazing. I had the avocado with turkey, and my boyfriend went with the pastrami. Both were fresh, flavorful, and packed just right. We devoured our subs — definitely hit the spot!

Great little gem for a satisfying sandwich fix.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: The to go mighty sandwich shop! Such a great variety (and generous with Avo!). We split the Italian super sub, and it was great! Ratios were perfect, and bread was nice and crusty. There were plenty of staff here ready to make fast and fresh sandwiches during the lunch hour. Nowhere to eat or sit, so ger your order to go and enjoy!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
One of the best subs I’ve ever had! The pastrami, Swiss, bacon, and avocado is simply incredible. The staff recommended it as it was my first time there.
Sandwich was incredible. Perfectly cooked pastrami, delectable bacon, huge chunks of avocado, melting Swiss cheese, balanced mustard, and topped with a crispy bun toasted to perfection.
I want to go back and get this again.
A+ will be back.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: this is hands down the best sandwich i’ve ever had in my life. i got the avocado turkey swiss with everything and it was delicious. i plan to come back and order the roast beef (“everyone’s favorite”). we are at a nearby park and the vibe was immaculate. they don’t have indoor seating but there is a park and various benches located nearby where you can enjoy your decadent sub.

top_10.name: Ted’s Market
top_10.address: 1530 Howard St, San Francisco, CA 94103, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
It was my first time going there.
We got sandwiches for the Giants game! Friendly service & they even called me back because I forgot to order cheese on my sandwich.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: On my way out of city and kids wanted some sandwiches. Stopped by on a holiday. Parking in front on street. Super clean inside. Sandwich maker was nice, efficient, attentive. Good selection of drinks and snacks. Cashier very nice. Good menu including breakfast and daily specials.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
One of the best sandwich spots in the city, they open as early as 7am and their sandwiches never MISS! Service is great the ladies behind the counter always have a smile and have great attitudes when you order your sandwich. I always get the Italian combo or the pastrami sandwich and it’s always bomb.

Pro tip: ask to get your sandwich toasted!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I never have high expectations for a deli to have good vegan sammies but holy hell! Best vegan sub I’ve ever even dreamt of.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Classic deli with quality ingredients and lots of options. They roast their own turkey, and probably do a bunch of other stuff to raise the bar. This is a great spot for lunch or breakfast. Ladies behind the counter are all top notch.

testimonials:
It was my first time going there.
We got sandwiches for the Giants game! Friendly service & they even called me back because I forgot to order cheese on my sandwich.

On my way out of city and kids wanted some sandwiches. Stopped by on a holiday. Parking in front on street. Super clean inside. Sandwich maker was nice, efficient, attentive. Good selection of drinks and snacks. Cashier very nice. Good menu including breakfast and daily specials.

Service is great the ladies behind the counter always have a smile and have great attitudes when you order your sandwich. I always get the Italian combo or the pastrami sandwich and it’s always bomb.

Pro tip: ask to get your sandwich toasted!

top_10.name: The Hungry Spot
top_10.address: 2077 Hayes St, San Francisco, CA 94117, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Had Hayes and corn salad. Couldn't get a picture of Hayes salad because someone wanted to dig in! We will rock you and I need a hero half sheet of lazy pizza! Had salads from there before and they're always fresh and have a nice balance of ingredients! The pizzas are nice, crunchy and soft! Best eaten soon after getting it. Service is excellent! Will be back to try other things on the menu!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Literally the most delicious sandwich I’ve eaten in my 34 years. We felt so welcome. It was the owner’s birthday and after eating half of the HUGE sandwich she gifted us an amazing slice of chocolate mousse cake. We will absolutely be back! ♥️

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Lovely, cozy spot for a delicious sandwich! $23 (including tip and tax) for the BBQ Bacon and Chicken sandwich + side of chips. Sandwich was super filling and I appreciated that it was cut and put into a take-out box. The nice lady who took my order brought it out to me personally, too. I don't have a dog, but they had complimentary dog treats near the door.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Amazing food, beyond amazing service, and quality meal!!! Ordered the chicken pesto avocado and had the mixed bliss salad. VERY GENEROUS PORTIONS! Everything tasted super fresh and delicious. The service was outstanding. Catalina was so nice and friendly and welcoming and made our experience wonderful! She was so kind and made sure we were really cared for and was super attentive (very rare in restaurants these days to have service as good as this). We really had a great time dining here and are going to come here again!!! The only problem is that there is limited seating if you are coming with a bigger party but other than that, 11/10 experience!!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
During my recent visit to The Hungry Spot, I had the pleasure of indulging in their garlic Parmesan chicken wings and Greek salad, and I must say, it was a culinary experience worth raving about.

The garlic Parmesan chicken wings were a revelation. Perfectly crispy on the outside and tender on the inside, each bite was a delightful blend of flavors. The rich, buttery Parmesan complemented the robust garlic notes beautifully, creating a savory sensation that left my taste buds dancing with joy. The wings were generously coated, ensuring that every morsel was packed with flavor. It's clear that great care was taken in their preparation, resulting in wings that are nothing short of perfection.

Accompanying the wings was a refreshing Greek salad that provided the perfect balance to the rich flavors of the chicken. The salad was a vibrant medley of fresh ingredients: crisp lettuce, juicy tomatoes, crunchy cucumbers, and tangy red onions, all tossed in a light, zesty dressing. The feta cheese added a creamy texture, while the olives gave a delightful briny punch. Every bite was a harmonious blend of textures and tastes, making it a standout dish in its own right.

The exceptional food was only matched by the phenomenal customer service at The Hungry Spot. From the moment I walked in, I was greeted with warm smiles and a friendly atmosphere. The staff were attentive, knowledgeable, and genuinely passionate about providing an excellent dining experience. They went above and beyond to ensure that every aspect of my meal was perfect, making me feel like a valued guest.

In summary, my dining experience at The Hungry Spot was truly remarkable. The garlic Parmesan chicken wings and Greek salad were outstanding, each dish crafted with care and bursting with flavor. The customer service was exemplary, adding an extra layer of enjoyment to the meal. I highly recommend this place to anyone seeking delicious food and outstanding service.

Will be back to try other things on the menu!

I don't have a dog, but they had complimentary dog treats near the door.

top_10.name: Sandy's
top_10.address: 1457 Haight St, San Francisco, CA 94117, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: ABSOLUTE MUST-TRY! This was by far the best muffuletta I have ever had! While it is a little pricey, the combo makes it so worth it and it is well worth the price regardless! Cookie are also incredibly delicious too! The staff here were super friendly and attentive. This is a small business and is really pushing the neighborhood forward! I cannot think that I could recommend this place any stronger. Definitely a must-have when visiting San Francisco!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Didn't get their famous muffaletta but tried their egg sandwich and cookie. Cookie was amazing, kinda pricey at $5 but worth it for the size and quality. Egg sandwich, while good, didn't feel like it fully justified the $14 price tag. Not the most complex flavor and just put between two pieces of regular white bread.

Even with that though the customer service was great, and if I'm ever around there again I will stop by for a cookie.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Sandwich was A1 but the cookies oh my goodness, absolutely unreal.

And the owner recommended a few great spots with a view to eat it for which we were super grateful!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Had a wonderful time at Sandy’s! Their sandwiches are so tastyyy and they have THE BEST coleslaw in the world, very dill forward. Great service too, everyone is so kind

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Been craving a good muffuletta since our trip to NOLA five years ago, this place hits the spot and then some.

Tried their classic and their roasted mushrooms vegetarian option, loved both of them.

testimonials: ABSOLUTE MUST-TRY! This was by far the best muffuletta I have ever had! While it is a little pricey, the combo makes it so worth it and it is well worth the price regardless! Cookie are also incredibly delicious too! The staff here were super friendly and attentive. This is a small business and is really pushing the neighborhood forward! I cannot think that I could recommend this place any stronger. Definitely a must-have when visiting San Francisco!

Sandwich was A1 but the cookies oh my goodness, absolutely unreal.

And the owner recommended a few great spots with a view to eat it for which we were super grateful!

top_10.name: The M Stop Deli
top_10.address: 2598 San Jose Avenue, San Francisco, CA 94112, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
First time here and it was great! I ordered 2 of the T Line sandwich and asked kindly for avocado instead of cheese. The worker was really nice and made the sandwiches very fast. Both sandwiches were big and lots of deli meat in them. The dutch bread was also very fresh.

Also got the rice krispie banana dessert, great combination idea. Recommend getting it if you want something sweet.

Extremely good and great atmosphere!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
The M Stop Deli is a great stop for a satisfying sandwich in SF. I’ve tried the M Line, T Line and the P Line on Dutch Crunch bread. All were amazing, but my favorite was definitely the M Line with the really tender beef tri-tip!

Portions were generous, ingredients tasted fresh, and it’s great having a halal deli option like this in the city. I’d definitely recommend giving it a try.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I came across this place on the DoorDash app while I was hungry and in need of something to eat. It is pretty unique that they name their sandwiches after the different muni bus lines from San Francisco. Their sandwiches are special from others, it is packed with a combination of meats, vegetables and special sauces they use. Everything is made from scratch daily which is a plus. This place is fairly new in the neighborhood, I remember when it used to be a liquor/convience store. They also offer drinks and snacks besides their awesome sandwiches. I highly recommend this place for all sandwich enthusiasts, anyone looking to try something new or if you just happen to be in the area. I definitely will be back to tryout the other delicious options they have to offer.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
The M Stop Deli, that's where we'll get our lunch, then he said we'll take our lunch out to Ocean Beach along with that pail of sardines, catch a sea lion and drop it off at Union Square like Hobert and I did last month....it'll be funny as F!  Well... we were just about to put that darn sea lion in the truck when a game warden spotted us and made us put it back in the ocean!
And...in all that excitement, all I could think about was how amazing that sandwich from the M Stop Deli was.  It was truly spectacular!
5 stars all day ✨️   ☆☆☆☆☆

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This place has such a warm atmosphere ✨ So Perfect for a couples who like to split a bite! When I tell them I'm splitting it with my husband, sometimes they write cute stuff like Hers & His

top_10.name: Deli Board
top_10.address: 1058 Folsom St, San Francisco, CA 94103, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Loved the pastrami in my 555 sandwich. The Stephanie (tuna bacon) was very flavorful and was a hit. The Armando (turkey bacon avocado) was not bad but not quite as flavorful as the others. The waffle fries are GREAT and perfect with the included mick sauce. Crispy with very creamy interior.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I got there less than an hour before closing and they were still very busy and I’m happy for them. There were 10 parties in front of me and several waiting for their food but I still got everything within 20 mins. As I was waiting, about 30 mins before closing, they ran out of brisket and pastrami. Roast beef was juicy, ingredients fresh, and waffle fries cooked perfectly.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Well damn. This place lives up to the hype. You must order the 49er. Literally the best sandwich I’ve ever had in my life. Also tried the Stephanie (tuna and bacon) and the Leroy brown.  Both were solid.  But the 49er was an absolute legend. Fries and mick sauce delicious. Worth the long line.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: 4.2/5 for the sandwich. Waited 40 mins in line to get my hands on one of these sandwiches. I got the 49er and it was good. The meat was good but the standout for me was the bread. Would come back again but kinda wish they were less expensive. Great restaurant atmosphere too

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This cozy spot is worth the wait! Pictured is the 555 and the Armando. The line had about 20 people when we joined, and it was almost 30m to get our food. It was definitely worth it. Be prepared that parking is tough, no restroom, and no seating. The nearby streets don’t really have benches either. I would still recommend this delicious spot!

top_10.name: Saigon Sandwich
top_10.address: 560 Larkin St, San Francisco, CA 94102, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This sandwich place is very unassuming but it is definitely one of the most worthwhile sandwiches that I’ve eaten. It is very cheap at $7 but the taste was exquisite. The pate made everything taste better. It does not feel dry at all unlike the Bahn Mi’s that I’ve had before. Btw, I bought the Pork Belly Pate combo and it was the rightest decision that I’ve made in my life. Also the shop is in the hood but that made the experience more real and authentic. I love this sandwich.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Great value for money banh mi. You won’t find anything cheaper and the portions are huge. One more then enough for a person don’t be greedy we were. A little bit toooo generous with the pate

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: It is just a little shop. However, the food taste very good. I can’t believe the over $5 sandwich can make me full while it’s very delicious. There are a lot chicken in my sandwich. I recommend this to everyone.(CASH ONLY)

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Very solid banhmi
Got the pork belly one for 7.5 and chicken for 5.5.
Tbh the pate and cold cuts outshined the pork belly on that sandwich, but it was delicious.
The chicken banhmi was a little dry, has mayo instead of pate. Still delicious.

Recommend taking a bit of a detour and stick to major streets to get here. Eddie/Turk is pretty sketchy between here and Market street

Cash only
There's a Bank of America ATM not too far away

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Easily my favorite place to get food! Nice customer service, freshly made to order, and delicious taste every time! Phenomenal sandwiches (I get tofu) and great Vietnamese coffee. They are CASH ONLY and well worth the wait if there's a line. I highly recommend this place and I suggest ordering two sandwiches.

testimonials: This sandwich place is very unassuming but it is definitely one of the most worthwhile sandwiches that I’ve eaten. It is very cheap at $7 but the taste was exquisite. The pate made everything taste better. It does not feel dry at all unlike the Bahn Mi’s that I’ve had before. Btw, I bought the Pork Belly Pate combo and it was the rightest decision that I’ve made in my life. Also the shop is in the hood but that made the experience more real and authentic. I love this sandwich.

It is just a little shop. However, the food taste very good. I can’t believe the over $5 sandwich can make me full while it’s very delicious. There are a lot chicken in my sandwich. I recommend this to everyone.(CASH ONLY)

top_10.name: The Bird
top_10.address: 115 New Montgomery St, San Francisco, CA 94105, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
What. A. Fried. Chicken. Sandwich!!! Easily one of the best fried chicken sandwiches in the Bay and I was more than impressed when I stumbled upon this small but mighty establishment. Blink and you miss it and you definitely don’t want to miss it!

The spicy fried chicken sandwich is off the charts delicious!! Crispy and juicy large portion of chicken topped with apple slaw (don’t shy away from it, sounds different because it is but it sets the sandwich apart and off!!) I savored every bite and was sad when I finished it! Only thing I would add to it is to make it a little spicier but even then, ridiculous good!!

Highly recommend this spot if you’re craving a good chicken sandwich!!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
ordered the fried chicken sandwich, all the fixings and spicy. it was delicious and one of the best fried chicken spots in SF. chicken was juicy and filling, the coleslaw and pickles were an excellent and fresh complement with a toasted sandwich bun to boot. would recommend for anyone to swing by and try out.

the sandwich was so appetizing i couldn't get a good photo before devouring.

the staff was excellent and one gentleman even recommended something from earlier in the day they still had (the apple fritters)! so stop by early if youre lucky enough to try those as well, they're delicious too!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Well dressed and seasoned crispy chicken that overhangs the bun, spicy but not too spicy. Slaw was a fantastic complement with lots of celery and apple. Prices were great and service was quick. Will definitely come back here next time I’m in town.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I came in on a Sunday and it was the only place in the neighborhood that was open. Glad to have tried the spicy Cjicken sandwich (no mayo). It was really spicy and delicious!
The staff was really friendly, the place was clean, and they had March Madness on the projector.
I work next door and can’t wait to go back!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: The chicken had flavor and the tots were cooked just right. My favorite was the corn ribs. They were so delicious 😋 also the staff was very friendly

testimonials:
What. A. Fried. Chicken. Sandwich!!! Easily one of the best fried chicken sandwiches in the Bay and I was more than impressed when I stumbled upon this small but mighty establishment. Blink and you miss it and you definitely don’t want to miss it!

The spicy fried chicken sandwich is off the charts delicious!! Crispy and juicy large portion of chicken topped with apple slaw (don’t shy away from it, sounds different because it is but it sets the sandwich apart and off!!) I savored every bite and was sad when I finished it! Only thing I would add to it is to make it a little spicier but even then, ridiculous good!!

Highly recommend this spot if you’re craving a good chicken sandwich!!

ordered the fried chicken sandwich, all the fixings and spicy. it was delicious and one of the best fried chicken spots in SF. chicken was juicy and filling, the coleslaw and pickles were an excellent and fresh complement with a toasted sandwich bun to boot. would recommend for anyone to swing by and try out.

the sandwich was so appetizing i couldn't get a good photo before devouring.

the staff was excellent and one gentleman even recommended something from earlier in the day they still had (the apple fritters)! so stop by early if youre lucky enough to try those as well, they're delicious too!

Well dressed and seasoned crispy chicken that overhangs the bun, spicy but not too spicy. Slaw was a fantastic complement with lots of celery and apple. Prices were great and service was quick. Will definitely come back here next time I’m in town.

top_10.name: Philmore Creamery
top_10.address: 1840 Fillmore St, San Francisco, CA 94115, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Wonderful gelato! Reminds me of Italy. (Don't believe me? Just check my post history.) That said, we don't glaze and "Italy" is not the goal. This gelato is great in and of itself. Light, but still creamy in texture. Clean flavours, exactly as described by their names. My only disappointment is buying a small and not going for something larger.

Do stop by if you have a chance. Really good gelato, especially around SF bay area.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: The sorbet makes my mouth water with an explosion of flavor. I love the flavor of the peach, chocolate, and lemon sorbets. It’s perfect for lactose-free, low-fat diets!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: They use Sicily Bronte Pistachio DOP to make that flavor. I’ve never seen any gelato like this in Bay area! Perfectly sweet and so flavorful! This becomes My #1 gelato and sorbet in SF bay area!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Very tasty gelato. We got a medium with coconut almond chocolate chip and the cinnamon cookie.
The coconut was very refreshing and the cookie was like creamy biscoff.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: House-made delicious ice cream in the heart of San Fransisco.  we got the mandarin, the berry, the cherry, and the crème brûlée, and all four were absolutely delicious! Our favorite was a mandarin, each cup comes with a cookie. Other specialty items like ice cream, popsicles, cakes, cream, puffs, and to go pints are available. Parking is limited since it’s in the middle of San Francisco.

top_10.name: Mitchell's Ice Cream
top_10.address: 688 San Jose Avenue, San Francisco, CA 94110, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Everyone comes to this place. Lines can be out the door sometimes.  While it's pricey, and no, I can't compare it to nowhere else because i don't buy ice cream elsewhere. They have a huge variety of flavors. I got coffee and tofee espresso, and it was really good. You also get to try any ice cream before you buy, which I find great. I got a double scoop of 2 different ice creams, and they charge an additional $2 for the scoop.. based on what we were told.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
This picture says it all.  Once the ice cream melts in your mouth, the favorable reaction justifies the efforts to reach there.

Believe me, it worth it and be prepared for enjoying powerful varieties of great flavors, which will guarantee your repeated visits.

Thanks for the team attention and making this tasting experience organically colorful and yet, impactful.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Love love love Michell’s ice cream. I’ve been coming here my entire life. Never been disappointed. Often there is a line, but it is always worth the wait!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I understand the historical significance, but just for the value of your money this place ain't worth it. I've had plenty of more interesting and creative ice cream elsewhere at higher quality and cheaper price. The crowd is annoying as well.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Well dang this was an excellent find in our travels! A scoop Sticky Monkey on top of a scoop of Mocha Fudge was AMAZING! EACH WERE INDIVIDUALLY EXCELLENT AND TOGETHER THEY WERE ALSO AMAZING!

Also sampled the avocado ice cream. Don't sleep on that. That's pretty dang good.

My only regret is that we couldn't take any with us. They definitely have A ton that you can purchase to bring home for your own freezer!

top_10.name: Salt & Straw
top_10.address: 586 Hayes St, San Francisco, CA 94102, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I had one scoop of the goat cheese berry habanero and the coffee and nuts (half half). They were good. Not overly sweet at all. I also tried (sample) olive oil and pear blue cheese. They were good but not distinct flavors for the names. Def come back. Love it. Have outdoor seating. Perfect for a warm sunny day.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Oh man, where do I even start with Salt & Straw? This place is like if a rogue alchemist snuck into a dairy farm and started experimenting with forbidden elixirs. I strolled in with high hopes and emerged victorious with a milkshake that’s basically liquid gold: sea salt caramel as the silky base, crowned with two scoops of their olive oil ice cream. Olive oil in ice cream? It sounds like a madcap plot twist, but it delivers; creamy with a whisper of earthy savoriness that dances with the caramel like old flames rekindling. Each slurp was a symphony of rich, balanced bliss. I felt like I’d unlocked a secret level in the game of desserts.
But wait, the drama unfolds: the straw. And hey, “Straw” is literally in their name... talk about irony! This biodegradable bad boy decided to split clean down the middle quicker than a celebrity couple in tabloid headlines. One moment it’s heroically tackling the thick shake; the next, it’s in two pieces, forcing me to improvise like a survivalist in the wilderness. Ended up tilting the cup back like I was toasting the gods. Pro tip: pack a backup straw forged from adamantium, or just lean into the mess.
Even with the straw’s split-second betrayal, this was an epic win. Salt & Straw, you’re the flavor wizard I didn’t know I needed. 5 stars, no notes, because who needs perfection when you’ve got pure, chaotic joy? 🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: The woman (semi tall caucasian with cool style) who scooped my ice cream was super sweet, she was patient and let me and my friends try many different flavors! She even let me try one after ordering! Me and my friends tried the pickle one which wasn’t our favorite… 😬but the flavors we ended up getting were delicious, I loved the chocolate chip zucchini bread! ☺️☺️ Great service, atmosphere and ice cream!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
This ice cream shop benefits greatly from its prime location in a key shopping area, close to several city venues, and it does offer a water station and restroom, which are definite pluses. While the shop boasts some interesting and more exotic ice cream flavors that might tempt adventurous palates, the overall experience left something to be desired.

The employees were polite and met basic customer service expectations, but their apparent preoccupation with socializing amongst themselves didn't foster a sense of enthusiastic assistance. Parking is also a significant drawback. While street parking is available, the prices felt outrageously high, and the nearest garage is a few blocks away.

Perhaps the most unsettling aspect was the emptiness of the store. Despite having shelves and coolers, they were largely bare, giving off an odd, almost going-out-of-business vibe. This unfortunately made the grubbiness of the walls quite noticeable.

Personally, the shop felt like it was trying too hard to cultivate a cool and trendy image without fully delivering on it. While the availability of some unique flavors elevates it beyond a three-star rating, the numerous downsides prevent it from reaching a four. It has potential, but it just not there.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I consider this one of those establishments which is too hyped up and also ‘tries too hard’ so ends up being hit or miss. Many flavors, in fact, probably the majority of flavors, are unique and sound interesting but arguably sometimes just taste too weird or downright not yummy. Their limited traditional flavors like chocolate and vanilla are solid. I guess if one is an adventurous type and or bored of the usual flavors, this would be a great place, but those who prefer the standard and or tried and true flavor combos may not find their menu a bit over the top. Luckily, they do allow samples, otherwise it would be difficult and possibly disastrous to commit to an entire serving (which is of course pricey as expected for SF, without trying first.) interior was clean and nice, with 4 stools for seating (there are benches outside as well). Service was friendly and prompt.

top_10.name: Garden Creamery
top_10.address: 3566 20th St, San Francisco, CA 94110, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Whenever we’re in the mission area, this is the one place my friends and I always go to.

They have unique Asian flavors like ube, pandan, Japanese milk coffee, you name it. They have limited flavors that change pretty frequently and they’re all amazing, super rich and filled with flavor. There’s usually a line whenever we go but it’s so worth the wait.

Not to mention they allow you to sample up to 3 flavors and the employees are always so friendly!! I can’t recommend this place enough/ can’t wait to go back again!!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Tried many flavors of ice cream here. Would definitely recommend. Some of the flavors are shown in the photos below.

The black sesame was well balanced with their creaminess and their intensity of the black sesame, and was not overly sweet.

The Japanese strawberry sherbet was perfectly tart. it had a decently, strong strawberry taste, also not overly sweet.

The salty kaya was well balanced. It was sweet and umami at the same time. My only critique is that it was a little bit too salty then I would have liked.

The Matcha Oreo was OK. Was not that big of a fan of the Matcha, the Oreo was just decent.

The Ube pandan was absolutely delicious. Strong Ube taste,. The pandan worked very well with the Ube. Altogether, it was not overly sweet. very good combo

The lychee black tea was also very good. Strong lyches taste, and a moderately strong black tea taste as well. Very good combo

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Loved Garden Creamery! As of 2025 is one of the best gelatos in SF in my opinion. Great neighborhood place. Low key but a destination in itself. Seems Im not the only one as there is usually a big line outside even on weekend nights. Line moves fast so be patient. Their unique sorbets flavors are amazing. My favorites so far are the Lime, Mango and Strawberry. A plus they are dog friendly…

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
If I could give it a 11/10 I would. This little ice cream shop right around the corner on Valencia and 20th is prob my #1 ice cream shop in the entire Bay Area.

Tons of different flavors and the staff is always welcoming and friendly with everyone in the shop.

Our favorite flavors so far has been Lychee, Ube Panda and Japanese UCC Milk Coffee. Highly recommend to anyone looking for a light, refreshing and addictive treats in an afternoon or post-dinner!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: The ice cream was absolutely incredible! Made with locally sourced ingredients and infused with love, it was a delightful experience. The sweetness level was just right, not too overpowering. The flavors were unique and not overly similar to other shops. I highly recommend this place and will definitely be returning. On top of all that, the prices are very reasonable!

top_10.name: Marco Polo Italian Ice Cream
top_10.address: 3886 Noriega St, San Francisco, CA 94122, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I’ve heard of this place for a long time. The interior was very clean and bright with some space to sit. Their flavors were amazing. They’re definitely unique and tropical. The staff let us tried a couple flavors and all of them were really impressive. They were like juice burst in your mouth. The price was also very good. We were able to get three flavors with the medium cup and he gave us a decent amount. I would definitely recommend trying the pandan leaf and mangosteen. And I can’t wait to come back to try more.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Marco Polo Ice Cream is a true gem in San Francisco, especially if you’re craving something beyond the usual. This spot serves up delicious gelato-style ice cream with a unique Asian twist. Flavors like durian, jackfruit, Thai tea, and matcha bring bold, authentic taste profiles you won’t find at most ice cream shops. Each scoop is creamy, rich, and packed with flavor. They also offer traditional favorites like chocolate and vanilla, so there’s something for everyone. Whether you’re an adventurous eater or just want something cool and refreshing, Marco Polo is absolutely worth the visit.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Been going to Marco Polo since it was on Taraval St for the last 20 plus years. The new location is nice. I usually order the mango and jack fruit but not I just resort to jack fruit. There are no words to describe the taste but delicious! Go and try the different flavors.

Tip: there is a Marco Polo in SJ too

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This is their new place, they moved from Taraval st. The place is small only has 2-3 tables. The ice cream tastes a little bit different than the old place,  the durian and double choc are good. Around $6.00 for 2 scoops and you can choose 2 different taste.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Super yummy! They have so many Asian inspired flavors and this is now my favorite spot in all of San Fran! I went here in the dead of winter and it was so worth it, even sitting out in the cold. Can’t wait to go back, that durian ice cream has a GRIP on me.

top_10.name: Salt & Straw
top_10.address: 2201 Fillmore St, San Francisco, CA 94115, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Good ice cream, concerned about cross-contamination

I saw the benches outside were both occupied as well as the seats inside, so I knew their ice cream was probably going to be good. I had a vanilla ice cream in their single size for about $7. It was really creamy and had specks of vanilla bean.

After having a few spoonfuls, I saw that there was another flavor mixed into the vanilla. It tasted like ube. This meant that the person who scooped my ice cream didn't clean the scoops between customers. While I don't have food allergies, I'm concerned for those who do.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: So yummy every time. The ice cream is so interesting with it changing every month. I would recommend that you try all the OG flavors. Then do the monthly ones after you have your baseline for every other time that you go. My face is the snickerdoodle. In the photo I have the coffee stone fruit and the banana sherbet 8.5/10

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Im drooling just thinking about this ice cream again.

Got the gooey brownie and the salted, malted, cookie dough. The sizes were a good portion. Can definitely taste the salt in the cookie dough, which helps balance the other flavors. && brownies were gooey with a touch of fudge? Lovely.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Really good ice cream with great rotation and variety. I got the birthday cake and blueberry and it was great. Only giving 3 stars because we broke 3 spoons in less than 2 minutes. So 3 stars for 3 spoons.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Fantastic ice cream: full of flavor, smooth texture, and I love that you can split a scoop to combine two different options. I am a big fan of the coffee and love nuts and my wife really appreciated the vegan options. We had ice cream every day across our five days in SF and this was the very best of everything we tried.
