top_10.name: Miyako Old Fashion Ice Cream
top_10.address: 1470 Fillmore St, San Francisco, CA 94115, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
This is a historical landmark and place, in its own right, as this is a family run business, long standing, in the community and they've kept the prices low and competitive! The sandwiches and ice cream cones are crafted with love, as the original owner is still active, serving flavorful ice cream cones to his patrons and crafting those delicious sandwiches. You have to stop by and treat yourself to a cone, of one of the owner's various selections of flavors, including specialty flavors. Or maybe you would like one of his delicious sandwiches, including hot pastrami, with nacho chips and your choice of potato salad or cole slaw. I recommend the slaw: it's delicious. 💯😋
All for a REMARKABLE price. 👌🏾

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This a fascinating place; what a city jewel!  It took me back from when I was a kid. The store is dated, dusty yet magical. They carry unique old fashioned ice cream flavors and also a variety of candy in old jars behind the counter. A sweet old folk helps you in the nicest, kindest demeanor. If you want a different kind of experience, this place  is a must visit!  But beware is not a glamorous, commercial, bougie place, is more like an alternative grungy but awesome place

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: A visit to this ice cream shop yielded a simple, decent milkshake, although a little too milky.  The prices are too low, in my opinion. I think the owner should consider a price hike. I don't know if the older gentleman was the owner, but he was friendly and seemed to be an institution. I feel like there's probably some history here that's worth exploring the next time I'm back in the area. Looking for something other than an ice cream? There are plenty of other sweets as well. By the way, I'm not sure where the one hundred flavors tagline came from. Perhaps it's referencing all of the various items in the shop, not just the ice cream.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: What a nice place! The ice cream is really delicious, and the man that served us was adorable. The avocado and banana flavours are my personal favourites. I will come back for sure on my next visit!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: The ice cream is fresh and tastes amazing! The owner, Thomas has been working there for 28 years and is so nice and welcoming. During a school project we stopped by for a cold treat and loved his shop! I will definitely be back soon!!! If you are ever passing by in filmore please check him out I mean this was delicious, refreshing, incredibly welcoming, and they have so many choices of ice cream, floats, and sandwiches I’d try when I come back! Amazing.

top_10.name: Bi-Rite Creamery
top_10.address: 3692 18th St, San Francisco, CA 94110, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Perfect ice cream stop before heading to the park next door.

Heard this was one of the best ice cream shops in the city, so we swung by after a late brunch around 3PM. The line was long. Took us about 20 minutes to get inside and order, but it was totally worth the wait.

We tried a few of their most popular flavors: Black Sesame, Balsamic Strawberry, and Honey Lavender. My personal favorites were the latter two. Both had delicate, nuanced flavors. The balsamic and lavender notes were subtle, just enough to leave a pleasantly aromatic finish without overwhelming the creamy base.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
🍦 Delicious Ice Cream:
The ice cream at Bi-Rite Creamery is genuinely delicious. It's rich, creamy, and clearly made with high-quality ingredients, resulting in fantastic flavors that truly satisfy.

😊 Super Friendly Staff:
The staff here are incredibly friendly and welcoming. As first-time visitors, we especially appreciated how accommodating they were, allowing us to sample quite a few flavors before we settled on our choices. This made the experience even more enjoyable.

👍 First-Timer Friendly:
Their willingness to let us sample multiple flavors made our first visit a very positive and memorable one. It's great for discovering new favorites.

📍 Overall Impression:
Bi-Rite Creamery is a must-visit for ice cream lovers in San Francisco. The combination of delicious ice cream and wonderfully friendly service makes for a truly delightful experience. Highly recommended!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I visited this place on a Sunday afternoon and had to wait about 25 minutes in line—but it was absolutely worth it!
I went for the Make Your Own sundae, and it turned out to be the best choice ever. I picked Black Sesame, Salted Caramel, and Peanut Butter flavors, and topped it with spiced pecans, caramelized bananas, hot fudge, and, of course, whipped cream. It was incredibly delicious!
I totally recommend checking this place out!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: My partner and I explored this spot two months back while we were in San Francisco. On our way to Dolores Park, we craved something sweet and stumbled upon this place. We decided to order a banana split. The staff assisting us was incredibly friendly and provided great explanations. The banana split was absolutely delicious. Although there was a long line when we got there, it moved quite quickly. We can't wait to return to this place again in the future.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
My second fav ice cream in the world. Creme brulee is insane!!!
Its a smidge icy, just enough to perfectly melt in your mouth and not coat your tongue in fatty cream. Not too sweet but developed flavours. Amazing
Organic sugar cones also 🥹🙏

testimonials:
Perfect ice cream stop before heading to the park next door.

Heard this was one of the best ice cream shops in the city, so we swung by after a late brunch around 3PM. The line was long. Took us about 20 minutes to get inside and order, but it was totally worth the wait.

We tried a few of their most popular flavors: Black Sesame, Balsamic Strawberry, and Honey Lavender. My personal favorites were the latter two. Both had delicate, nuanced flavors. The balsamic and lavender notes were subtle, just enough to leave a pleasantly aromatic finish without overwhelming the creamy base.

🍦 Delicious Ice Cream:
The ice cream at Bi-Rite Creamery is genuinely delicious. It's rich, creamy, and clearly made with high-quality ingredients, resulting in fantastic flavors that truly satisfy.

😊 Super Friendly Staff:
The staff here are incredibly friendly and welcoming. As first-time visitors, we especially appreciated how accommodating they were, allowing us to sample quite a few flavors before we settled on our choices. This made the experience even more enjoyable.

👍 First-Timer Friendly:
Their willingness to let us sample multiple flavors made our first visit a very positive and memorable one. It's great for discovering new favorites.

📍 Overall Impression:
Bi-Rite Creamery is a must-visit for ice cream lovers in San Francisco. The combination of delicious ice cream and wonderfully friendly service makes for a truly delightful experience. Highly recommended!

I visited this place on a Sunday afternoon and had to wait about 25 minutes in line—but it was absolutely worth it!
I went for the Make Your Own sundae, and it turned out to be the best choice ever. I picked Black Sesame, Salted Caramel, and Peanut Butter flavors, and topped it with spiced pecans, caramelized bananas, hot fudge, and, of course, whipped cream. It was incredibly delicious!
I totally recommend checking this place out!

top_10.name: San Francisco's Hometown Creamery
top_10.address: 1290 9th Ave, San Francisco, CA 94122, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Stopped in for an treat after I had a long walk through GGP. Great service, what these girls have to deal with is crazy. I hope they are making great $$$.
So the ice cream was good, not great, but good. I will go back and try another flavor.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: They have flights of ice cream! It is a brilliant idea to be able to try 5 different flavours. Vegan options available and açai was very good and unique. The mint chip had a nice natural mint flavour and the strawberry was the best strawberry ever (so I’m told).

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Tried a staple (Madagascar vanilla) and a flavor that is on rotation (Lemon Blueberry). We liked the light and fresh taste of the special flavor.  The vanilla could have been more vanilla-y. I do like the smidge sizing.  We got a double smidge. (For those of us watching our waistline) 😅 We even shared to get a little something post-lunch without feeling guilty later. Service was sweet and awesome. (Non-judgey)

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Flavors are limited but the Thai coconut was great but the chocolate sorbet was too bitter for me. I got vanilla ice cream with their homemade hot fudge and bought a brownie separately to add to my ice cream. Delicious! The worker also offered to warm up the brownie. Also the place was very neat.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: The best ice cream I’ve ever had. Their mint chocolate chip is made using 10 pounds of fresh mint. And their seasonal coffee ice cream tasted like actual coffee. Their homemade waffle cone was worth trying as well. Unfortunately they only allow 1 sample per customer but honestly all their flavors are worth trying once

testimonials:

So the ice cream was good, not great, but good. I will go back and try another flavor.

Tried a staple (Madagascar vanilla) and a flavor that is on rotation (Lemon Blueberry). We liked the light and fresh taste of the special flavor.  The vanilla could have been more vanilla-y. I do like the smidge sizing.  We got a double smidge. (For those of us watching our waistline) 😅 We even shared to get a little something post-lunch without feeling guilty later. Service was sweet and awesome. (Non-judgey)

top_10.name: Polly Ann Ice Cream
top_10.address: 3138 Noriega St, San Francisco, CA 94122, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Polly Ann has the best black sesame ice cream (imo) and I'll keep coming back for it when I visit SF! It's nutty and creamy - super sesame-forward which I like.

I also appreciate the huge variety of flavors they have. The wheel is also super fun.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Great ice cream shop! The flavor selection is great, there are a lot of dairy free and vegan options, and the staff was exceptionally polite and helpful. The cost is very reasonable for SF too.  I got dairy free strawberry with fruity pebbles and the hubs got brigadeiro. The location is nestled in a neighborhood but not very close to main attractions. Please note: there are no public restrooms and seating is limited.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Delicious ice cream! I got the cookie dough. Huge portions and super creamy. Very sweet after a few bites.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Love this local ice cream shop! A great pick-me-up if you’re having a hard day, or a fantastic treat to top off an already good day! They have so many delicious and unique flavors. Star Wars is my favorite! They even do pup cones, which my dog absolutely LOVES! I like taking friends and family here, and I always recommend it to tourists!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This ice cream place offers a fun beach vibe and a great selection of unique ice cream. While the atmosphere inside is somewhat generic with limited seating, the staff is friendly and helpful. Street parking is the only option, but it's also a not-bad spot to enjoy an ocean view.

testimonials:
Polly Ann has the best black sesame ice cream (imo) and I'll keep coming back for it when I visit SF! It's nutty and creamy - super sesame-forward which I like.

I also appreciate the huge variety of flavors they have. The wheel is also super fun.

I got dairy free strawberry with fruity pebbles and the hubs got brigadeiro. The location is nestled in a neighborhood but not very close to main attractions. Please note: there are no public restrooms and seating is limited.
Delicious ice cream! I got the cookie dough. Huge portions and super creamy. Very sweet after a few bites.

top_10.name: Smuggler's Cove
top_10.address: 650 Gough St, San Francisco, CA 94102, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I don’t understand what the 1-star reviews talking about. The service was amazing. After telling the barkeeper once my name he called me after my name. Our drinks were done under 10min. Very friendly stuff.
I can recommend to come before the rush like around 9pm. It’s easy to spent there 3-4h.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Worth dropping by for a drink, although not really designed to hang out. Strong drinks and limited seating kind of make you feel like you’re intended to move along. Drinks were really tasty and aesthetically presented, and the line outside moved pretty quickly, so I’d go again if in town, but wouldn’t be a regular. A worthwhile novelty to experience at least once.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This place! So mysterious and adorable! When you first walk in you’re like, “Oh my where am I going?” Then you enter this super cute place and you see a different place here in San Francisco. You are transported to Captain Jake’s place or something. I don’t think I am doing it justice so you will have to try it yourself! Servers were so great and attentive and the drinks delicious! . I truly hope you #enjoy and keep following me on my journey to finding these gems and sharing them with you ❤️. All love!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Some of the best tiki vibes you can find at a tiki bar. Even has a 2 story water fall!
Drinks are top notch across the board.
You do have to order at the bar at this establishment. They’ll call your name when your drinks are ready. Many tiki bars I’ve been to in the past will have someone wait on you. It can be a little busy at times.

A little disappointed that there were no fiery drinks or group drinks.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
This is an amazing part of tiki history, worth visiting at least once. The service was good. The drinks were solid, though leaned sweeter than I expected, especially the Zombie (not pictured). My favorite was the Rum Barrel. The presentation of the drinks was somewhat understated.

I think “tiki culture” has come a long way, with incredible bars in SF and elsewhere. Perhaps Smuggler’s Cove hasn’t quite kept up. Still a great spot and worth a visit though!

top_10.name: Pacific Cocktail Haven
top_10.address: 550 Sutter St, San Francisco, CA 94108, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Stopped by on a Sunday night and it did not disappoint. The place was lively with great music and a fun crowd. The bartenders were friendly, the service was on point, and the drinks were creative and well-made. Definitely a solid spot if you're looking for a high-energy cocktail bar with a great vibe.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
PCH was on our list of bars to hit during this trip to the city. What a fantastic choice we made! "T", our bartender, was awesome. Engaging, super knowledgeable, and just a pleasure to talk to. Made the visit THAT more enjoyable!
Incredible craft cocktails here at Pacific Cocktail Haven! If you're in San Francisco, you need to stop by. Opens at 5pm...

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: If you're not on a budget, and enjoy unique cocktails, then this place is for you. Visiting from Seattle, this bar was recommended as a place to try in the downtown SF area. Going on a Tuesday evening, it was not busy at all. We stuck with the Whiskey section of the menu, trying the Tropical Gangsta, Kung Fu Panda and Thrilla in Manila. I'd say out of those three, the Thrilla in Manila was my favorite. If I go back to SF, I'll surely visit this place again.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
A must if you visit SF and enjoy cocktails.

They have a long list of drinks and everyone would find one that they would enjoy. It gets crowded, but we were able to find seats a little late into the night.

Definitely a younger vibe, but not a crazy crowd.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This was our first stopping place of the night, and it was a great place to begin. We came shortly after they opened and were able to snag a section. They have both interior and exterior seating. The interior is well designed and doesn't make it feel small.  They have a great selection of spirits and cocktail list. I had the Malty By Nature, which was a japanese single malt based and a little more on the spirit forward side, but tasty. My friend had their Thrilla in Manilla, and that had more of a refreshing taste. The staff here were friendly and attentive. I would come back here again to try more of their drinks.

top_10.name: Blackbird
top_10.address: 2124 Market St, San Francisco, CA 94114, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
This Bar is really nice .
Cocktails are good .
I ‘ m not drinking alcohol at moment and the bartender made me his favorite drink ,
a mohito without alcohol .
The bartender who helped me ,
I can tell that he love what he does.
Looking at him making drinks it could be almost hypnotic.
The perfect timing , the way he poor and pick  items , herbs and etc
He know  what he does .
They host meet ups a few times a month
Wich is fun.
Lots of Gay people and the location is good.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: We went to this bar for a business mixer. The atmosphere is incredible. The staff is super friendly. The drinks were spot on. We will definitely go back!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Stopped in on a Friday night, had a great time. Tasty prebatched cocktails as well as handmade stuff. Very friendly staff too

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Bartender Megan is a KILLER behind the bar. John Taffer himself would say this bar runs on Megan.

She made the best drinks and she was working the whole night without a break compared to her other coworkers. She knows a good cocktail and made sure to straw test every drink we ordered.

Every bar needs more Megan!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Great drinks, good service

top_10.name: Cityscape
top_10.address: 333 O'Farrell St, San Francisco, CA 94102, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
My wife and I went here on a Tuesday night.

I ordered a Mont Gay Black Barell Rum and Coke. And my wife had a Coppola Director's Cut Red Wine. Both drinks were very good.

Beautiful view of San Francisco. Friendly servers. Relaxing atmosphere. We will definitely visit here again.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This place was very cute! It had a gorgeous panoramic view of SF. Occasionally our views were distorted by classic SF fog, but for the most part it was beautiful during the day time. I can only imagine the night lights would be even better. The drinks were pricey and the food was appetisers only. I recommend the cheeseboard with cocktails as a relaxed prequel to a nice date night dinner. Perfect atmosphere for chitchatting with your loved ones.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Gorgeous view, and crazy contrast from what's going on outside this building. A glass of beer is $17 but it's definitely worth it.

While you get to this building, on reasonable sidewalks, and crowds of homeless people, and then you get a royal view and crazy contrast.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: The décor marries modern minimalism with mythological motifs. The Celestial Sisters, once hidden in a historic theater, now watch over patrons in modern form, adding narrative depth and aesthetic nuance. The bar menu showcases imaginative craft cocktails such as the Nightfall, Midheaven, and more, each offering a creative and elevated drinking experience.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
The panoramic skyline views are simply unbeatable, especially during sunset. It's the perfect spot to unwind with a cocktail while taking in iconic landmarks like the Golden Gate Bridge, Alcatraz, City Palace, Salesforce tower and Bay bridge.

The ambiance is sleek and modern, with comfortable seating and a relaxed vibe. The drink menu is creative, and the small bites are tasty, though a bit on the pricey side. Service was friendly, but it did take a while to get our drinks during peak hours.

testimonials:
My wife and I went here on a Tuesday night.

I ordered a Mont Gay Black Barell Rum and Coke. And my wife had a Coppola Director's Cut Red Wine. Both drinks were very good.

Beautiful view of San Francisco. Friendly servers. Relaxing atmosphere. We will definitely visit here again.

top_10.name: Local Edition
top_10.address: 691 Market St, San Francisco, CA 94105, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: No food here, but that's okay the cool underground jazz club feel was just what I needed for a late night escapade. The drinks were good and fairly priced. I would recommend you read all the funky news papers on the wall and take a closer look at all the type writers on the wall. 8.1/10

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Lounge bar with live jazz music, a nice selection of cocktails, great interior, no food but there is a pizza place just outside. Nice place for any occasion 💜

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: We stumbled upon this spot late at night while on the hunt for a drink — and honestly, it was a vibe. A super cool underground bar with an intimate, low-lit atmosphere that instantly set the mood. It was definitely on the louder side (as expected), but that only added to the energy of the place. The drinks? Spot on. We didn’t end up ordering any food — pretty sure the kitchen had already wrapped up for the night — but that didn’t take away from the experience. We wrapped up and headed out around 1:20 AM, feeling like the night owed us nothing. Overall, a solid late-night find.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This place isn't quite a speakeasy, but it does have the vibes of one. The reservations were a bit hard to get, so plan ahead. The live music was a massive boost to the ambiance. The espresso martini was really good but the Old  Fashioned was rather disappointing. There aren't many thrills about this location, but it is pretty nice. If I travel here again, I will give another shot.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I had such a nice time here! The vibes of this are immaculate down to all the details. The typewriters, suitcases, and newspapers provide the perfect decor and the dark lighting give everything a dreamy romantic look. The place is deceptively large but that actually works against it because some of the back seats seem like they have no view of the stage at all.

Bartenders are all very friendly and knowledgeable. Tried four different drinks on the menu and each had it's own unique flavor. Some, like the under market, had weird flavor combinations that I felt didn't work well together. My favorite was the Dublin down because I'm a sucker for egg white foam in a cocktail and also the different components of the drink gave it a great depth of flavor. They had a fantastic espresso martini even if it still doesn't beat my personal favorite in SF (Persona on sutter street,btw).

I made reservations based on recommendations from other reviews but they didn't seem necessary for a random Wednesday night. That being said, it seems like a reservation does get you a better seat.

Finally, obviously have to talk about the live music. It's the thing that ties all the different elements of this bar together to form the perfect experience. Nothing else in the world can compare to the vibe of listening to live jazz in a low lit room while sipping on a craft cocktail. It really feels like stepping back in time.

testimonials: No food here, but that's okay the cool underground jazz club feel was just what I needed for a late night escapade. The drinks were good and fairly priced. I would recommend you read all the funky news papers on the wall and take a closer look at all the type writers on the wall. 8.1/10

top_10.name: Owl Tree
top_10.address: 601 Post St, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: The bartender recommended the lychee martini & the cucumber mint gimlet. Both were absolutely delicious. Music was on point the whole time. I really liked this place! Walked here from the Hilton no problem.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: We hosted a corporate event at The Owl Tree, and it was absolutely perfect! Adrianna and the bartending staff were fantastic, making sure our signature cocktails were spot on and our guests were well taken care of. The security team was exceptional, managing our guest list and promptly notifying us of any issues. We also had custom decor, and the Owl Tree team handled all the details with ease, coordinating everything flawlessly so we didn’t have to intervene much. Their dedication to ensuring everything went off without a hitch was truly impressive. Highly recommend The Owl Tree for any event!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I had a fantastic time at The Owl Tree Bar! The atmosphere was cozy and inviting, with its dark-wood decor and comfortable black leather booths. Derrick, the bartender, was incredibly friendly and welcoming. I ended up staying longer just to chat with him. He made an amazing espresso martini that I highly recommend. Such a great spot to relax and enjoy some quality drinks!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Every time I’m in town, I make it a point to come back, Dasha is an amazing bartender, and Jared the barback is just as great. They’re always fast, friendly, and create such a warm atmosphere. It’s that kind of genuine service that keeps me coming back. Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
My personal favorite here in San Francisco. Warm, cozy and friendly. This bar is surrounded by some great hotels and hostels so you’re always going to meet someone from somewhere interesting who dropped in for a drink. The bartenders and staff are the friendliest you’ll find. They boast a great selection of beers both bottled and tap and cocktails are perfect. They also let you play music for free so yeah… 10/10

I would upload more photos but it’s just me and my friends going absolutely bonkers at the bar.

top_10.name: Evil Eye
top_10.address: 2937 Mission St, San Francisco, CA 94110, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: If you are looking for a bar with a cool vibe, unique food and drinks. You should try this place. The staff was friendly and the drink and was was really good. Not typical bar food. More upscale. I went in a Friday around 5:30 it was empty but by time I left at 9 it was packed! Definitely worth a try

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Don't raise your eyebrows or give me the evil look, the evil eye hits its mark. It has a cool vibe, attracting a wide range of customers from young to old. It's loungey, it's low key but the cocktails are high class.  The bartenders know their craft and make you feel at home.  You can chill out or do some remote work.  Play some pool or chat up a new face.  I didn't try their food but their drink selection was worth the trip.  Next time I ll sample their food .

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Vibes are immaculate, great tunes. Matt the bartender makes one of the best funky daiquiris I’ve had.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I absolutely love Evil Eye! Great service even on a busy night, always friendly and attentive. The decor is super eclectic and cool—there's something fun to look at everywhere you turn. It gives off a laid-back, quirky vibe that makes it a great place to hang out with friends or just unwind. The bar menu is creative and fun, and the drinks are just as unique as the space itself.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: When I was a kid, my grandfather used to do this old Italian ritual to ward off the Evil Eye. Which might explain why it took me so long to find this place. Thanks a lot, Nonno. Evil Eye has it all. Superb cocktails, excellent food, a really inviting atmosphere with comfortable couches and tons of space, friendly and skilled staff, and if you’re somehow looking for more there’s pinball and a pool table. Allora, non preoccuparti del malocchio. 🤘🏻

top_10.name: The House Of Shields
top_10.address: 39 New Montgomery St, San Francisco, CA 94105, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
One of the oldest bars in SF, very interesting drinks and good vibes.
Much smaller than I expected.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I have found a new favorite bar. Wandered in because I was curious, and was pleasantly surprised. It's a historic bar with GORGEOUS interiors, friendly service, fun historical anecdotes, and there was live music when I was there. I will definitely be back, and hopefully in time to catch the sandos!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Ver cool old-school bar. It was very quiet at 3pm on a Thursday. I had a Manhattan, which was delicious. Recommended!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This bar lives up to its reputation. The cocktails are modern twists on classics. My biggest beef nowadays with so many cocktail lounges is a poorly balanced cocktails. This staple of SF maintains a reputation for quality and craftsmanship. The cocktails were well balanced and flavorful. Great walk back in time with this gem.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Loved Lemony Snicket. Nice cocktail. Nice atmosphere and service. Would go again.

testimonials:
One of the oldest bars in SF, very interesting drinks and good vibes.
Much smaller than I expected.

I have found a new favorite bar. Wandered in because I was curious, and was pleasantly surprised. It's a historic bar with GORGEOUS interiors, friendly service, fun historical anecdotes, and there was live music when I was there. I will definitely be back, and hopefully in time to catch the sandos!
Ver cool old-school bar. It was very quiet at 3pm on a Thursday. I had a Manhattan, which was delicious. Recommended!

top_10.name: The View Lounge
top_10.address: 780 Mission St, San Francisco, CA 94103, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: If you're in the mood for a center-city view from a great vantage point and great cocktails, The View is the perfect lounge to go to. The bar, while not the biggest, has a great selection of spirits and the bartenders are quite talented. The drinks here are a but pricey, but you're paying for the view. They do have food that is great, but I personally wouldn't come here for dinner, but instead to relax and hang out with friends for a couple drinks and overlook the city. The atmosphere is upbeat and the service was pretty good for how busy it can get.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
The food was really tasty — truly excellent in terms of flavor. However, we found it quite pricey for the portion sizes, which were very small despite being delicious. Service was good.

The view is beautiful. We went around sunset and sat on the side with a view toward the bay — it was lovely, but for sunset, we’d recommend the opposite side of the building, where you can actually watch the sun go down. That view is even more special.

To eat, we ordered the chips, which came out hot, crispy, and not greasy at all. They were served with hummus, which was light and fresh.
We also had two mini burger pairs — absolutely delicious! The doneness of the meat, the goat cheese, and the sauce made for a perfect combination.
Lastly, we ordered the scallops (you get two), which were outstanding, with a sauce that really complemented the dish. Highly recommend those!

To drink, we had just a glass of wine and tap water.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Loved that it was seat-yourself—no wait for a host! The lounge had a relaxed vibe, reasonably priced drinks, and an ambient atmosphere.
Didn’y get the chance to order food as we came here for drinks after dinner.
Super stunning view of the city skyline. Definitely worth a visit.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: We visited for the view and a few drinks on a Thursday night. Not too crowded, but nearly full. Beautiful view and relaxed atmosphere. Our server was great and friendly.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Excellent place to be at if you are in Mariott Marquis in SFO. The atmosphere was really good, crowded most of the days , it opens till midnight so a good place to hangout
The food quality was good. I ordered mushroom dish and it was fantastic. The presentatiin and taste was awes8me.
The quantity/size of the dishes are not fulsome so you would need to order at least 2 items if you are hungry . Each irem costs 20-30 dollars so on an average a bill if 50-60$ per person if one dish and one drink

top_10.name: Tunnel Top Lounge and Bar
top_10.address: 601 Bush St, San Francisco, CA 94108, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: we came here after our group sang karaoke nearby. the atmosphere, selection of drinks and a friendly staff made our first time here an unforgettable one. we will definitely come back. we didn't order food as we had just eaten. the price point was within range along that area. come visit the iconic tunnel top bar!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: What a great neighborhood bar! We were staying in a hotel close by and stopped in last night and we had a great time. Anders the bartender is really terrific. Friendly and treated everyone in there so well from the regulars to the newcomers. San fran prices but a good happy hour.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Great music, great drinks and even more amazing prices. If you're looking for some rare whiskey for a great price, check out their top shelf. Pappy, Thomas H Handy, etc. They even offer flights.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I was told this was a dive bar worth checking out.  In reality it's an awesome bar on top of Stockton tunnel with a chill, everyone is welcome, kind of vibe.  The drinks are phenomenal.  This place has some of the best cocktails at the best prices in the area.  They have high end bourbon on the cheap if that's your thing.  All of the cocktail's are very reasonably priced compared to area bars.  The volume of customers this place sees is due to the high level of craftsmanship, speed of service, and quality you are getting for the price.  Definitely stop by by a cocktail!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Small cosy place, crazy good vibe n drinks

top_10.name: Prime BBQ
top_10.address: 33 W 25th Ave, San Mateo, CA 94403, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Vibe and atmosphere  of this place is great. Food is very good. I will definitely recommend this place to everyone. Such a great yakitori restaurant in San Mateo. This is just an another restaurant added in my favorite list.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Asian owned Japanese and Chinese skewer place. Nice staff, the Japanese skewers were better than the Chinese ones. My favorite was actually the shiitake mushroom I forgot to take a picture of. The oyster and scallop were good and fresh. Got a free Thai tea with a cute iced bear  for leaving a review, good flavor and not too sweet. (kinda sad only his head was left, looked like he was drowning! lol) The Wagyu and regular beef skewers had too many tendons, made it chewy. The udon had good flavor and chewy consistency. Cute setup and ambiance. Nice staff that check up on you periodically. Food may take a little bit to arrive since they need to grill them all individually. Complimentary Kim Chi and seaweed salad. Has a grill to keep your skewers warm. Scan the QR code to order. They are open late and have happy hour! They also give out free ice cream for a Google review.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Cute skewer BBQ spot in San Mateo! They have a great selection of quality meats, seafood, and veggies; everything looked fresh and well-prepared. We focused just on the skewers and the garlic grilled eggplant this time (which was excellent), so I can’t speak to the entrees yet.

The skewers were fantastic—perfectly grilled, flavorful, and nicely seasoned. The garlic eggplant was great too: tender, and packed with flavor.

The ambience is cozy and stylish, with a fun, upbeat vibe. Despite being busy, the staff was incredibly friendly, which made the whole experience even better.

Also, bonus points for the Thai iced tea ice cube bear.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Prime BBQ is hands down one of the best barbecue spots I’ve tried. The brisket was incredibly tender with a beautiful smoke ring, and the ribs just fell off the bone. Every bite was full of deep, smoky flavor. The sides were just as impressive—especially the creamy mac and cheese and the tangy coleslaw. The portions are generous, the service is friendly, and the overall vibe is laid-back and welcoming. If you’re in the area and craving real BBQ, Prime BBQ is a must-visit. I’ll definitely be back!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Great food, although service is a bit slow. Don’t sleep on the crispy pork belly. The prime rib was good as well

top_10.name: Capelo's Barbecue
top_10.address: 2655 Middlefield Rd, Redwood City, CA 94063, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Wow! What a great place!? Super nice servers, especially the lady at the counter (so warm and wonderful), great beef brisket, delicious baked beans and scary good kale slaw (we were so hungry that we forgot to take photos..)
And the place is CLEAN. Every table was pristine and a staff member was regularly working on keeping it that way.
Highly recommend!
The atmosphere is also really nice, relaxed and cute with lots of potted plants that someone cares for very well.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Delicious barbecue joint in Redwood City. The beef brisket was amazingly soft and moist, possibly the best brisket I’ve had on the Peninsula. Pulled pork was juicy, and the Mac and cheese and creamed corn were both very good. Fast and friendly service. Small parking lot with limited parking, though.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
As a Texan, I must say that the ribs and brisket are just okay. The sides are decent as well. I wouldn't recommend the cilantro peanut slaw or the seasonal sauteed vegetables. The desserts however looked phenomenal!

The interior is very nice and clean and the people here were awesome! It was a good dining experience overall.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Food was amazing,  they have 4 sauces available along with free jalapeños, pickles &pickled red onions. Got the Brisket, Ribs & jalapeño / cheese sausage. It's a little pricey but well worth the treat. This was $40

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
A Smokin' Good Time at Capelo’s BBQ!

My first time dining and I'm hooked! If you're in the area and craving amazing barbecue, you've gotta stop by.

I devoured the brisket – tender, smoky, and absolutely delicious. They have a great selection of sauces available to add extra flavor to your meat, and the pickles and pickled onions were a perfect tangy addition. My sides, mac & cheese and peanut slaw, were also on point.

They've got great outdoor seating and a convenient beer spot. Highly recommend!

As a Texan, I must say that the ribs and brisket are just okay. The sides are decent as well. I wouldn't recommend the cilantro peanut slaw or the seasonal sauteed vegetables. The desserts however looked phenomenal!

The interior is very nice and clean and the people here were awesome! It was a good dining experience overall.

top_10.name: Henry's World Famous Hi-Life
top_10.address: 301 W St John St, San Jose, CA 95110, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Their check-in process is a bit unusual, but make sense. When we arrive, we had to get a number. When our number was up, the host came to take our order and we continued to wait at the bar. Then when the table was ready, we got seated and the food came quickly. Unusual, but quite efficient process.

I went there specifically for their prime rib. I would say it was average. The pork belly side order was very good!  Their Long Island Ice tea was quite strong.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: High-quality steaks, chicken, and ribs in the little italy section of San Jose. A little different setup. Go in and take a number. Wait for your number to be called and place your order, where they'll take your name. Wait for your name to be called, and you'll be taken back to your seat. From there, the food comes fast. Note: you order from the wall, but it doesn't list everything (e.g. - Mac n' cheese, which is really good). Ribs were great. Sirloin was decent.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: So the hi-life has been there my entire life and it never fails even back in the day when flooding used to be a problem they would rally and become even more awesome. Every time I come to town it's my very first stop I literally go from the airport to the Hi-Life and as always they deliver amazing food and a fabulous atmosphere with super great employees! This will continue to be in my very first stop anytime I travel into the state and back home as long as they exist 😊

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
As always, great service and food.
Authentic american bar and restaurant.

We ordered:
1. $29 Half rack of baby back Ribs + salad + baked potato
2. $29 Pork Chop + backed potato + salad

The portions are huge.

Thank you!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
This place is great. Very laid back while maintaining strong quality.

Came here for dinner after my flight got canceled and I had to spend an extra night in san jose. The bartender, Ryan, was awesome and had great banter.

Got the ribs and ribs plate and it was fantastic. Smoky and tasty. Excellent beer and booze selection as well.

If you want a relaxed venue that delivers great meat and alcohol, this spot is tough to beat.

top_10.name: Baby Blues BBQ
top_10.address: 3149 Mission St, San Francisco, CA 94110, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I'm not typically going for a BBQ joint but I think the warm weather or the moon position sort gave me the feeling of trying Baby Blues.  Honestly I'm happy I went and it for sure didn't give me the blues.  Yes the place is rustic some might call it funky but it works.  I like the big L shaped bar in the middle on which you can sit from both sides. That somehow gives you the opportunity to strike up conversations with random other guests or just enjoy the moment by yourself.
I tried their Cesar salad Mac and Cheese and pulled pork shoulder sandwich.  I like that the pork wasn't smothered in sauce .  Sauces came on the side so to each its own.  You can bathe in them, simply dip or forgo them.

The presentation is rather smartly done.  The Caesar , oh well it's a Caesar not much to say about it.  The mac and cheese was rather tasty but could have stayed in the oven a bit longer to make it a bit less saucy.  The pulled pork was tasty. I didn't care for the brioche as it loses its texture too quickly.   I'd love to try it on a French baguette or a sourdough roll with a crust and id add gruyere.  Again the sandwich was good it just gave me ideas on how I'd try to enhance it.

Well done thanks chef

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: So I finally decided to try this place. I tried out the sausage plate with a chile verde cheddar pork sausage that comes with rice & beans and cornbread. The flavor of the sausage was delicious but some of my beans were undercooked and hard. I thought the cornbread was horrible and lacked that cornbread texture and flavor. For a $27.16 price tag with a drink I was highly disappointed with only two small sausages. That was definitely not $30 worth of food or service when the guy played dominoes the whole time I was there with a customer. I highly doubt I will try anything else from here again!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Being from Austin, TX, I know good BBQ—and I’ll admit, I was skeptical about trying it away from home. But the craving hit hard, so I ordered ¼ lb pulled pork, ½ lb brisket, the Texas beef rib, and their mac & cheese. Everything was delicious!

The brisket stole the show: smoky, flavorful, and so tender I regretted not ordering a full pound. The Texas beef rib was a fun adventure—huge, meaty, and nicely smoked. I don’t usually eat beef ribs back home, but the Texan in me had to try it. Leftovers even made the perfect breakfast with eggs.

Pulled pork was flavorful and juicy—I skipped the sandwich so I could taste the meat on its own. (Pro tip: it’s just as good the next day in a quick sandwich.) And the mac & cheese? Creamy, cheesy perfection; true to the South. It could have been my #1, but I didn’t want to overshadow the BBQ. Leftovers from this meal fed me two more times—I basically walked out feeling like I got away with a steal.

A special shoutout to Jackie, the manager that night. She had the kind of warmth and hospitality that makes you feel like you’ve known her forever. She even indulged my Texan request for pickles with my BBQ (no judgment here!) and walked me through their sauces—each one worth trying, especially if you mix them for fun flavor combos.

Bottom line: I’ll be back. Next time I’ll try more of their menu (and fingers crossed for peach cobbler!). If you’re anywhere nearby, it’s worth the trip. They blend Southern BBQ beautifully—and yes, this Texas girl gives it a thumbs up.

Also, the atmosphere/ambiance of the restaurant is through and through a Southern vibe! IYKYK

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
What a surprise , stumble upon this quirky restaurant. So happy we did the food was amazing and service was fantastic. Very interesting layout and design. The root beer was the best I’ve had .
Have to order pig candy bacon .
If you in San Francisco you have give this place a go.
Thank you chef and waitress 🙏🏻.
If this review has been a help let me know ❤️

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I really like this place. I learned about them from the SF locals so during breaks from work I will find a park and come here and throw down. The food is always fresh and the staff is always friendly. I’ve tried multiple items here including the blackened catfish and the brisket which is awesome also. I like the beef links to. This is a laidback gem in the mission.

top_10.name: Hardwood Bar & Smokery
top_10.address: 680 8th St, San Francisco, CA 94103, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Perfect casual spot for ribs. Everything we had was great: beer, ribs, brisket “chilli” cheese fries. It didn’t really taste like chilli perse but still phenomenal. The bbq sauce is the perfect balance of sweet and tangy! Must try!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I mean come on… look at that plate! It was so good that I went back for a second time in just a few days. It’s phenomenal BBQ, actually better than I would have expected out of San Francisco. Both times, my server was the guy that kinda favors Pete Davidson (You’ll see). Guy does a great job and is super friendly. My only critique is the potato salad. I grew up on the other side of the country so i’m not used to having potato salad with the skin still on it. To each their own, it wasn’t terrible— just odd for me.

Overall, I’d definitely recommend to anyone and I’ll definitely be back myself.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: One of the best bbq restaurants in San Francisco. They do an incredible job with smoking their meats. Really solid menu, the nachos are probably my favorite item on the menu. It’s hard to mimic good bbq in these parts but Hardwood is stepping up and killing it.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: The barbecue fork spare ribs was really soft and delicious. Smoked smell was very good. But the brisket was too dry and hard. The atmosphere of the restaurant was good, the staff was very friendly, and it was impressive that they were tactful to meet our demands.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: The BBQ is awesome. The meat is very smoked and seasoned. The meat is fall off the bone. It's not a fatty cut of meat, but still very flavorful. The service was great, very friend and helpful with the menu. I also had the Fieldwork IPA which was goo as well, a slightly hazy flavor. The atmosphere was casual and fun. A definite must try.

top_10.name: Tommy's Joynt
top_10.address: 1101 Geary Blvd, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I love this joint!! I love the go to the counter and get what you want freshly sliced and delicious 😋.  I am a sucker for Thanksgiving dinner and this place delivers deliciously. You have to ask for cranberry sauce but I can forgive that. The stuffing is delicious but I don't care for the texture I like mine less wet. The gravy is divine mashed potatoes are real. The guys behind the counter are great and seem to be used to people not knowing what to order because it all looks so good . The bartenders were great and made excellent suggestions.  I have been here multiple times during my visit to San Francisco.  Do not miss out on this joint! Get a filling meal at a reasonable price and make sure you do not skip those house made pickles 😋 . I am not a pickle guy but these were exceptional. The charm of this place oozes old school and a no nonsense way of doing things. If you have read this review thank you. You have been great I have been Mike C!!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: WHAT A JOINT!!!! Love this place. Its old, gritty and good like I like it. The pastrami is fantastic and the green beans are outstanding. This is a stand up order and seat yourself bar that is a staple to San Fran. They do it right and it is super affordable….two can eat for under $50 without a problem. Its old school with simply spectacular MEATS!!!!!! Its worth the walk.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: For what it is, 5 stars. It’s a classic S.F. joint, with a hot plate of healthy food and other options You can walk through the buffet, see and choose from 5 or so meats, combine it with mashed potatoes and or green beans, salad or baked beans, and a sourdough or soft roll; large plate is 18, and small is 13.50. It's a big plate of food, a whole and complete meal, for less than $20. But of course we tip so it's a bit more than that. You order at the buffet and pay there, get your food on a tray and seat yourself. This is an old school diner and bar combo, and it looks it. Cozy.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: 3.3/5 for the food. Got the pastrami sandwich on a wheat bread. The restaurant is pretty old and it’s pretty confusing on what to order. The price is decent but I think the food was average and nothing special. Reminds me of langers in LA for the vibes but less cleaner. The old folks at the counter were pretty nice though

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Got my fill of Corned beef and pastrami while I was in SF.  I just took it back to my room but the bar looked pretty cozy to spend some time at night. Super well spiced and tasty!

testimonials: I love this joint!! I love the go to the counter and get what you want freshly sliced and delicious 😋.  I am a sucker for Thanksgiving dinner and this place delivers deliciously. You have to ask for cranberry sauce but I can forgive that. The stuffing is delicious but I don't care for the texture I like mine less wet. The gravy is divine mashed potatoes are real. The guys behind the counter are great and seem to be used to people not knowing what to order because it all looks so good . The bartenders were great and made excellent suggestions.  I have been here multiple times during my visit to San Francisco.  Do not miss out on this joint! Get a filling meal at a reasonable price and make sure you do not skip those house made pickles 😋 . I am not a pickle guy but these were exceptional. The charm of this place oozes old school and a no nonsense way of doing things. If you have read this review thank you. You have been great I have been Mike C!!

WHAT A JOINT!!!! Love this place. Its old, gritty and good like I like it. The pastrami is fantastic and the green beans are outstanding. This is a stand up order and seat yourself bar that is a staple to San Fran. They do it right and it is super affordable….two can eat for under $50 without a problem. Its old school with simply spectacular MEATS!!!!!! Its worth the walk.

For what it is, 5 stars. It’s a classic S.F. joint, with a hot plate of healthy food and other options You can walk through the buffet, see and choose from 5 or so meats, combine it with mashed potatoes and or green beans, salad or baked beans, and a sourdough or soft roll; large plate is 18, and small is 13.50. It's a big plate of food, a whole and complete meal, for less than $20. But of course we tip so it's a bit more than that. You order at the buffet and pay there, get your food on a tray and seat yourself. This is an old school diner and bar combo, and it looks it. Cozy.

top_10.name: Horn Barbecue
top_10.address: 3422 Mount Diablo Blvd, Lafayette, CA 94549, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
We drove from Campbell to try this place, as the desire to find quality BBQ is very strong. Sadly, we were somewhat disappointed.
We arrived at 6 pm and they were announcing they didn't have any ribs left. We ordered 1lb of brisket ($40/lb), coleslaw, potato salad, and mac-n-cheese. The meat looks lovely but it didn't have any smokiness and it was somewhat dry. It wasn't tender even though it looked like it. Pouring more sauce on it didn't help much. 😔
The coleslaw was good. It had a nice vinegar/mustard flavor and was better than most we've had. We were thankful it wasn't thick with mayonnaise.
The potato salad was pretty good too. It was creamy and the potato pieces were of good size. We would've liked some more onion and maybe a little less creamy.
The mac-n-cheese was a disappointment. It was overcooked and the cheese mixture wasn't creamy nor flavorful. Finding good quality mac-n-cheese with real cheddar and a crisp top is hard to find.
The staff is very nice but the interior is REALLY smokey. To the point of making our eyes water instantly. The chairs are the usual metal hard simple chairs and we had to eat outside due to the smoke inside. There were no paper towel rolls outside but at least we found seating.
One disappointment is that they had their catering van in the handicap parking space and there was only one other in a higher level of the parking lot.
We are quite picky about our bbq and this just didn't have a shining star with what we tried. For $40/lb, the expectation was pretty high and was not met. We left the restaurant and went for additional eating at The Hideout Kitchen.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
While it’s not quite on the same level as Horn in Oakland, this spot still serves up some good BBQ. The brisket was just okay — tender enough but lacking that deep, smoky punch I was hoping for. The ribs, on the other hand, were the star of the show: fall-off-the-bone tender, well-seasoned, and packed with flavor that keeps you reaching for the next bite.

The real surprise was the potato salad — hands down some of the best I’ve ever had. Perfectly creamy with just the right amount of tang, it could honestly hold its own as the main reason to stop by.

It’s definitely on the pricier side, but that’s the reality of upscale BBQ these days. If you’re a ribs fan and appreciate top-tier sides, it’s worth a visit.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: This is the best BBQ place! Everything is delicious, juicy and perfectly done. Had fun talking to the owner about “rib theory” and ribs having a slight bite vs overcooking them to fall off the bone. He was right. They are way better with a slight bite. We had a blast. Highly recommend! 😎

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Stopped into HORN Barbecue for lunch and was completely blown away. The brisket was incredibly tender and smoky, the mac & cheese was perfectly creamy, and the baked beans had an amazing sweet and savory flavor. Everything was absolutely delicious.

To top it off, the customer service was fantastic—friendly, attentive, and really made us feel welcome. This place is a must-try! Can't wait to come back.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Had a fantastic lunch at Horn BBQ today. Jordan & crew were incredibly hospitable from the moment we walked in, helping us through the menu & walking us through their process. The food not only looked amazing, but tasted superb. The standout in particular was the brisket - perfect amount of fat and the crust was phenomenal. Will absolutely be back here or to their location in Oakland!

top_10.name: Breakwater Barbecue
top_10.address: 10151 Cabrillo Hwy, El Granada, CA 94018, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
The sides were fantastic. The BBQ was, by my admittedly very high BBQ standards, good but not great.

The brisket was dense, had a nice bark, and was tasty, but didn't achieve the tenderness of excellent brisket. I wanted to love it but could only like it. Don't get me wrong, I'd eat there if I was going to be on that side of the peninsula, but I wouldn't go there for that alone.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Great new space off Highway 1. Texas-style barbecue in Half Moon Bay Area in small town of El Granada. Food is absolutely legit! Burnt ends banh mi is delicious and the brisket chili is absolute perfection! Smoked brisket by the 1/2 lb was so tender and melted as I picked it up with a fork. I don’t know how they sliced it without it breaking up. The pork ribs were great per my wife! I would not recommend the mini loaf cornbread for $5 because it is definitely not worth $5. The size of it is like the cornbread Boston market used to sell. I think they were $1 when they were around. I am definitely coming to this barbecue joint regularly from now on to try everything eventually! I am so glad they picked this vacant spot because now they will get even more attention from drivers on Highway 1 that will see the long lines out the doors.

Update June 8, 2025:
Went for a second visit today to try more things on the menu.
1) Breakwater Burger - Very good smoke and meat! Needs BBQ sauce in my opinion for the true barbecue theme.
2) Reuben brisket pastrami - Very excellent overall from the bread to the cheese on the meat! Definitely going to order this regularly!
3) Birria brisket tacos - The meat inside the tacos were excellent and the cheese with the tortilla were excellent! The chamote dip was lacking flavor to compliment the taco so I decided to pour the red BBQ sauce into the chamote sauce and that fixed the problem real good!

Signage outside is finally updated! Great service and better food!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
If you order take out, and you do it online, keep this in mind...They do NOT have curbside pickup.

Next, they do NOT provide anything to carry orders out in.  When I picked up my order, I was handed three (3) loose boxes with my order. I get that they may be trying to be green, but there are green options that don't have food boxes sliding across the back of my car.

Ok...for the food.

It was OK.  Not great, but OK.

We had their Brisket Cheesesteak.  I had their fries and we shared an order of their appetizer Brisket Street Tacos.

First, the tacos weren't an appetizer, it was a full meal. You can see the pictures attached. It was a huge order.

The cheesesteaks were dry and the meat looked like it went through a blender. What I mean there is that it was all very finely chopped which didn't make sense for a sandwich as EVERYTHING fell out as soon as you picked it up.

Lastly, everything was quite salty. With BBQ, you should expect a little salt especially if they are using dry rubs.  But...it tasted like someone took a big shaker to the fries and meat because it was too much salt.

This was our first try with them as they just recently opened and I truly hope someone can be successful in that location. I just don't know that we will eat there again.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Best BBQ I've had, hands down! I highly recommend the brisket sandwich melt and the breakwater burger (it has chopped smoked brisket added), truly the most superb sandwich & burger I've eaten 😋

Congrats Wyatt & team on the prime new location!! Nothing like smelling BBQ from my backyard 😎

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Pluses and minuses for this small restaurant. Friendly wait staff, but they wouldn't let us put my Husband's birthday cake in the fridge. Limited seating, get your own water and utensils, brisket was inconsistent (lean slice on top, extra fatty slice underneath). I'll wait a while to come back; they are closed Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday.

top_10.name: 4505 Burgers & BBQ
top_10.address: 705 Divisadero St, San Francisco, CA 94117, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: We got the best burger, a half pound of brisket and a roll. To start, skip on any bread here they all suck. The roll was dry and flavorless, the white bread is not even wonder bread. The burger was extremely good, but considering it is just the burger on it's own it's a little pricey for what you are getting. Yes it is flavorful and juicy but it's not amazing. The brisket is good but it's more just run of the mill.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
We came as a group of six and ordered The Presidential, which includes five meats, five sides, and three fixins, plus warm buttery rolls. It also came with a big salad, so the table looked absolutely full — definitely a shareable, crowd-pleasing spread. Visually impressive and filling for sure.

The food was decent overall — nothing especially memorable in terms of flavor, but it covered all the BBQ basics. We tried brisket, pulled pork, smoked chicken, sausage, and ribs — all were fine, just not exceptional.

Service is minimal: you order from your phone, and they bring the food to the table, but everything else — sauces, napkins, water, cleanup — is entirely self-serve. Great for a relaxed, casual meal, but don’t expect full service. Still, it was a fun and easy group experience.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
The food here was mediocre at best. My two-meat plate, featuring dry brisket and ribs, was a letdown, though the pulled pork was acceptable and the upgraded spicy fries were good.

It was a busy holiday weekend but when I got seated, there were many spots available on the patio. However it did take 40 minutes for food to arrive, but they do bring your food to you which is nice. However what was really concerning was the staff's insistence that I refill my 16oz water bottle from an outdoor, warm-water handwashing station rather than at the water dispenser, despite my safety concerns.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: We stopped here to eat while in the City. It was delicious. The BBQ sandwich, the potato salad, the breakfast sandwich, baked beans, and chicken and fries were great. I recommend if you're in the area.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
got the two meats, beef brisket and pork shoulder, with spicy fries and coleslaw.

portion/price: the portions are small for the price.

taste: the meats are decent - they’re flavourful and tastes nice. however, we honestly expected better. spicy fries were GOOD. overall, a meal that gets the job done.

service: order and you’re given a number. they’ll bring it to your table and if they see you when you’re done, they’ll clear the table.

atmosphere: there are heaters which is a nice touch. nice vibes.

top_10.name: Smoking Pig BBQ
top_10.address: 1144 N 4th St, San Jose, CA 95112, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Great BBQ spot. Very casual. Plenty of parking (dedicated lot, some street parking). Great place to have lunch and enjoy some ribs, brisket and soda. Meat combo platters are reasonable and they include cornbread and a side. The sides are delicious. I had the potato salad today.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: The person whom I chose to refer to has hostess/ cashier/ waitress; was super she noticed my pain right away and seated me. She gave me time to review the menu. She patiently and excitedly went over the items and allowed me to choose. The food was sooo good. The greens truly southern style with a kick. I’m just happy not to have sugar in my greens to taste. The cornbread is really slap yo mama style. Want to go and get just cornbread. The ribs are smoked to perfection seasoned and fall of bone. The hot link sausage was a bit spicy for my taste but good no dought.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: The service and food were pretty good! I got the two meat combo platter for $22. For that price point, especially after tip and tax, I was expecting more meat... Otherwise the food itself was pretty decent

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
with a taco stand at every corner and hundreds of other places to choose from today's culinary adventure led me to try the smoking pig.

word of mouth and speaking with a few patrons who were eating one of them telling me they come here every other week I knew we made the right choice.

the smell of the various BBQ meats was intoxicating coming from the small little shop with blues playing in the background it was perfect the service was second to non and the different BBQ sauce at the table made every bite tasty and savory and phenomenal cannot say enough I highly recommend

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Out of the many local BBQ spots in San Jose, they are one of them.
Overall they aren't bad but nothing stands out either, it's fine, the mac & cheese was solid however.

The pricing is where they aren't a place I would recommend, it's just too high for the food and quality compared to other places nearby.

The person whom I chose to refer to has hostess/ cashier/ waitress; was super she noticed my pain right away and seated me. She gave me time to review the menu. top_10.name: HINODEYA Ramen & Bar Chestnut
top_10.address: 3340 Steiner St, San Francisco, CA 94123, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
HINODEYA Ramen 🍜 is one of the best franchise restaurant in San Francisco , this is my second time eating Japanese food, and I love it ,
My  friends try first time Japanese food, and they also like it, the staff was very friendly, Manager also very nice and kind person, Food is fantastic.
I highly recommend this restaurant.
I’m going to visit this restaurant soon  🥰❤️ it .

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Everything about our meal was spectacular. I ordered the Ultimate Scallop Ramen with Fried Spring Rolls and Edamame and my coworker chose the Spicy Ramen.

Both were spectacular. Tasty and hot the spot.  I ate every bite if that tells you anything.

Highly recommended!!!!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I love to eat here, at first I thought it was small resto. But its spacious inside. The Japanese guy who might be the owner/manager is really nice. Definitely will be back, if in the area again. We also love the food esp the ramen! 🇯🇵🍜🍥🥢

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Visited here for dinner, ordered chicken karage ramen bento and veg gyoza and ramen bento with creamy sauce. This combination is good value for the price. Food was very tasty and also service was excellent. Restaurant decor is very pleasing, specially in the back.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Great food, great vibe. Helpful staff. They sounded a gong when we entered 😀Definitely recommend if you’re into ramen.

top_10.name: Torraku Ramen - Lombard
top_10.address: 1449 Lombard St, San Francisco, CA 94123, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: The ramen was really good. Much better than what I can find in Toronto. The service was very welcoming. Plus was quiet and felt great after a long day in SF. If you’re near it. Check it out!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Had 2 of my dinners here during my stay at the Samesun Hotel a couple of steps away. The food here singlehandedly raised my impression of Japanese food. The seafood yakisoba is the absolute best stir-fried noodles I've ever had - and I've had amazing Asian food before. They are also generous with their portion and protein. The staff is super adorable and respectful. The wait time may be slightly longer than what I'm used to but you know they made their food with care and skills. Highly recommend - you have to try!!!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: The food was delicious. We went from 5-7pm which is their happy hour, (discounted prices on select dishes). I got the Katsu Don with pork. It was crispy and fresh. They also gave us some pistachio ice cream at the very end. Would highly recommend.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I got the beef yakisoba and my firend got seafood ramen—both were super tasty! The yakisoba had tender beef and great flavor, and the seafood ramen came with fresh shrimp and squid in a rich, comforting broth. Portion sizes were generous, and the service was smooth. Will definitely come back next time I’m craving ramen! Highly recommended.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
I got the Shoyu Ramen with the pork shoulder. I don't have any complaints at all but I'll start the rundown:

Bowl was full, Broth was yummy, meat was tender enough, egg was PERFECT, the table spices were so yummy, and the employees were kind! On top of that the bowl was fuller than I've seen a few others lately. I'll remember her for sure 💜.

What's cool too is that tip is included AND they gave me complimentary ice cream samples. 10/10

testimonials: The ramen was really good. Much better than what I can find in Toronto. The service was very welcoming. Plus was quiet and felt great after a long day in SF. If you’re near it. Check it out!

Had 2 of my dinners here during my stay at the Samesun Hotel a couple of steps away. The food here singlehandedly raised my impression of Japanese food. The seafood yakisoba is the absolute best stir-fried noodles I've ever had - and I've had amazing Asian food before. They are also generous with their portion and protein. The staff is super adorable and respectful. The wait time may be slightly longer than what I'm used to but you know they made their food with care and skills. Highly recommend - you have to try!!!

top_10.name: HINODEYA Ramen 680 Clay
top_10.address: 680 Clay St, San Francisco, CA 94111, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Honestly I was disappointed- I was really excited to try since this is one of my friends favorite restaurants and made her fall in love with San Francisco but it really did not do it for me. The meat wasn’t soft and barely had flavor. My friend said the meat is normally like this. The noodles were great though. I have heard other locations (like the Japantown one) aren’t as great but this did not match my expectations. Marafuku does a better job

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Very nice establishment, clean and comfortable. I encountered at least 4 different staff members, each of whom was friendly. The atmosphere was comfortable and no one made me feel like a baka gaijin. I had the fried shishito pepper appetizer and the house ramen [spicy level]. Absolutely delicious. The pork melted, the broth was delightful, and the noodles were perfect. Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Incredible restaurant!!  As soon as we walked inside we knew we were at the right restaurant because we were greeted by the nicest server, Paloma!  We ordered the most delicious Ramen !! Food came out quick! We highly recommend Hinodeya if you want delicious food and spectacular service!  5 stars! Thank you Paloma for the great service!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
For ramen in SF, this is the spot. With a variety of ramen and unique the scallop ramen was light bright with seafood cooked to perfection. It was a lovely and warming to the soul. While the fried Brussel sprouts did work as well.

Staff friendly and bathroom was clean.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Good Food, Friendly Service, small space.

We ordered Chicken Karaage, the Hinodeya Ramen, and the Spicy Miso Ramen. The Chicken Karaage was good. It tasted like dark meat, maybe chicken thigs, and the breading was crispy and light. Maybe a tempura or corn starch batter. Both the Ramens were good. The Hinodeya Ramen had a bit of a fishy taste, but not in a bad way. The Spicy Miso Ramen was good too, but I was expecting it to have more of a kick. I did only ask for it to be a level 2 though. Next time, I'll shoot for a 4 or 5. Either way, I didn't think I was going to be able to finish, but I polished off both of these bowls.

The service was good. They brought our ordered out super fast, were willing to bring us additional cups when asked, and were banding on a drum for when I assume they got a tip.

The atmosphere was fine. Pretty tiny. Family style bench seating.

testimonials: Honestly I was disappointed- I was really excited to try since this is one of my friends favorite restaurants and made her fall in love with San Francisco but it really did not do it for me. The meat wasn’t soft and barely had flavor. My friend said the meat is normally like this. The noodles were great though. I have heard other locations (like the Japantown one) aren’t as great but this did not match my expectations. Marafuku does a better job

Very nice establishment, clean and comfortable. I encountered at least 4 different staff members, each of whom was friendly. The atmosphere was comfortable and no one made me feel like a baka gaijin. I had the fried shishito pepper appetizer and the house ramen [spicy level]. Absolutely delicious. The pork melted, the broth was delightful, and the noodles were perfect. Highly recommend!

Incredible restaurant!!  As soon as we walked inside we knew we were at the right restaurant because we were greeted by the nicest server, Paloma!  We ordered the most delicious Ramen !! Food came out quick! We highly recommend Hinodeya if you want delicious food and spectacular service!  5 stars! Thank you Paloma for the great service!

top_10.name: Ushi Taro Ramen SOMA
top_10.address: 343 8th St, San Francisco, CA 94103, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Small joint that blew me away! The broth is packed with flavor, the meat nicely cut and the eggs perfectly cooked. But the best thing was their tempura mushrooms! OMG! And I'm not a big fan of fried food. Super recommend, give it a try!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: My husband found this place because we were nearby. He read good reviews so we decided to try eating there. The place was full of visitors, so we needed to wait a bit. The waitress was serious, but maybe because she was busy. Anyway, we appreciate when people smile, that gives us a feeling of welcoming. She was attentive, don’t get me wrong, but just serious. The food we ordered was great, I really liked their gyoza with salty soy sauce. Ramens were delicious, and keep it in mind that Traditional and spicy one gave the same broth, just spicy has spice. And yea, the bone barrow was salty and tasty too. The portions were huge. I think it’s possible to share between 2 people, especially if you don’t eat much. But if you are a big eater you will love this portion. The atmosphere was friendly, young people, couples, friends,  and us as a family. The music wasn’t so loud, thank God. I don’t like places with loud music that you can’t even hear each other. So that was a big + for me. It was warm inside, and cosy. So I would defiantly recommend visiting this place and have your own experience in there! Thank you 🌸

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: The food was very delicious, though a bit salty for my taste. It went really well with beer. The portion size was just right. The tables were a bit close together, which was slightly uncomfortable, but understandable since it’s a small place. I liked that you can add sides to every menu item.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
Beautiful cosy restaurant with top class food and service.

We are visiting from the UK and we were looking for a ramen restaurant near our hotel on Mission.

This restaurant didn't disappoint. We had the Gyoza + Traditional & Shoyu Ramen. All dishes were served with care and full of flavour.

Highly recommended! Thanks for looking after us.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Amazing place for good food. Broth was very tasty and delicious. Love the curry too! My favorite spot when San Francisco fog rolls in :)

testimonials: Small joint that blew me away! The broth is packed with flavor, the meat nicely cut and the eggs perfectly cooked. But the best thing was their tempura mushrooms! OMG! And I'm not a big fan of fried food. Super recommend, give it a try!

top_10.name: Marufuku Ramen
top_10.address: 1581 Webster St #235, San Francisco, CA 94115, USA

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: It’s definitely worth the wait! We got the regular pork belly Ramen: the broth, the veggie, the condiment, the noodles, the egg everything is like a Symphony harmonically dancing together. Just fight through your hunger and impatience while being in line but the end is all worth it! It currently kids, friendly restaurant, providing kids water cups kids utensils. The service is very fast.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text:
We visited the Marufuku Ramen location in San Francisco, inside the Japan Center (Kinokuniya Building), and it did not disappoint. We got there pretty close to closing time, but the staff was super friendly and didn’t rush us at all.

The Tonkotsu ramen was absolutely incredible—just like what I had at their Oakland location. The broth was rich, creamy, and full of flavor. A lot of places mess this up and serve something too thin or watered down, but Marufuku nails it. The chashu was perfectly cooked, tender, and packed with flavor. Portions were generous too, which is always a plus.

We also tried the takoyaki and the shrimp buns, and both were awesome. The takoyaki had that perfect soft-inside, crispy-outside texture, and the shrimp buns were flavorful and satisfying. The karaage was decent, though it felt more like regular fried chicken than classic Japanese-style karaage.

The space is upstairs in the Kinokuniya building, with a casual vibe and a solid drink menu as well.

Overall, this is an amazing spot for ramen and small bites in the city. Whether you’ve been to their other locations or not, this one’s absolutely worth checking out. Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: The best Tonkotsu ramen I have tried so far, comparable if not better than Ippudo! Really good deep flavored broth, good charsiu, nice soft boiled egg, chewy and firm noodles. Highly recommended must try 👍🏼

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: Beautiful atmosphere and some of the best ramen you will ever have. It was well worth the wait to have this delicious broth and noodles to accompany it. While waiting there is plenty to explore all around so it feels like no time at all. Every dish we had was delicious and the service was lovely.

reviews.author: Anonymous
reviews.text: I had the Tonkotsu Deluxe(medium spicy) and Bao bites - both were outstanding. The ramen broth was rich and flavorful. The bao was soft, fluffy and packed with flavor. The wait can be long (waited for an hour), so get on the list early, esp on weekends. Totally worth the wait.
